recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this procedure to apply for a building permit for work being performed on all properties – commercial, industrial, or residential. A building permit is required for new construction, additions, enlargements, alterations, change of use or occupancy, relocation, hazardous materials abatement, site work, retaining walls, fences, fill/stockpiling (50 cubic yards or more), installation of a solid-fuel-burning heating appliance, chimney or flue in a dwelling, or for any exterior work on a building or structure designated as a landmark structure or located within a historic district.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Compliance Inspection Request
recordTypes.description: All rental dwellings shall be required to hold a valid certificate of compliance. It shall be the responsibility of the owner of a rental property to schedule inspections and to obtain a certificate of compliance from the Building Division. Select this procedure to request an inspection for a certificate of compliance.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Propane Use Permit  Application
recordTypes.description: REQUIREMENTS FOR THE USE OF LIQUID PROPANE GAS (LPG) ARE REGULATED UNDER, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, CHAPTERS 24, 30, AND 38 OF THE FIRE CODE OF NEW YORK STATE AND THE CODE OF THE CITY OF ITHACA. GENERAL REQUIREMENTS ARE LISTED BELOW AND SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE CODE ENFORCEMENT OFFICALS OF THE CITY OF ITHACA.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this procedure to apply for a permit to demolish entire structures, major portions of a structure such as entire wings or additions, or for deconstruction of buildings or structures in accordance with the Code of the City of Ithaca Chapter 146.

recordTypes.name: Electric License Registration/Renewal
recordTypes.description: Registration and renewal for electricians licensed in the City of Ithaca.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for permit to perform electrical work on new or existing buildings or structures within the City of Ithaca.  Only City-licensed electricians and those licensed in other jurisdictions seeking a reciprocal application for work may apply for electrical permits.

recordTypes.name: Ithaca Electrical Examination Application
recordTypes.description: In compliance with the terms of Article II, Section 146-35 (and amendments thereto) of the Building Code of the City of Ithaca, you must apply to take the examination for a Certificate of Competency and registration as a licensed electrician in the City of Ithaca, New York for the purpose of doing electrical work within the jurisdiction of the Building Code of the City of Ithaca.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit Application
recordTypes.description: All plumbing work, except for minor repairs, requires a plumbing permit. Select this procedure to apply for a permit to perform plumbing work on new and existing buildings within the City of Ithaca.

recordTypes.name: Request - Official Street Address
recordTypes.description: In accordance with Chapter 342 of the Code of the City of Ithaca, the City Engineer is the authority who assigns official street addresses within the City of Ithaca. Once we make such a designation, we notify several other departments and agencies.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: The Sign Ordinance of the City of Ithaca regulates existing and proposed outdoor advertising, outdoor advertising signs and outdoor signs of all types.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Structure Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Temporary structures are defined as stages, platforms, band shells, sheds, or other structures erected for a period of less than 180 days. Select this procedure to apply for a permit to erect a temporary structure.

recordTypes.name: Tent or Membrane Structure Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
A tent is a structure, enclosure, umbrella structure or shelter, with or without sidewalls or drops, constructed of fabric or pliable material supported in any manner except by air or the contents it protects. A membrane structure is an air-inflated, air-supported, cable or frame-covered structure as defined by the Building Code of New York State and not otherwise defined as a tent. 

Tents, umbrella structures, and other membrane structures erected for a period of less than 180 days shall comply with the Fire Code of New York State. Select this procedure to apply for a permit to erect a tent or membrane structure for less than 180 days.

recordTypes.name: Water Heater Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this procedure to apply for a permit to perform alterations on existing water heaters, including removal and replacement of an appliance, reconfiguration or extension of a system, or installation of an additional appliance, in both commercial and residential properties.

categories.name: Public Works
categories.content: The Department of Public Works is the largest department within the City of Ithaca and is overseen by the Superintendent of Public Works. Within this department there are 3 main divisions, which are broken into smaller areas to provide the city with a vast array of services: Engineering, Water and Sewer, Streets and Facilities.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit: Residential

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for Nash County Zoning Permits ONLY. It may not be used to apply for or to upload zoning documents from the Towns of Bailey, Castalia, Dortches, Middlesex, Momeyer, Nashville, Red Oak, Sharpsburg, Spring Hope, or Whitakers. Please upload those items to the Building Permit Application. This permit allows the applicant to use or occupy a tract of land or a building; or to erect, install or alter a structure, building or sign situated in the jurisdiction of the County that fully meets the requirements of the Nash County Unified Development Ordinance (UDO). All applicants are required to submit a site plan for the project. ***Please note that this zoning permit is not a building permit.***

recordTypes.name: Apprenticeship Grant
recordTypes.description:
Building Trades/ Carpentry Apprenticeship Readiness Programs 
 
Funding will be provided to prepare a highly skilled workforce to meet the demands in the City of Scranton. This program will provide funds for pre-apprenticeship programs in the Building Trades and Carpentry crafts. 
Scranton citizens deserve an opportunity to have a family sustaining career and the completion of an apprenticeship readiness program and, ultimately, their enrolling in a State Certified Apprenticeship training program can lead them to one in the construction industry. The Building Trades State Certified Apprenticeship Programs are the gold standard of workforce development programs for those wanting a career in construction.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Development Permit
recordTypes.description:
Permit Requirements: As required by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Code of Federal Regulations, National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP), 44 CFR PART 60.3 (a) (1), no work of any kind may begin in the special flood hazard area (SFHA) as designated on the City’s Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM) until a Floodplain Development Permit has been issued by the Floodplain Manager. The permit shall be for all “development” as written in the City’s floodplain ordinance. File of Council No. 16, 2020.

The Ordinance defines "Development" as:

Any man-made change to improved or unimproved real estate including, but not limited to, the construction, reconstruction, renovation, repair, expansion, or alteration of buildings or other structures; the placement of manufactured homes; streets and other paving; utilities; filling, grading and excavation; mining, dredging, and drilling operations; storage of equipment or materials; and the subdivision of land.

The Floodplain Development Permit is the mechanism by which our community evaluates any and all impacts of activities proposed within our regulated floodplains. All activities must comply with City of Scranton Floodplain Management Ordinance, File of Council No. 16, 2020. The National Flood Insurance Program provides flood insurance to individuals at much lower premiums than could otherwise be purchased through private insurers, and makes certain federal funds are available to communities. In order for citizens to be eligible for the national flood insurance rates, or for communities to receive certain kinds of federal funds, the community must agree to meet minimum floodplain standards.

recordTypes.name: 2024 COS Home Program Application
recordTypes.description:
The City of Scranton’s Office of Economic and Community Development currently has an open application for it’s 2024 HOME PROGRAM FUNDING.  The total amount of HOME funds to obligate is $436,730.65. 

  HOME is authorized under  Title II of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act,  as amended. Program regulations are at  24 CFR Part 92. Additional information about the HOME program can be found by visiting the HOME program web pages.

Organizations Eligible to Apply

Public or private entities who are housing developers, sponsors or owners and that have project management control capacity are eligible to apply for HOME funds. Examples of eligible entities are:

•\tNot-for-profit organizations
•\tHousing authorities
•\tMunicipalities
•\tFor-profit organizations, private individuals are not eligible to submit project applications directly  benefiting themselves.   For example:   A homebuyer is not eligible to request funds to rehabilitate a property that is used as his or her principal residence.  Projects must benefit a group of people and be administered by an agency or organization (i.e., a legal entity).   The administrative capacity of the agency or organization is one of the factors considered in the selection of the application
\t
The intent of the HOME Program is to:
1.\tProvide decent affordable housing to lower income households
2.\tExpand the capacity of non-profit housing providers
3.\tStrengthen the ability of state and local governments to provide housing, and
4.\tLeverage private-section participation

Eligible Uses of HOME funds

HOME funds may be used for:
•\tRehabilitation
•\tReconstruction
•\tNew construction
•\tConversion of an existing structure from another use to affordable residential housing, Conversion of a structure to commercial use is prohibited.
•\tSite improvements
•\tAcquisition of property in need of rehabilitation is eligible as part of either a homebuyer program or a rental housing project
•\tAcquisition of vacant land only if construction will begin on a HOME project within 12 months of purchase
•\tDemolition of an existing structure may be funded by HOME only if construction will begin on the HOME project within 12 months


Total Amount of 2024 HOME Program Funding Available:  $436,730.65

recordTypes.name: 2024 COS CDBG Funding Application
recordTypes.description:
The City of Scranton’s Office of Economic and Community Development currently has an open application for it’s 2024 CDBG FUNDING. The total amount of CDBG funds to obligate is $2,122,778.


The Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) Program provides annual grants on a formula basis to states, cities, and counties to develop viable urban communities by providing decent housing and a suitable living environment, and by expanding economic opportunities, principally for low- and moderate-income persons. The program is authorized under Title 1 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974, Public Law 93-383, as amended 42 U.S.C. 5301 et seq. The program was designed to reinforce several important values and principles of community development:

· CDBG's flexibility empowers people and communities to design and implement strategies tailored to their own needs and priorities.

· CDBG's emphasis on consolidated planning expands and strengthens partnerships among all levels of government and the private sector in enhancing community development.

· CDBG's technical assistance activities and set-aside for grantees builds the capacity of these partners.


CDBG Proposed Rule On January 10, 2024, HUD published a Proposed Rule in the Federal Register which would enable much needed revisions and updates to the requirements governing the Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) program · Visit the CDBG Proposed Rule page



Eligible Actvities

CDBG funds may be used for activities which include, but are not limited to:

· Acquisition of real property

· Relocation and demolition

· Rehabilitation of residential and non-residential structures

· Construction of public facilities and improvements, such as water and sewer facilities, streets, neighborhood centers, and the conversion of school buildings for eligible purposes

· Public services, within certain limits

· Activities relating to energy conservation and renewable energy resources

· Provision of assistance to profit-motivated businesses to carry out economic development and job creation/retention activities

Each activity must meet one of the following national objectives for the program: benefit low- and moderate-income persons, prevention or elimination of slums or blight, or address community development needs having a particular urgency because existing conditions pose a serious and immediate threat to the health or welfare of the community for which other funding is not available.

Generally, the following types of activities are ineligible:

· Acquisition, construction, or reconstruction of buildings for the general conduct of government

· Political activities

· Certain income payments

· Construction of new housing (with some exceptions)


Application Period: Tuesday, December 17th through Friday, January 3rd, 2025.

categories.name: Scranton 311
categories.content: Scranton 311 is the City’s customer service center for non-emergency inquiries. Requests for service can be submitted via telephone, online form, or email. We will get your request to the right department and update you as the situation changes. Together, we develop valuable insights that help improve our city.

categories.name: Code Enforcement
categories.content: Code Enforcement enforces building and property codes to support a healthy, safe, and vibrant community for Scranton residents. The department investigates complaints about possible violations and takes action to mitigate quality of life concerns. This department also distributes permits and conducts inspections for homes, rental properties, and businesses.</

categories.name: City Planning and Zoning
Business Administration
categories.content: The Department of Business Administration’s primary responsibilities include recording the City’s financial activity, maintaining the computerized accounting system, processing payments to vendors, procurement of goods and services, and issuing required financial reports. This office also prepares and monitors the City’s Annual Operating and Capital Budgets. The Department oversees the following bureaus: Administration, Treasury, Human Resources, Information Technology, and

categories.name: Economic and Community Development
categories.content: Community Development manages the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (“HUD”) entitlement grants as well as funding for housing and neighborhood development initiatives. The Department leverages public and private funds to provide affordable housing, promote safe and livable neighborhoods, and stimulate economic development in Scranton.

categories.name: Public Works
Fire
categories.content: The mission of the Bureau of Fire is to provide efficient and effective fire protection and emergency services to the citizens of the City of Scranton. The department is dedicated to this mission and has initiated fire prevention programs throughout the community and local schools, through the use of a fire safe house.

recordTypes.name: Application for Tax Stabilization
recordTypes.description: The City of Providence intends to increase the pace of economic development, and thereby increase the city’s tax base, it is vital that city provide property developers, entrepreneurs and investors with a predictable tax phase-in plan that will encourage investment in Providence. It is therefore in the public interest to develop a set of clear criteria for eligibility for tax stabilization, as well as a defined long-term plan to bring a project to full taxation.

recordTypes.name: Apply for an Entertainment/Raffle/Class F Liquor Licenses (with entertainment)
recordTypes.description:
As you should be aware, Section(s) 14-193-201 of the Providence Municipal Ordinances provide the governing law for entertainment licenses in the city. 
In this regard, Section 14-199 provides that said licenses expire on the last day of the month.  Further, the renewal application for entertainment licenses “must be submitted no later than seven (7) days following expiration of the licensee’s current entertainment license”. (Section 14-195.)
In order to ensure enough time for processing, all renewal applications for entertainment must be submitted on or before the fifteenth (15th) day of the month for entertainment to be held in the next succeeding month. Any late applications will likely require an in person hearing before the Board.
 In the event that your application for entertainment (or renewal thereof) is not received in a timely fashion as required by ordinance, your application may not be approved by the Board of Licenses.
If your application is not approved prior to the 1st of the month, you are NOT permitted to have ANY entertainment events until approved by the Board.

recordTypes.description: A vendor shall apply for a Providence Fireworks Vendor Permit pursuant to this section. The fee to obtain a Providence Fireworks Vendor Permit shall be fifty dollars ($50.00). An application for a Providence Fireworks Vendor Permit shall be submitted in writing to the office of the board of licenses and shall include the name of the applicant, the name of the applicant's business, and the location of where the fireworks will be sold. A vendor must submit a separate application for each location where fireworks will be sold.

No license is required for the following: investigators employed by any federal, state or city/town; persons employed to research genealogical work or family history compilation; insurance investigators; credit reporting agencies; or certified computer examiners. Pursuant to Rhode Island General Law 5-5-20.

City Ordinance 14-285.

The said license shall be issued after due application, as described in this article, and payment of the prescribed fee. An application for license renewal must be submitted annually.

recordTypes.name: Soil Erosion Permit
recordTypes.description:
THE SOIL EROSION PERMIT IS INCLUDED WITH THE BUILDING PERMIT. IF YOU INTEND TO FILL OUT A BUILDING PERMIT THEN DO NOT FILL THIS INDIVIDUAL SOIL EROSION PERMIT OUT.

This permit is required for any individual, corporation, or organization proposing a development project that involves the disturbance of natural terrain, in accordance with the soil erosion ordinance. The permit ensures that all necessary precautions are taken to minimize soil erosion, protect water quality, and prevent environmental degradation during construction or land development activities.

Applicants must provide details of the proposed project, including the site location, scope of work, and any measures planned to control soil erosion. The permit is essential for compliance with local environmental regulations and must be obtained prior to beginning any land disturbance activities.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
NOTICE: Combination Sign permits and combination Swimming Pool permits are now available - so separate building and wire permits are no longer necessary.

Apply here for a building permit from the Town of Smithfield, and (if applicable) apply for a related Fire Plan Review from the Fire Marshal. Tent only projects are applied for under the Fire Marshall page. These permits may be for all structures including pools, decks, houses, commercial buildings, etc.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Apply here for an electrical permit from the Town of Smithfield, and (if applicable) apply for a related Fire Plan Review from the Fire Marshal. Energy storage systems unrelated to photovoltaic systems may be applied for here as well.
NOTICE: All applications, designs, and wire work, as of May 1, 2022, shall be in accordance with NFPA 70, 70E 2020 edition; NFPA 72 2019 edition.
NOTICE: There is a Sign Permit available - so separate wire and building permits are no longer necessary.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Apply here for a mechanical permit from the Town of Smithfield, and (if applicable) also apply here for a related Fire Plan Review from the Fire Marshal. This permit is for all HVAC, similar mechanical systems and automatic fire suppression systems. This permit is also for air movement systems, boiler, pressure vessel, refrigeration, and fossil fuel fired appliances and storage tanks. Water based heating systems including solar systems and radiant flooring area also under this permit. 
NOTICE: All applications, designs, and mechanical work, as of May 1, 2022, shall be in accordance with SBC-4  International Mechanical Code, amended 2018 edition; SBC-19 International Fuel Gas Code, amended 2018 edition; NFPA 13, 13R, and 13D amended 2016 edition.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit

NOTICE: All applications, designs, and plumbing work, as of May 1, 2022, shall be in accordance with SBC-3  International Plumbing Code, amended 2018 edition.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool and Spa Permit
recordTypes.description:
This is a combination permit that allows for NEW INSTALLATIONS of in-ground and above ground pools, public and privately owned. This combination permit is for pools without and with electrical connections so your electrician doesn't have to pull a separate wire permit.  
Pools with heating sources other than electric shall require a separate fuel gas or mechanical permit. Existing pools needing new wiring shall require individual (separate) wire permits.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Plat
recordTypes.description:
Anderson County Development Moratorium Information.

Anderson County Ordinance 2025-036 hereby declares and places a moratorium suspending the acceptance and or issuance of any new permits for development for a period of 90 Days for properties located within the unincorporated areas of Anderson County. 
Please Note: The Council, by subsequent ordinance, may extend the temporary suspension and temporary moratorium for a further time- period.

This includes the following residential uses.   

Residential subdivisions of more than 4 lots and any residential living unit, townhomes, apartments, duplexes, or any other multi- developments.

The exceptions are: 
1. Any project(s) reviewed and approved by the Planning Commission.

2. Existing lots of records that have been recorded in the Register of Deeds Office.
3. Pending litigation cases involving residential subdivisions and developments.

4. Towns and cities within Anderson County are not affected by this moratorium because they are separate jurisdictions and a separate form of government and council.

5. Creation of lots that are 5 acres in size that are located along an existing street or road where no new street or road is created as per state law.

6. Commercial and Industrial Development.
This moratorium takes effect on September 2, 2025, due to the pending doctrine under state law that recognizes effective adoption of ordinance upon first reading which was September 2, 2025.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description: Zoning regulates the allowable uses of land in certain areas of Anderson County. “Rezoning” involves changes to the official zoning designation of a property. Property owners can request rezoning of their property at any time. The rezoning process does not apply to unzoned properties in the County. Rezoning is not a formality; it is a change to the County’s law governing the use of private property. Members of the public, including the applicant, have the opportunity to comment on the request at the Planning Commission meeting, and at the 1st Council reading. Postcards are sent to property owners within 2000 feet of the subject parcel, notifying them of the proposed change and the meeting schedule. Notice of the proposed change will also appear in a newspaper of general circulation. A sign(s) will be posted on the property, identifying the property as under consideration for rezoning. The sign will be removed upon completion of the rezoning process.

recordTypes.name: Medical Exception Application
recordTypes.description:
What is a medical exception?

Per Anderson County Ordinance, for residential areas, only one dwelling is allowed and permitted per a parcel. A medical exception is a special exception and permit that can potentially be granted to allow a temporary mobile home to be placed on a property where a dwelling may already exist. A medical exception is a temporary use until the applicant no longer wishes to utilize it or if the medical exception is no longer needed. Medical exceptions are required to be renewed every year and are accompanied by an annual renewal fee. Medical exceptions are usually sought after to take care of a loved one who may need assistance in day to day living.

All medical exception requests for zoned areas are required to be reviewed by the Anderson County Board of Zoning Appeals at a regularly scheduled public hearing. Is is strongly encouraged for all applicants to attend the public hearing in which their medical exception application is reviewed. This is highly suggested to applicants in case the board may have questions about an application or if those that live in the surrounding vicinity may not be in favor of the medical exception request.

recordTypes.description:
This application is submitted to facilitate the incorporation of an existing private roadway and right-of-way (ROW) into the public roadway network, ensuring compliance with the current Hamilton County Highway Department Standards and Subdivision Regulations.

For newly constructed roadways that will remain private, an inspection will be conducted to confirm adherence to the Hamilton County Subdivision Regulations, including any approved variances. In such cases, the resolution phase of the process will be omitted.

recordTypes.name: Illicit Discharge/Illicit Connection Report Form
recordTypes.description:
If you see water pollution, witness any material spilled or dumped into a waterway, or observe conditions in a storm drain or stream that indicate a polluting activity has occurred, please report immediately! If the situation is an imminent threat to life or health, please call 911.


Illicit Discharge- Any discharge to an MS4 that is not entirely composed of stormwater. Illicit Connections- Illegal and/or unauthorized connections to the municipal separate stormwater system whether or not such connections result in discharges into that system.

recordTypes.description: A  Development Permit is required for any site development constructing initial infrastructure construction including but not limited to; water, sewer, storm drainage, and/or public/private streets, sidewalks, parking areas, etc.  Fees on this permit are the permit fee, plan review fee, and use tax, based on job valuation estimated cost of materials and labor).  Additional drainage fees may also apply.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use
recordTypes.description: Temporary use refers but is not limited to temporary sales stand, temporary sales office, construction office, construction yard, etc.  Temp uses are allowed with approval of a temp use permit for a period of 90 days, with one extension of 90 days permitted on each application.  Extended uses may be permitted for a period of one year with renewals in subsequent years, to be determined by the Community Development Director.  The City of Brighton may impose conditions, bonding, and insurance necessary for the health, safety, and welfare of the inhabitants of the community.  Setback and other requirements of the district in which the temp use is located shall apply to buildings and structures connected with such temp use, and such buildings and structures shall be constructed so as to be structurally sound and attractive to the community.  Signs associated with this request will be reviewed to the adopted City of Brighton sign code regulations

Residents planning on parking in these locations are required to apply for a Parking permit. The cost is $25 with a maximum of 2 permits per household.

This permit is strictly for installation of BMPs and earthwork. No infrastructure may be installed under this permit.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Sign
recordTypes.description:
The purpose of temporary signs is to display messages for a temporary duration. Temporary signs shall not be used as a subterfuge to circumvent the regulations that apply to permanent signs or to add permanent signage in addition to that which is permitted by Section 9.04. Temporary signs shall be removed on or before 90 days after first being placed, unless otherwise specified in this subsection. 
All temporary signs must be located on private property and only with the consent of the property owner.
Temporary Yard sings do not require a permit.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit
recordTypes.description:
* Please note: no inspections will be scheduled after 11:00 am on Friday's during Town of Avon summer hours from June 20, 2022 - August 26, 2022. 

Driveway permits are required for renovation / reconstruction of existing driveways and for new driveways prior to Engineering Department sign-off on Certificates of Occupancy for new home construction. Before Engineering sign-off on new home building permits, the Developer must take out an Excavation Permit which will allow for work in the Town right-of-way.  When the Developer is ready to pave the driveway apron, he or his contractor must take out a separate driveway permit.  The Town has standard requirements for driveways, and are particularly concerned about the driveway apron.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description:
* Please note: no inspections will be scheduled after 11:00 am on Friday's during Town of Avon summer hours from June 23, 2025 - August 22, 2025. 

Sewer Permits are required for all sanitary sewer-related work being performed outside of a building and must be inspected by Town staff.  This includes repairs, renovations, new connections, and disconnects.  For new connections, sewer billing begins at the date of the approved connection.  All fees and charges must be paid prior to issuance of a sewer permit.  For new connections, this includes the Connection Charge, Benefit Assessments (if applicable), and the permit fee. 

NOTE: Annual Sewer Use Charges begin at the date of connection to the sewer, regardless of the status of the construction project.

recordTypes.name: Excavation Permit for Individual Lots
recordTypes.description:
* Please note: no inspections will be scheduled after 11:00 am on Friday's during Town of Avon summer hours from June 20, 2022 - August 26, 2022. 

Excavation permits are required for all non-driveway related work within the Town's right-of-way,  Excavation Permits for Individual Lots are intended for work to be done for the benefit of a single property,  Excavation Permits for Linear Projects are intended for work done by utility companies where the project abuts multiple properties.  Prior to Engineering signing-off on new home building permits, the Developer must take out an Excavation Permit which will allow for work in the Town right-of-way.  When the Developer is ready to pave the driveway apron, he or his contractor must take out a separate driveway permit.  The Town has standard requirements for work within the right-of-way, and developers and contractors are urged to contact the Engineering department for information concerning Town requirements.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Establishment Permit and Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description:
Body Art Establishment Permits expire on May 31st annually. Permits are non-transferable.

Important Payment Notice
To ensure faster processing of your permit, we strongly recommend making your payment by Credit Card or ACH.

Please note:
•Credit card payments are processed immediately, allowing us to begin work on your permit without delay.
•Payments made by cash or check will not be processed until funds are received and verified, which can result in significant delays.

If timely processing is important to you, we urge you to use a credit card at the time of submission.

recordTypes.name: Street Opening  Permit - Obstructions
recordTypes.description:
IMPORTANT NOTE: This application is for any construction related projects. If you are looking to obstruct the public right of way for an event (Road Race, Parade/Procession, Block Party, etc.) you must reach out to the Framingham Police Department. 

All applicants are responsible for notifying the Framingham Police Department of any street/sidewalk obstructions regardless if a detail is required for your project. You can contact the police detail line at:  (508) 532-5907.

A street obstruction permit is required if you are obstructing in the public right-of-way, including the street, sidewalk, curb, driveway apron, and/or grass berm area. 

An Access Permit from the Massachusetts Department of Transportation is required when conducting work on a State-owned road. 

Obstructions conducted on a private road do not require a street opening permit from the Department of Public Works.

recordTypes.description:
The Contractor License Registration form should be submitted for anyone who is looking to apply for a Street Opening Permit (utility/driveways) or a Trench Opening Permit. 

This registration should be filled out once to set your company up with a DPW Contractor License profile. Once this registration is reviewed and approved, you will be able to submit Street (utility/driveway) /Trench Opening Permits. 

Please note, this registration should only be applied for once.

recordTypes.name: Street Opening  Permit - Utilities and Borings
recordTypes.description:
A street opening permit is required if you are excavating in the public right-of-way, including the street, sidewalk, curb, driveway apron, and/or grass berm area. 

An Access Permit from the Massachusetts Department of Transportation is required when conducting work on a State-owned road. 

Excavation conducted on a private road does not require a street opening permit from the Department of Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Street Opening  Permit - Driveway
recordTypes.description:
A street opening permit is required if you are excavating in the public right-of-way, including the street, sidewalk, curb, driveway apron, and/or grass berm area.

Excavation conducted on a private road does not require a street opening permit from the Department of Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description:
Demolition permit applications are ONLY for demolishing a COMPLETE STRUCTURE.

CITY OF FRAMINGHAM
DEMOLITION PERMIT APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS COMMERCIAL & RESIDENTIAL
Please note that your demolition permit application cannot be submitted without the following:

1) Completed demolition permit application
2) Permit fee ($15 per $1,000 of job cost)
3) Debris Affidavit
4) Workers compensation insurance affidavit
5) Workers compensation insurance certificate
6) CSL & HIC if Applicable
7) Disconnect/Approval letters are required if applicable from:
Water & Sewer Dept., Gas Company, Electric Company, Telephone Company and Board of Health

Please note: All buildings 75 years or older needs to be notified and reviewed by the Framingham 
Historical Commission under the Demolition Delay By-law

recordTypes.name: Change to an Existing Alcohol License Application
Trench Opening Permit
recordTypes.description:
A trench opening permit is required for excavations greater than 3 feet in depth with less than 15 feet in width on both public and private property.  

Typical permit include but are not limited to the following:
- Water, sewer, drainage connections, disconnections, and/or repairs on private property
- Private utility installations and repairs by the electric, telephone, gas, or cable companies
- Large test pits 

Please note: 
- Work within the City's public roadways will also require a Street Opening Permit. 
- If you are conducting any water, sewer, or drainage work, you must be a Licensed Drainlayer. 
- The turn around time for all permits is within 5 business days.

recordTypes.name: Special Purpose Pool Permit to Operate Application ONLY
Swimming Pool Construction Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description:
No person shall construct or install a swimming, wading or special purpose pool, or expand, remodel or otherwise make any change which may affect the compliance of an existing swimming, wading or special purpose pool with the requirements of 105 CMR 435.00 until the plans and specifications for the construction or change, under the stamp and signature of a Massachusetts Registered Professional Engineer or Registered Architect, have been approved in writing by the Board of Health. 

All work shall conform to approved plans and specifications. Any revision or change in the approved plans and specifications which may affect the capacity or the health or safety features of the swimming, wading or special purpose pool, shall be submitted to the Board of Health for review. Approval of said change or revision of plans shall be obtained in writing before the work affected by the change is undertaken.

In addition to this Swimming Pool Construction Plan Review Application, a Swimming Pool Permit to Operate Application must be submitted. 

Important Payment Notice
To ensure faster processing of your application, we strongly recommend making your payment by Credit Card or ACH.

Please note:
•Credit card payments are processed immediately, allowing us to begin work on your application without delay.
•Payments made by cash or check will not be processed until funds are received and verified, which can result in significant delays.

If timely processing is important to you, we urge you to use a credit card at the time of submission.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit to Operate Application ONLY
recordTypes.description:
According to 105 CMR 435.00 No person shall operate or maintain any swimming, wading or special purpose pool without obtaining a permit from the Board of Health. 

An application must be submitted for each swimming pool.

The application must be submitted to the Framingham Public Health Department at least fifteen (15) days before the expiration of a permit, or otherwise at least fifteen (15) days before the opening of the pool swimming, wading and special purpose pool (whirlpool).

Pool Permits expire on May 31st annually.  Permits are non-transferable.

Important Payment Notice
To ensure faster processing of your permit, we strongly recommend making your payment by Credit Card or ACH.

Please note:

Well - Application for Permit to Construct, Alter or Repair a Well
recordTypes.description:
The well construction permit shall be on-site at all times that work is taking place. Each permit expires one (1) year from the date of issuance unless revoked for cause. Permits may be extended for one additional six-month period, provided that the Board of Health receives a written request at least one (1) month prior to the one-year expiration date. There is no additional fee for a permit extension, provided there is no change in the plans for the proposed private well. Private well construction permits are not transferable.

Important Payment Notice

recordTypes.name: Alcohol License  Draft test - NO  RECORDS
Auctioneer License
recordTypes.description: The application, a copy of your state Auctioneer License, and  $10.00 is required for a Town of Lexington Auctioneer License.

recordTypes.name: Street Performers Application
recordTypes.description: The Town Manager's Office will issue permits for Performers after an application process, and an annual fee of $25.00 is paid. Performances may take place Sundays through Saturdays 10:00am to 10:00pm with locations decided on first come first served basis.

recordTypes.name: Block Party Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Block Parties requests are made through the Town Manager's office with permission given by Department of Public Works when roads are to be blocked. Please note: no unsealed alcoholic beverages are allowed in any street which has a right of public access.

recordTypes.name: Patriots' Day Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits can be issued to charitable organizations within the Town such as religious, fraternal, civic, or student groups for vending locations on Patriots' Day each year in Lexington. Applications are due at least 3 weeks before Patriots' Day of the year requested and each Sponsor is allowed a maximum of 4 permits.

recordTypes.name: Historic Districts Commission Application for Formal Hearing
recordTypes.description: This is an application to attend a public meeting before the HDC to request a Certificate of Appropriateness for exterior alteration.

recordTypes.name: Historical Commission Application for Formal Hearing
Outdoor Dining Permit
recordTypes.description: Local restaurants in Lexington may apply for an Outdoor Dining Permit for sidewalk and private parking lot areas adjacent to their businesses. Fees for these permits are included as well as approval from necessary departments in town.

recordTypes.name: Automatic Amusement Device License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Automatic Amusement Device license for any type of device that you deposit a coin into and the game is put in motion to play.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Certificate
recordTypes.description: Short-term rental (STR) refers to the rental of any dwelling unit or bedroom as residential accommodation for a duration of less than 30 consecutive days. Short-term rentals are allowed within certain parameters, and there are rules and regulations you must follow to legally rent out your residence on a short-term basis. See Section 135-6.10 of the Code of Lexington Zoning Bylaws - Short-Term Rentals.

recordTypes.name: Certified Abutters List
recordTypes.description: Please note: Your Certified Abutters List will be available through this online portal after certification by the Assessor's Office. You can then download the Certified Abutters List, map, and related materials. If you require a Lexington Abutters List for an out-of-town address, please contact the Assessor's Office directly (781-698-4578).

recordTypes.name: Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation (ANRAD)
recordTypes.description: For confirming wetland resource area boundaries with the Conservation Commission. Conservation filings will not be reviewed and accepted until the meeting date filing deadline. Applicants can submit a filing before the meeting deadline date but the filing will not be accepted until the meeting date filing deadline.

recordTypes.name: Annual Fire Inspection and/or Drill - (includes Recreational Camp Programs)
Water Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any work on and existing or proposed water lines: services and/or mains. Only licensed drainlayers in Lexington may apply for this permit.   Fee=$100 for the first 50' plus .30/ft for longer lengths.

recordTypes.name: Commercial/Public Fire Drill Application
recordTypes.description: Commercial/Public property Fire Drill only. Properties that are required to have an Annual Inspection have their Fire Drill included with that application.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any work on and existing or proposed sewer lines: services and/or mains.  Only Lexington licensed drainlayers may apply for this permit.  Fee=$100 for the first 50' plus .30/ft for longer lengths.  A sewer stub fee may be due for a new connection.

recordTypes.name: Battle Green Permit
recordTypes.description: The Board of Selectmen issues permits for the use of the Battle Green. Please submit an application no less than two weeks prior to the requested date.

recordTypes.name: Amendment to Order of Conditions
recordTypes.description: Apply to make an amendment to an existing Order of Conditions. This process is required for any project that must be reviewed by the Engineering Department. Discretion is up to the Conservation Commission as to whether an amendment will be allowed or a new application process is required.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: This application must be completed, signed and submitted with the application fee by the applicant or representative in accordance with the Rules and Regulations of the Board. The applicant is advised to review the Lexington Zoning Bylaw and the Rules and Regulations of the Board of Appeals prior to filing this application. Petitioner or representative must attend the hearing.  Information provided on this page may constitute findings of fact.

recordTypes.name: Amendment to a Preliminary Site Development & Use Plan
recordTypes.description: Applications to amend an existing CD or RD districts adopted under previous versions of the zoning bylaw in effect on January 1, 2016.

recordTypes.name: 2025 Cultural District Grant Application
recordTypes.description: The goal for these funds is to help nurture arts and cultural initiatives and bring positive economic benefits to cultural institutions and local businesses while supporting Lexington's creative community in its ongoing pursuit of partnerships and financial resources.   You must be part of the Lexington Cultural District to receive funds through this grant.  All applications are due by March 28th 2025.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Application
recordTypes.description: The Town of Lexington is pleased to welcome a variety of special events, from community festivals to concerts and athletic competitions. It is the goal of the Town of Lexington to work with event managers and organizers to help ensure that the events taking place in our community are both safe and successful, while minimizing the impact on our residents and businesses.

recordTypes.name: Class I/II/III License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues licenses for Class I, II, and III dealers.

recordTypes.name: Public Records Request
recordTypes.description:
If you cannot find the public records you want in the resources provided, or by searching our Records Repository, you may request public records from the Town by filling out this online request form.  


Please note if you are currently logged into your Viewpoint Cloud, your name associated with that account will be available to the public.
 
If you would like to send an anonymous request, you may:

•Log out and create a new Viewpoint Cloud account adding only an email address. 
•Deliver to the records access officer by hand.
•Deliver via first class mail at the record officer's business address.
•Send by email

ALL requests for police related materials including Incident and Accident Reports, should ONLY be requested directly through the Police Department link and NOT through the OpenGov portal.  Requests pertaining to confidential and/or sensitive information should NOT be requested through OpenGov as this is a PUBLIC portal. 


If you have any questions please contact the Town Clerk's office at 781-698-4558. 

Please see our website for Department contact information: https://www.lexingtonma.gov.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Administrative Review

recordTypes.name: Trench Permit per MGL c 82a, Jackie's Law
recordTypes.description: Any work which creates a trench, as defined in 520 CMR 14.00 and MGL c. 82A, §§ 1 through 5,  requires a Trench Permit.  Fee=$50.

Initially when inputting an address (Step 2 of your application), please indicate the Location where the Raffle will be held. Later the application will ask for your business address.

recordTypes.name: Tree Removal and Mitigation Permit  Final
recordTypes.description: This bylaw is enacted for the purpose of preserving and protecting  trees pursuant to Chapter 120 Town of Lexington By-Laws certain in regard to trees on portions of private property. To achieve these purposes, this bylaw establishes a Tree Committee and empowers the Committee, in conjunction with the Tree Warden, to regulate the removal and replacement of trees in certain circumstances, and to promote the planting and protection of trees throughout the Town. It is desirable that the Town plant more trees than are removed to compensate for tree losses and the length of time to maturity. The provisions of this bylaw, when pertaining to private property, apply only when there is major construction or demolition as defined below and only within setback areas.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Hazardous Tree Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply to remove any dangerous tree on your property that is bordering conservation land or is within the buffer zone of a protected resource.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Excavation Permit
recordTypes.description: A Right-of-Way Excavation Permit is required for any digging in the public right of way: streets, sidewalks and shoulders.  Only Lexington licensed excavators and drainlayers can apply for Right-of-Way Excavation Permits. Fee=$60 for the first 50' plus .30/ft for longer lengths. Right of Way Excavation Permits are not issued for non emergency work during winter moratorium as no road work is allowed during that time. It is from 11/15 to the day after Patriot's Day

recordTypes.name: Burn Permit
recordTypes.description: *** PLEASE NOTE ***  On the day you wish to burn, call 781-698-4700, press #8 after 9AM.  A recording will inform you if burning is allowed that day.  Following the message you will be asked to record your permit number.

recordTypes.name: Notice of Intent
recordTypes.description: Any project within wetland resource areas, including the 100 foot wetland buffer zone, and/or the 200 foot riverfront area is required to file for a Conservation Permit for review and approval by the Conservation Commission. When filling out the filing, please refer to the Massachusetts Wetlands Protection Act (M.G.L. C. 131, S. 40) as well as the Town of Lexington Wetland Protection Code (C. 130). Due to regulatory time periods, conservation filings will not be reviewed and accepted until the posted meeting date application deadline. Applicants can submit a filing for a deadline before the deadline date but the filing will not be accepted until the application deadline.

recordTypes.name: Sunday Public Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: A Sunday license is a license required for entertainment occurring on a Sunday that the public must pay a fee to attend and is part of the so-called "Blue laws.". Historically, activities that require a Sunday license include dancing or any game, sport, fair, exposition, play, entertainment or public diversion. G.L. c. 136, §4.

FOR TRANSFER OF REAL ESTATE: Homeowners are required to have the Fire Department perform a Compliance Inspection for Smoke Detectors and Carbon Monoxide Detectors within 60-days of transferring property as regulated by M.G.L. Chapter 148 Sections 26F, 26F 1/2, and 527 CMR 31.00.
Call for a Re-Inspection, do not submit a new application.
IF LOW VOLTAGE SYSTEM OR SYSTEM WITH KEYPAD, APPLICANT NEEDS TO HAVE ACCESS TO KEYPAD WITH PASSCODE AT TIME OF INSPECTION.

categories.name: Building Department
categories.content: As a governmental entity, the Massachusetts Public Records Law applies to records made or received by the Town. Any information received through use of this site is subject to the same provisions as information provided on paper. Otherwise, the Town does not share any personally identifying information with any third party.

recordTypes.description: Please use this form to submit Service Requests to the Department of Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Open Air Burning Permit
recordTypes.description:
Open Air Burning Permit

Burning may only be conducted from January 15th to May 1st of the year issued.

You are required to call the Open Burning Information Line 978-640-4419 each day you intend to burn, prior to burning. The information Line will advise you if open air burning is allowed for that day.  If burning is allowed, you will be prompted to record your street address and permit number for our daily record.

recordTypes.name: Residential Smoke Alarm/Carbon Monoxide Alarm Inspection  Application
recordTypes.description:
We conduct residential smoke alarm inspections on Tuesday/Thursday/Saturday mornings in a 9:00 am to 12:00 pm window. 

All smoke alarms must be under 10 years old.

All alarms need to be properly located and tested prior to the inspection. You will fail the inspection and be charged a $25.00 re-inspection fee if any smoke or CO alarm does not work due to a mechanical defect, has missing or dead batteries, or if your house numbers are missing or not visible from the street side of the house.

House numbers must be permanently affixed to the house by either nails or screws and they must be clearly visible from the street. House numbers affixed to doors or a mailbox alone do not meet this requirement.

For additional info and PDF guides please visit: 
https://www.tewksbury-ma.gov/225/Smoke-Carbon-Monoxide-Inspections

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Residential SWIMMING  POOL  ( INGROUND OR ABOVE GROUND)
recordTypes.description:
This application is to apply for RESIDENTIAL building permits for SWIMMING POOL (INGROUND AND ABOVE GROUND POOLS)

*** BUILDING PERMIT MUST BE PICKED UP AT THE BUILDING DEPARTMENT

recordTypes.name: Road Race Permit
recordTypes.description: Required for all Road Race approvals.  Applicant must contact the Tewksbury Police Department for their initial review and approval.  Once approved, please either upload their approval letter or Police Dept. will contact our office directly with approval and guideline recommendations.

recordTypes.name: RCOC
recordTypes.description: Request for Certificate of Compliance (RCOC)

recordTypes.name: Request to Amend an OOC
recordTypes.description: Request to Amend an Order of Conditions (OOC)

recordTypes.name: COMMERCIAL Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application should be completed to apply for  COMMERCIAL building permits.

*** BUILDING PERMIT MUST BE PICKED UP AT THE BUILDING DEPARTMENT

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit-TEWKSBURY
recordTypes.description:
Only Licensed Electricians can apply for this permit.
 This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc. 


Please refer to advisory regarding electrical installations completed without permit/inspections:

https://www.mass.gov/lists/board-policies-and-guidelines-examiners-of-electricians#advisory-regarding-how-to-rectify-electrical-installations-completed-without-required-permits-and-inspections-

recordTypes.name: Request to Extend an OOC
recordTypes.description: Request to Extend an Order of Conditions (OOC)

recordTypes.name: One-Day Entertainment License
recordTypes.description:
One-Day Entertainment License ONLY 

Entertainment Licenses approved subject to:

1.  Completed application 
2.  Scheduled Public Hearing with the Select Board
3.  Legal Notice published in the paper 7 days prior to Select Board Public Hearing
4.  Certified Abutter’s List from the Assessor’s Office and Abutter Notification

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit- TEWKSBURY
recordTypes.description: Only Licensed Journeyman and Master Plumbers may file for this permit. Electric Hot Water Heater(s) require a Plumbing Permit. Gas Hot Water Heater require a Plumbing and Gas Permit. This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Plan Review for New Construction or Major renovations
Gas Permit-TEWKSBURY
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  Only Licensed Plumbers, Gasfitters and LP Installers can apply for this permit. Gas Hot Water Heater(s) requires a Gas Permit and Plumbing Permits.

recordTypes.name: Automatic Amusement License
recordTypes.description: Any individual or business that is seeking to keep or operate Automatic Amusement Devices must have an approved license from the Select Board.

recordTypes.name: Liquor License
recordTypes.description:
Applications for all liquor licenses are available on the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commission (ABCC) website at the URL below. Applications must be filled out electronically and uploaded onto your application with the Select Board and all of the required attachments and fees.
 
https://www.mass.gov/apply-for-an-alcoholic-beverages-license-abcc

recordTypes.name: Sheet Metal Permit -TEWKSBURY
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a sheet metal worker is manufacturing, fabricating, assembling, handling, erecting, installing, dismantling, alteration and/or repairing duct work, commercial fans, kitchen hoods and vents, architectural sheet metal and metal roofing.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Plan Review - Minor Renovations/new ownership for Existing Food Establishments
Food Establishment Permit (for new food establishments and residential kitchens) (notifications will be sent when it is time to renew your food permit)
recordTypes.description: The Permit to Operate a Food Establishment expires annually on December 31st

recordTypes.name: ZBA Variance
recordTypes.description: Zoning Board of Appeals Application for Variance

recordTypes.name: Marijuana Annual Renewal (ONLY) License
recordTypes.description:
Applications for all liquor licenses are available on the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commission (ABCC) website at the URL below. Applications must be filled out electronically and uploaded onto your application with the Select Board and all of the required attachments and fees.
 
https://www.mass.gov/apply-for-an-alcoholic-beverages-license-abcc

recordTypes.name: Farmer's Market Liquor License

Temporary Food Permit (if you are applying for a permit for a mobile food truck, whether it is yearly or temporary, OR if you are applying for a YEARLY mobile vendor permit, please use the Mobile Food permit application.)
recordTypes.description: Temporary food permit applications must be submitted and approved by the Health Department within 7 days prior to the event.

recordTypes.name: ZBA Party Aggrieved
recordTypes.description: Zoning Board of Appeals Application as a Party Aggrieved

recordTypes.name: ZBA Special Permit
recordTypes.description: Zoning Board of Appeals Application for Special Permit

recordTypes.name: Frozen Dessert Permits
recordTypes.description: Frozen Dessert permits expire annually on March 1st

recordTypes.name: One Day Liquor License
recordTypes.description: One-Day liquor license ONLY in accordance with Chapter 138, Section 14

recordTypes.name: Funeral Director
recordTypes.description: Funeral Director permits expire annually on April 30th

recordTypes.name: Health & Wellness Fair Registration
recordTypes.description: Registration form for Health & Wellness fair vendors.

recordTypes.name: Hotel, Motel, Lodging and Rooming House Permit
recordTypes.description: Hotel, Motel, Lodging and Rooming House permits expire annually on April 30th

recordTypes.name: Indoor Ice Skating Rink
recordTypes.description: Indoor Ice Skating Rink permits expire annually on December 31st

recordTypes.name: Installer's License (for grease tank installs and D-box repairs ONLY)
recordTypes.description: Installer permits expire annually on Jan. 31st

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Permit (this permit is for a YEARLY mobile food truck/cart, YEARLY mobile vendors or those applying for a TEMPORARY mobile food truck/cart permit. If you are not a mobile truck/cart and want to apply for a temporary food permit, please use the temporary food permit application)
recordTypes.description:
Yearly Mobile food permits expire annually on December 31st. 
Yearly Mobile food permit fee is $150.00.
Temporary mobile food permit is $50 per event

recordTypes.name: Offal, Solid Waste, Medical Waste Collection, Transport & Disposal Permit (anything other than septage)
recordTypes.description: Offal, Solid Waste, Medical Waste Collection, Transport & Disposal Permit expire annually on Jan. 31st

recordTypes.name: Recreational Camp License Application
recordTypes.description: The Recreational Camp License is required to operate a Recreational Camp in the Town of Tewksbury.

recordTypes.name: Septage Hauler Permit
recordTypes.description: Septage Hauler permits expire annually on Jan. 31st

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool: Public, Semi-public, Wading pool and special purpose Operation Permit
recordTypes.description: Pool permits expire annually on April 30th

recordTypes.name: Tanning Facility License
recordTypes.description: Tanning Facility permits expire annually on April 30th

recordTypes.name: Tobacco Sales Permit (notifications will be sent when it is time to renew your tobacco permit)
recordTypes.description: Retail Tobacco sales permits expire annually on Dec. 31st

categories.name: Building Department
Conservation Commission
categories.content:
Welcome to the Tewksbury Conservation Commission Online Permitting Page!


Below, you will be able to complete various different applications and pay applicable fees online. Supplemental information pertaining to the Tewksbury Conservation Commission, including (but not limited to) filing deadlines, the Tewksbury Wetland Protection Bylaw, policies, and guidance documents can be found at:

categories.name: Health Department
categories.content: Health Department
