categories.name: Fire Dept
categories.content: ONLINE PERMITTING CURRENTLY AVAILABLE FOR:

recordTypes.name: Catering Notification Form
recordTypes.description: Use this form to notify the Town of upcoming catering events

recordTypes.name: Opioid Settlement Funds Mini Grants
recordTypes.description: Apply for the Town of Bourne's Opioid Settlement Funds Mini-Grant program here. The application period is December 1, 2025 to January 10, 2026 at 11:59 PM.

recordTypes.name: Annual Entertainment License
recordTypes.description:
New applicants only. Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license. 

Apply for an Annual Entertainment License here.

recordTypes.name: Master Drainlayer License
recordTypes.description:
New Applicants Only: Apply for a Master Drainlayer License here. 

Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Mooring Inspector Application
recordTypes.description: Application for the Town of Bourne, Department of Natural Resources list of Approved Mooring Inspectors.

recordTypes.name: Change of Address Request
recordTypes.description: Request to update your mailing address for real estate, personal property, boat excise tax, sewer billing, marina/mooring billing. You must call your water district directly to update your address for water billing.

recordTypes.name: General Online Permitting and Licensing Help
recordTypes.description: Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing your Information

recordTypes.name: Event Inquiry/Reservation Form
recordTypes.description: Use this form to inquire about hosting an event or to reserve the date and location for your event. Note: This form does not constitute official event approval

recordTypes.name: Annual Common Victualler/Food Vendor License
recordTypes.description:
New Applicants Only: Apply for a Common Victualler or a Food Vendor license here. 

Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

Common Victualler: any establishment that has on its premises the ability to assemble, prepare, or cook food and has seating for the purpose of consuming that food on the premises.
Food Vendor: Any eating or drinking establishment or place where food or drink is prepared for sale or for service to the public on the premises or elsewhere, that is not licensed as a Common Victualler or Innholder.

These licenses do not include liquor.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is ONLY used for new construction, renovations (including deck, kitchen and bathroom), alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs to existing buildings including commercial, and one and two family buildings.

recordTypes.name: Bed and Breakfast Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: Licenses to operate Bed & Breakfast Establishments expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Establishment License Application
recordTypes.description: Effective November 1, 2019, there are amended local regulations in effect applicable to all existing and new Body Art Establishments. Licenses for Body Art Establishments expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Building- Express Permit RESIDENTIAL ONLY( Roof, siding, windows/doors, shed over 200sf, solar, insulation/weatherization, temp storage, fence, stove)
recordTypes.description: This application is used for smaller projects: roof, siding, roof mounted solar, windows/doors, fence, and sheds over 200 square feet.

recordTypes.name: Business Certificates
recordTypes.description:
New Applicants Only. Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license. 

Business Certificates are required for any person conducting a business at an address within the borders of the Town of Bourne and are valid for four years. Applications for a Business Certificate must be notarized if not signed in person at our office.

recordTypes.name: Open Burning Permit
recordTypes.description:
Open Burning Permit - Valid for the entire Open Burning Season (January 15 through May 1).

310 CMR 7.07, The Air Pollution Control Regulations, prohibits commercial and institutional open burning.

recordTypes.name: General Use of Town Property Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application when an event specific application is not available.

recordTypes.name: Car Wash on Town Property
recordTypes.description:
Apply to hold a car wash on town property here. Applications must be submitted no later than 30 days prior to the event. Car washes are only permitted at the following locations:
1. Fire Station #3 (Sagamore Beach)
2. Fire Station #2 (Barlows Landing, Pocasset)
3. Town Hall
4. Jonathan Bourne Public Library
5. Veterans Memorial Community Center

recordTypes.name: Residential Resale Inspection  - Smoke and CO Compliance (26F & 26 F1/2)
recordTypes.description: This form is the application for an inspection to meet the requirements of Massachusetts General Law Chapter 148, Section 26F and 26F1/2 for residential properties. The inspection will confirm that smoke and carbon monoxide alarms meet the requirements for the sale or transfer of property.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Practitioner Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Body Art Practitioner Permits expire annually on December 31st or are available for Temporary Technicians who perform body art services for less than 14 days.

recordTypes.name: Installation or Alteration of Oil Burning Equipment & Storage of Oil
recordTypes.description:
Application for a permit and certificate of completion for the installation or alteration of fuel oil burning equipment and the storage of fuel oil.

At this time, there are no Bourne Fire/Rescue or Town of Bourne requirements related to oil storage tanks that are above and beyond the requirements of the Massachusetts Comprehensive Fire Code - 527 CMR.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Practitioner Apprentice Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Body Art Practitioner Apprentice Permits expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Block Party
recordTypes.description: A block party is a social gathering or party for all the residents of a block or neighborhood, typically held on a closed-off private or public way.

recordTypes.name: Alcohol License - New or Transfer
recordTypes.description: Annual or Seasonal Alcohol Licenses

recordTypes.name: Parade/Procession
recordTypes.description: Apply to have a parade or procession here

recordTypes.name: Propane Installation, Storage, and Use
recordTypes.description:
Permit for the installation, storage, and use of 42 pounds of propane or more. The includes aboveground and underground installations, LP tank exchange, and LP filling stations.

A new permit is required upon the expiration of any tank, or upon the change of propane delivery company.

An additional permit may be required from the Plumbing Inspector. Please contact the Building and Inspection Department at 508-759-0600, and follow the voice prompts for the Inspection Department.

recordTypes.name: Body Works Establishment Application
recordTypes.description: Body Works establishment permits expire on December 31st and can be renewed annually.

recordTypes.name: Energy Storage System Permit
recordTypes.description: For battery and energy storage systems as regulated by 527 CMR, and NFPA 855.

recordTypes.name: One Day Vendor License
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a one-day hawker/peddler vendor license. No hawker/peddler vendor activity shall be permitted in the Town of Bourne without a valid license issued.

recordTypes.name: Campground/Manufactured Housing Community Application
recordTypes.description: Campground and manufactured housing community licenses expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Complaint Form
recordTypes.description: This form is to be used to submit and track complaints.

recordTypes.name: Unvented Fuel-Fired Heater Permit
recordTypes.description: Fire Department permit for the installation of an unvented propane or natural gas-fired space heater. You will need a separate gas fitter permit and inspection.

recordTypes.name: One Day Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a One Day Entertainment License here. Do not click "Select" if you are trying to apply for an Annual Entertainment License. You may apply for multiple one-day licenses within a single application.

recordTypes.name: Antique, Second-Hand Goods, Junk Dealer License
recordTypes.description: NEW LICENSES ONLY! Do not click "Apply" if you are looking to renew your license. Apply for an Antique, Second-Hand Goods, Junk Dealer License in the Town of Bourne. You need to apply for a license if you plan to solicit for, be a collector of, or a dealer in antiques, secondhand goods and/or junk within the Town of Bourne.

recordTypes.name: One Day Liquor License
recordTypes.description: Apply for special one-day liquor license here.  An individual or entity may only be issued a maximum of thirty (30) special one day licenses in a calendar year.  All Massachusetts alcoholic laws must be observed.

recordTypes.name: Hot Works Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for a permit to conduct hot works, including welding and allied processes; heat treating; grinding; thawing pipe; powder-driven fasteners; hot riveting; torch-applied roofing; and similar applications producing a spark, flame, or heat.

recordTypes.name: Farmers Market Food Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: Farmers Market means a public market or public marketplace located in a city or town that operates or occurs more than once per year for the primary purpose for Massachusetts farmers, from more than one farm, to vend food, crops and other farm related items that they have produced directly to the public, or a public market or public marketplace used by farmers that is established by a municipality under M.G.L. c. 40, § 10, or operates on Department of Conservation and Recreation land by special permit under M.G.L. c. 132A, § 2F.

recordTypes.name: Hazardous Materials Processing Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for a permit to process hazardous materials, for the responsible official at a facility with hazardous materials processing.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: To be filled out by any establishment/organization which deals in any form of food products including milk, cream and frozen desserts.

recordTypes.name: Road Race - Use of Town Roads
recordTypes.description: Any entity who wishes to utilize the streets and ways of the Town of Bourne for competitive or non-competitive purposes, including but not limited to running, walking, cycling, or the operation of motorized vehicles such as motorcycles must complete the Road Race Permit

recordTypes.name: Beach Clean-ups
recordTypes.description: Apply for a beach clean-up event here. Beach clean-up events are only allowed between 8 a.m. and 2 hours prior to sunset from October to May and may not occur on federal and state-recognized holidays.

recordTypes.name: Class I, II & III Motor Vehicle Dealer License
recordTypes.description:
New Applicants Only: Application for a Class I (new), Class II (used), or Class III (junkyard) license in the Town of Bourne. 

Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Plan Review
recordTypes.description: For new, remodeled, renovated, or changes to food operations or ownership.  For new establishments, this review is required  prior to applying for a Food Establishment Permit.

recordTypes.name: Waste Oil Storage
recordTypes.description: Permit application for the storage of waste oil.

recordTypes.name: Propane Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for a permit to remove propane storage tanks, in accordance with the Massachusetts Comprehensive Fire Code, 527 CMR Table 1.12.8.43 and Section 69.1.2.

recordTypes.name: Funeral Director
recordTypes.description: Funeral Directors licenses are renewable annually on May 1st.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Open-Air Parking Lot License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a temporary open-air parking lot license here. An individual or entity may only be issued a maximum of thirty (30) temporary open-air parking lot licenses in a calendar year.

recordTypes.name: Farmer's Market Permit (Alcohol Sales)
recordTypes.description: A Farmer's Market Permit allows wineries, breweries, and distilleries to provide samples of their produced alcoholic beverages and sell by the bottle/case their product for off-premises consumption. These special licenses are issued in accordance with MGL Chap 138 Section 15F

recordTypes.name: Request for Determination of Applicability (RDA)
Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for complete demolition of a building and/or accessory building. For partial and interior demolition use the Building Permit application.

recordTypes.name: Hotel & Motel
recordTypes.description: Licenses to operate a hotel, motel, inn, or guest/ efficiency units expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Underground Tank Removal
recordTypes.description: Application for the removal and transportation of an underground storage tank for underground storage tank owners.

recordTypes.name: Industrial Waste Hauler
recordTypes.description: Application fee of $200.00 is non-refundable.  Cash or check payable to the Town of Bourne required.  Permits may not be prorated or transferred and expire on December 31st. Incomplete applications will be returned for corrections/ completion and delay the issuance of a permit.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Heat Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to provide temporary heat.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services. 
 Also includes low voltage wiring. 
Also including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: Road Opening/Utility Work Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application is to be used by the utility companies (or private contractors thereof) for requests to cut into/opening a road for the:
relocation, retirement, repair, renewal or installation of a gas line(s) or mains
relocation, retirement, repair or installation of a line/pipe/mains to carry water
relocation, retirement, repair or installation of cables for internet or telephone use

Adequate plan must be submitted with permit

recordTypes.name: Gas Fitter Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when natural gas gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Quarterly Innkeeper Inspection
recordTypes.description: Application for a quarterly fire inspection for all innholder licenses.

recordTypes.name: Quarterly Institutions Inspection
recordTypes.description: Application for a quarterly inspection of institutions as defined by the state building code, licensed by and under the supervision of the department of public health, or licensed by the department of public welfare.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical/Sheet Metal Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required to erect, install, enlarge, alter, do major repairs, remove, convert or replace a mechanical system.  The property owner or owner’s agent can apply for this permit.  This permit is issued by the Building Inspector.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Camps
recordTypes.description: Licenses to operate a Recreational Camp for Children is renewable no less than 90 days before the camp commences.

recordTypes.name: Yard Sale
recordTypes.description: Apply for a permit to have a yard, garage, and/or barn sale here. Application must be submitted at least three days before date of proposed sale. Off premises signs are not allowed.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Rubbish Hauler
recordTypes.description: Garbage Removal licenses expire annually on December 31st

recordTypes.name: Day Care/Preschool Annual Inspection
recordTypes.description: This is the application for day care and preschool facilities to request an annual fire department inspection.

recordTypes.name: Application/Permit for Supervised Display of Fireworks
recordTypes.description: Application for a permit for a supervised display of fireworks for a licensed fireworks shooter or company.

recordTypes.name: Septage Haulers
recordTypes.description: Septage Haulers/ Pumpers license’s are expire annually on December 31st

recordTypes.name: Plumbing & Gas Water Heater or Boiler Combo Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime the building’s Water Heater or Boiler is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Septic Installer Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits may not be prorated or transferred and expire on December 31st each calendar year.

recordTypes.name: Self Service Fueling Plans Review
recordTypes.description: This is the application to start the plan review process for new or modifications to existing self-service gas stations in Bourne. This process does not replace sending five hard copies of the plans to the fire department for review. Please submit the hard copies to Bourne Fire/Rescue, 51 Meetinghouse Lane, Sagamore Beach, MA 02562.

recordTypes.name: Stable License
recordTypes.description: Horse stable licenses expire annually on June 30th

recordTypes.name: Shed Registration Form: under 200sf
recordTypes.description: This application is used for sheds under 200 square feet.

recordTypes.name: Blasting Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to conduct blasting operations. A fire department detail will be required in addition to the permit application fee.

recordTypes.name: Storage of Combustible or Flammable Materials
recordTypes.description: Application for a permit to store flammable or combustible solids, liquids, or gases.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for permit to operate a public, semi-public swimming pool, or wading pool. Swimming Pool licenses expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Trench Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime a trench hole or other excavation is being done to a depth of 3 (three) feet or more.  If this application is in connection with a road opening permit, please attach copy of road opening permit.

recordTypes.name: Tanning Facility License
recordTypes.description: Tanning licenses expire on June 30th and may be renewed annually

recordTypes.name: Disconnection of Fire Protection System
recordTypes.description:
THIS PERMIT IS NOT FOR THE INSTALLATION OF NEW FIRE & LIFE SAFETY SYSTEMS OR FOR MODIFICATIONS TO EXISTING SYSTEMS.

Permits for new fire and life safety systems are applied for and granted through the building department, including, but not limited to fire alarms, fire suppression systems, and sprinkler systems.

Permits are required for the disconnection of fire protection systems outside of routine maintenance.

In accordance with Massachusetts General Law, Chapter 148, Section 27A, and Section 13.7.2.2 of the Massachusetts Fire Code, 527 CMR, a permit from the fire department is required for shutting off, disconnecting, obstructing, removing, or destroying any part of any sprinkler system, water main, hydrant, or other device used for fire protection, or carbon monoxide detection and alarm in any building.

Depending on the nature and scope of work, this department may require a fire watch, which may incur an additional cost to the applicant or property owner.

In addition, a permit may be required from the Bourne Inspector of Buildings for work on fire protection systems that are required in accordance with the Building Code.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster Permit
recordTypes.description: In accordance with section 19.1.1 of the Massachusetts Fire Code, 527 CMR, a permit is required for any rubbish container of greater than six cubic yards.  Permits are not required for dumpsters which are delivered to a location and removed in the course of a single business day.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Permit
recordTypes.description: Temporary Food Establishment permits can be used up to 14 days.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco & Nicotine Products Sales Permit
recordTypes.description: Tobacco Sales licenses expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Dispensing Motor Fuel from a Tank Vehicle
recordTypes.description: This is the application for a permit to refuel vehicles located at commercial, industrial, governmental, or manufacturing establishments from tank vehicles.

recordTypes.name: Tank Truck and Fuel Transfer Truck Storage
recordTypes.description: This is an application for one permit per company or corporation for the storage of all tank truck and fuel transfer tank vehicles parked in the Town of Bourne during non-business hours.

recordTypes.name: Well Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to install private water supplies.

recordTypes.name: Fire, EMS or Community Outreach/Public Education Detail Request
recordTypes.description: This is the form for requesting fire or EMS details from Bourne Fire/Rescue. We require at least 48 hours notice (2 business days) to set up the detail. Additional dates can be requested at the same time. When a detail needs to be canceled, notify the duty officer at least 24 hours prior to the scheduled detail by calling 508-759-4412, and via a message on this application.

recordTypes.name: 21E Research
recordTypes.description: A request for research into the history of a property under Massachusetts General Law, Chapter 21E -  Massachusetts Oil and Hazardous Material Release Prevention and Response Act. All requests are processed following receipt of payment and are completed within ten (10) business days.

recordTypes.name: Agricultural Burning Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for agricultural open burning in accordance with Massachusetts General Law, Chapter 111, Section 142L. Permission to allow burning shall be based solely on whether appropriate meteorological conditions exist to ensure safe burning. THIS IS NOT AN OPEN BURNING PERMIT FOR BURNING BETWEEN JANUARY 15 AND MAY 1.

recordTypes.name: TEST
recordTypes.description:
DO NOT APPLY FOR ANY PERMIT OR INSPECTION USING THIS APPLICATION.

This is an internal application for fine-tuning the permitting application and inspection process for Bourne Fire/Rescue.

categories.name: Building Dept
categories.content:
Apply for building, electrical, plumbing, and other permits related to construction. See below for applications. If you have any questions, contact the Town of Bourne Building Department at (508) 759-0600 Ext.1512.

UNIT 1  on the address means there is one dwelling unit on the property.

Pocasset Mobile Home Park is filed under 141 Barl

categories.name: Select Board/ Administration
categories.content:
We are currently working on adding more online permits/licenses, as well as improving our current applications. Please have patience while we work on this process.

If you have any questions, contact the Town Administrator's Office at (508) 759-0600 x1503

categories.name: Fire/Rescue & Emergency Services
categories.content:
This is the portal for applying for fire department permits. Choose the appropriate application below.

Bourne Fire/Rescue does not issue permits for new fire alarms, kitchen fire suppression systems, sprinkler systems, or modifications to existing fire and life safety systems. Permitting for new fire and life safety systems is addressed in the Building Code and under the authority of the Building Commissioner. Please check with the Building Department for the permit requirements for tho

categories.name: Conservation
categories.content:
Application Timeline and Process

1. We are now accepting e-permits for RDA (Request for Determination of Applicability

categories.name: Special Events
categories.content:
Full information regarding Special Events can be found here : Special Events | bournema (townofbourne.com)
Attention Applicants!
  • Select Board Approval Required: All events must be approved by the Select Board, which only meets twice a month

recordTypes.name: Bulk Water Hauling Station Access Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit application for private water hauling companies, utility companies and construction contractors.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Inspection and Maintenance Reporting
recordTypes.description: Annual maintenance report for stormwater infrastructure.

recordTypes.name: Backflow Prevention Device Permit
recordTypes.description: Testable backflow prevention devices are required to protect the City's Public Water System for potentially harmful reverse flows from various private development projects. These devices are required for ALL commercial, industrial, multi-use and multi-family greater than 4-units type developments.

recordTypes.name: Hawkers and Peddlers License
recordTypes.description: Any hawker, peddler, itinerant vendor, trader, farmer, merchant, or other person who sells, offers to sell, or takes orders for merchandise from temporary or transient sales locations within the City or who goes from town to town or place to place within the City for such purposes requires a Hawkers and Peddlers License.

recordTypes.name: Express Building Permit
recordTypes.description: For Fences, Roofing (Re-Shingle only), Sheds (200 sq ft or less), Siding and Windows ONLY

recordTypes.name: Sewer System Development Fee
recordTypes.description: Applies to new residential, commercial or industrial construction with sewer connection permit applications submitted on or after September 6, 2022.

recordTypes.name: Water System Development Fee
recordTypes.description: Applies to new residential, commercial or industrial construction with water connection permit applications submitted on or after September 6, 2022.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit (Minor)
recordTypes.description: For Residential alterations to include Additions, Renovations, Decks, Garages, Pools, Solar, Accessory Apartments, In-Law Apartments etc

recordTypes.name: Major Building Permit
recordTypes.description: A major building permit application is used for any project that is new construction, such as a new home, new apartment building, new condo(s), new manufactured home or new non-residential building, as well as any commercial construction or alterations/additions.

recordTypes.name: Drainage Permit
recordTypes.description: Drainage permit is for stormwater management and erosion control.

recordTypes.name: Obstruction Permit
recordTypes.description: Sidewalk Obstruction Permit

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: All electrical work.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: All plumbing work requires a plumbing permit.

recordTypes.name: Utility Company Excavation Permit
recordTypes.description: Excavation permit for utility companies only.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: All mechanical work such as heating, ventilation, air conditioning, tank installation, furnaces, boilers, gas line / piping work.

recordTypes.name: Special Event License
recordTypes.description: Banners, Parade/Race, Raffles, Solicitation, Wrestling/Boxing, Fundraisers, Other

recordTypes.name: Taxi License
recordTypes.description: Taxi Operator, Taxi Driver, Taxi Vehicle, Taxi Vehicle Transfer

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for demolition only of a building or a portion of a building. Please note that a third party hazardous material report is required for demolition either with and abatement plan or showing that there are no hazardous materials.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for any signs requiring a sign permit per Article 29 of the City's Zoning Ordinance.  https://www.ecode360.com/32219511

recordTypes.name: Outdoor Dining License
recordTypes.description: Outdoor Dining Licenses are required when a licensed food establishment wishes to use City property for outdoor dinning.

recordTypes.name: General License
recordTypes.description: Includes - Second Hand Dealers, Pawnbrokers, Junk Dealer, Motor Vehicle Junk Yard, Mobile Home Park licenses and Drop Off Bins

recordTypes.name: Pyrotechnics Permit
recordTypes.description: Fireworks permit

categories.content:
Effective January 1, 2025 we are following NH adopted 2021 ICC codes.

recordTypes.name: Vitals Statistics Request(s)
recordTypes.description: Use this form to request a birth, marriage, or death certificate.

recordTypes.name: Westminster Parking Lot Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for employee permit parking in the Westminster Choir College Parking Lot A. Employers may apply & pay online for up to ten (10) permits.

recordTypes.name: Parking Meter Bag Request
recordTypes.description:
All requests must be submitted at least 48 hours prior to the date meter bag(s) are needed, Monday-Friday (holidays included). 

EFFECTIVE 3/31/25 Meter Bags cannot be reserved for weekend or evening usage.  All meter bags must be removed by 5PM Monday-Friday.

recordTypes.name: Spring Street Garage Permit Renewal ONLY
recordTypes.description: For current permit holders ONLY.

recordTypes.name: Princeton Fire Department Volunteer Interest Form
Initial Application to Volunteer for the Princeton Fire Department
Affordable Housing Rental Application
recordTypes.description: Thank you for your interest in the Affordable Housing Rental Program in Princeton. Your first step toward renting an affordable unit is to complete and electronically submit this Preliminary Application.

recordTypes.name: Princeton Prepares Registry
recordTypes.description: The Princeton Prepares - Extra Assistance Registry is a voluntary program to help emergency responders better serve residents who find it difficult to help themselves in the event of a major disaster or extreme weather events, such as a hurricane or heatwave.

recordTypes.name: Tax Sale Bidder Information Application
recordTypes.description: Instructions: Complete the following information to assist the tax office in the preparation and redemption of tax sale certificate(s). Submit it online or with the payment of the certificates purchased. One form must be prepared for each person in whose name a certificate is issued.

recordTypes.name: Backyard Chicken Registration / Renewal
recordTypes.description: Annual registration for backyard chickens is required. Failure to register every year will result in a $50.00-$500.00 fine. Registration fee is $20.00. Application requires photo or sketch of coop.

recordTypes.name: Alarm Registration
recordTypes.description: All residential and commercial alarms must be registered with the Princeton Police Department. Alarms are to be registered within 30 days of installation and re-registered during the town-wide biennial January alarm re-registration period.

recordTypes.name: Residential Rental Property Registration and Inspection
recordTypes.description: To be completed by the owner to register a rental property and schedule the inspection.

recordTypes.name: PRD Facility Request Form
recordTypes.description: Picnic pavilions/areas are available to be reserved at the following parks: Community Park South (covered pavilion), Greenway Meadows, Grover Park, Marquand Park, Smoyer Park and Turning Basin(covered pavilion). Picnic areas at all other locations are available first come first served and may not be reserved.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
A sewer permit is required for any new sewer connection or reconnection; temporary disconnection or
permanent disconnection of any sewer lateral; alteration, replacement, or repair of any sewer lateral within
any portion of the public right-of-way or any municipal sewer easement; or an addition, alteration, or change
in use to any property which will increase the daily volume of sewage from the property.

recordTypes.name: 1. How to Sign Up and Create an Account
Application for Outdoor Dining License
recordTypes.description:
An Outdoor Dining License is required for businesses to operate an outdoor dining use within the public right of way to adjacent buildings. A detailed plan must be submitted for approval, along with the appropriate application fee and annual license fee. 

Only owners or registered agents of retail food establishments may apply for Outdoor Dining Licenses.

recordTypes.name: Additional Trash Cart Request
recordTypes.description: Please submit your request here for one additional 32-gallon or 64-gallon trash cart.

recordTypes.name: Application for Tree Removal from Private/Public Property
recordTypes.description: Property owners are required to apply for a permit before the removal of a tree. Please contact a licensed tree expert if you need an evaluation of the health of a tree on private property.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention - Certificate of Smoke Alarm & Carbon Monoxide Alarm Compliance Application
recordTypes.description: A Certificate of Smoke Alarm & Carbon Monoxide Alarm Compliance is required whenever there is a change of ownership or occupancy in a one- or two-family structure or attached single-family structure. ONLY FOR PROPERTIES WITHIN THE MUNICIPALITY OF PRINCETON. Not required if the building will be demolished or renovated (to the extent it cannot be occupied during renovation). Call the Fire Marshal’s Office at (609) 497-7646 for a waiver letter.

recordTypes.name: Bicycle Registration
recordTypes.description: Residents are encouraged to register their bicycles with the Princeton Police Department to assist in identifying their bicycle in the event that it was lost or stolen.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Property Registration
recordTypes.description: To be completed by the owner or long-term lessee to register a short-term rental property.

recordTypes.name: CP Pool Community Room Facility Request Form
recordTypes.description:
To make a reservation for the CP Pool Meeting Room, you MUST be a Princeton Resident or a current CP Pool Member.  Reservations can also be made in person at the Princeton Recreation Department Office at 380 Witherspoon Street, Monday through Friday from 9 am to 5 pm.  

Reservation days and times are as follow: 
Weekends & Holidays: Noon to 2:00 pm & 3:00 pm to 5:00 pm* 
*Unless otherwise noted

recordTypes.name: Lead Paint Hazards Inspection
recordTypes.description: To be completed by municipal staff to add a lead inspection to a rental inspection

recordTypes.name: Application to Donate to Microforest Project
recordTypes.description: Princeton’s first Microforest Project at Quarry Park will turn 5,000 square feet of underutilized lawn-covered parkland into a natural ecosystem. The planting of 1,500 trees and shrubs will improve carbon sequestration and water absorption and enhance the biodiversity of the park. Donations to support this project may be made in memory of or to honor a special person or event, or as an undesignated donation.

recordTypes.name: Application to Request a Street Tree
recordTypes.description: Princeton engages in a bi-annual tree planting contract to plant street trees in an effort to restore and maintain the tree canopy throughout the municipality. To request a street tree be planted adjacent to your property or in another public location, please submit an application to determine the eligibility and feasibility for an upcoming tree planting contract.

recordTypes.name: Fire Safety Business Registration Form
recordTypes.description:
This is a registration form to register your business with the Princeton Bureau of Fire Safety. It is critical that all of the information is up to date and correct. We will use this information for both Fire Safety Inspections and Fire Department Response.
If you have any questions regarding the form please call us at 609-497-7646.

recordTypes.name: Cart Swaps, Missing/Damaged Carts, and Leased Cart Returns
recordTypes.description: Please use this application to request a swap to a smaller cart, report a missing/damaged cart, or return a trash cart.

recordTypes.name: Engineering Site Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: Any improvement to one and two-family homes which creates more than 400 square feet of net new impervious area or disturbs 5,000 square feet of land is required to include an on-site stormwater management facility, subject to Engineering approval of the site plan.  This Engineering review of a site plan must be completed before Zoning Department and Building Department permit submittals.

recordTypes.name: Agent Certification
recordTypes.description: To be completed by the designated agent

recordTypes.name: Princeton Recreation Youth Basketball Clinic Supervisor
Firearms Fee Payment
recordTypes.description: In order to streamline the payment of the firearms fees we have set up this document for online payment option for applicants.

recordTypes.name: Lost Property Report
recordTypes.description: Lost property is property that is lost or missing and is not believed to be a theft.  Examples would be leaving an item unattended and not remembering exactly where you left it.  If you blieeve the item was stolen, please call (609) 921-2100 to report the incident.

recordTypes.name: Application for Extension of Time to Correct Housing Code Violations
recordTypes.description: To be completed by the owner if violation repairs require additional time

recordTypes.name: Municipal Board and Governing Body Stormwater Training
recordTypes.description: In accordance with the Tier A Municipal Stormwater General Permit, Municipal Board and Governing Body members who review and approve applications for development and redevelopment projects must complete stormwater training within six months of commencing duties and once per term of service thereafter.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit Application - FOOD TRUCK
recordTypes.description: ONLY FOR TRUCKS OR CARTS WITH A FIXED HOOD FIRE SUPPRESSION SYSTEM.  (Other types of vehicles may require an Open Flame Fire Safety Permit.)  Issued per vehicle, per event/day for events located within the Municipality of Princeton.  PLEASE NOTE:  FOOD TRUCKS ARE NOT PERMITTED ON PUBLIC STREETS OR PROPERTY.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit Application - TENT/CANOPY
recordTypes.description: Required for tents/canopies greater than 30 linear feet in any direction.  For tents/canopies to be used between April 1st and November 30th only.  A separate permit is required for each tent/canopy located more than 5 feet from another tent/canopy.  Tents/canopies less than 5 feet apart are considered one.

recordTypes.name: Permit to Excavate/Occupy the Public Right of Way
recordTypes.description: The permit to excavate and/or occupy the public right of way permisses contractors, utility providers, and the general public to excavate and/or occupy any roads, streets, alleys, highways, sidewalks, shared use paths, curbs or gutters under the jurisdiction of the municipality (paved or unpaved). A detailed plan must be submitted for review prior to beginning work, along with the appropriate permit fee and bond.

recordTypes.name: Vacant House Request
recordTypes.description: Notify the Princeton Police Department that you will be out of town for a period of time.

recordTypes.name: Notice of Change of Status
recordTypes.description: To be completed by the owner when the property ceases to be rented

recordTypes.name: Youth Basketball League Volunteer Coach
Voluntary Community Camera Program Registration
recordTypes.description:
In furtherance of the concept of community partnerships, the Princeton Police Department is requesting residents, businesses, and organizations that have security cameras in place on their property to complete a short registration form. The registration is voluntary and does not give the Princeton Police Department access to your camera system.  It allows our agency to maintain a database of active cameras in the event a crime occurs in the area.  As crimes occur nearby, residents and business owners are not always aware that their system may have captured information that could help solve the crime, thus keeping our community safer.

If you would like to partner with the Princeton Police Department in deterring criminal activity and capturing violators, we encourage you to register your surveillance cameras with us.

recordTypes.name: Residential Food Scraps Drop-Off Program Registration
recordTypes.description: Register here for the food scraps drop off program by answering the following questions. Once completed, you will be notified by email that you may participate. Only one application may be submitted per dwelling. Additional applications will be removed.

recordTypes.name: Princeton University Lead-Safe and Lead-Free Certificate Upload Portal
recordTypes.description: Upload your lead-free or lead-safe certificate here. For use by Princeton University only.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit Application - OPEN FLAME
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for the use of firepits and grills (regardless of fuel type), for gas or propane-powered tent heaters, for the use of open flame devices in a theatrical performance, or for candles or sterno being used in a non LHU assembly area.  A separate permit is required for each individual grill that is separated by more than 5 feet horizontally.  Except for tent heaters and theatrical performances, open flame permits are issued per event per day.

recordTypes.name: Landscape Registration Application
recordTypes.description: Landscape contractors will be required to register and provide a Certificate of Insurance showing that said applicant has purchased and maintains workers' compensation insurance from an insurance company licensed in the State of New Jersey as may be required by law.

recordTypes.name: Reservation for Bulk Waste
recordTypes.description: Bulk items are collected every Wednesday. Please submit your request for bulk waste pick up by 11:59 p.m. the Sunday prior. Residents will be notified of the collection date once scheduled. Do not place bulk items curbside until you receive the assigned pickup date.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit Application - CUTTING/WELDING
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for the use of hot work performed within Princeton. Hot work includes any cutting or welding operations.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Facility Inspection and Maintenance Report
recordTypes.description: Property owners, Homeowners Associations, and business owners responsible for inspections and maintenance of stormwater facilities must submit the following form annually to the Engineering Department. Please complete one form per contiguous stormwater system.

recordTypes.name: Youth Academy Application
recordTypes.description: Application to participate in the Princeton Police Department's Youth Academy which is scheduled for July 29, 2025 - July31, 2025 from 8:30AM to 12:30PM.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention - Type 4 Permit for Flammable/Combustible Materials
recordTypes.description: The Uniform Fire Code states:  “It shall be unlawful to engage in any business activity involving the handling, storage or use of hazardous substances, materials or devices; or to maintain, store or handle materials; to conduct processes which produce conditions hazardous to life or property; to install equipment used in connection with such activities; or to establish a place of assembly without first obtaining a permit from the fire official.” [N.J.A.C. 5:70-2.7(a)]

recordTypes.description: Application for Certification for Proper Connection of Sump Pumps/Roof Drains and Other Surface and Ground Water Drains

recordTypes.description: This permit is required for the use of firepits and grills (regardless of fuel type), for gas or propane -powered tent heaters, for the use of open flame devices in a theatrical performance, or for candles or sterno being used in a non LHU assembly area.  A separate permit is required for each individual grill that is separated by more than 5 feet horizontally.  Except for tent heaters and theatrical performances, open flame permits are issued per event per day.

Application for projects consisting only of a trade: 
HVAC, Water Heater, Generator, Electrical Fixture, Gas Line, Electric Vehicle Charging Station, Duct Work, Plumbing Fixture, and/or Water or Sewer Line

recordTypes.name: Report a Minimum Housing Code Violation
recordTypes.description: Minimum Housing Code Violations include abandoned structures, unsafe equipment or systems, pest infestations, open storage/trash, overgrown yard/weeds, plumbing leaks and ventilation issues.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to pay the annual inspection fee for stormwater control measures.

recordTypes.name: Report a Zoning Code Violation
recordTypes.description: Zoning Code Violations include building without permits, illegal signage, land disturbance, over occupancy, front yard parking, improper /unapproved use of structures, lighting problems, and short-term rental violations.

recordTypes.description: Use this application only for new construction, additions, alterations, repairs of One & Two-Family dwellings, Duplexes and Townhouses (less than 4 stories) covered by the NC Residential Code.

recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a Form District Permit for properties in Blue Hill.

recordTypes.description: Use this application for appeals and variances.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application for new construction, additions, alterations, and/or repairs of:  commercial, educational, office, institutional, apartment, condominium and/or multifamily-residential buildings.

recordTypes.description: Use this application for Community Design Commission review of building elevations, lighting plans, alternative buffers, and applications for Blue Hill Certificates of Appropriateness (COA).

recordTypes.description: This is a form that allows anyone with questions to enter the address and question and get a response from a staff member about their questions.  It also serves to keep questions attached to addresses so there is a record of what information has been discussed about a property.

recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a Conditional Zoning District.

recordTypes.name: Report a Private Property Code Violation
recordTypes.description: Private Property Code Violations include dumping trash, a hazard or a nuisance, junk/dilapidated vehicles, and other unsanitary conditions.

recordTypes.name: Development Agreement Compliance Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a Development Agreement Compliance Permit for Glen Lennox.

recordTypes.name: Permit Modification Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for modifications to Final Plan Zoning Compliance Permits and minor modifications to entitlements (Conditional Zoning, Special Use Permit).

recordTypes.name: Townhouse Building Type Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Use this application for review of Townhouse buildings.  Please use one permit per Townhouse building type.  There is no permit issued with this application.  For review only.

Plat Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application for exempt plats, recombinations, easements, right-of-way dedications, boundary surveys, condominiums.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Zoning Compliance Permit
recordTypes.description: A Short Term Rental (STR) Zoning Compliance Permit is required for the rental of all or part of a residential dwelling unit for a period of less than 30 days for compensation.

recordTypes.description: This is a permit for the core and shell of a commercial project that will be administratively divided into separate permits for different areas of the building structure.

recordTypes.name: Parking Deck Commercial
recordTypes.description: This is a permit application for a parking deck that is part of a commercial project that will be administratively divided into separate permits for different areas of the building structure.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for Planning Commission review and approval of a project as required in Section 4.7 of the Land Use Management Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for Council review of a Special Use Permit.

recordTypes.name: Supplemental Forms
recordTypes.description: This section contains forms that may be required for permits based on the scope of the project.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application for major subdivisions, minor subdivisions, and final plats.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for an administrative (staff review only) Zoning Compliance Permit or a Final Plans Zoning Compliance (post-entitlement projects).

recordTypes.name: Zoning Closeout (Staff Only)
recordTypes.description: This application is for staff only.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Letter
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Verification Letter will state a property's zoning district.

categories.name: Help & Resources
categories.content: Welcome to the Help and Resources page for the City of Marion Permitting and Licensing Portal. Here, you’ll find everything you need to navigate the permit application process with ease. Whether you're a first-time applicant or a seasoned professional, our guides, FAQs, and support tools are designed to help you understand requirements, submit applications, and track your progress seamlessly.

categories.name: Planning & Development Services
categories.content: Our Planning and Development Department is here to help shape the future of our community while ensuring that growth aligns with local priorities, safeguards public health and safety, and enhances economic and community development while protecting the environment.

categories.name: Building Permitting and Inspections
categories.content: The City of Marion Building Department is dedicated to ensuring that all construction within our community meets safety standards, building codes, and local regulations. We play a vital role in safeguarding the health, safety, and welfare of people within our community by reviewing construction plans, conducting inspections, and providing guidance throughout the building process.

categories.name: Code Enforcement
categories.content:
Our Code Enforcement Department is committed to maintaining the safety, cleanliness, and aesthetic appeal of our community. By enforcing health, sanitation, nuisance, and property maintenance ordinances, we work to ensure that our neighborhoods remain vibrant, safe, and compliant with city standards.

Our

categories.name: Utilities
Fire Inspections
categories.content: Within the City of Marion, fire inspections are the responsibility of the Planning and Development Department. Our department maintains a list of all properties that require regular fire inspections, including annual ones such as foster care homes, daycare facilities, schools, and hospitals. All business, however, require an inspection at least every three years. For more information, you may contact the Planning and Dev

recordTypes.description: Instructions on signing up for a ViewPoint Cloud Account and how to access your profile and records.

recordTypes.description: Application for obtaining an Emergency 911/mailing address. Required prior to applying for Planning/Zoning/Code Enforcement permits.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: New Construction, Remodels, Renovations, Structural Repairs, Cosmetic Work etc. for Commercial Projects. Any question that does not have an (*) next to it is not required to be answer, you may skip and move to the next question or step. Please also bring or send 2 sets of hard copies of plans to: Planning/Zoning/Code Enforcement Department, 542 W Ridgeway St, Warrenton, NC 27589.

An NC State Demolition permit may be required based on the project scope. Any question that does not have an (*) next to it is not required to be answered, you may skip and move to the next question or step.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit Application
recordTypes.description: No building, sign, structure or any part thereof, designed or intended to be used shall be erected or repaired until a Zoning Permit has been issued by the Zoning Administrator or his/her authorized representative. A fee shall be charged for the issuance of a zoning permit.

recordTypes.name: Septic Permit/Improvement Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for all new septic system evaluations or upgrades (adding additional flow to the system)

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Home Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for Mobile Home Permit. Please be sure to have a site plan ready to upload with your submission. Trade Permits (electrical, mechanical, plumbing, etc.) related to the set-up of the mobile home are automatically included with a Mobile Home Permit. Any question that does not have an (*) next to it is not required to be answered, you may skip and move to the next question or step.

recordTypes.name: Septic Permit/Construction Authorization
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for all new septic system evaluations, upgrades, revisions, repairs, or connection to an existing septic system.

recordTypes.name: Septic Permit/Existing System Approval
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for approval to use an existing septic system.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Building Permit application, including options for included trade permits.

ANY structure over 144 square feet (12’ x 12’) in size requires a building permit through the Planning/Zoning and Code Enforcement Department – the only exceptions are farm buildings as part of bona fide farms. Additional plan review may be required depending on the extent of the new construction. Sheds/accessory buildings under the noted 144 square feet (12’ x 12’) size do not require a building permit, but may require a zoning permit or electric permit if electric service is to be added.

ALL NEW STRUCTURES (with exception to mobile homes, boathouses, non-covered decks, and those in the size range listed above) REQUIRE SUBMITTAL OF TWO SETS OF HARD COPY (PAPER) PLANS TO BE MAILED OR BROUGHT TO THE CODE ENFORCEMENT OFFICE(MINIMUM 11"x17" PRINT) FOR PLAN REVIEW. ANY PLANS SMALLER THAN MINIMUM WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.

recordTypes.name: LSS/AOWE/Engineer Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this application when submitting plans from a NC Licensed Soil Scientist, an AOWE, or Engineer.

recordTypes.name: Well Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this application when applying for a new private drinking water well, well abandonment, and well repair.

recordTypes.name: Copy of Existing Septic Permit Request
recordTypes.description: Please use this when requesting a copy of an existing septic permit.

recordTypes.name: Water Sample Request
recordTypes.description: Please use this application when requesting water samples. Typical water samples consist of microbiology (coliform/e-coli), inorganics (pH, iron, manganese, hardness, etc.), and nitrates/nitrites. Fees: Microbiology-$75.00; Inorganics only-$100.00; Full Panel (microbiology, inorganics, & nitrate/nitrite)-$150.00. Expect 1-2 weeks for results. Other samples are available upon request. Please contact Environmental Health for all available options.

recordTypes.description: Construction of Additions/Remodels & Repairs for Residential Projects. Any question that does not have an (*) next to it is not required to be answered, you may skip and move to the next question or step. For Additions and structural Renovations, please also bring or send 2 sets of hard copies of plans to: Planning/Zoning/Code Enforcement Department, 542 W Ridgeway St, Warrenton, NC 27589.

For structural work, please also bring or send 2 sets of hard copies of plans to: Planning/Zoning/Code Enforcement Department, 542 W Ridgeway St, Warrenton, NC 27589. Building Permit not required for structures smaller than 12ft x 12ft.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Storage Units
recordTypes.description:
TSU = Temporary Storage Unit

A. Definition: "Temporary Storage Unit" means any container used for the storage of personal property that is typically rented to owners or occupants of real property, but may be owned by such, for their temporary use and which customarily is delivered and removed by truck.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certificate (Zoning Compliance Letter)
recordTypes.description: A zoning certificate, also known as a zoning compliance certificate or zoning certificate of occupancy, is a legal document that confirms a property complies with current zoning regulations and can be used for its intended purpose. It ensures that a property's use aligns with local zoning laws, which are designed to protect the public from potential nuisances or hazards.

Holiday Sales License (RIGL 5-23-1) is for those business' selling retail items on legal holidays including New Year's Day, Memorial Day, Fourth of July, Victory Day, Labor Day, Columbus Day, Veteran's Day, Thanksgiving Day and/or Christmas or any other enumerated holiday officially celebrated.

recordTypes.description: Apply for a  Special Event Permit  -  A SPECIAL EVENT within the meaning of this chapter is any event that requires the partial or full closure of a road or street or other public property, such as a section of a beach or park or public parking lot, or that the applicant or sponsor knows or should know by promotion, public announcements, or past experience.  To view the Special Event Ordinance in its entirety, within the Town Code, click select to proceed to the next page.

recordTypes.name: Collection Box Permit
recordTypes.description: This is an annual permit for placement of a Collection Box pursuant to Section 726 of the Town of Middletown Zoning Ordinance.  The permit year shall begin on July 1 in each year and shall terminate on June 30 of the following calendar year.  A collection box permit shall be renewed annually. The application for renewal must be filed not later than 30 days before the permit expires, otherwise a new permit application must be submitted. The application for renewal shall be upon a form provided by the Building Official.

recordTypes.name: Registration for Short Term Residential Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply for a short term rental registration from the Town of Middletown.  Permit December 1, 2025 - November 30, 2026.

categories.name: Planning Board
categories.content:
Planning Department

The Department serves as an informational office for residents, developers, and business owners providing access

recordTypes.name: Small Wireless Communications Facilities Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is only to be used for small cell facilities located within the right of way. All facilities located on private property should use the Building Permit application under the Building Department.

recordTypes.name: Site Specific Development Plan Submittal
recordTypes.description: A site-specific development plan is the first step towards the issuance of a building permit. All proposed new development, redevelopment, additions, changes of use that necessitates a change in parking area, or residential dwellings with six or more sleeping areas must go through this process.

recordTypes.name: Application for Variance or Special Exception
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Appeals is the body in the City authorized to grant variances and decide special exceptions. A variance is a variance from the requirements of the zoning ordinance when strict application of the ordinance would result in unnecessary hardship. A special exception seeks permission to do something that the zoning ordinance permits only under certain  circumstances.

recordTypes.name: Courtesy Review Request
recordTypes.description: If you are seeking departmental review and comment about a proposed, conceptual development within the City of North Myrtle Beach, we encourage you to utilize our courtesy review system.

recordTypes.name: Permit Application (ALL PERMIT TYPES -- Building & Tree)
recordTypes.description: Use this link to apply for a building permit online!

recordTypes.name: Plat Application
recordTypes.description: A plat is a type of plan that is drawn to scale and shows the divisions of a piece of land. Generally, the City of North Myrtle Beach needs to approve and stamp these plans prior to them being recorded at the county office. If you are submitting a survey, as-built, unit exhibit, or plat, please use this form.

recordTypes.name: Cost Estimate Approval, Plat Completeness Certification or Financial Guarantee Reduction
recordTypes.description: Please use this application to certify a plat or plat's infrastructure as complete, apply for the release of any financial guarantee held by the city, or to to have a cost estimate approved prior to submittal as part of a final plat. Additionally, this application can be used to apply for a reduction in the financial guarantee amount (allowed twice during construction per §20-36).

recordTypes.name: Major Plat Formatting Review
recordTypes.description: We offer a courtesy review for major plats (preliminary & final) to allow a surveyor to correct any formatting errors on a plat document prior to submitting the complete major plat application. These plats are reviewed by staff, but they will also be reviewed again though the Technical Review Committee when the complete major plat submittal is made.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Map and PDD Amendment
recordTypes.description: A zoning map amendment is an official change to the City's Zoning Map that changes the zoning district of a property. This change may allow different land uses or densities. A Planned District Development (PDD) amendment is a change to an existing PDD. If you are submitting for a rezoning, pre-annexation, annexation, PDD zoning, or PDD amendment, please use this form.

recordTypes.name: Addressing Verification
recordTypes.description: An address verification letter confirms the E-911 address for a certain piece of property or business.

Our new permitting system is active as of September 25, 2019.

categories.name: Zoning
categories.content: The Zoning Division of the Planning & Development Department approves building permits and inspects new construction for compliance with the city's zoning regulations. Here, you can apply for a Variance or Special Exception from the City's Board of Zoning Appeals.

categories.name: Public Works
categories.content: The Public Works Department coordinates issuance permits for small wireless communications facilities.

recordTypes.name: Adding Others to Your Application - Guest Portal Access
recordTypes.description: Click here to learn more about adding people to your application.

recordTypes.name: Code Enforcement
recordTypes.description: For code enforcement cases, report any properties that may have violations from the zoning code,, or nuisance violations.

recordTypes.name: Express Solar Permit
recordTypes.description: This is the equivalent of an over-the-counter application for simple solar panel installations.

recordTypes.name: How to Schedule an Inspection
recordTypes.description: Click here for more information on how to schedule an inspection.

recordTypes.name: Express Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: This is the equivalent of an over-the-counter application for simple mechanical projects.

recordTypes.name: Express Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This is the equivalent of an over-the-counter application for simple plumbing projects.

recordTypes.name: Damage Asessment
recordTypes.description: Please note, this damage assessment form should only be used for project types/structures that require a building permit. Fences under 8' in height, sheds/accessory structures under 200 square feet, and cosmetic only damage do not require a damage assessment inspection and will not require a permit to repair unless special circumstances exist such as proximity to a steep slope hazard, wetland, or shoreline.

recordTypes.name: ICC Building Valuation Data
recordTypes.description: Click here for detail on ICC Types of Construction and Occupancy Groups.

recordTypes.name: Street Opening Permit
recordTypes.description: A Street Opening Permit is required to create any opening or excavation within the City of Sun Prairie right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Recycle Center Permit
recordTypes.description:
The City Recycle Center is located at 1798 South Bird Street. Materials accepted at the Recycle Center include mixed recycling (single stream), brush and yard waste, appliances without Freon, oil absorbents, oil filters, waste motor oil, antifreeze, scrap metal, cardboard (flattened).

A recycle center permit is required to enter the Recycle Center. This is a sticker that should be displayed on your windshield when entering the facility.

Questions? Please call the Public Works Department at 608-837-3050

recordTypes.name: Natural Lawn Registration
recordTypes.description: A Natural Lawn Registration is required for the growth of grasses and flowers purposely cultivated to exceed of 8-inches in height from the ground, excluding noxious weeds and grasses identified in Section 8.36.010 of the City's Ordinance and in WI Admin Code NR 40. A Natural Lawn Management Plan is required with registration that includes a written plan relating to the management and maintenance of a lawn upon which the planted grasses and flowers may exceed 8-inches in height.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit
recordTypes.description: Driveway permits must be obtained through the Engineering Department when a driveway is being replaced, modified, or a new driveway is installed.

recordTypes.name: Development Agreement Application (Public Improvements)
recordTypes.description: Applications for the preparation and approval of a Development Agreement in the City of Sun Prairie will not be processed until the required filing fee ($500) is submitted. No partial applications will be accepted. All required information shall be submitted at least one (1) month prior to the Common Council meeting at which the applicant desires to have the agreement considered. An agreement will not be scheduled for review by the Committee until the City Attorney deems it ready for consideration.

recordTypes.name: MWOT - One and two-family homes Minor Work permit
recordTypes.description: This application should be used for minor work to one or two-family homes.  This would include any project that does not require plans to be submitted and approved such as roofing or siding, water heaters or softeners, or furnace or air conditioning replacements; or other miscellaneous construction, electrical, plumbing or HVAC work.

recordTypes.name: MWMC - Multi-family buildings (3+ dwelling units) or commercial buildings Minor Work permit
recordTypes.description: This application should be used for minor work to multi-family dwelling (3+ units) or commercial buildings.  This would include any project that does not require plans to be submitted and approved such as roofing or siding, water heaters or softeners, or furnace or air conditioning replacements; or other miscellaneous construction, electrical, plumbing or HVAC work.

recordTypes.name: Blasting Permit
recordTypes.description: No person within the city shall operate a rock crusher or do blasting in such a manner so that any dust, dirt or vibration from such operation shall, in any way, damage or injure any person or property within the city.  All blasting within the city shall be performed according to the requirements of Chapter Comm 7, Explosive Materials, Wisconsin Administrative Code, and all subsequent amendments thereto.

recordTypes.name: Burn Permit Application (Controlled Burns Only)
recordTypes.description: A burn permit is required for controlled burns associated with natural lawns, prairie restoration, and the maintenance of conservation areas.  A burn permit is not required for cooking fires in manufactured grills, fires in manufactured fire pits, ground level fire rings with a spark arrestor cover and approved fixed outdoor fire features.  Controlled burns shall be planned and conducted in accordance with Chapter 19 of the Sun Prairie General Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Erosion Control and Stormwater Management Permit
recordTypes.description: Erosion Control and Stormwater Management Permit may be required for commercial, industrial and residential dwelling projects. Dane County Land Conservation Department permitting may also be required. See requirements on City of Sun Prairie website.

recordTypes.name: Retaliation Complaint Intake Form
recordTypes.description: As a tenant in Sun Prairie, you have the right to contact the City of Sun Prairie and request that your housing provider address maintenance or safety concerns. Under Sun Prairie Municipal Code Section 9.18, housing providers are prohibited from retaliating against tenants for exercising these rights.

recordTypes.name: OTFD - One or two-family homes  new construction, additions, alterations permit
recordTypes.description:
This application should be used for the new construction of, additions to, or alterations of one or two-family homes.  This would include any project involving the home itself and requires plans to be submitted and approved  Examples including but not limited to:

- New Construction

- Additions (including sunrooms, porches, decks)

- Finishing and remodeling of space (such as kitchens, bathrooms, and basements).

recordTypes.name: MFCB - Multi-family buildings (3+ dwelling units) or commercial buildings new construction, additions, alterations permit
recordTypes.description: This application should be used for the new construction of, additions to, or alterations of multi-family dwellings and commercial buildings.

recordTypes.name: Cigarette, Tobacco, and Electronic Vaping Device License
FSBS - Accessory buildings, structures, fences, pools permit
recordTypes.description: This application form is for work such as fences, private swimming pools, gazebos, pergolas, yard sheds or detached garages.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Cart Permit
recordTypes.description: Food trucks must have a permit from the city of Sun Prairie prior to engaging in sales within the City. Permits will be issued on a calendar year basis. Vendors will be required to display their permit in a conspicuous location. Food trucks participating in a private event not open to the general public are not required to obtain a permit. Food trucks participating in an event hosted by the city of Sun Prairie are not required to obtain a permit.

recordTypes.name: SAPL - SolarAPP+ New Residential Roof Mount Solar permit
recordTypes.description:
This application form is only for new roof mount solar photovoltaic (PV) systems with or without battery storage.  These submittals have been pre-approved by the Solar App+ platform.  
For alterations to existing systems, or ground mount systems serving one or two-family homes please select the appropriate permit type from the list.

recordTypes.name: PV -  Non-SolarAPP+ solar photovoltaic systems permit
recordTypes.description: This application should only be used for the installation of ground mount solar photovoltaic (PV) systems serving one or two-family homes, alterations to existing systems, or all commercial installations.

recordTypes.name: Operator's License (Bartender License)
recordTypes.description: Sometimes referred to as a Bartender's License.

recordTypes.name: FSPR - Commercial Fire Suppression System Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application form is for fire suppression system plan review submittals involving buildings within the scope of the Wisconsin Commercial Building Code.  This does not include Kitchen Hood Suppression Systems.  For those systems, please see Kitchen Hood Suppression System Plan Review.

recordTypes.name: SIGN - Sign permit
recordTypes.description: This application form is for signs.

recordTypes.name: DEMO - Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This application form is for work involving the complete demolition or razing  of a building or structure.

recordTypes.name: FAPR - Commercial Fire Alarm System Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application form is for fire alarm system plan review submittals involving buildings within the scope of the Wisconsin Commercial Building Code.

recordTypes.name: Solicitor's Permit
recordTypes.description: Required for anyone wishing to sell items door-to-door in the City of Sun Prairie.  Persons who have owned or operated a business in Sun Prairie for at least one year, are working for a registered charitable organization, or who are  selling home grown produce do not need a Direct Seller's, Peddler's & Solicitor Permit.

recordTypes.name: KSPR - Commercial Kitchen Hood Suppression System Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application form is for kitchen hood suppression system plan review submittals involving buildings within the scope of the Wisconsin Commercial Building Code.

categories.name: Building Inspection Commercial Plan Review
categories.content: New construction or additions to commercial, industrial, and certain multifamily residential buildings must first be reviewed by the City of Sun Prairie Planning Division for site plan approval and any necessary conditional use allowances / permits. This also applies to any change of occupancy or use of existing commercial and industrial buildings.

recordTypes.description: Use this for completely demolishing a building or structure.  NOT FOR INTERIOR DEMOLITIONS.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit Copy_1
recordTypes.description:
Use this type of permit for piping work (water, drain, waste, and vent; or gas)
**Please NOTE: Town Ordinance does not allow for Residential Properties to install/replace underground fuel tanks of any type.

recordTypes.name: Fire Sprinkler Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this type of permit for new sprinkler system installations or modifications to NFPA 13, 13D, & 13R systems.

Also to include Standpipes NFPA 14, Pumps, Tanks & Fire Mains NFPA 20, 22 & 24.

recordTypes.name: Fire Suppression Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this type of permit for Hood systems NFPA 17 & 17A, Clean Agent Systems ie, FM-200, etc. NFPA 2001, Water Spray & Foam Water Spray NFPA 15 & 16.

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm System Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this type of permit for new fire alarm systems or changes to existing installations NFPA 72.  Fire Alarm shop drawings separate from the Electrical drawings are required.

A new Rights of Way Ordinance(

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Special Events Application
recordTypes.description: A completed Special Event Permit application is required for all events with the City of Lauderdale Lake.  All events will be reviewed by the Planning, Building, Fire and BSO for approval.

recordTypes.name: Open/Expired Permit Research Request
recordTypes.description:
Use this form to request a search for any open or expired permits associated with a property in the City of Lauderdale Lakes. This search identifies permits that remain open, expired, or incomplete in the City’s records. 

Results reflect only information currently available to the City and are not a guarantee that all work on the property was properly permitted.


A $40.00 fee applies to each property parcel number requested.
All Permit Search Requests must be submitted online through the City’s permitting portal.

Please allow seven to ten (7–10) business days for processing. Requests submitted after 2:00 p.m. will be processed on the next business day. Results will be delivered electronically through the online system.

recordTypes.name: BLDG – Contractor & Design Professional Registration
recordTypes.description:
All contractors, private providers, special inspectors, engineers, and architects must register with the City of Lauderdale Lakes before performing any work or submitting documents. 

Registration requires providing a copy of your state license, local Business Tax Receipt (BTR), general liability insurance, workers’ compensation or exemption, and a valid driver’s license. 

Engineers and architects are also required to register.

recordTypes.name: Engineering Permits
recordTypes.description: Engineering Permits authorizes individuals or companies to perform construction, maintenance, or temporary activities within public streets, sidewalks, or easements. Theses permit types ensures that all work is conducted safely, with proper restoration and minimal disruption to the public.

recordTypes.name: Family Days Corporate Booth/Sponsor Application

recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a permit relating to driveways, patios, or other hardscape installations.  Do NOT use this application for sport courts; use the Sport Court Permit Application.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for an electrical-only permit.  This application is only for the following types of work:  electrical service repair/upgrade, residential vehicle charging station, generators.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a permit for residential or commercial elevator and conveyance projects (installation, modernization, or repair).

recordTypes.name: Fence Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a fence permit.

recordTypes.name: Winter Market Sponsor
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply to be a Sponsor of the Deerfield Winter Market.

recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a permit to hold a garage or estate sale.

recordTypes.name: Grading, Drainage, and Foundation Work Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a Grading, Drainage, and Foundation Work permit, including work such as stormwater detention, stormwater discharge (including burying downspouts), drain tile, change of grading on property, window wells, foundation stabilization, foundation membranes, etc...

recordTypes.name: Annual Village Events Sponsor
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply to be a Annual Village Events Sponsor.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a Hazel Avenue Lead Service Program Project permit ONLY.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for an irrigation permit.  This includes replacement of RPZ device and/or installation or replacement of deduct meter.
