recordTypes.description: It is also recommended that all other contacts that are frequently used in permit applications (i.e. Design Professionals, Owners, Project Managers, Superintendents, etc.) also complete a Contact Registration.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certification Letters
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Certification is a letter confirming the existing zoning for a property, usually for legal purposes, and will state the current zoning classification and a list of prior zoning cases.  The zoning certification letters are only provided for parcels within the City of Sandy Springs.

recordTypes.name: Attics Inspections
recordTypes.description: Attic inspections are included as part of the City of Sandy Springs new Multifamily Rental Housing ordinance that consolidates all the requirements into a single ordinance to simplify the annual inspection process. Attics Inspections are conducted by a Certified Building Inspector (CBI).

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Inspections
recordTypes.description: Mechanical inspections are included as part of the City of Sandy Springs new Multifamily Rental Housing ordinance that consolidates all the requirements into a single ordinance to simplify the annual inspection process.

recordTypes.name: 5. User Login & Password Reset Guide
recordTypes.description: If you're having trouble signing into your OpenGov account, follow these steps to troubleshoot and resolve the issue.

recordTypes.name: Character Area Map Amendment
recordTypes.description: A Comprehensive Plan Character Area Map Amendment is a request to amend the City's Comprehensive Plan.  This is required before a Zoning Map Amendment (Rezoning) where the proposed zoning is not allowed in the applicable Character Area.

recordTypes.name: Vendor Verification
recordTypes.description: Food and Alcohol Vendors only at this time.

recordTypes.name: 6 City Development Code
recordTypes.description: Use this document to determine design parameters such as setbacks, minimum lot dimensions, maximum building heights, maximum lot coverage, minimum canopy coverage, and more.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Inspections
recordTypes.description: Electrical inspections are included as part of the City of Sandy Springs new Multifamily Rental Housing ordinance that consolidates all the requirements into a single ordinance to simplify the annual inspection process.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Inspections
recordTypes.description: Plumbing inspections are included as part of the City of Sandy Springs new Multifamily Rental Housing ordinance that consolidates all the requirements into a single ordinance to simplify the annual inspection process.

recordTypes.name: 7. City Technical Manual
recordTypes.description: Use this document to research technical design requirements such as sidewalks, roadway design, water conservation, landscaping, buffer requirements, and more.

recordTypes.name: Plat Division
recordTypes.description: A plat is a map, drawn to scale, showing the divisions of a piece of land.  When a property is divided into “subdivisions”, a review of the proposed divisions is required. The City of Sandy Springs has three types of plat review: a Preliminary Plan (concept) review, a Minor Plat (up to 3 lots), and a Final Plat (4 or more lots) review.

recordTypes.name: Use Permit
recordTypes.description: A request to change or expand an existing use identified as a conditional use in Article 3 through Article 7 or expressly requiring a conditional use permit elsewhere in this Development Code. Conditional use may not be used to allow additional height beyond the allocated district or beyond the maximum bonus height.

recordTypes.name: Quick Tip: How to Complete a Multifamily Rental Housing Inspection
8. Community Development GIS Map

recordTypes.name: City Certified Building Inspector (CBI) Inspections (FOR OFFICIAL CITY USE ONLY)
recordTypes.description: Certified Building Inspector (CBI) Inspections are included as part of the City of Sandy Springs new Multifamily Rental Housing ordinance that consolidates all the requirements into a single ordinance to simplify the annual inspection process.

recordTypes.name: Address Change Request
recordTypes.description: Property owners can request a change to their individual address through City staff review.  Any changes must still be in sequence and meet all of the City's addressing policies.

recordTypes.name: River Corridor Review (MRPA)
recordTypes.description: The Chattahoochee River Corridor is an area that contains any property within 2000 feet from the banks of the Chattahoochee River. The area extends from directly below Buford Dam downstream to the limits of Fulton and Douglas counties. Properties along the Chattahoochee River have an undisturbed 50-foot buffer from the banks of the river as determined by the State of Georgia. These properties also have an impervious surface setback of 150 feet from the banks of the river which prohibits the installation of pavers, gravel, concrete, structures, etc. These buffers are in place to protect state waters and to prevent erosion.

recordTypes.name: MRH Code Upgrade Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit type is exclusive to Multifamily Rental Housing (MRH) properties that are required to modify their structures to meet the current MRH ordinance.  This permit includes the following types of work:
   - Attic Fire Barrier Installation
   - Attic Intumescent Paint Installation
   - Attic Fire Sprinkler System Installation
   - Corridor Non-Combustible Siding Installation

categories.name: Licensing
categories.content: Business License Renewal Season for a 2026 Chamblee Occupational Tax Certificate has begun.  Please submit your renewal before April 15, 2026 to avoid late penalties and interest.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Fire/Safety System Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for Fire Sprinklers, Alarms, Kitchen Ventilation Control/Hoods and Suppression Systems, Emergency Responder Radio Communication System (ERRCS), Fuel Tanks, Spray Booths, and other engineered systems.

recordTypes.name: Home Business Occupation Tax Certificate
recordTypes.description: A Home Business Occupation Tax Certificate is required for anyone, without a commercial location, that uses their residence as an office only to conduct business.

recordTypes.name: Utility Permit
recordTypes.description: Contact Assistant Director Paul Osburn at 678-631-5454 or at pwpermits@smyrnaga.gov with any questions.

recordTypes.name: Film Permit
recordTypes.description: Film permits are issued by the Economic Development Department for all productions which exceed ten (10) on-location crew members and three (3) on-location vehicles on public and private properties within City limits.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential Building Permits are required for New Construction, Accessory Structures, Building Additions, Decks/Porches (including replacements), Interior Renovations, Solar Panels & Generators, Roof Replacements, Window Replacements, and projects involving two (2) or more licensed trades. Other permits may be required based on the scope of work. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Sign Permits are required for new monument signs, wall signs, subdivision directional signs, face changes to existing signs, and temporary signage.

recordTypes.name: Tree Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: Tree Removal Permits are required to remove any tree with a diameter breast height (dbh) of 24 inches or greater on properties with no development activity. Contact the City Arborist for more details: 678-631-5362.

recordTypes.name: Irrigation Meter
recordTypes.description: Property owners may apply for a separate irrigation meter to be billed by the Water Department. Meters must be installed in accordance with the City of Smyrna "Irrigation Backflow Standards". Total fees: $1,765 (Irrigation Meter Fee- $1,700; Meter Permit Fee- $50; Technology Fee- $15).

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Fire/Safety System Permit for Limited Work
recordTypes.description:
Any time work is done to a fire protection system in Smyrna, a limited work permit must be issued. These permits are free of charge (applicant responsible for $15 technology fee,) and only require a scope of work letter to obtain. All applications must be made through OpenGov.

The scope of work letter shall include the project name, address, anticipated start and completion dates, project scope of work, number of sprinkler heads, and a statement indicating there will be no adverse hydraulic effects on the system’s remote area or demand.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Business Occupation Tax Certificate
recordTypes.description:
A Commercial Business Occupation Tax Certificate is required for any business located in a commercial space within the city limits of Smyrna. The Business Occupation Tax Certificate must be issued prior to opening the business.
—
If the business plans to sell alcohol, an Alcoholic Beverage License application must also be submitted.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Commodity Protection Assessment and Arrangement Plan
recordTypes.description:
Tenants/Owners for all Storage Occupancies and Storage use areas must submit a Storage Commodity Description Letter, as well as Commodity Arrangement Plans as documents on the following screen.  Additional items will be required where the building or space is protected with a fire sprinkler system.  The applicable sections for sprinklered buildings are found in the Commodity Protection Assessment and Arrangement Plan Review Checklist that can be found on our website.

It is important to provide accurate information for the proposed commodities and the arrangement of the storage to apply the most appropriate provisions of the fire codes.

recordTypes.name: Water Meter Request
recordTypes.description: All new single-family homes require a 1" domestic water meter to be purchased and installed prior to Certificate of Occupancy. All other meters can also be requested.

recordTypes.name: Tree Assessment Report
recordTypes.description: Tree Assessment Reports can be requested to identify the condition of a tree and make suggestions for mitigating any issues the tree may have. Contact the City Arborist for more details: 678-631-5362.

recordTypes.name: Variance Application
recordTypes.description:
All requests for a variance from the terms of the Zoning Code relating to setbacks, distance requirements between buildings or other substantially similar dimensional regulations, parking, or accessory structures, except when requested as part of a rezoning, shall be heard by the License and Variance Board as established by city ordinance. 

The City of Smyrna License and Variance Board meets on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday of each month.  Hearings begin at 10:00am in the Council Chambers in City Hall at 2800 King St SE.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Commercial Building Permits are required for New Construction, Accessory Structures, Building Additions, Interior Renovations/Tenant Finishes, White Boxes, Racking Systems, Solar Panels & Generators, Cell Tower Colocations, Temporary Modular Buildings, Roof Replacements, and projects involving two (2) or more licensed trades. Other permits may be required based on the scope of work. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Knox Box Key Installation/Update Request
recordTypes.description: Complete this request and a member of the Smyrna Fire Department will arrange to secure the keys in your new box or update the keys in your existing box.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Fire Safety System Removal Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit, when approved, allows for the removal an existing fire safety system. Any fire safety system required by the State of Georgia's minimum standards and/or an approved automatic fire sprinkler system that is required by City of Smyrna ordinance shall not be removed.

This permit to remove a Fire Safety System shall include a letter that contains the project name, the commercial building permit number, the address, the fire safety system type requested to be removed, and a supporting narrative which defines the request.

Note: If approved, there will be no fee if there is either a Commercial Building Permit or a Commercial Building Permit associated with this application (The applicant will be responsible for $15 technology fee). All applications must be made through OpenGov.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential and Commercial Demolition Permits are required for Full & Partial Structural Demo, Interior-Only Demo, and Pool Demo/Infilling. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Pawnbroker Occupation Tax Certificate
recordTypes.description: Pawnbroker Occupation Tax Certificates are issued to any business wherein a well-defined part thereof is to take or receive–by way of pledge, pawn, or exchange–any goods, wares, merchandise, titles for vehicles, or any kind of personal property whatsoever as security for the repayment of money lent thereon.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description: Rezoning applications are due Friday by 4:00pm, 30 days prior to the Planning and Zoning Board meeting.  A copy of the rezoning package can be downloaded from the Community Development Section of the City Website. Appointments are suggested with Community Development before submittal.  Please call Joey Staubes at 678-631-5355 to schedule an appointment.

recordTypes.name: Special Land Use Application
recordTypes.description: Rezoning applications are due Friday by 4:00pm, 30 days prior to the Planning and Zoning Board meeting.  A copy of the rezoning package can be downloaded from the Community Development Section of the City Website. Appointments are suggested with Community Development before submittal.  Please call Joey Staubes at 678-631-5355 to schedule an appointment.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit
recordTypes.description: All land-disturbing activity must be regulated via the issuance of a Land Disturbance Permit. Land-disturbing activity includes, but is not limited to: Tree/Vegetation Removal, Clearing, Grubbing, Stripping, Dredging, Excavation, Reclamation/Infilling, Paving, etc. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Precious Metals Dealer Certificate
recordTypes.description:
A Precious Metals Dealer Certificate application must be completed by any business planning to buy or sell precious metals (e.g., gold, silver, etc.).
—
A Precious Metals Dealer business operating in Smyrna must have a current City of Smyrna Occupation Tax Certificate and a Precious Metals Dealer Certificate.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Consumer Fireworks Use Permit
Mobile Food Vendor Occupation Tax Certificate
recordTypes.description: This application should be completed for the following: 1) Ice Cream Trucks; 2) Mobile Food Vendors; 3) Pushcarts; 4) Temporary Food Establishments.

recordTypes.name: Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential and Commercial Pool Permits are required for new inground and above-ground pools and spas. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Amendment Application
recordTypes.description: Rezoning applications are due Friday by 4:00pm, 30 days prior to the Planning and Zoning Board meeting.  A copy of the rezoning package can be downloaded from the Community Development Section of the City Website. Appointments are suggested with Community Development before submittal.  Please call Joey Staubes at 678-631-5355 to schedule an appointment.

recordTypes.name: Retaining/Detention Wall Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential and Commercial Retaining Wall Permits are required for walls (including wall replacements) that are taller than four (4) feet when measured from the bottom of the footing to the top of the wall. Retaining walls that support a surcharge load or classified liquids must also be permitted, regardless of height. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: Zoning Verification letters are $30 per parcel.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Rental License
recordTypes.description: Every property with a short-term rental unit operating in Smyrna must have a current City of Smyrna Occupation Tax Certificate and Short-Term Rental License.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Sales Certificate
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Sales Certificate is required for any person who sells, or offers to sell, any goods, wares, merchandise, or services from any truck, tent, temporary structure, or temporary location.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit (Standalone)
recordTypes.description: Electrical Permits are required for standalone electrical work that is NOT part of an active Building Permit. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Public Fireworks Display Permit
Plat Approval
recordTypes.description: Plats are required for any subdivisions, after installation of any water quality, and/or reconfiguring land lot lines. Plats must be submitted, approved, and signed by City of Smyrna staff prior to being recorded with the Cobb County Superior Court.

recordTypes.name: Annexation Application
recordTypes.description: Please contact Community Development at 678-631-5355 to confirm your property is eligible for annexation before submitting an application.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal - Tent, Membrane or Special Event Structure Permit
Out of Local Area - Commercial Business Occupation Tax Certificate
recordTypes.description: The Out of Local Area - Commercial Business Occupation Tax Certificate is for those companies wishing to do business in the City of Smyrna that do not have a physical location in the area.

recordTypes.name: HVAC Permit (Standalone)
recordTypes.description: HVAC Permits are required for standalone mechanical work that is NOT part of an active Building Permit. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit (Standalone)
recordTypes.description: Plumbing Permits are required for standalone plumbing work that is NOT part of an active Building Permit. Contact Community Development at 678-631-5387 with questions.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Parking Registration
recordTypes.description: The City of Smyrna requires the registration of accessory parking areas for Special Events and Braves parking. All that is needed to register your parking area is the completion of a quick registration form.

recordTypes.name: Alcoholic Beverage License
recordTypes.description:
An Alcoholic Beverage License application must be completed by any business planning to sell alcohol.  Agent changes for the business also require an application.
—
For new businesses, a Commercial Business Occupation Tax Certificate application must also be completed.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Alcohol Catering Permit
recordTypes.description: A Special Event Alcohol Catering Permit is required for anyone who desires to sell or serve alcoholic beverages temporarily (no more than three consecutive days during the term of the license) for consumption on non-licensed premises during a special event.

recordTypes.name: Final Plat
recordTypes.description: The Final Plat provides the legal and technical data required to confirm compliance with Glynn County Regulations and to proceed with the final approval process for a subdivision.  The Final Plat shall consist of a map or maps, drawn at a scale of not less than one inch in one hundred feet. (Note:  References are to Article VII of the Glynn County Regulations - §709)(scale 1”=100’)

recordTypes.name: Abandonment
recordTypes.description: Application to remove dedicated public interest on specific rights-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Letter
recordTypes.description: This is a request for a zoning certification letter

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Tax Registration- In Home Business
Tax Refund
recordTypes.description: Any taxpayer from whom a tax or license fee was collected who alleges that such tax or license fee was collected illegally or erroneously may file a claim for a refund with the Glynn County Board of Commissioners at any time within one year or, in the case of taxes, three years after the date of the payment of the tax or license fee to Glynn County.

recordTypes.name: Close Business
recordTypes.description: This form should be completed when a business ceases operation in order to officially close the business and stop the assessment of annual Occupation Taxes.

recordTypes.name: Tree Removal Request
recordTypes.description: St. Simons Island property owners Live Oak tree removal request.

recordTypes.name: Reduced or Waived Fee Request Form
recordTypes.description: Fee waivers and reductions are considered for non-profit and community engagement events at county parks. Requests are subject to board approval. A representative must attend the Finance Committee meeting to speak on behalf of the request.

recordTypes.name: NO SOLICITATION LIST
recordTypes.description: Complete this form to be added to the No Solicitation List which prohibits door-to-door sales at the registered address. This list is provided to all applicants for a door-to-door solicitor applicants.

recordTypes.name: Fireworks Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to Conduct Public Exhibition or Display of Fireworks and/or Fireworks or Pyrotechnics Exhibition or Display Before a Proximate Audience.

recordTypes.name: STR Certificate Application- Individual
recordTypes.description: This application is for individual property owners who rent one or two locations.

recordTypes.name: STR Master Certificate Application- Property Managers
recordTypes.description: This application is for individuals and companies who manage the rental process for three or more locations.

recordTypes.name: Add/Remove Property from Master Certificate
recordTypes.description: Complete this form to add or remove a property from your MASTER CERTIFICATE. (This is not to be used for individual STR certificates)

recordTypes.name: PTV Permit
recordTypes.description: Personal Transportation Vehicle Registration Form

recordTypes.name: Condemnation
recordTypes.description: For a condemnation to be reviewed, there needs to be at least 5 Glynn County residents filing a complaint. Please add any additional applicants in the additional applicants section.

recordTypes.name: Plat Vacation
recordTypes.description: Any plat or any part of any plat may be vacated by the owner of the premises, at any time before the sale of any lot therein by filing a written instrument to which a copy of such plat shall be attached, declaring the same to be vacated. Such an instrument shall be executed, acknowledged or approved, and recorded or filed, in like manner as plats or subdivision; and being duly recorded or filed shall operate to destroy the force and effect of the recording of the plat so vacated, and to divest all public rights in the streets, alleys, and public grounds, and all dedications laid out or described in such plat. Sec. 803 Subdivision Regulations

recordTypes.name: Foundation Only
recordTypes.description: Foundation only permits must be approved by The Glynn County Community Development Department before an application may be submitted. Please contact the Community Development Department at 912-554-7459 for more information.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning
recordTypes.description: Application to amend or change the zoning classification of a property as depicted on the Official Zoning Map of Glynn County

recordTypes.name: Expedited Subdivision
recordTypes.description: Applications for subdivisions or modification of a previously approved subdivision as set forth in Subdivision Regulations Article VIII

recordTypes.name: Feather Banner Permit
recordTypes.description: A free-standing temporary sign typically constructed with a plastic or metal shaft driven in the ground and an attached pennant typically in the shape of a feather, teardrop or rectangle that is vertically elongated and attached to a shaft.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Construction Plans
recordTypes.description:
Application that typically follows approval of a preliminary plat of a subdivision to describe, in detail, any physical improvements related to streets, drainage, and utilities. 
If the site is on septic, you must attach a Level 3 Soil Evaluation to this application and have applied for a commercial septic tank permit with the Department of Public Health.

categories.content: Apply for or renew a short-term rental certificate or master certificate. Step by step instructions can be found below.

recordTypes.name: Coop License Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a chicken coop license to keep backyard hens on your property.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter Request
recordTypes.description: Request a Zoning Verification Letter for a property or multiple properties in the City of Champaign.

recordTypes.name: Business Buildout Program
recordTypes.description: Small businesses may apply for up to $20,000 in reimbursement to establish physical storefronts in the City of Champaign.

recordTypes.name: 5. How to Reach Us! About Us & Contact Information
recordTypes.description: How to reach us!

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk Cafe Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply for a sidewalk café permit to extend your service areas onto public rights-of-way.  These permits are renewed annually for qualifying businesses.  The permit runs concurrently with the calendar year.

recordTypes.name: Tent Permit Application
recordTypes.description: For tents over 700 sq. ft. or multiple tents without 10 feet of separation in an over 700 sq. ft. footprint.  For events that require a special event permit, this tent permit application is not required.  The tent permit will be part of the special event application.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration Application
recordTypes.description: Complete this application if your company is a contractor wishing to apply for a permit, or any design firm (architectural, structural engineering, or professional engineering) responsible for signing/sealing any drawing to be submitted for review, even if that design firm is not the applicant or the architect of record. Professional Land Surveyors are not required to complete this application. Sole proprietors offering services in his/her name as licensed (e.g., Bob Smith, Architect) are not required to have a Design Firm Registration Number but are still required to complete this Contractor Registration Application. Sole proprietors shall contact Building Safety at 217-403-6100 for directions on how to complete the contractor registration form. Companies which have submitted an application and payment to the state but have not yet received the Design Firm Registration Number issued by the State of Illinois shall contact Building Safety at 217-403-6100 for directions on how to complete the contractor registration form while the state is processing your information.

recordTypes.name: Development Application
recordTypes.description: Application forms for planning and zoning cases

recordTypes.name: Liquor License
recordTypes.description: This liquor license application is used to apply for a new business liquor license, or to process a change to an existing liquor license (i.e. change of ownership, change of license category, change of form of ownership, expansion of premises, transfer of location, additional owner).

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for one- and two-family dwellings and townhouses (not more than three stories in height above grade plane) designed to meet the requirements of the International Residential Code (IRC), including new construction, additions, alterations, and changes of occupancy. For all other building types, complete the "Commercial Building Permit" application.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Occupancy Permit
recordTypes.description: No person may temporarily occupy or use any City right-of-way other than a roadway for more than four consecutive hours without first obtaining a permit from the Director of Public Works.   No person shall cause, create or maintain any obstruction of any right-of-way, unless specifically authorized pursuant to the Champaign Municipal Code.  Except pursuant to a permit issued by the City, no person shall construct any facility, or perform any work on any facility, on, over, above, along, upon, under, across, or within any City right-of-way or occupy City right-of-way.   No person shall place sidewalk furniture, signs or dumpsters in any City right-of-way or operate any outdoor cafes or conduct outdoor retailing on any City right-of-way except pursuant to a permit issued by the City.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for commercial and multi-family buildings and structures designed to meet the requirements of the International Building Code (IBC), including new construction, additions, alterations,  changes of occupancy and specialty projects (e.g., footing and foundation only, roof recover, roof replacement, ground-mounted solar, roof-mounted solar, swimming pools and spas, and telecommunication and broadcast towers). Each building or structure on the lot requires a separate building permit. Where a single building has more than one address, input the primary address for the project and include the overall building address as an additional location. For one- and two-family dwellings and townhouses designed to comply with the International Residential Code (IRC), complete the "Residential Building Permit" application instead of this application.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Liquor License
recordTypes.description: A temporary liquor license is needed if selling alcohol, charging admission to an event that includes the service of alcohol, or serving alcohol at a catered event where the caterer does not have a City liquor license. Applicants should carefully review the City's Liquor Ordinance for regulations concerning temporary liquor licenses before applying. Applicants may also contact City staff to review your particular proposal and discuss your eligibility and possible options before applying for a temporary license.

recordTypes.name: Nuisance
recordTypes.description: Exterior property area concerns in the City of Champaign.  Some examples are tall grass and weeds, garbage and refuse, & inoperable vehicles.

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit required to connect to the City of Champaign's sanitary sewer system or repair existing connections to the system.

recordTypes.name: Tenant Inspection
recordTypes.description: Interior inspections of tenant occupied residential properties in the City of Champaign.

recordTypes.name: Housing Inspection
recordTypes.description: Exterior building conditions of residential properties in the City of Champaign.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for all plumbing work, including new work, alterations, and replacement of fixtures (e.g., water heater replacement). This application shall also be used for gas piping installed by the plumbing contractor.

recordTypes.name: Pavement Degradation Fee
recordTypes.description: Pavement Degradation Fee

recordTypes.name: Fire Sprinkler Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for all fire sprinkler work, including new work, alterations, and replacement projects.

recordTypes.name: Redevelopment Incentive Program
recordTypes.description: Reimbursement applications for up to $200,000 or 20% of project costs for building improvements in City of Champaign TIF districts.

recordTypes.name: Storm Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit required to connect to the City of Champaign's storm sewer system or repair existing connections to the system.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building
recordTypes.description: Exterior building issues at commercial properties.  For interior concerns in commercial properties, please contact the Fire Department at (217) 403-7200.

recordTypes.name: Seasonal Liquor License
recordTypes.description: This short-term liquor license is designed for establishments that provide recreational or agricultural services to the public but are open 6 months or less. This license permits the licensee to sell alcoholic liquor by the drink for consumption on the premises where sold.

recordTypes.name: Farmers' Market License
recordTypes.description: A Class F Farmers' Market license shall authorize the retail sale of alcohol in its original package, not for consumption on the premises, at a farmers' market.

recordTypes.name: Vacant Structure
recordTypes.description: Monitoring and registration of vacant residential structures in the City of Champaign.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for all mechanical work, including new work, alterations, and replacement projects. This application encompasses heating, ventilating, air conditioning, refrigeration, hoods, and hood suppression. It also includes gas piping when installed by the mechanical contractor.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Approach Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit required to construct, remove/replace, or alter driveway approach (portion of driveway that exists in City of Champaign right-of-way)

recordTypes.name: Fireplace Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for new construction of a gas or woodburning fireplace or when adding a gas insert to an existing fireplace. For gas piping to a fire pit, complete the "Mechanical Permit" application in lieu of this application.

recordTypes.name: Grading and Drainage Permit
recordTypes.description: The Champaign City Council has enacted an ordinance (Municipal Code Section 29.5) requiring stormwater drainage to be accounted for on most development activities.  The City Engineer is to approve all grading and drainage work above certain thresholds.

recordTypes.name: Keg Permit
recordTypes.description: A City keg permit is required for events involving the use and possession of alcoholic liquor with a total cumulative capacity exceeding sixteen gallons (i.e. more than one standard size keg). Applications must be submitted at least five working days in advance of the event.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a sign permit: wall sign, freestanding sign, canopy or awning sign, projecting sign, or temporary sign.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Erosion Control Permit
recordTypes.description: The Champaign City Council has enacted an ordinance that requires construction sites to take steps to minimize soil erosion during and after construction.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for all electrical work, including new work, alterations and replacement projects. This application also encompasses electrical work for roof-mounted and ground-mounted solar projects. For temporary electrical service, complete the "Temporary Electrical Service Permit" application in lieu of this application. For fire alarm work, complete the "Fire Alarm Permit" application.

recordTypes.name: Liquor License Rider Addition
recordTypes.description: Application to add a Liquor License Rider to an existing, eligible liquor license. This includes the following Rider types: Catering, Package, BYOB1, Video Gaming, Grocery Cafe, and Outdoor Cafe.

recordTypes.name: Class A - Presence of Minors Exemption
recordTypes.description: This application is used to add a specific exemption to a Class A liquor license to allow for the presence of minors on site without a required parent or guardian. Class A licenses must follow specific requirements as listed in Sec 5-45(g)(3) of the Liquor Code.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Electrical Service Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for temporary electrical service only. For all other electrical work, complete the "Electrical Permit" application. For fire alarm work, complete the "Fire Alarm Permit" application.

recordTypes.name: Class III Land Disturbance/Erosion Control Permit
recordTypes.description: The Champaign City Council has enacted an ordinance that requires construction sites to take steps to minimize soil erosion during and after construction.

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for all fire alarm work, including new work, alterations and replacement projects. For all other electrical work, complete the "Electrical Permit" application or the "Temporary Service Electrical Permit" application, as applicable.

recordTypes.name: Music Venue Rider Addition
recordTypes.description: This Rider permits eligible establishments to host All Ages Shows as described in Section 5-45.2 of the City's Liquor Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for demolition of an entire building or structure or portion thereof. Selective demolition associated with a commercial building permit or residential building permit does not require a separate demolition permit. For commercial work, the selective demolition work shall be shown on the drawings. For commercial and residential projects, the selective demolition work shall not commence until the building permit application has been submitted for review.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit required to construct, remove/replace, or alter City of Champaign sidewalk.

recordTypes.name: Music Venue - All Ages Show Registration
recordTypes.description: Licensees with a Music Venue Rider can host "All Ages Shows" as outlined in Section 5-31.5 of the City's Liquor Ordinance. Licensed establishments must use this form to register each All Ages Show with the City at least 14 days prior to the event.

recordTypes.name: Teen Event License
recordTypes.description: This form is used by a licensee to register an all-teen event, which allows licensed establishment to admit people under twenty-one years of age to enter and remain upon the premises, as outlined in Section 5-45.1 of the City's Liquor Ordinance. Every all-teen event must be registered with the City at least five business days in advance of the event.

recordTypes.name: Moving Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for moving a building or structure to another lot or to another location on the same lot. Sheds and other accessory structures moved by flatbed truck or trailer do not require a moving permit.

categories.name: Address Request Form
categories.content:
This page is currently under construction. If you need to have an address assigned, contact Brandon Haist in Public Works at (217) 403-4700.

A valid address is required to be assigned and available in our database before applying for a permit.

categories.name: Neighborhood Services
categories.content:
The Neighborhood Services Department responds to concerns about property conditions in the City of Champaign.  If you have any questions we can be reached at neighborhoodservices@champaignil.gov or by calling (217) 403-7070.

Please note that concerns about noise should be directed to the City of Champaign Police Department at (217) 333-8911.

categories.content:
Liquor Licensing

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration
recordTypes.description:
Certificate of Liability Insurance
Required
The Certificate of liability insurance must have the following:

Minimum of $500,000 for each occurrence of death or bodily injury.
Minimum of $100,000 for each occurrence of property damage, OR must have combined single limit covering both bodily injury and property damage, minimum $500,000 each occurrence.
Policy number
Effective and expiration dates of coverage
Name of sole proprietor, partnership, or corporation as the insured
Name, address, and phone number of insurance provider
City of Fishers listed as Certificate Holder: City of Fishers, 3 Municipal Dr. Fishers, IN 46038
Coverage may NOT be limited to a single job
Notify Permits and Inspections department in writing at least 30 days prior to cancellation.

recordTypes.name: ADA Grant
recordTypes.description: The 2026 ADA Grant program by the City of Fishers provides up to four matching grants of up to $2,500 each to support accessibility improvements at physical locations within the city. The grants aim to fund projects that remove barriers and enhance inclusion for individuals with disabilities through sustainable infrastructure or facility upgrades. Priority will be given to projects with the greatest community impact and long-term accessibility benefits.

recordTypes.description: Use this form for visits to city parks with groups of 20 or more.

recordTypes.name: Compost Tumbler
recordTypes.description:
Prior to completing this FREE COMPOST TUMBLER application, take a water quality pledge at indiana.clearchoicescleanwater.org and save a digital copy of the pledge verification sheet (automatically generated by the site) or a screen shot of the pledge approval to your computer, phone, tablet, etc.  You will need to upload that sheet or screen shot to the compost tumbler application and to be eligible for the composter.

After completing your application, please monitor your email as you will be notified of your compost tumbler approval via email through the application portal.  Upon approval, you will receive instructions on where to pick up your composter.   There may be a several week delay between an application and a  City notice to pickup your tumbler due to expected application volume and inventory.  Thank you for your interest!

recordTypes.name: Honor A Hero
recordTypes.description: Honor a service member in your life during a special ceremony hosted by the City of Fishers in partnership with the Fishers Parks and Recreation Foundation. Purchase a brick paver to be engraved and installed at Liberty Plaza, located in the center of the Nickel Plate District. Your family and friends will have a place to celebrate your loved one and their selfless sacrifice for years to come.

recordTypes.name: Alarm Permit Application and Renewal
recordTypes.description: The City of Fishers maintains an alarm ordinance that requires homes and businesses with security/fire alarm systems to have an alarm permit application on file with the police department. The purpose of the permit is to accurately track contact information for the owners of these structures, help reduce the number of false fire and security alarms, and ensure that emergency alarm systems function properly. By reducing responses to false alarms, duty officers are available to respond to other calls for service.

recordTypes.description: Annexation is the legal process by which a person or entity requests to be incorporated into the City. The most common example is when a property owner wants to connect to City services for a development project.

recordTypes.name: Drainage Easement Permit (Fences and Other Easement Improvements)
recordTypes.description: Any construction, grading, improvements, such as but not limited to fences, patios, sheds, decks, pools, tile installations, sump pump re-routes, etc. within the drainage swale or drainage easement require this type of permit authorization from the Public Works Department.  In addition, a parallel construction permit is required by the Departments of Planning and Permitting and Inspections for Decks, Pools/Spas, Building Additions, Screened-in Porches, and Accessory Structures or Sheds.  Please contact those Departments at 317-595-3120.  THIS PERMIT IS TO BE COMPLETED BY THE CONTRACTOR.           Permit Requirements:      1. Extent of easement encroachment:      a.  Minimum of 10 feet of easement width must be provided for storm sewer maintenance access and drainage flow behind easement construction.      b. If the drainage easement is shared by two properties behind or beside one another, at least 5 feet of easement or drainage swale width must be provided on each property.      c. The 10 feet easement access width minimum is intended for fences, small sheds, and minor landscaping that may be more easily removed if more width is required. Decks, patios, pool patios, etc. that are inherently more difficult to remove, may have a larger easement restriction requirement based on the case review and the overall easement width.      d. Decks cannot be attached to the home if they are permitted to encroach within the easement.      e. Decks, patios, etc. with proposed permanent roof structures cannot be attached to the home or have any supportive member of the roof structure within the drainage easement.           2. If storm pipe or drains exist within the easement, the 10 feet gap requirement should be divided equally with a 5 feet gap on both sides of the pipe/structure.          3. Existing condition of the swale/easement:  a. If existing encroachments prevent adequate maintenance access, the permitted encroachment may be more strictly limited to maintain the 10 feet easement width required for flow or maintenance.          4. Encroachments shall be allowed on the home side of the drainage easement so maintenance access and drainage flow is allowed behind the encroachment.          5. Willows or other water loving species of trees are strictly prohibited within any portion of the drainage easement if storm sewers exist nearby due to their aggressive nature and ability to damage and obstruct storm sewers .         6. Fences or other improvements shall not cross-cut the swale perpendicular to the swale flow line (regardless of open or closed panel fence types, removability of panels, or gate options)          7. Swale grading or other tile installations to improve drainage within the easement must restore grade to the original flow line grade or to a steeper, improved flow line grade.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description: The purpose of this application is to provide for the issuance of special event permits to regulate events on the public streets, rights-of-ways, parks, and public property of Fishers and to provide for fees, charges, and procedures required to administer the permit process for all Fishers Special Events.  Such events are outside of the usual and expected use of public streets, right-of-ways, and public property.

recordTypes.name: FHD School Health Club Grant
recordTypes.description: To provide students with programming, support, and resources to address health, wellness, or social determinants of health in the community through community service projects within the HSE School District area. Social determinants of health are the conditions which people are born, grow, live, work and age that shape health. Social determinants of health include factors like socioeconomic status, education, neighborhood and physical environment, employment, and social support networks, as well as access to health care.

recordTypes.name: Certified Pool Operator Training Course
recordTypes.description: The Fishers Health Department is now offering the PHTA Certified Pool Operator course. Intended for facility operators of public and semi-public pools, this 2 day in-person class covers all facets of safely operating and maintaining a pool, from mechanical operations to diagnosing issues and dosing chemicals.

recordTypes.name: Fishers Advisory Committee on Disability Sponsorship
recordTypes.description:
Fishers Advisory Committee on Disability Sponsorship Application

Thank you for your interest in supporting Fishers Disability Awareness Month. Organized by the Fishers Advisory Committee on Disability, this annual community initiative highlights disability awareness, accessibility, and inclusion throughout Fishers.

Sponsorships help make these programs and events possible while also recognizing organizations that are committed to supporting and uplifting the disability community.

This application allows you to submit your sponsorship information and complete payment securely online. Sponsorship benefits vary by level and are outlined on the next page.

recordTypes.name: Annexation Application (Non-Contiguous)
recordTypes.description: This annexation application is for property that is non-contiguous and does NOT MEET the requirements for annexation but still wishes to connect to City of Fishers Sewer. The property owner must still submit a petition for annexation and waiver of remonstrance. This will allow the City to annex the property when it meets the eligibility requirements.

recordTypes.name: Food Service Facility Fats, Oils and Grease (FOG) Program Modification Request Form
recordTypes.description: Submittal of this form does not guarantee a modification will be granted.  The grant of a modification based on this form may be revoked at any time if wastewater is identified as having a negative impact to the health, safety, and welfare of others, or if circumstances warrant.  A modification only applies to the specific part of the program mentioned in this form and not for any other part.  The request will not be processed if it is found to be incomplete

recordTypes.name: Emotional Survival  for Law Enforcement
recordTypes.description: Join us for a full day (8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.) of training on Kevin Gilmartin’s - Emotional Survival for Law Enforcement.  Teaching law enforcement professionals to survive and live through a police career cannot be limited to just teaching operational tactical survival skills.  Training for officers and their spouses or significant others with the skills of emotional survival are just as important.

recordTypes.description: Please fill out for death certificate request

recordTypes.description: The State of Indiana requires a license to operate a childcare facility. Use this form to submit a request for a zoning confirmation letter if your business is located within the City of Fishers.

recordTypes.name: Storm Sewer Tap Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for drain tile or sump pump taps into public storm pipe or storm drains.  If the applicant wants to apply for a  Stormwater Grant for this work, they must complete a Stormwater Grant and obtain approval first before finalizing this permit.  If a storm drain beehive structure is located on the property, the tap permit should be requested for the beehive and not the storm pipe.  ALL APPLICATIONS MUST BE COMPLETED BY THE OWNER AND NOT THE CONTRACTOR.  Permit requirements are listed next. 1. Call utility locates to determine the storm sewer locations. 2. Carefully excavate down to the storm sewer depth or the required depth for a structure tap. 3. Core drill a hole size slightly larger than the diameter of the drain tile or sump line connection diameter. 4. Drain tile connections must be flush with the inside wall of the pipe or structure. 5. Grout the drain tile or sump pump pipe to the storm pipe or structure wall with a cement-based hydraulic cement. 6. Backfill around the drain tile or sump pump pipe and the storm pipe or structure with #8 stone. If the excavation is within the road right-of-way, use flowable fill per the Engineering Department right-of-way excavation permit requirements. 7. Backfill any remaining excavation volume with the original soils and compact the excavation with a vibratory or similar compactor. 8. Use seed and straw or seed and erosion control blanket (if within a swale flowline) to restore the disturbed area of the excavation area.

recordTypes.name: Vehicle Inspection Number (VIN) Checks
recordTypes.description: Indiana State law requires that a person must obtain a certificate of title for all vehicles owned by that person within 60 days of becoming an Indiana resident. Further, Indiana residents must title newly acquired vehicles no later than 31 days from the date of purchase. Police officer inspections, commonly referred to as VIN (vehicle identification number) checks, are required if the vehicle was not previously titled in Indiana. Any vehicle coming into Indiana from another state, including those assigned to an Indiana resident on a manufacturers certificate of origin, must be inspected.

recordTypes.name: Fishers Arts & Culture Business Matching Grant
recordTypes.description: The Fishers Arts & Culture Business Matching Grant is targeted at businesses & organizations for the installation of public art on their property. The City of Fishers will provide Request for Qualifications (RFQ) facilitation to help select an artist if needed.

recordTypes.name: Grading Permit
recordTypes.description: The Grading Permit is an early release for mass earthwork on a site for which an Improvement Location Permit application is under review.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Grant
recordTypes.description: The Stormwater Grant was developed to help residents with drainage, floodplain, or water quality related improvements.  Applications are accepted year-around.  The grant provides up to a 50% cost reimbursement for projects such as drain tile installs, sump pump re-routes, swale re-grading, bank stabilization and other erosion projects, pond dredging or muck reduction, rain garden and native plant installs, and floodplain improvements, such as elevating buildings and/or installing flood vents.  Applicants will need to create an account on this Viewpoint Cloud software first (under the Sign Up menu at the top of this page) in order to be able to complete an application.  Applicants are responsible for project  completion and full payment prior to submitting receipts for reimbursement.  Grant approval is required before moving forward with the project.  Note that three (3) contractor quotes are required for comparison in the grant approval process.  If you are completing the work yourself, the City only needs labor, materials, and equipment estimates from the owner.  Please provide copies of store or website costs for materials and equipment and use $15 per hour for owner labor costs.

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer Repair/Replace/Add Permit
recordTypes.description: This form should not be used for new sewer laterals.

recordTypes.name: Impact and Sanitary Sewer Fee Appeal
recordTypes.description: The Impact Fee Review Board hears appeals from developers and builders relative to impact fees assessed to their projects.

recordTypes.name: Fishers Police Cadet Application
recordTypes.description:
The Fishers Police Department Cadet Program is for Fishers residents between the ages of 14 and 19 who are interested in a possible law enforcement career. Cadets will not only receive classroom lessons but will also participate in hands-on training activities led by members of the police department, ride alongs with officers, and opportunities to volunteer at City events.  

Program advisors want to increase the visibility of the cadets in and around the City of Fishers. Therefore, cadets will be receiving training in areas such as radio communications, patrol tactics, and crowd control as they volunteer their service to the community.  The goal is to provide cadets with the skills and qualifications needed in the law enforcement field.

recordTypes.name: Food Facilities Complaint
recordTypes.description: Use this form to report complaints about an establishment, complaints about a food product at an establishment, and/or complaints about suspected illness from a food establishment.

recordTypes.name: Neighborhood Vibrancy Grant
recordTypes.description: The purpose of the Neighborhood Vibrancy Grant is to provide funding for creative and innovative ideas that make our community a more beautiful place to live.

recordTypes.name: Improvement Location Permit
recordTypes.description: An Improvement Location Permit (ILP) is required for all commercial, industrial and multi-family apartment developments. This permit allows for site work only.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for a stand alone floodplain permit with no other associated City permits required associated with the property.

recordTypes.name: Private Road Dedication Application
recordTypes.description: All eligible private roads within the designated neighborhood must be submitted for acceptance by the HOA/POA or property owners responsible for the private road for applications to be considered. Additionally, approval will be subject to the satisfaction of conditions being met after an onsite assessment by the Department of Engineering. You may view the ordinance and policy conditions at Fishers.in.us/ResidentialPrivateRoads.

recordTypes.name: Fats, Oils, and Grease (FOG) Program Quarterly Report Submissions
recordTypes.description:
Include cleaning and maintenance receipts along with the Maintenance Log when submitting. The
quarterly reports shall be submitted no later than ten (10) business days following the reporting quarter.

recordTypes.name: Nickel Plate Review Committee
recordTypes.description: The Nickel Plate Review Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving Architectural Drawings and Civil Site Design for developments which fall within the Nickel Plate districts (DC, MC, VC, HC, TC).

recordTypes.name: Food Truck Permits
recordTypes.description: A Food Truck Permit is required for any mobile concessions operation within City limits. These permits are valid for one calendar year and must be renewed annually.  Use this form to apply for new and renewal food truck permits.

recordTypes.name: Teen Academy Application
recordTypes.description: The 23rd session of the Fishers Police Department Teen Academy will be held from June 9-13, 2025.  The academy will be held at Riverside Intermediate in Fishers between the hours of 9:00 a.m.-3:30 p.m. each day.  The Teen Academy is a five-day camp that is filled with law enforcement-type training to allow teens the opportunity to better understand how law enforcement works.

recordTypes.name: General Environmental Complaints
recordTypes.description: Use this form to report un-maintained properties, inside or out, which cause a public health concern.  This includes any conditions that may transmit, generate, or promote disease. This can include but is not limited to Health Nuisances, Dwellings Unfit for Human Habitation, Rodent Infestations, or Mosquito Issues.  DO NOT use this form to report High Weeds and Grass or Abandoned/Unmoved Vehicles.

recordTypes.name: Nickel Plate Trail Neighbors Connection & Screening & Privacy Grant
recordTypes.description: For those who live in a single-family home on property directly adjacent to the Nickel Plate Trail (i.e. your property line touches the trail right of way), the City is offering a grant program that may go toward installing screening, privacy, or buffering improvements up to $2,000 per property.

recordTypes.name: Planned Unit Development
recordTypes.description: The PUD Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving Architectural Drawings and Civil Site Design for developments which fall within existing and proposed PUD zoning district.

recordTypes.name: Grade Challenge Request
recordTypes.description: Use of this form is limited to food operators wishing to appeal their issued sanitation grade following inspection. The appeal must be submitted within 5 days of the inspection and must detail the specific violation(s) the operator is challenging. Please include any accompanying documentation to support the appeal. More information on the City of Fishers Sanitation Grading System can be found at:  https://www.fishers.in.us/1482/Retail-Food-Inspection-Grading-System

recordTypes.name: Grade Change Inspection Request
recordTypes.description:
Use of this form is limited to food operators wishing to apply for an additional full inspection once during the calendar year, for an opportunity to improve the issued letter grade by up to one level. Please note that re-inspections will typically be conducted within 3 months of the submitted application. Inspections are unscheduled and the operator will not be aware of the date and time the inspector will come. Any new grade and placard will not be issued until all applicable fees are paid and all violations noted on the inspection are corrected.   

Please note that this is a full inspection. It is possible that this inspection may result in a letter grade that is the same or worse than the currently issued grade. Operators desiring to improve their letter grade can choose to receive guidance and education from FHD Health Inspectors on measures that will need to be taken for improvement, prior to submitting this application. FHD Health Inspectors have extensive FDA training and are available to educate and guide facilities on measures that can be implemented to assure a consistent food safety environment. Food safety classes such as ServSafe are offered by FHD and others and will also help assure compliance among the facility staff. The grading scale and point correlations with the Indiana Retail Establishment Sanitation Requirements are available on the FHD website for review by operators.

More information on the City of Fishers Sanitation Grading System can be found at:  https://www.fishers.in.us/1482/Retail-Food-Inspection-Grading-System

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer New Connection
recordTypes.description: This form should not be used for sewer lateral repair/replacement. please go to Engineering Department and fill out the Sanitary Sewer Repair/Replace/Add permit.

recordTypes.name: Primary Plat Permit
recordTypes.description: A Primary Plat is required for the subdivision and platting of land. A Primary Plat shall be prepared in conjunction with any proposal to subdivide or plat property within the jurisdictional area of the Plan Commission.

recordTypes.name: Residential Plot Plan Request
recordTypes.description: Access copies of residential plot plans here.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool & Spa New Construction/Remodel Permit
Rezone Permit
recordTypes.description: A Rezone application is needed when seeking to change the zoning classification of a property. The Advisory Plan Commission (APC) will provide a recommendation to City Council, who then determines if the rezoning should be approved or denied.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Encroachment Permit
recordTypes.description: A request to allow a patio, seating area, or other use in the public right-of-way. For construction within the right-of-way, use the Right-of-Way Activity Permit.

recordTypes.name: Naloxone (Narcan) Program
recordTypes.description: The FHD is offering FREE Naloxone kits to the community and businesses around Fishers.  Naloxone program is a community-based overdose education and naloxone distribution program that was created as a way to combat Indiana’s opioid overdose epidemic. Its critical function: to reverse the effects of opioids in order to prevent overdose death.  If you have Naloxone kits in your facility or at home, please check the expiration date. We would like to replace your old kits with new ones.   It takes less than 30 minutes to obtain a FREE kit that could save a life!

recordTypes.name: Riverfront District Designation Permit
recordTypes.description:
Indiana Code § 7.1-3-20-16.1 (the "Act") authorizes the legislative body of a city to designate and establish the boundaries of a municipal riverfront development project area (the “Area”) within its territorial boundaries. If an Area is established, the Act then allows the Indiana Alcohol and Tobacco Commission to issue a three-way, two-way, or one-way permit for proprietors within the designated area to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. Permits issued within the Area do not count against an area’s permit quota.

To encourage private investment within the Area and specifically to encourage investment by new restaurant proprietors, the City of Fishers established the Riverfront District project area for all projects included in the subject ordinance, which projects have been funded, in part, with state and city funds under city ordinance 091823E.

recordTypes.name: On-Site Sewage Disposal System Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form for new installation or repair of an existing on-site sewage disposal (septic) system.

recordTypes.name: Secondary Plat Permit
recordTypes.description: A Secondary Plat is required for the subdivision and platting of land. Secondary Plats need to be recorded at the Hamilton County Recorder’s Office. Primary Plats are a prerequisite.

recordTypes.name: Sign-Permanent Permit
recordTypes.description: Sign permits are required for all permanent signs.

recordTypes.name: Open Waterway Sample Submissions
recordTypes.description: This form is for water sample submissions where the public is most likely to come into contact with surface water.

recordTypes.name: Paternity Affidavit
recordTypes.description: Vital Records provides voluntary paternity establishment for mothers and fathers who are not married at the time of birth, and NO father is listed on the birth certificate. If mother and father marry after the birth of a child we can establish voluntary paternity upon marriage.

recordTypes.name: Sign-Temporary Permit
recordTypes.description: Sign permits are required for all temporary signs.

recordTypes.name: Special Exception
recordTypes.description: A Special Exception is required when a use is permitted subject to the review, approval, and conditions of the Board of Zoning Appeals or City Council.

recordTypes.name: Permanent Food Establishment Permits
recordTypes.description: For new and existing permanent food and restaurant establishments.  You will be able to fill out an application for a new permit, renewal permit, and change of ownership.

recordTypes.name: Street Tree Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required when anyone wishes to plant a tree within the public right-of-way which normally includes the area of land between the sidewalk and street.

recordTypes.name: Private Water Well Construction and Repair
recordTypes.description: All wells drilled or repaired in Fishers, Indiana are required to be permitted and drinking water wells should be sampled before being released for use.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Improvement Permit
recordTypes.description: A Subdivision Improvement Permit (SIP) is required for all residential developments that qualify as a major subdivision (six (6) lots or more and/or includes public rights-of-way).

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use Permit
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Use Permit is intended to allow temporary outdoor sales and temporary uses in the City (i.e. construction trailer, seasonal sales, special event tents, storage pods, etc.).

recordTypes.name: Public Pool/ Beach Permit
recordTypes.description: All public and semi-public pools in the City of Fishers must obtain a valid license from Fishers Health Department. Renewal license applications are due every year.

recordTypes.name: Text Amendment Permit
recordTypes.description: A Text Amendment application is needed when proposing an amendment to the text of the Unified Development Ordinance (UDO) or a Planned Unit Development (PUD) Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: ServSafe* Training
recordTypes.description:
The ServSafe food safety training uses materials from the National Restaurant Association (NRA) and is taught by the Fishers Health Department Health Educator who is a Registered ServSafe Proctor and Certified ServSafe Instructor by the NRA. Upon successful completion of the exam, participants will receive a certificate from the National Restaurant Association and be registered in their database. The certificate should be renewed every five years. Topics covered:

Basic food safety
Microbiology
Contamination
The flow of food
Receiving & storage
Food preparation & service
Active managerial control
Pest management
Training employees

recordTypes.name: Vacation Request
recordTypes.description: A request to vacate rights-of-way, easements, or plats.

recordTypes.name: Variance
recordTypes.description: A development standards variance or land use variance allows a deviation from the City’s Unified Development Ordinance (UDO) or zoning code. Only the Board of Zoning Appeals can grant variances.

recordTypes.name: Suicide Prevention (QPR) Training
recordTypes.description: Question. Persuade. Refer. (QPR). These are actions we all can take to help someone who is in crisis, prevent a suicide and save a life. This free training teaches participants how to recognize loved ones at risk, how to intervene, and offer referrals and resources.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter Request
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Verification Letter identifies a property’s zoning designation, overlays, and other applicable regulations.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Permits
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Food Permit required for a single event. Temporary events may include city celebrations, fairs, and festivals.

recordTypes.name: Vendor Liability Release Farmers Market
recordTypes.description: Please fill out this liability form for the Farmers Market only if you are going to be a part if the Fishers Health Department booth.

recordTypes.name: Weekly Pool/Spa Sample Submissions
recordTypes.description: By submitting sample results to the Fishers Health Department you indicate that these results, as know to you, are taken from the actual lab report and have not been falsified. Falsification can lead to enforcement measures by the Fishers Health Department including revocation of the pool permit.  You will need to upload attachments to the record each week as a new attachment.  Pool address on the analysis must match address of permit.  You may submit samples for multiple pools in the same record only if the addresses of the pools are the same.

recordTypes.name: Mental Health First Aid Training
recordTypes.description: Mental Health First Aid training teaches people how to recognize signs of mental health challenges or crises, how to offer and provide initial support, and how to guide a person toward appropriate care if necessary. There are two course options: Youth Mental Health First Aid (for adults supporting adolescents ages 12-18) and Adult Mental Health First Aid (for adults supporting other adults age 18 years or older). All course participants must be at least 18 years old.

recordTypes.description:
WARNING: False Application, Altering, or Mutilating or counterfeiting of Indiana Birth Certificates is Criminal Offense under Indiana Law #1.c.16-19-6 and is punishable to the fullest extent.
NOTICE: Legitimate birth records are issued to the individual named on the record, their parents, legal guardian (Guardianship Papers MUST be presented), grandparents, **brother, sister, spouse, or children**
*You must be at least 18 years of age with appropriate proof to obtain a copy of birth records. 
**Siblings and children must be at least 21 years of age with proof of relationship to obtain a copy of birth records**  Due to unforeseen increases, the FEDEX delivery charge will increase to $15.

recordTypes.name: Celebration of Independence Food & Non-Food Vendor Application
recordTypes.description:
The fee for each Waukee Celebration of Independence vendor is $25. 

Vendors will receive a 10’ x 20’ booth. Vendors are required to keep all equipment and belongings within their designated spaces. All electrical cords are the responsibility of the vendor, and all cords must be marked appropriately so they do not become a tripping hazard. 

Vendors attending July 3 must be set up by 3:30 p.m. and ready to serve at 4:30 p.m. until 9 p.m.

Vendors attending July 4 must be set up at 10 a.m. and ready to serve at 12 p.m. until 10 p.m.

Any and all requests for temporary street closings require approval by the Waukee City Council.

Floodplains and with all other applicable County ordinances and the laws and regulations of the State of Iowa.

No water well for which a County permit is required shall be installed or reconstructed until an application has been submitted and permit issued by Polk County.

recordTypes.name: Grading & Site Improvement Permit
recordTypes.description: A site improvement permit is required to begin grading and/or site improvement construction associated with an approved site plan or approved grading plan. Site improvement permits are required when no new building construction is taking place. Any property or development site to conduct land-disturbing activities including fill in excess of three (3) feet, or excavation exceeding five (5) feet, or work that involves greater than 50 cubic yards of excavation, or fill or any grading or clearing activity that disturbs an area five thousand (5,000) square feet or greater within unincorporated Polk County shall obtain a permit prior to any land-disturbing activities.

Please also use this permit type for moving/relocating homes within the County from one place to another or into the County as well as manufactured/mobile homes into a community park.

A Minor Site Plan is allowed when there is an existing site plan on file and the following:

or

or
* Unmanned utility substation 
or
* New non-residential use on a property where a change of use permit is required

minimal changes to an existing site and is allowed when one of the following

recordTypes.name: Major Final Plat

The Major Final Plat will be reviewed and approved upon satisfactory compliance with the Comprehensive Plan, Zoning Ordinance and pertinent Subdivision Ordinance regulations.

recordTypes.name: Sound Equipment Permit
recordTypes.description: No person shall use operate or cause to be used or operated any sound equipment upon the public streets or in any building or upon any premises, public or private, if the sound therefrom be plainly audible from any public street or public place within the county, unless said person first obtains a permit in accordance with this section; complies with the condition imposed by the permit including the maximum permitted sound level shown therein; and complies with all other applicable provisions of the Polk County Noise Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Reporting - Performance Test
recordTypes.description: For reporting of performance tests including (but not limited to): stack testing as a result of  a construction permit requirement, stack testing as a result of an operating permit requirement, NESHAP test reporting (e.g. ZZZZ testing), NSPS test reporting (e.g. JJJJ testing), product/material test reporting, or other compliance demonstrations.

recordTypes.description: An owner or operator that utilizes the small unit exemption as specified in PCBHRR Chapter V, Article X, Section 5-33(63) must maintain on-site an exemption justification document.

recordTypes.description:

Please also use this permit type for moving/relocating existing detached garages within the County from one place to another or into the County.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: A sign permit is required for the erection, alteration, or relocation of any sign in the unincorporated areas of Polk County. The repainting, changing of parts, and preventative maintenance of signs located on the site shall not be deemed alterations requiring a Sign Permit.

recordTypes.description:
Application for a construction permitting variance. 
**This is only for Air Quality equipment, not for a building variance.**

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer Connection Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for Polk County Residential or Commercial/Industrial Sanitary Sewer Connection Permit

recordTypes.name: Variance Appeal Application
recordTypes.description:
The Polk County Board of Adjustment is empowered by Iowa law and by the Zoning Ordinance of Polk County to hear requests and to make decisions on variance appeals to the Zoning Ordinance for individual properties where provisions of the Ordinance impose a unique and unnecessary hardship on the property owner and where the granting of a variance is not contrary to the intent of the Zoning Ordinance or to the public interest. 

Each variance appeal is only a request to have a hearing before the Board of Adjustment. Notice of the hearing will be provided to all property owners located within 250 feet from the subject property.  The Board of Adjustment will make a determination at a public hearing whether or not to approve or deny the request based on a staff report, applicant presentation, as well as public input.  All appeals that are denied shall not come back to the Board of Adjustment for one year.  Refunds will not be made once notice has been sent out to adjacent property owners.

recordTypes.name: Comprehensive Plan Amendment and Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description:
A submittal is only a request to have the Comprehensive Plan amendment and/or Zoning
Map change reviewed at a public hearing before the Zoning Commission. The Zoning
Commission reviews the requested Comprehensive Plan amendment and/or Zoning Map
change at a public hearing making a recommendation based on a staff report, applicant
presentation, as well as public input. The Zoning Commission recommendation is considered
by the Board of Supervisors at a public hearing on the request. Notice of each public hearing
is published in the official county newspapers and individual notice will be mailed to all
property owners located within 500 feet of the subject property. Requests that are denied
shall not come back to the Board of Supervisors for one year. Refunds will not be made once
notice has been sent out to adjacent property owners.

categories.name: Building Permits
categories.content:
The Polk County Building Department reviews plans, issues permits and inspects building construction located within the unincorporated areas of the County. The 2021 International Codes have been adopted for Residential, Commercial and Industrial projects. Required permits can range from decks and pools to factories, storage facilities, chemical/fuel tanks and more. The County has also adopted the State Plumbing, Mechanical, Electrical and Energy Codes.

categories.name: Code Violations/Enforcement
categories.content:
Code Enforcement investigates and enacts enforcement of properties in violation of the Zoning and Health Nuisance Ordinances in an effort to eliminate conditions that threaten the life, health, safety and general welfare of the community. 

Polk County has adopted a Health Nuisance Regulation that assists in keeping properties cleaned up in the unincorporated areas of the County. If you have junk, debris, unlicensed and/or inoperable vehicles on your property yo

categories.name: Environmental Health Services
categories.content:
Environmental Health Services Division provides services related to those affecting the health and safety to the physical environment in which we live. 

Services include:
* Permitting and Inspections of On-Site Wastewater Treatment Systems (OWTS) 
* Review of Time of Transfer (TOT) Inspection Reports for Private On-site Water Treatment Systems
* Private Well inspections for New and Abandoned Wells throughout the County

The two main active Township Fire Departments are Saylor and Delaware. The <u>Polk County Building Department</u> performs plan reviews, inspections and issues permits for Fire Protection Systems and Fire Code related items.
