A property owner, resident, business, or licensee receiving a Notice of Code Violation(s) may contest the alleged violation(s) and any fees, civil penalties or adverse license actions. A person contesting a code enforcement or licensing violation shall complete the online Administrative Appeal Hearing Request F

recordTypes.description: Use this application to register a cannabis retail business with the City. Applicants MUST have a license from the Office of Cannabis Management prior to applying for a registration.

recordTypes.description: The City requires that utility work within the Right of Way (ROW) be performed by a company authorized as a public utility by the MN Public Utilities Commission (MPUC). Entities that own utilities/facilities that will remain in the ROW must complete a registration form annually.

recordTypes.description: If your property has inground irrigation or is heated by a boiler, the City of Oakdale needs an annual backflow preventer test filed.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
A building permit is required for roofing, siding, windows, doors, new construction, remodeling, additions, garages, decks, porches, drain tile, retaining walls, and shed

You can also apply for a Certificate of Occupancy inspection with the building permit

NOTE: Electrical, Mechanical and Plumbing permits are not included in Building Permits. You must also apply for those individual permits as applicable for your project.

City of Oakdale Building and Inspections Notice

Lead times for building permit application review and inspections for the City of Oakdale. 
•Permit issuance: 3 business days
•Plan review: 10 business days
•Request an inspection: 5 business days before inspection 

We are committed to great customer service, and these amended timelines allow our staff to provide the best service possible during an increasingly busy time of year. Thanks in advance for your time and patience. 

If you have questions, please call 651-739-5150.

recordTypes.description: Apply for a Special Event Permit to host an event in the City of Oakdale that meets applicable event criteria per City Code Chapter 14.

recordTypes.description: Complete this application for a conditional use permit. Refer to City Code Section 25-3-900 for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.description: A permit is required for commercial parking lot replacement/re-surfacing, expansion or seal coating. This application requires a civil plan and site plan.

recordTypes.description: Keg beer may be brought into City of Oakdale parks with a permit and park shelter reservation. Application must be received 14 days prior to scheduled event.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to register your Night to Unite event or apply for a block party permit.

recordTypes.description: Complete this application for an encroachment agreement involving structures located within the public Right-of-Way or City owned property.

recordTypes.description: Submit a request for a property and special assessment verification. This request itemizes all outstanding balances that relate to a particular property within the City of Oakdale.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for an exception to local ordinance restrictions related to winter parking, event parking, temporary parking, oversized vehicles, and weight restrictions.

recordTypes.description: Apply for fireworks sales license. If applying to sell fireworks in a tent, applicants must also complete a tent sales license application.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description:
A demolition permit is required for demolition of residential, commercial or garage structures. A lot survey is required to be submitted with the permit application.

How to find a Minnesota Licensed Asbestos Contractor or Consultant
https://asbs.web.health.state.mn.us/search/find-contractor.jsf

MPCA Asbestos foRms
https://www.pca.state.mn.us/business-with-us/asbestos-in-demolition-or-renovations

If there are hazardous materials on site, please review the links below. You will need to download and complete the checklist. You will be prompted to upload the checklist in upcoming steps:

Pre-Renovation or Demolition Requirements
https://www.pca.state.mn.us/sites/default/files/w-sw4-07.pdf

Building Material Reuse and Recycling
https://www.pca.state.mn.us/business-with-us/building-material-reuse-and-recycling

Checklist https://www.pca.state.mn.us/sites/default/files/w-sw4-20.doc 

Required Submittals: will be prompted to upload the following to this application 
1.\tA site plan showing
a.\tA north indictor
b.\tThe actual dimensions of the lot or lots drawn to a scale of 1"=20' and drawn to the actual bearings of the lot(s)
c.\tThe actual location of all building or structures on the property in relation to the property lines.
d.\tThe actual location of the building(s) or structure(s) to be demolished.
2.\tProvide proof of cancelation of property insurance
3.\tA copy of a written release from all utility companies stating such utilities to the building or structure being demolished have been properly terminated. Please download the form that will be available after you submit your application. Then upload once signed before final inspection. 
4.\tVerify SAC units are retained or credited to the property
5.   Hazardous materials and Asbestos abetment IF APPLICABLE

recordTypes.description: Complete this application for a Planned Unit Development (PUD). The purpose of a PUD is to improve the overall quality of a project through collaborative design. If there is a subdivision, an applicant must also follow requirements of a Preliminary and Final Plat process. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process. A project initiation meeting with the City Planner is required prior to submitting an application.

Zoning department approval is required for a fence erected in the City of Oakdale, per City Code (Chapter 25, Article 18, Section 25-318). Fences must be constructed according to the ordinance, and site plan must be included with the permit application. 

Locating property Lines https://www.oakdalemn.gov/991/Locating-Property-Lines

recordTypes.description: A permit is required for the alteration or installation of a fire sprinkler and/or alarm system. Contact the Oakdale Fire Department for more information.

recordTypes.description: Complete this application for a Planned Unit Development (PUD) Amendment. This requires approval by City Council. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Plat (Major Subdivision)
recordTypes.description: Complete the preliminary plat to subdivide a property. The preliminary plat drawing must conform to all Minnesota State laws and be consistent with the City’s Subdivision regulations, Comprehensive Plan and Zoning Code. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan
recordTypes.description: A site plan must be submitted and approved by City Council for development in certain districts before a building permit can be issued. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.name: Grading/Filling Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for grading or filling. Applicants must include the amount of fill required and submit a site plan detailing the area and scope of work at the time of application.

recordTypes.name: Lawn Sprinkler/Irrigation Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for lawn sprinkler or irrigation system installation. Applicants must include the type of installation and anti-siphon device.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Amendment
recordTypes.description: An amendment to a previously approved Site Plan must be submitted to and approved by the City Council if proposed modifications to the subject property are not consistent with the originally approved Site Plan. This approval applies to development in certain zoning districts before a building permit can be issued.

recordTypes.name: Liquor Sales Supplemental Application
recordTypes.description: The liquor sales supplemental form must be completed by a license applicant’s spouse, officer of business, person in charge of premise or person controlling/owning five percent or more of interest in business.

recordTypes.name: Rental Housing License
recordTypes.description: The City issues licenses for all rental properties in Oakdale. The licensing term is January 1 through December 31.

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Home Installation Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for new or reinstalled manufactured homes. Homeowners cannot install manufactured homes.

recordTypes.name: Massage Therapy or Bodywork License
recordTypes.description: Apply for Massage and Bodywork Therapy license or renewals. Please use the same application to apply for either premise and/or practitioner license.

recordTypes.name: Vacation of Property
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for the vacation of street, alley or utility easement. Please refer to MN Statute 412.851 for requirements.

recordTypes.name: Variance
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to request a variance from ordinances. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: A mechanical permit is required for residential or commercial mechanical projects including air conditioners, air exchangers, boilers (new or replacement), ductwork addition or remodel, fireplace installation or conversion, furnace installation or replacement, and gas piping.

recordTypes.name: Non Rental Property or Transfer of Ownership Certificate
recordTypes.description: The City issues licenses for all rental properties in Oakdale. The licensing term is January 1 through December 31.

recordTypes.name: Massage Therapy or Bodywork Supplemental Application
recordTypes.description: The massage and bodywork therapy supplemental form must be completed by a premise license applicant’s spouse, officer of business, person in charge of premise or person controlling/owning five percent or more of interest in business.

recordTypes.name: Variance (Administrative)
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to request an administrative variance. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Letter
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to request an official letter from the City that verifies zoning and land use information on specified property located in the City.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Vendor License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a mobile food vendor license. Applicants must also have a food license from the State of Minnesota and Washington County. If you have a Minnesota Department of Agriculture license, no proof of County license is needed.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Ordinance Amendment - Map
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to request rezoning of parcels within the City. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing/Sewer and Water Permit
recordTypes.description: A plumbing permit is required for residential or commercial plumbing projects including automatic washers, bathtubs and showers, dishwashers, drinking fountains, fire sprinkler heads, floor drains, garbage disposals, newly added kitchen sinks or laundry trays, backflow protection devices, sewer installation and repairs, new water line installation, sump pumps, washbasins, water closets and urinals, water heaters and water softeners.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for temporary and permanent signs. Applications must include a site plan and a construction plan.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Ordinance Amendment - Text
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to request a text amendment to the Zoning Ordinance. Refer to City Code sections referenced for required submittal documents and subsequent process.

recordTypes.name: Pawnbroker/Precious Metal Dealer/Secondhand Goods Dealer License
recordTypes.description: Apply for pawnbroker, precious metal dealer or secondhand goods license or renewals.

recordTypes.name: Storage Tank Installation/Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for storage tank installation or removal.  A site plan must be included with the application.

recordTypes.name: Structure Relocation Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for structure relocation. This application requires City Council approval.

recordTypes.name: Pawnbroker/Precious Metal/Secondhand Dealer Supplemental Application
recordTypes.description: The pawnbroker, precious metal dealer, secondhand goods supplemental form must be completed by a license applicant’s spouse, officer of business, person in charge of premise or person controlling/owning five percent or more of interest in business.

recordTypes.name: Solicitor Registration
recordTypes.description: Apply for solicitor registration. The registration is renewable annually.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description:
A swimming pool permit is required for swimming pools that are underground or above ground and over 3000 gallons. 
NOTE: Electrical, Mechanical and Plumbing permits are not included in Building Permits. You must also apply for those individual permits as applicable for your project.
SWIMMING POOL means any pool, tank, depression or excavation in or above-ground, or other structure which shall cause or has the capacity to retain water with a depth greater than 30 inches which shall be designed for the intent to be used for swimming, wading, or immersion purposes by individuals.

recordTypes.name: Peddler/Transient Merchant License
recordTypes.description: Apply for peddler or transient merchant license. Licenses are issued quarterly in January, April, July and October.

recordTypes.name: Peddler/Solicitor/Transient Merchant Supplemental Application
recordTypes.description: A supplemental form must be completed for anyone conducting business door-to-door on behalf of a Solicitor/Peddler/Transient Merchant license applicant.

recordTypes.name: Solid Waste Hauler License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a license to conduct solid waste hauler services in Oakdale, as well as recycling and roll-off services.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Liquor License
recordTypes.description: Complete this application for organizations holding events in non-licensed premises wishing to provide or sell liquor.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Outdoor Patio License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a license to for a temporary outdoor patio license. If selling liquor, a liquor license must already have been obtained.

recordTypes.name: THC Product Sales License
recordTypes.description: Apply for Tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) product sales license or renewals.

recordTypes.name: THC Product Sales Supplemental Application
recordTypes.description: The THC product sales supplemental form must be completed by a license applicant’s spouse, officer of business, person in charge of premise or person controlling/owning five percent or more of interest in business.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco Sales License
recordTypes.description: Apply for tobacco sales license or renewals.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco Sales Supplemental Application
recordTypes.description: The tobacco sales supplemental form must be completed by a license applicant’s spouse, officer of business, person in charge of premise or person controlling/owning five percent or more of interest in business.

recordTypes.name: Used Car Dealer License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a license to operate a used car dealership in Oakdale.

categories.name: Building Permits
categories.content: This page is intended to assist in applying online for building permits for the City of Oakdale. All building and related permits ensure that projects will be constructed according to nationally recognized standards. The standards are designed to protect buildings from collapse and fire, and to ensure the safety of all building occupants. Review of permit applications also ensures that projects meet zoning requirements, such as yard cover

categories.name: Rental Housing
categories.content: The City issues permits for all rental properties in Oakdale. Once a completed license application has been received by City staff, the application will be reviewed. You will then receive an email to complete the payment process before scheduling an inspection and receiving the license. Please refer to page 2 of the

categories.name: Business Licenses
categories.content:
This page is intended to assist in applying online for business licenses in the City of Oakdale. If you have questions about whether your business requires a specific license, please contact the City at 651-730-2139.

The following online business license and registration applications are available for Oakdale:

categories.name: Planning and Zoning
categories.content: This page is intended to assist with completion of planning applications for the City of Oakdale. If you have questions about planning applications, please contact the City at 651-730-2720. Applicants are also encouraged to review the webpage on the land use application process before applyi

categories.name: Community Resources
categories.content: This section allows residents to complete requests and forms related to a variety of City functions.

categories.name: Engineering
categories.content:
The City requires that utility work within the Right of Way (ROW) be performed by a company authorized as a public utility by the MN Public Utilities Commission (MPUC). Entities that own utilities/facilities that will remain in the ROW must complete a registration form annually.

The annual fee for ROW registration is $50. Permit fees vary based on project scope. Please re

categories.name: Events
categories.content: Use this page to apply for permits or requests related to events in the City of Oakdale.

categories.name: Fire
categories.content: Use this section to apply for permits from the Fire Department.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description:
Site Plan Review is a process where the construction of new buildings, new additions, and certain types developments are reviewed by the City Planning staff and the City Council. Site Plan Review shall be required, as stated by the provisions of this Ordinance, to ensure compliance with City zoning and other ordinances on large scale and other projects, to expedite procedures necessary for the obtaining of building permits, to provide the developer with a central review of a development proposal, to conserve the time and efforts of City employees in the various departments, and to provide for a speedy processing of applications for building permits on large scale and other projects.

Owner authorization form must be uploaded with application. Form can be downloaded here: https://www.jacksonms.gov/documents/site-plan-review-owner-authorization-form/

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Vending Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply for your Mobile Food Vending Permit to legally operate a food truck or mobile unit in the City. Required annually and includes health, fire, and location approvals.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification
recordTypes.description: The Zoning Verification Letter is a standard form letter depicting the zoning classification and whether the current or proposed use is permitted in that zone. Any additional information you need added to the letter should be approved by the Zoning Administrator prior to or at time of request. You may contact her at (601) 960-2001.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Violation
recordTypes.description:
Here you can report zoning violations - you can also communicate directly with a code enforcement officer that is assigned to the case. 

Some of the most common zoning code violations include illegal land use, improper signage, and excessive noise levels. Illegal land use occurs when a property is used for a purpose that is not allowed by the zoning code. This can include using a residential property for commercial purposes, or vice versa.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Sign Permits are issued by the Signs and License Division of the Department of Planning and Development. This division is responsible for accepting, reviewing applications and the authorization of sign permits. Individuals or business owners who wish to place a sign on or off their premises must obtain a sign permit. All signs must meet proper height and setback requirements.

recordTypes.name: Business License
recordTypes.description:
Anyone who conducts business in the City of Jackson must obtain a Business License, except for businesses that are specifically exempted by state or federal statute. Business License fees must be paid before the business opens and are renewable annually.

***** Privilege Tax Application Form *****
Applications for the Privilege Tax should be filled out, notarized, and uploaded to the Business License Application; or as an alternative, the applicant can submit a valid picture ID.

Applicants can obtain a Privilege Tax Application Form at https://www.jacksonms.gov/license-information/

They must have the following information:

             A) Name(s) of the person(s) associated with the business on the application.

             B) Proper Fee Payment. Most fees are determined by either the number of employees or the amount of inventory.

             C) A NAICS Code, the standard used in classifying business establishments.

***** During the process, the Zoning Division must approve the application.
***** The required inspections must be completed before the license is issued.
***** Required Inspections include but are not limited to the following:

1) Health Department Inspections - required for childcare providers and anyone preparing or serving food. The applicant is responsible for obtaining approval from the County and/or State Health Department, and inspection verification must accompany the Business License application.

2) Fire Inspections

3) Sign Permit - required before a license can be issued. The Signs and License Division will arrange for this inspection after applications are filed.

4) Police Inspections - required for certain types of businesses including those serving beer and wine, pawn brokers, and others.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit
recordTypes.description:
Right of Way permits are required for all work that is done in right of way.  This includes but is not limited to driveway and sidewalk work, utility boring and digging, etc. These permits are reviewed by Public Works. 

Requests for water taps and sanitary sewer taps are handled by JXN Water. Visit their website at http://jxnwater.com. Do not request a water tap or sanitary sewer tap as part of a ROW permit request.

recordTypes.name: Small Cell Permit
recordTypes.description: Small Cell permits are required for the installation of any small cell sites constructed on City right of way.  This does not include small cell sites constructed on private property. These permits are reviewed by Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Real Estate Developer Academy
recordTypes.description:
Real Estate Developer Academy is a program dedicated to expanding economic opportunities for emerging developers by providing essential training, resources, and mentorship. Academy graduates will be equipped to take on transformative projects that address housing, commercial development, and community revitalization across Jackson.  This application will be open until April 15, 2025.

If you need assistance, please contact Angela Brown, afbrown@jacksonms.gov or 601-960-1615.

recordTypes.name: Fire Inspection Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is used when a applicant is requesting an inspection with the Fire Marshal's Office. 
Examples include annual fire inspections, fire alarm, sprinkler and suppression test.

recordTypes.name: Public Fireworks Display Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for public and private firework displays within the City of Jackson.

recordTypes.name: Fire Report Application
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request a report to provide to insurance companies that outline the scope of damage, cause and origin of fire incidents.

recordTypes.name: Carnival and Exhibits Operational Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This permit application is for the operation of a carnival or fair within the City of Jackson.

recordTypes.name: MSTAT
recordTypes.description:
The MSTAT testing process will be utilized as a measurement tool to assess a firefighter trainee’s
ability to enter into the Basic Firefighter 1001 I-II at the Mississippi State Fire Academy in accordance
with NFPA 1001, 1.3.8, 2019 edition.

recordTypes.name: Surplus Property
recordTypes.description: Any organization or individual looking to obtain property from the City of Jackson must obtain approval from the Surplus Property Committee after their application is submitted with the necessary documentations, no property will be sold, conveyed or disposed of until it is declared surplus property. Please be aware the Surplus Property Application might require development plans that include financial data, site plans, conceptual drawings and sketches relative to the proposed construction or infill development.

recordTypes.name: Special Events Permit
recordTypes.description: This application can be utilized for any and all events planning to be implemented in the City of Jackson.

recordTypes.name: Report Illegal Dumping
recordTypes.description: This application is used to report illegal dumping in thr city of jackson. The reporter must have photo documentation and be willing to testify to the accou ts reported in this complaint.

recordTypes.name: City of Jackson Homeless Data Collection
recordTypes.description: “Functional zero is a milestone, which must be sustained, that indicates a community has measurably solved homelessness for a population. When it’s achieved, homelessness is rare and brief for that population.” (Built for Zero). Functional Zero means that the same number of those entering homelessness exit homelessness that month.

recordTypes.name: Neighborhood Association Registration
recordTypes.description: Document is for Neighborhoods Associations and other Organizations to apply to the City to become Registered Neighborhood Associations and Organizations within the city.

recordTypes.name: GIS Map Request
recordTypes.description: Neighborhood associations can request boundary maps, city maps, zoning maps and other maps via this application.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for clearing, grubbing, filling/grading, timber harvesting, and related activities.

recordTypes.name: Rental Registration Program
recordTypes.description:
The purpose of this application is to establish a Registration requirement for owners of Rental Housing Units to protect the health, safety and welfare of the public insofar as they are affected by the maintenance of said Units and the occupancy thereof. The purpose shall be accomplished by requiring rental housing units to be registered and inspected. This article shall be construed to secure this express intent.  

The Department of Planning and Development shall be responsible for the administration and enforcement of this article.

Documents that may be be needed to submit your application are below. Requested document requirements depend on the information submitted. 

Documentation of State Incorporation/LLC State Authorization
Notarized Local Agent Declaration Page
Owner or Local Agent Picture ID Card
HUD Inspection (if applicable)
HUD Voucher (if applicable)

Call 601.960.1671 for more information regarding this application or with any questions.

recordTypes.name: 2026 Mayor’s Summer Youth Employment Program (MSYEP)
recordTypes.description:
The Mayor’s Summer Youth Employment Program (MSYEP) is a unique and fun way for youth to develop an array of skills while earning money.  The Mayor’s Summer Youth Employment Program fosters an environment that teaches work ethics and life skills while also exposing teens to diverse careers. MSYEP is open to all City of Jackson residents between ages 16 through 24. 



NO PAPER APPLICATION(S) WILL BE ACCEPTED.



For more information, and if you have questions about completing this form or the required documents, please contact Monica Hobson at (601) 960-2429 or mhobson@jacksonms.gov and ask about MSYEP.

recordTypes.name: Business Retention CRM
recordTypes.description:
The City of Jackson offers several programs and services that make locating and staying in Jackson a smart decision. Whether you’re an out-of-state company looking for a new home base for your manufacturing operations or corporate headquarters, or you’re an existing Jackson company looking to expand your footprint, we have a variety of programs that can be tailored to meet your needs.

The Economic Development office is dedicated to promoting initiatives and economic tools to business owners interested in relocating or expanding their companies in the City of Jackson. We seek to help qualified companies realized their expansion goals and retain jobs in our City.

Business retention is very competitive, and as such, we partner with Hinds County Economic Development Authority, the Greater Jackson Chamber Partnership, and a multitude of other partners to ensure your company utilizes the appropriate incentives to help solidify your footprint and attract a qualified workforce.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Appropriateness: Tree Removal
recordTypes.description: This application is for removal of dying tree or a tree endangering a house. If you are applying for removal of a live tree larger than six inches in diameter and 5ft or more above the ground, please use the regular COA application for JHPC review and approval.

recordTypes.name: Community Improvement: Clean-Up Assessment Repayment Plan
recordTypes.description: Repayment plan for city abated property.

recordTypes.name: Master Electrical License
recordTypes.description: The City of Jackson’s municipal ordinance requires all electrical, mechanical, and plumbing contractors hold City of Jackson licenses prior to performing work or pulling permits in the city limits. Only Master license holders can pull permits.

recordTypes.name: Address Request
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request a address to be assigned to a new parcel, plat, utility facility  or telecommunication facility, or to update or correct an existing address. For any work utility work in the right-of-way, apply for a Right-of-Way permit (ROW).

recordTypes.name: Code Enforcement Violations
recordTypes.description:
The IPMC (International Property Maintenance Code) has been adopted by the City of Jackson and is used as the basis for the City's Property Maintenance Codes.

The City's goal is to encourage both property owners and tenants to voluntarily correct violations when a violation is reported or has occurred.  Potential violations are inspected through a process of inspection, notification, education, and notices with the owner or tenant ultimately being responsible for violation corrections.  Should violations occur, the owner/tenant is given the opportunity to resolve the issue before legal action is taken. 

The Office of Code Enforcement ensures compliance to the City of Jackson Code of Ordinances. 

The Code Enforcement Officer responds and investigates complaints and nuisances which may violate the City's Code of Ordinances. 

Below you will find the most common complaints we receive from citizens and how to be in compliance with our code:

Weeds, grass undergrowth and other such plants, except ornamental plants and trees 
Vehicles not stored within an enclosed structure or screened from the public street serving the property.
Yards have accumulation of rubbish.
Exterior structure not secured - deteriorating  
Abandoned building
Condemnation
Unsafe building, house or signage

recordTypes.name: Master Mechanical License
recordTypes.description: The City of Jackson’s municipal ordinance requires all electrical, mechanical, and plumbing contractors hold City of Jackson licenses prior to performing work or pulling permits in the city limits. Only Master license holders can pull permits.

recordTypes.name: Street Closure Permit
recordTypes.description:
THIS PERMIT IS NOT FOR SPECIAL EVENTS.

THIS PERMIT IS NOT FOR WORK BEING PERFORMED IN THE RIGHT OF WAY

The contractor is responsible for providing, barricades, road closed and detour signs.

recordTypes.name: DREAM Internship Application
recordTypes.description: DREAM is the City of Jackson's internship program where our mission is to provide professional development to scholars who are pursuing academics or foresee a career in communications, governance, or as a sole proprietor. DREAM encourages critical thinking, sound reasoning, and the formation of new ideas in the pursuit and acquisition of knowledge and proficiency. DREAM supports learning and developmental experiences to leverage academic tutelage in professional environments. We intend to transition scholars from study to practical application.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Appropriateness: New Construction, Addition, Alteration, Repair, Relocation and Demolition
recordTypes.description: This application is for New Construction, Addition, Alteration, Repair, Relocation and Demolition of a historic structure in the City of Jackson.

recordTypes.name: Suppression / Vent Hood System Test Inspection
recordTypes.description:
This application is used when a applicant is requesting an inspection with the Fire Marshal's Office. 
Examples include annual fire inspections, fire alarm, sprinkler and suppression test.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Appropriateness: Fence Construction
recordTypes.description: This application is for construction of side and/or back yard fence, the fence height is not exceed 6ft tall , and the fence type is wooden good neighbor fence, or simply designed wrought iron, steel, aluminum fence only.

recordTypes.name: Entertainment District (ED) Application
recordTypes.description: An income tax incentive in the form of a five (5) year accelerated depreciation period is provided for construction and renovation projects.  This designation is also needed to apply for Tourism Rebate.

recordTypes.name: Cell Tower or Cell Tower Generator Application
recordTypes.description:
Before permit approvals TWO SETS OF PHYSICAL PLANS AND SPECIFICATION SHEET/BOOK must be delivered to the Building Permit Division located in the Warren Hood Building at 200 S. President St, 3rd floor, Jackson, MS 39201. 

The commercial building permit is for all projects that are not governed under the International Residential Code. All new construction, substantial renovation, alteration, and additions are commercial except for construction on 1 and 2 family structures.

recordTypes.name: Master Plumber + Gas Fitter License
recordTypes.description: The City of Jackson’s municipal ordinance requires all electrical, mechanical, and plumbing contractors hold City of Jackson licenses prior to performing work or pulling permits in the city limits. Only Master license holders can pull permits.

recordTypes.name: Residential Electric Contractor Registry
recordTypes.description:
Sec. 26-24. - Registration required.

All commercial and residential construction general contractors and electrical contractors, plumbing contractors, gas fitting contractors, air conditioning contractors and refrigeration contractors doing business within the city shall register with the building official. It is hereby established that the city building official shall maintain an approved list of general contractors and subcontractors upon registration.

recordTypes.name: Signs and License Violations
recordTypes.description:
Sign Permits
Sign Permits are issued by the Signs and License Division of the Department of Planning and Development. This division is responsible for accepting, reviewing applications and the authorization of sign permits. Individuals or business owners who wish to place a sign on or off their premises must obtain a sign permit. All signs must meet proper height and setback requirements.

Sign Ordinance
The sign ordinance was enacted by the Jackson City Council with the following goals:

Promoting a pleasant environment while providing for a consistent regulation of commercial signs
Reducing the risk of distraction or confusion to drivers
Eliminating structural hazards
Protecting and promoting the tourism industry by providing an unobstructed view of the city’s scenic areas
The Signs and License inspectors are responsible for locating illegal signs and notifying owners who must comply with the sign ordinance within a designed period or be fined.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
Before permit approvals TWO SETS OF PHYSICAL PLANS AND SPECIFICATION SHEET/BOOK must be delivered to the Building Permit Division located in the Warren Hood Building at 200 S. President St, 3rd floor, Jackson, MS 39201. 

The commercial building permit is for all projects that are not governed under the International Residential Code. All new construction, substantial renovation, alteration, and additions are commercial except for construction on 1 and 2 family structures.

recordTypes.name: Jackson Collaborative Application
recordTypes.description:
The Jackson Collaborative application is intended to connect you with services and organizations to assist you in your path to success whether you are interesting in becoming employed, starting a business, expanding your education, and growing your skills.

For more information about the Jackson Collaborative, visit https://www.jacksonms.gov/jackson-collaborative/

recordTypes.name: JHPC Compliance Agreement
recordTypes.description: Routine maintenance and minor work may be approved by staff via Compliance Agreement if there is to be no change in the design, materials, or general appearance of the structure of grounds.  Replacement of roofs, fascia boards and a small amount of replacement siding with identical sizes and types of material is an example of routine maintenance.  A determination can be made at the time of the preliminary conference with staff.

recordTypes.description: The electrical permit is for electrical projects that are not associated with a Commercial or Residential Permit. If associated with a larger project, the general contractor or project lead will apply for all permits within the Commercial or Residential Permit application. These are single issue permits. Examples are meter change out, adding outlets/fixtures, panel repairs and temporary electric poles etc.

recordTypes.name: Vacant Property Registration
recordTypes.description:
Vacant Building/Property Registration and De-registration 

The owner of any building that has been vacant shall within 30 days after the building becomes vacant or within 30 days after the effective date of this article, whichever is later, request an inspection of the vacant building from community improvement to verify that it is properly secured and file a registration statement with the City of Jackson, Community Improvement Division, Jackson Police Department, on forms provided by the division for such purposes. The registration statement shall remain valid for one year from the date of issuance. The owner shall be required annually to renew the registration as long as the building remain vacant and shall pay an annual registration fee as follows:

recordTypes.name: Leisure Recreational District (LRD) Application
recordTypes.description: Authorize business entities that hold alcoholic beverage permits issued by the Department of Revenue, and that are located within the boundaries of the designated Leisure and Recreation District, to allow patrons to leave the licensed premises with an open container of alcohol and to carry and consume alcoholic beverages within the designated LRD.

recordTypes.name: Food Truck Inspection
recordTypes.description: This application is used when a applicant is requesting an inspection with the Fire Marshal's Office for a FOOD TRUCK only.

recordTypes.name: Fire Inspection for Apartments

recordTypes.name: Qualified Resort District (QRD) Application
recordTypes.description: Being in a QRD allows a business to extend operations hours to sell beer, alcohol and waives the food-to-alcohol ratio.

recordTypes.description: This permit application is for the construction of a new fence or alternation, rehab or addition to existing fence. Fence permits includes gates. THIS INCLUDES DUMPSTER ENCLOSURES.

New businesses and tenant changes not requiring a commercial building permit must get an occupancy inspection. A Certificate of Occupancy will be issued upon completion of inspection.

recordTypes.description:
Community Improvement Division  Qualifications:

* BOARD-UP AND & OR GRASS AND WEED CONTRACTORS*

All contractors must be licensed, bonded, insured, and have a tire hauler certificate
Must provide a copy of privilege license, contractor’s bond, and proof of insurance.
 
DUNS & Bradstreet Number/ SAMS #
 SIN# EIN# or EFIN# 
 Privilege License
City of Jackson Vendor Number

General Liability Insurance Coverage for injury to a person and/or property $100,000.00 per person $100,000.00 per occurrence.

******The City of Jackson must be listed as the Insurance Certificate Holder******

Workman’s Compensation Insurance MAY be required for sickness, disability, or other injury of an employee arising out of and in the course of the employment
 Automobile Liability Insurance Coverage with minimum limits for injury to person or property or $25,000.00 per person and $50,000.00 per occurrence.
 MUST be able to provide dump receipts for all work performed ?
 Necessary equipment to perform work  Trailer, Bush Hog, Zero Turn Mower, Weed Eater, Chainsaw, etc. Equipment will be verified twice a year* 


 DEMOLITION CONTRACTORS’ QUALIFICATIONS : 

All contractors must be licensed, bonded, and insured. 
Must provide a copy of privilege license, contractor’s bond, and proof of insurance.
DUNS & Bradstreet Number
SIN# EIN# or EFIN#
CAGE Code (if you plan to bid on CDBG projects)
Privilege License 
Certificate of Responsibility 
City of Jackson Vendor Number 
State contractor License endorsing demolition

 $500,000.00 Pollution Liability Insurance ?
 General Liability Insurance with maximum bodily injury coverage of not less than $500,000.00 and $500.000.00 per occurrence.

 Workman’s Compensation Insurance MAY be required for sickness, disability, or other injury of an employee arising out of and in the course of the employment.
Automotive Public Liability Insurance with maximum limits of not less than $500,000.00 per one accident. Automotive Property Damage Insurance with maximum limits of not less than $500,000.00 per one accident? 

Owner’s Protective Liability Insurance with the City of Jackson as a named insured and their servants, agents and employees as additional insured in amount not less than $500,000.00 as well as property damage liability coverage in the amount of $500,000.00 per occurrence and $500,000.00 for all damages arising out of injury to or destruction of property during policy period. 

 Certified Abatement Supervisor MUST be on site.
 MUST be able to provide dump receipts for all work performed.
Have access to heavy equipment to perform demolition work necessary Track hoe, Dozer, etc.

 Equipment will be verified twice a year*
******* The City of Jackson must be listed as the Insurance Certificate Holder*******

recordTypes.description: As per the New York State Fire Code Chapter 11 Section 1104.16.5.1 (examination), fire escape stairways and balconies shall be examined for structural adequacy and safety in accordance with Section 1104.16.5 by a registered design professional or others acceptable to the fire code official every five (5) years, or as required by the fire code official. recordTypes.name: Elevator Inspection Report
recordTypes.description: It shall be the duty of the owner or agent of a building which has a passenger or freight elevator therein contained to register and provide the Department of Buildings of the Town of Hempstead with a semi-annual inspection report, which shall be obtained from a recognized elevator repair or installation company or from an insurance company.

recordTypes.name: Condition Assessments of Parking Garages
recordTypes.description: In accordance with Part 1203 Section 1203.3(J) of the Uniform Code, the Town of Hempstead Department of Buildings requires that Condition Assessments be performed for all parking garages.  The condition assessment requires that an on-site inspection and evaluation be performed by a New York State Licensed Professional Engineer for evidence of deterioration of any structural element or building component of such parking garage; evidence of the existence of any unsafe condition in such parking garage; and evidence indicating that such parking garage is an unsafe structure.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: The City of Mount Vernon is required by New York State Law to have a Zoning Board of Appeals for situations where a development proposal does not conform to the City's Zoning Code. Therefore, the five-member Zoning Board of Appeals has specific duties that are clearly identified by New York State Law. The Zoning Board of Appeals is tasked with granting use variances, area variances as well as the interpretation of the Mount Vernon Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Architectural Review Board Application
recordTypes.description: The Architectural Review Board is charged with conserving the value of buildings by preserving the aesthetic character of neighborhoods. Therefore, the Architectural Review Board reviews items like building/construction materials, building design and building style with the intent of issuing a certificate of appropriateness. Accordingly, the Architectural Review Board has been making determinations concerning these types of applications since 1961 when the Architectural Review Board was created by the City Council.

recordTypes.description: The City of Mount Vernon ("CMVNY") is committed to its small business community.  The expansion of our local economy is interconnected with the growth of CMVNY small businesses. recordTypes.name: Unified Solar Application Permit
recordTypes.description:
The City of Mount Vernon has developed a checklist used by the Building Department and the Fire Department Plan Examiners when reviewing all Solar Panel applications.  To assist applicants when filing a Unified Solar Permit Application, we are sharing this checklist.  Note that requirements to qualify for review as a Unified Solar Permit application as noted on the USP applications remain in place and this checklist is only to be used as a guideline in addition to the application to aid the applicant by clearly detailing what our Plan Examiners will be looking for in the filing documents.  This checklist is unique to this City and was developed based on previous inadequate/incomplete USP applications filed since we launched the USP process in April 2024.
This City has the following challenges which has generated the need of these checklist to help mitigate issues due to the following:
1.\tAn older housing stock which has properties that might require:
a.\tAdditional structural roof support that may be required for any additional dead load added to it.
b.\tRoofing materials and/or application that may need to be repaired or replaced to accommodate these types of installations.
c.\tOutdated and insufficient electrical power source and wiring which need to be upgraded to safely handle the requirements of these types of installations.
d.\tGenerally, the houses in this city were built in close adjacency to neighboring houses so there is more of a threat for the spread of a fire.
2.\tA history of a high rate of residential fires resulting in our fire department requiring the following:
a.\tA clear and direct roof access path to the properties for firefighting.
b.\tRoofs that with this additional dead load added is still structurally capable of supporting the live load of firefighters/first responders when fighting fires.
c.\tUpgrading of electrical systems associated with these types of installations that can accommodate them safely.
The MV Building Department and Fire Department is supportive of the benefits to the environment and the energy savings of its residents installing solar panels and believes these guidelines will achieve this and at the same time if met they will keep our residents and our first responders safe.  

Please note:

The plans for this application will be reviewed by the third-party plans examiner company, Labella, and the Fire Department. Once both reviews are approved, a Building Department inspector will conduct an initial inspection to verify the site conditions.

After the plans are approved and the initial inspection is passed, the permit will be issued.

Do not begin any work before receiving the official permit and signed, approved plans from the Department of Buildings. Performing work without a permit will result in a Stop Work Order and a violation being issued.

recordTypes.name: Letter of Completion
recordTypes.description:
Please be advised of the following requirements when requesting a Letter of Completion:

1. Title Search: 
A current Title Search must be uploaded to attachments, highlight the permit# and scope of work that requires closing.

2. Inspections Prior to 2010: 
A $100.00 fee per permit inspection was required. 
To waive the additional fee, you must upload a copy of the receipt to the attached request in the Open Gov              portal. 
If the original building permit is not available, submit it under the 2010 Letter of Completion process.

3. Permits Issued After 2010: 
A $100.00 fee was paid at the time of permit issuance for Letter of Completion.

4. Required Documents for Letter of Completion:
A copy of the original building permit.
A notarized Letter of completion from the contractor who performed the work.

Should you have any questions or require assistance, please leave a comment on the portal.

Thank You.

recordTypes.name: Event Facility Request Form - Current
recordTypes.description:
The Event Facilities Request Form is used by Mount Vernon residents, community groups, businesses, and third-party organizers to formally request the use of a city-owned facility, park, field, or designated public space for a planned event or activity.

This form collects key event details, including the event purpose, date and time, expected attendance, setup needs, and any special services required, so the department can review the request, confirm availability, determine staffing and safety needs, and ensure the event complies with all applicable policies, permits, and operational requirements.

Submission of this form does not guarantee approval. All requests are subject to department review and confirmation.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Mount Vernon
recordTypes.description:
Building Permit Application

The application fee for a building permit shall be as follows:

$125 filing fee
For all buildings, except existing one- and two-family dwellings, $15 for each $1,000 of estimated cost, permit fee.
For work on existing one- and two-family dwellings, $10 for each $1,000 of estimated cost, permit fee.
Additional documentation:
Letter of completion $100.00 


Please upload to attachments a physical application found at https://cmvny.com/282/Documents-Forms-Fees 
Reminder: sign and notarize necessary sections to prevent delay on processing your permit. We have 10 days to review your application.

Once the proposed work is completed and the final inspection has been passed, please submit the signed and notarized Letter of Completion from the contractor immediately following the final inspection. This will allow the Department of Buildings staff to close the permit within ten (10) business days.

recordTypes.name: Private Carter's License  Copy
recordTypes.description:
This license is required of any company that wished to engage in business of collecting, removing and/or transporting trade waste, garbage or rubbish in the City of Mount Vernon.  

COMMERCIAL MEAT WASTE
Offal and all and every kind of refuse from the trimming of meats, fish and fowl in retail markets, fish markets and butcher shops.
GARBAGE
Every refuse accumulation, except commercial meat wastes, of animal, fruit or vegetable matter that attends the preparation, use, cooking, dealing in or storing of meat, fish, fowl, fruits, vegetables or baked goods.
PERSON
Any individual, firm, corporation, association or partnership, and includes the plural as well as the singular and the feminine as well as the masculine gender.
RUBBISH
Discarded combustible and noncombustible waste material and refuse of every character accumulated within the City, except garbage, trade waste, commercial meat wastes and offensive materials as defined in § 1 of Article X of the Sanitary Code of the City of Mount Vernon, New York, and includes but is not limited to ashes or the residue from burning wood, coal, coke and other combustible materials of every description, house dirt, trash, newspapers, papers, cartons, rags, boxes, wood, excelsior, wood shavings, sawdust, rubber, leather, tree branches, yard trimmings, dry leaves, tin cans, metals, mineral matter, glass, crockery and dust.
TRADE WASTE
Any refuse from the manufacture, processing, assembling or repair of any kind of goods, wares or merchandise and any such manufactured, processed, assembled or repaired goods, wares or merchandise which has been discarded by the person, firm or corporation manufacturing, processing, assembling or repairing same or who is engaged in the sale of any manufactured, processed, assembled or repaired goods, wares or merchandise, but such term does not include commercial meat waste, as defined herein.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Application - CURRENT
recordTypes.description: Special Event shall mean any preplanned meeting, activity, parade, banner hangings or gathering of a group of persons, animals or vehicles or a combination thereof, having a common purpose on any public/private street, sidewalk, alley, park, or other public/private place or building, which special event substantially inhibits the usual flow of pedestrian or vehicular travel, or which occupies any public/private place or building so as to preempt normal use of space by the general public or which deviates from the established use of such space or building.

recordTypes.name: Parade / Procession Permit
recordTypes.description: Unless otherwise permitted by law, all processions and parades over any public streets or places are prohibited unless a prior written permit signed by the Mayor is obtained. Such permit shall designate the street or streets or public places over which processions and parades may move as well as the day and hours thereof.

categories.name: **Practice Category**
categories.content:
What is a category?
Categories are a high level grouping of record types (e.g. permits & licenses) within ViewPoint Cloud. 


How are categories commonly used in ViewPoint Cloud?
Categories are commonly associated with departments, such as Building or Licensing. They’re a great way to divide users & user settings, financial reporting, and guide

recordTypes.name: Applying and making Payments through Portal Account
recordTypes.description:
2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
Applying for a Permit

Start an Application:

First, you must have a profile. Please see 1. Signing Up, Creating a Profile, & Accessing Your Information for more information.

To navigate to a specific application, click on Explore next to the Department or Category name. Then click Select next to the type of permit. Lastly click Start to start the application. At that time, you'll be prompted to log in (if you have not already logged in) and can apply for your permit or license.

Saving Drafts:

Applications can be saved as Drafts and completed at a later time. To save your application, click on Save and Exit on the upper right side of the form. 

To return to that Draft:

1. Go to your Profile

2. In the Active Records section, click on the Record. All Draft records will be labeled "Draft."



Paying a Fee

When a fee is due, you'll be notified automatically via email.

To pay:

1. In the email notification, click on Pay Online. You can also go to the site, view your profile, and click on the Record in your Inbox.

2. In the Permit Fee step on the Record page, you'll see an overview of the fees and you'll be able to pay automatically with a credit card or e-check.

3. Click on Pay to pay the fee then follow the prompts to enter and submit your payment details.

recordTypes.description:
3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Document
Receiving your Permit, License, or Other Documents

When a plan review, permit, license, certificate of occupancy, certificate of completion, or any other document is issued, the applicant will be notified automatically via email.

To Print Your Document 

In the email, click on the Print button. This will take you to the Record page. You can also log in to the OpenGov Citizen Services Cloud site, go to your Profile, and click on the Record.

On the Record page, click on the Document Issuance step and click Print (toward the bottom right of the preview).

recordTypes.name: Residential Alteration/Repair Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for residential alteration and repair permit.  This permit cannot be used to add any new area (including decks) to an existing home/building and cannot be used for apartments or multi-family dwellings.

Examples include: foundation repair, finishing off an existing unfished bonus room or basement, truss repair from storm damage, reconfiguring an existing space into a different use (i.e. converting a closet into a bathroom).

recordTypes.description:
Before submitting please confirm that the submittal is for EOP or AOWE private option permitting.


EOP or AOWE private permitting options  require the engineer or LSS to submit a Notice of Intent (NOI) and an Authorization to Operate (ATO) to the health department.  The health department has minimal involvement in EOP/AOWE beyond the notification.

recordTypes.name: Existing System Approval or Well Setback Compliance NEW
recordTypes.description:
An Existing System Approval (ESA) is required for properties served by a wastewater system prior to reconnecting to the existing wastewater system or making any other additions to the property. 

Affidavit - Instead of receiving an ESA from the Health Department an owner of a property can choose to submit an Affidavit confirming that the proposed construction will meet local and state on-site wastewater system setback requirements pursuant to NCGS 130A-335 as long as the construction does not increase the design daily flow or wastewater strength. 

NOTE - The affidavit can only be submitted for confirming wastewater system setbacks.  If a well is located on the property, a well setback approval will be required to confirm well setbacks. 

A Well Setback Compliance Approval is needed when an improvement is being made to a parcel of land with an existing well to verify setbacks from the well are met. (Well Setback Compliance Approval is not needed if an existing system approval is submitted for the improvements.)

recordTypes.name: Fuel Storage Tank Removal, Installation, and Abandonment  Permit
recordTypes.description:
This Permit is required for the removal or abandonment of any underground or aboveground fuel storage tank(s) in Chatham County.  This shall apply to residential and commercial properties.  

Applicant Requirements:
The work area and equipment must be secured at all times. The Fire Marshal’s Office must be notified a minimum of seventy-two (72) hours prior to the requested date of removal. A complete closure report, including but not limited to a certified soil testing report, hazardous materials manifest, and tank disposal receipt must be submitted to the Fire Marshal's Office upon completion of the job. It shall be the responsibility of the person(s) conducting the removal of the tank to adhere to all procedures as outlined in the State of North Carolina Regulations, NFPA 30 and 327, as well as with the regulations of any other State or Federal Agency. IF THERE IS EVIDENCE OF A RELEASE OF PRODUCT, REGARDLESS OF THE AMOUNT RELEASED, YOU ARE REQUIRED TO NOTIFY THE PROPER AUTHORITIES.

2)We review/approve your application & add the fee(s). 
3)You get a notification to your email to make the payment.

recordTypes.name: Goldston Recreation Fee Chatham Central School District
Tent and Temporary Structure Permit
recordTypes.description:
Permit submittals shall be 10 business days in advance of the event. Zoning and building approval is required. The structure(s) shall not be erected for a period of more than 180 consecutive days with in a 12-month period on a single premises.  Multiple tents at the SAME LOCATION may be permitted on a single permit. 

Each tent permit packet will be forwarded to a Fire Inspector who will be handling the issuance of your tent permit. We will review the submitted information and contact you if additional information is required. Once the submittal has been approved, the fire department will contact you to arrange for an on-site inspection. All applicable fees will be paid prior to the actual site inspection. Upon successful completion of the on-site inspection, the tent permit will be issued.

recordTypes.name: Fireworks / Pyrotechnic Special Effects Permit
recordTypes.description: An operational permit is required for the manufacture, storage, handling, sale or use of any quantity of explosives, explosive materials, fireworks or pyrotechnic special effects within the scope of Chapter 56 of the N.C. Fire Prevention Code. Exception: 1. Fireworks allowed by N.C.G.S. 12-414, 2. Storage in Group R-3 occupancies of smokeless propellant and small arms primers for personal use, not for resale and in accordance with Section 5606.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Fireworks Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any vendor, temporary or permanent, that will be selling consumer fireworks in Chatham County.

recordTypes.name: Wilson County Addressing Permit - Incorporated Areas or Wilson Co. Special Circumstance
recordTypes.description: This permit will be for officials in the Towns in Wilson County to complete to initiate addressing for people who do not fall in the Zoning jurisdiction of Wilson County Planning. Please complete this permit when approving a zoning permit for your respective Town.

recordTypes.name: New Septic/Existing Septic Re-Connection
recordTypes.description: Application for a lot evaluation for placement of a new septic system, expansion, or re-connection.

recordTypes.name: Wilson County Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is intended for Wilson County Zoning Permits only.  It may not be used to apply for or to upload zoning documents from the City of Wilson or the Towns of Black Creek, Elm City, Lucama, Saratoga, Sims, or Stantonsburg.  Please upload those items to the Building Permit Application. This permit, issued by the Wilson County Planning Staff, allows the applicant to use or occupy a tract of land or a building; or to erect, install or alter a structure, building or sign situated in the jurisdiction of the County that fully meets the requirements of the Wilson County Unified Development Ordinance (UDO). All applicants are required to provide planning staff with a site plan of the property.

recordTypes.description: Use the portal to apply and upload your Recombination, Exempt, and Minor Subdivision Plats for review.

recordTypes.name: Water Sample Request (Existing Wells)
recordTypes.description:
Access to a quality water source is vital to human development and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. Some water quality issues are easy to detect, while others are colorless, odorless and detectable only by lab analysis. To be sure your water is safe, it should be sampled and tested for contaminants periodically. Newly constructed wells are tested for bacteria and 17 inorganic parameters as a part of the well permit. Wilson County Environmental Health Services offers well water sampling and testing for existing wells to the citizens in the county. If you are experiencing water quality issues with your well water, or have safe drinking water concerns, contact Environmental Health Services to speak with a specialist.

Please allow two (2) business days for review of your sampling request.  You will be prompted for payment once the request has been approved.  Samples are sent to DHHS State Lab and can only be collected Monday through Wednesday before 4pm only.  Weeks that include a Holiday will vary. Bacteriological test results are generally returned within five (5) days. All other tests may take up to a minimum of four (4) weeks. Results are uploaded to this portal.

recordTypes.description: Application for Commercial and Residential Building Permits including, but not limited to, Single Family Dwellings, Commercial Buildings, Accessory Buildings, Signs, Swimming Pools, Storage Tanks, etc.

recordTypes.name: Utility Tap Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for new services for electric, natural gas, water and sewer utilities served by the City of Kings Mountain.

recordTypes.name: Line Drop Request
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request the City of Kings Mountain's Electrical Utility to have an overhead service wire cut loose or removed.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a driveway permit when adding a new driveway that will access a city maintained street within the City limits. For questions please call 704-734-4501.

recordTypes.name: Address Request Application
recordTypes.description: The new address must be within the city limits of King's Mountain.

recordTypes.name: Additional/Replacement Rollout Container
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for an additional or replacement rollout container within the city limits. If you are requesting a replacement container due to container being damaged by a city garbage truck, please call the Public Works Department at 704-734-0735 before you proceed with this application.

recordTypes.name: Bulky Yard Waste Collection
recordTypes.description: Use this application to pay for Bulky Yard Waste collection within the city limits. Please call 704-734-0735 for any questions.

recordTypes.name: Annexation Petition Application
recordTypes.description: An  original Annexation Plat is required to be submitted with the petition which contains the original signature, registration number and seal of the surveyor, as well as the required language and signature space for the Review Officer to sign prior to recording.  This map will be recorded prior to the Ordinance that is adopted by City Council.  If the Annexation Plat has been previously recorded, please provide a copy that reflects the Plat Book and Page number in which it has been recorded.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Decision Appeal Application
recordTypes.description: Appeals from the decisions of an administrative officer in which it is alleged there is an error in an order, requirement, decision, or determination in the enforcement of this UDO shall be made to the Board of Adjustment (BOA).

recordTypes.name: Encroachment Agreement
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for an encroachment agreement to perform utility work or other construction related activities on city maintained streets or right-of-ways adjacent to city maintained streets.

recordTypes.name: Land-Disturbing Activity
recordTypes.description: Use this application for a Certificate of Approval to undertake any land-disturbing activity such as grading.

recordTypes.name: Application for Rezoning or Text Amendment
recordTypes.description:
A rezoning is a request to change the zoning district of a given parcel. The zoning district classifications can be found in the UDO; 156.10.02 Zoning District Establishment. 

A text amendment is a request to change, add, or include any new language into the Unified Development Ordinance (UDO). The UDO can be found at the following address: https://online.encodeplus.com/regs/kingsmountain-nc/doc-viewer.aspx#secid-2001

recordTypes.name: Campaign Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Signs displaying support for or opposition to a candidate, political party, or referendum within the jurisdictional limits of the City of Kings Mountain.

recordTypes.name: Spill Cleanup
recordTypes.description: Use this application to pay invoices for spill cleanup services performed by City staff.

recordTypes.name: Central Business (CB) Vacant Property Registration
recordTypes.description: Registration of businesses that have been vacant for longer than 90 days without sale or rental.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Nonconforming Adjustment
recordTypes.description: An applicant for a Certificate of Nonconforming Adjustment shall submit a detailed plan of the existing site, showing the degree of Nonconformity with respect to the dimensional and design regulations of this UDO. In the case of a Nonconforming Use, the application shall include a detailed explanation of the current use, including documentation of traffic generated by the current use.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This form is used for initial site plan review of commercial projects to include zoning and grading and erosion control. Once the plans are approved, the applicant can apply for a commercial building permit.

recordTypes.name: Construction Documents/Preliminary Plat Review for Major Subdivisions
recordTypes.description:
Sketch Plan approval is required before apply for this review.
For more detail on the subdivision review process please see section 156.120 Subdivision Review Procedures here: https://online.encodeplus.com/regs/kingsmountain-nc-update/doc-viewer.aspx#secid-179
Preliminary Plat and Construction Plan requirements can be found in the Mapping Standards Appendix of the Kings Mountain UDO here: https://online.encodeplus.com/regs/kingsmountain-nc-update/doc-viewer.aspx#secid-209 
The applicant will be required to send 2 sets of hard copies to Public Works at 1013 N Piedmont Ave, Kings Mountain, NC 28086

recordTypes.name: Final Plat Review Application
recordTypes.description: The is for a single phase of a major subdivision. Every phase requires its own unique Final Plat Review Application.

recordTypes.name: Minor & Family Subdivision Application
recordTypes.description:
Minor Subdivisions are divisions of property that include up to five lots in the project design. Lots are served by frontage on an existing public road or by a new public or private road that is created during the design and review process for the Minor Subdivision.

Family Subdivision is a division of land solely among direct lineal descendants (children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren) and direct lineal ascendants (father, mother, grandfather, and grandmother); and brothers, sisters, nieces, and nephews.

recordTypes.name: Road Closing Petition
recordTypes.description: Form to submit a petition to City Council to fully close or partially close a road or street in the municipal limits of Kings Mountain.

recordTypes.name: Sketch Plan Review
recordTypes.description:
This is the first step in any commercial or Major Subdivision project review. 

All sketch plans shall be drawn to a scale of not more than 100 feet to an inch, and meet all requirements listed in the mapping standards of the Kings Mountain UDO here: https://online.encodeplus.com/regs/kingsmountain-nc-update/doc-viewer.aspx#secid-205

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A land use designated as a "special use" in a zoning district is one that might be appropriate if special standards are in place to ensure it is located, designed and operated in a manner that is in harmony with neighboring development. Special Use Permits are granted by the Board of Adjustment or City Council through a quasi-judicial hearing and review process set forth in the Unified Development Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: System Development Fee Refund Application
recordTypes.description:
Water and sanitary sewer system development fees may be waived if the development meets 3 criteria:
1) For single-family, detached residential lots; wherein the combination of the lot size, as measured in square footage, when combined with the total gross square footage of living space of the dwelling constructed on the lot, totals 9500 or greater; and:
2) Wherein, said same dwellings are offered for sale exclusively to owner-occupant purchasers, and not investor-for-rent purchasers; and:
3) Wherein, said same dwellings are constructed consistent with exterior façade design standards which earn no fewer than three (3) cumulative "performance points," as measured by the City of Kings Mountain UDO Section 156.50.08, Performance Flex Lot, Subsection B, utilizing only #1-5, being: wall materials; roofs; garages; façade articulation, and porches.

https://online.encodeplus.com/regs/kingsmountain-nc-update/doc-viewer.aspx#secid-604

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use Permit
recordTypes.description: The Temporary Use Permits  allow a use on a short-term basis and certain seasonal or transient uses not otherwise allowed. The following uses require a Temporary Use Permit: Amusement Enterprises, Commercial Outdoor Sales Events, Contractor Offices (Temporary),  Firework Stands, Food Trucks, Outdoor Circus, Carnival, Exhibition, or Show, Real Estate Offices in Construction or Temporary Modular Unit, Real Estate Office in Model Home, Seasonal Sales, Sidewalk Vendor, Temporary Mobile Home During Construction of New Home.

recordTypes.name: Variance Request
recordTypes.description: When unnecessary hardships would result from carrying out the strict letter of a zoning ordinance, the Board of Adjustment shall vary any of the provisions of the ordinance if all of the standards of Chapter 156.110.01(C)  are met.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Complaint
recordTypes.description: This record is for tracking and investigating a suspected violation of the UDO's zoning requirements.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description:
A zoning verification letter is a legally recognized document which informs commercial property owners, lenders and prospective buyers of zoning laws related to the particular property based on the municipalities current zoning ordinance.

A zoning verification letter will provide a general description of the zoning district, references to any applicable zoning and development standards plus any conditional rezoning requirements, and compliance.

This letter is NOT a zoning permit.

recordTypes.description:
Contractors working in the Public Right-of-Way must register with the City of Tallmadge. Registrations are valid to the end of the year. (TCO 721)

This includes, but is not limited to installing, constructing, improving, renovating, repairing or maintaining a construction project and/or system within a public street or utility right-of-way.

Certificates are not required for small accessory structures such as doghouses, benches, garden decorations, barbeque equipment, etc. provided they do not have a footprint that exceeds 50 square feet.

recordTypes.description: Use this form for projects involving city water and/or city sewer tap-ins and similar.

recordTypes.name: Utility Construction Permit

recordTypes.name: Addition to Existing Accessory Structure

recordTypes.name: Application to File a Property Maintenance Concern

recordTypes.name: Renewable Energy Equipment

recordTypes.name: Deck
recordTypes.description: When installing a deck on a property, zoning approval is required.

recordTypes.name: Demolition

recordTypes.name: Application to File a High Grass Concern

recordTypes.name: Application to File a Junk/Trash/Vehicle Concern

recordTypes.name: Fence/Wall

When installing a fence on a property, zoning approval is required.  Certificates
