categories.name: Public Works and Engineering
categories.content: The City of La Palma Public Works Division is dedicated to providing effective and efficient public works services and maintaining La Palma's infrastructure to ensure the safety, health, and well-being of all who live, work, and visit our diverse City. The Division provides services to the community through its <

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: Home occupations shall be permitted as appurtenant and accessory uses to any residential uses.

recordTypes.name: Airport Land Use Commission (ALUC) Referral Form
Body Art Plan Check Application
recordTypes.description: The Safe Body Art Act regulates tattooing, permanent cosmetics, branding and piercing. This law requires all body art practitioners to annually register with the county and work from and approved and inspected facility. Temporary body art events and mechanical ear piercing business are also regulated by the Safe Body Art Act.

recordTypes.name: Universal Planning Application Form
recordTypes.description: This application form is for use of all Planning Department applications.  For questions, please call the Department at (530) 458-0480 for assistance.

recordTypes.name: How to Create a User Account.          This is your first Step!
Community Event Coordinator Application
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out if you are a coordinator for a community event where the vendors will be selling or sampling food.

recordTypes.name: Cottage Food Operation (CFO) Application
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out and approved prior to selling food made from a residential property.

recordTypes.name: How to Track the Progress of your Application
Food Facility Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out and approved prior to opening a new food facility or doing any remodels to an existing food facility.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Facility Plan Check Application
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out if you are opening a New Mobile Food Facility or if you are doing any remodeling to an existing Mobile Food Facility.

recordTypes.name: Account Overview (How to find stuff in your account)
Public Swimming Pool Permit Minor Remodel
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out if you are doing a Minor Remodel to a Public Swimming Pool or Spa.

recordTypes.name: Public Swimming Pool Plan Check
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out if you are installing a New Public Swimming Pool or Spa & if you are doing a major repair to a Public Swimming Pool or Spa.

recordTypes.name: Seal Without Witness
recordTypes.description: Prior to filling out this application, permission is required from Environmental Health Staff.

recordTypes.name: Sewage Disposal System
recordTypes.description: Non-Refundable Permit Expires 1 year from date issued, application will not be complete without payment and plan.

recordTypes.name: Site Evaluation Application for  On-Site Sewage Disposal
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be submitted and the inspection will need to be performed before you apply for a septic permit.

recordTypes.name: State Small Water System Application
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out if you are putting in a well that will be used for 5 or more water connections for Human Consumption.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Facility Application
recordTypes.description:
This application will need to be filled out if you are going to be a food vendor at a temporary event not exceeding 3 days, this includes sampling of food.

Permits are non-refundable.

recordTypes.name: UST Closure
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out if you will be closing any permitted or unpermitted Underground Storage Tanks.

recordTypes.name: UST Installation
recordTypes.description: This application will need to be filled out if you will be installing new Underground Storage Tanks or repairing/modifying/upgrading any existing Underground Storage Tanks.

recordTypes.name: Water Well Application
recordTypes.description: This application will be filled out if you are drilling any residential, AG or various sampling wells.

categories.name: Need HELP!
categories.content:
In order to return to the Public Portal, use your browser's Back Button  or click on this link: https://colusacountyca.viewpointcloud.com/


All "How to" video clips found below can also be found at:

categories.name: Building Division
categories.content:
The Building Division assists in ensuring that all construction in the County is done in a safe manner. Obtaining a building permit ensures that minimum safety standards are met in the design, construction, quality of materials, use, and occupancy of all structures.  In performing its functions, the Building staff strives to provide common-sense solutions to complicated issues in a timely and professional manner.

PLEASE NOTE:  BUILDING PERMITS WILL NOT BE ISSUED ON FRI

categories.name: Environmental Health Division
categories.content:
The purpose of Environmental Health Division is to protect the public health and promote the well being of all Colusa County residents, workers, and visitors. The Environmental Health Division is responsible for enforcing numerous State and local regulations and relies heavily on education in fulfilling its legal responsibilities.

Should you have any questions regarding the on-line permitting system, please call our office at (530) 458-0888.

categories.name: Planning Division
categories.content: The Planning Division serves as Colusa County's land use information center and as the staff to the Board of Supervisors and the Planning Commission.  Its staff provides information to the public and businesses regarding residential, commercial, industrial, agricultural, and resource land uses and development projects.   These efforts are focused to facilitate the delivery of the highest level of customer service to the C

categories.name: Code Compliance Division
categories.content:
The Code Compliance Division is responsible for assisting property owners in complying with the County Code and helping to resolve compliance issues.

PRIVACY POLICY: Pursuant to Government Code Section 6254(f) Records of Complaint are not public record until the compliant has been finaled. It is the Department's policy to protect the identity of all complainants to the full extent allowed by law.
</

recordTypes.name: Code Complaint
recordTypes.description: Select "Apply Online" to report a code complaint such as tall grass, trash, junk vehicles, etc.

recordTypes.name: Re-Roof Permit
recordTypes.description: Re-Roof permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time.

recordTypes.name: Water Heater Upgrade/Replacement Permit
recordTypes.description: Water Heater Upgrade/Replacement permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time.

recordTypes.name: ACC Roofing and Solar Project
recordTypes.description: This Daily Observation Report include all potential observation sections which include - Traffic Control, Labor Compliance, ............

recordTypes.name: Furnace Upgrade/Replacement Permit
recordTypes.description: Furnace Upgrade/Replacement permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time. Keep in mind that it is the responsibility of the applicant to contact & coordinate with PG&E.

recordTypes.name: Seismic Retrofit/Earthquake Brace & Bolt (EBB) Permit
recordTypes.description: Seismic Retrofit/EBB Permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. For Multi-Family & Commercial foundation designs please use the Commercial Building Permit. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time.

recordTypes.name: Complete Streets Policy Checklist
recordTypes.description: This document was developed to assist project sponsors in defining and developing projects and local plans using the City of Arcata's Complete Streets Policy.

recordTypes.name: 2024  LK Wood and California Drainage Improvements
recordTypes.description: This Daily Observation Report include all potential observation sections which include - Traffic Control, Labor Compliance, ............

recordTypes.name: PV/EV/Battery Backup Permit
recordTypes.description: Please note that although the Photovoltaic Permit can be applied for at any time, approval is limited to city business hours.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Service Upgrade/Replacement Permit
recordTypes.description: Electrical Service Upgrade/Replacement permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time. Keep in mind that it is the responsibility of the applicant to contact & coordinate with PG&E.

recordTypes.name: Steel Waterline Replacement Project - DOR
recordTypes.description: Daily Observation Report for City of Arcata Steel Waterline Replacement Project (2025-2026)

recordTypes.name: 2025 Joint Slurry Project
recordTypes.description: This Daily Observation Report include all potential observation sections which include - Traffic Control, Labor Compliance, ............

recordTypes.name: Sewer Lateral  Permit/Certificate
recordTypes.description: If your sewer lateral project requires the use of a public right-of-way, you might also be required to apply for an Encroachment Permit.

recordTypes.name: Encroachment Permit
recordTypes.description: Please note that although the Encroachment Permit can be applied for at any time, approval is limited to city business hours.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Sign permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit is for work pertaining to 1-2 family residences (R3).

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Demolition permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. Be aware, some projects may require notification of the North Coast Unified Air Quality Management District (NCUAQMD). To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time.

recordTypes.name: Grading Permit
recordTypes.description: A grading permit is required to before any grading, ground disturbing, clearing of vegetation or any other land disturbing activity. Grading permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time.

recordTypes.name: On-site Wastewater Treatment System (OWTS) Permit
recordTypes.description: On-site Wastewater Treatment System (OWTS) permits can be applied for at any time, but approval is limited to city business hours 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday - Friday. To schedule an inspection, call or leave a message at (707)-822-5956 at least 24 hours prior to your desired time.

recordTypes.name: Rental Inspection
recordTypes.description: A Rental Inspection application is required for each parcel location. There is a section on the application to note if your parcel has more than one unit. If you have questions about the application, please contact 707-822-5956 for support.

recordTypes.name: Community Well Construction Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this permit for drilling activities associated with the construction of a Public Water System well. Construction of a new well can only be performed by a C-57 licensed driller. The California Contractors State License Board can be searched for that type of licensed driller at: https://www.cslb.ca.gov/OnlineServices/CheckLicenseII/CheckLicense.aspx

recordTypes.name: Domestic Well Construction Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this permit for drilling activities associated with the construction of a domestic water well. Construction of a new well can only be performed by a C-57 licensed driller. The California Contractors State License Board can be searched for that type of licensed driller at: https://www.cslb.ca.gov/OnlineServices/CheckLicenseII/CheckLicense.aspx

recordTypes.name: Existing System Leach Line Repair, Replace or Modify
recordTypes.description: This application is for replacement septic systems or repairs to existing systems leach field.

recordTypes.name: Monitoring Well Construction Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this permit for drilling activities associated with the construction of a monitoring well. Construction of a new well can only be performed by a C-57 licensed driller. The California Contractors State License Board can be searched for that type of licensed driller at: https://www.cslb.ca.gov/OnlineServices/CheckLicenseII/CheckLicense.aspx

recordTypes.name: New Alternative Design Septic System Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for a new alternative septic system installation. DO NOT DO A PERC TEST UNTIL YOUR SITE HAS BEEN APPROVED BY OUR DEPARTMENT. You will receive emails with each step of the process.

recordTypes.name: New Conventional Septic System Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for a new conventional septic system installation. DO NOT DO A PERC TEST UNTIL YOUR SITE HAS BEEN APPROVED BY OUR DEPARTMENT. You will receive emails with each step of the process. If your site is not approved for a conventional septic system an inspector will let you know.

recordTypes.name: Production Well Construction Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Select this permit for drilling activities associated with the construction of a well used for industrial, agricultural, injection/recharge, non-potable fire suppression, or other type of production.
Construction of a new well can only be performed by a C-57 licensed driller. The California Contractors State License Board can be searched for that type of licensed driller at: https://www.cslb.ca.gov/OnlineServices/CheckLicenseII/CheckLicense.aspx

recordTypes.name: Soil Boring and Exploratory Drilling Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this permit for non-permanent drilling activities such as soil boring, rock coring, or other exploratory and temporary activities. Construction can only be performed by a C-57 licensed driller. The California Contractors State License Board can be searched for that type of licensed driller at: https://www.cslb.ca.gov/OnlineServices/CheckLicenseII/CheckLicense.aspx

recordTypes.name: Tank Abandonment Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for a septic tank abandonment either by filling the tank in with an approved product or removal of the tank. Septic tanks can not be left empty in the ground as they can be a danger for collapsing.

recordTypes.name: Tank Repair/Replacement Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for replacement septic systems or repairs to existing systems.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Event Organizer Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is for event organizers that are putting on an event more than 4 hours with more than one food vendor. APPLICATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO BE SUBMITTED 1 MONTH PRIOR TO THE EVENT. A 25% penalty will be added to organizers applications for late submission, this includes organizations with a 501C3 letter.
Please contact our department if your event is less than 4 hours and only one food vendor as it is not needed for you to fill out this application and submit it. 
Our department has a list of permitted food vendors that are available. Contact our department for that list 760-878-0238.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Vendor Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for a temporary food vendor to fill out. This application is due 2 weeks prior to the event. Annual permitted food vendors will only need to submit this form once in a calendar year. If the menu changes you will need to send an email to InyoEHD@inyocounty.us

recordTypes.name: Well Destruction Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this permit for drilling activities associated with the destruction of an existing well. Construction can only be performed by a C-57 licensed driller. The California Contractors State License Board can be searched for that type of licensed driller at: https://www.cslb.ca.gov/OnlineServices/CheckLicenseII/CheckLicense.aspx

recordTypes.name: Well Modification Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Select this permit for drilling activities associated with the modification of an existing well. Construction can only be performed by a C-57 licensed driller. The California Contractors State License Board can be searched for that type of licensed driller at: https://www.cslb.ca.gov/OnlineServices/CheckLicenseII/CheckLicense.aspx

categories.name: Building and Safety Department
categories.content: Our department is here to help when filling out these forms online. There is an in office computer that is available at our department if you would like help filling out these forms. Some attachments will be required per application. Be prepared to upload these forms to the system so that it does not hold up your application. Building Plans and Structural Documents will be required to be in digital format.

categories.name: Environmental Health Department

recordTypes.name: Illicit Discharge Report Form
recordTypes.description: Illicit Discharge refers to the unauthorized or illegal release of pollutants, contaminants, or non-stormwater materials into stormwater systems, waterways, or the environment. These discharges bypass regulated treatment processes and often violate environmental laws or permits designed to protect water quality and public health.

recordTypes.name: LIQUOR: New License Application, License Renewal Application, Transfer of Ownership Application, and Change of Location Application for Liquor licenses
recordTypes.description: Click here to apply for a new liquor license, or renew an existing liquor license, or change the location of a liquor license, or transfer ownership of a liquor license.

recordTypes.name: Site Development Plan
recordTypes.description: The Development Plan Application consolidates the Lighting Plan, Parking Plan and the Screening/Buffering Plan into a unified application. This streamlined approach provides applicants with the flexibility to submit one application to cover all required information, as well as update individual components of the Development Plan as necessary.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: To begin a construction project on a commercial property, you must first complete this application. Commercial building permits are required for projects such as: new commercial, industrial and institutional buildings. These project types include; multi-family structures, commercial additions/expansions, accessory commercial structures, tenant finishes/improvements, change of occupancy/use, structural alterations, demolition, accessibility improvements (ADA), solar installations, or fire protection work. Contact Pueblo County Planning & Development at (719) 583-6100 to confirm whether your specific project requires a Commercial Building Permit.

recordTypes.name: No Fee Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
A no-fee permit is a trade permit pulled by a licensed subcontractor (such as electrical, plumbing, mechanical, or fire protection) for work associated with an active building permit. No additional fee is assessed because the permit fees for this scope of work were already paid under the primary building permit.

The no-fee permit is required for proper tracking, inspections, and code compliance for each trade involved in the project, but it does not result in duplicate permit fees. All work performed under this permit will comply with applicable codes and will be inspected as required by the Pueblo County Building Division.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Authorizations
recordTypes.description: The administrative authorization for proceeding at one's own risk allows an applicant to initiate construction activities prior to obtaining all the requisite approvals. This authorization is designed to facilitate the progression of projects that do not meet certain preliminary criteria, enabling work to commence under the understanding that the applicant assumes all responsibility and risk associated with beginning construction early.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Subdivision
recordTypes.description: The Administrative Subdivision process is used to evaluate proposed subdivisions that will create up to two lots or involve minimal adjustments to approved final plats.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: To begin a construction project on a residential property, you must first complete this application. Residential building permits are required for projects such as: new homes, additions, interior remodels, new garages or carports, demolition, new sheds or storage buildings, decks, patio covers, gazebos, fences (over 7 ft high), and any roofing, or solar service work. Contact Pueblo County Planning & Development at (719) 583-6100 to confirm whether your specific project requires a Residential Building Permit."

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Conforming Use
recordTypes.description: The Conforming Use Certificate process is an administrative process followed to document a use was lawfully established as a use-by-right within a building or on land prior to the adoption of the Pueblo County Zoning Resolution (now referred to as the Pueblo County Code) or prior to the effective date of an amendment to the Zoning Resolution (County Code), which under the current use regulations would require the issuance of a special use permit by the Pueblo County Planning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Nonconformance
recordTypes.description: The Certificate of Nonconformance process is an administrative process followed to document a use, parcel and/or structure was lawfully established prior to the adoption of the Pueblo County Zoning Resolution (now referred to as the Pueblo County Code) or an amendment to the Zoning Resolution (Code) creating the nonconformity and further meets the standards setforth in Chapter 17.124 of the Pueblo County Code.

recordTypes.name: LIQUOR: Tasting Permit
recordTypes.description:
Click here to apply for a Tasting Permit in association with a Retail Store Liquor License. If approved, you will receive one permit per month requested. 

Application must be submitted at least 30 days prior to the Liquor and Marijuana Licensing Board meeting that precedes the date of the earliest tasting. 

A calendar of the Liquor and Marijuana Licensing board can be found here. https://county.pueblo.org/liquor-and-marijuana-department/liquor-and-marijuana-licensing-board-meeting-calendar

recordTypes.name: Building Division Feedback / Complaint Application
recordTypes.description:
If you have comments, concerns, or complaints regarding the Building Division, please submit them using this form. We also welcome positive feedback and suggestions on how we can improve our service to the public.

If you have a matter that requires private or direct attention from the Building Official, please email Arnold Montoya at Arnold.montoya@pueblocounty.us.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Complaint Form
recordTypes.description:
This form is intended for reporting contractors who are performing work without required permits or who are not properly registered or licensed to work within the County. It may also be used by tenants to report potentially dangerous or hazardous structural conditions.

Please note that the Building Department does not provide legal advice, does not engage in civil or contractual disputes, and cannot guarantee whether a tenant will or will not face eviction as a result of any inspection findings.

This complaint form cannot be used for:
•Contract or payment disputes
•Poor workmanship that meets minimum code requirements but does not meet personal expectations
•Requests for refunds, compensation, or damage recovery
•Scheduling, communication, or customer service issues
•Civil disagreements between a homeowner and a contractor

recordTypes.name: LIQUOR: Special Event Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Click here to apply for a Special Event Permit. 
Special Event Permits allow non-profits to serve alcoholic beverages at fundraising events. 

Application must be submitted at least 30 days prior to the Liquor and Marijuana Licensing Board meeting that precedes the date of the special event. 

A calendar of the Liquor and Marijuana Licensing board can be found here. https://county.pueblo.org/liquor-and-marijuana-department/liquor-and-marijuana-licensing-board-meeting-calendar

recordTypes.name: Easement Vacation
recordTypes.description: The easement vacation (dedication) process is the process followed to vacate (dedicate) any public easement or portion thereof.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco License -  New Application
recordTypes.description: The State of Colorado now requires all businesses selling any type of tobacco products, including cigarettes, be licensed with both the local authority and the state authority. Please apply for a new license here.

recordTypes.name: Extraterritorial Water
recordTypes.description: This record type will be for staff only for the purpose of uploading documents and correspondence to a parcel for which research has been conducted by staff in response to development, meeting notes or land use questions prior to the submittal of an application.

recordTypes.name: Contractor's License Registration
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to register as a professional construction contractor with the Pueblo County Building Division and work in unincorporated Pueblo County.

recordTypes.name: Final Plat
recordTypes.description: The final plat process is the final application that is required for any major subdivision proposal.  This application is the second part of a Major Subdivision process, subsequent to a Preliminary Plan.

recordTypes.name: Flood Hazard Area Development Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit required before construction or development begins within any Special Flood Hazard Area (SFHA). The Floodplain Development Permit is the mechanism by which Pueblo County evaluates any and all impacts of activities proposed within regulated floodplains.

recordTypes.name: MARIJUANA: Renewal Application for a Pueblo County Marijuana Establishment License
recordTypes.description: Click here to apply for any type of new marijuana License or to renew any type of marijuana license

recordTypes.name: Over-the-Counter Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Over the counter permits include mechanical, electrical and plumbing for both residential and commercial properties. They also encompass small building projects for residential stucco, roofing, siding, windows, and doors. Service reconnects for both commercial and residential will be located in these permits as well.

recordTypes.name: MARIJUANA: New License Application for a Pueblo County Marijuana Establishment License
recordTypes.description: Click here to apply for any type of new marijuana License or to renew any type of marijuana license

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation
recordTypes.description: The home occupation process is an administrative process followed to document a home business in Pueblo County.

recordTypes.name: Special Inspection
recordTypes.description: To request a special inspection there is a fee of $110.00 that will be due after the permit has been received and reviewed. The property owner may sign the documents provided electronically or in office, or a copy of the lease may be provided to give Pueblo County Building Division permission to do the inspections. For lodging renewals, a copy of the lease or owner signature is not necessary.

recordTypes.name: Location & Extent Review
recordTypes.description: The Development Plan Application consolidates the Lighting Plan, Parking Plan and the Screening/Buffering Plan into a unified application. This streamlined approach provides applicants with the flexibility to submit one application to cover all required information, as well as update individual components of the Development Plan as necessary.

recordTypes.name: ***EMERGENCY ROW/ROWW NOTICE***
recordTypes.description:
In the case of an emergency:
You need to notify us of the location and date of the emergency work.
You have 72 hrs after the notification has been made to submit  a ROW permit.

recordTypes.name: Request an Inspection
recordTypes.description: This record type is used for scheduling an inspection for an already existing building permit. Schedule inspections in advance or you can request a same day inspection as long as your request is submitted before 8:30 AM.

recordTypes.name: Lot Consolidation Vacation
recordTypes.description: To allow the vacation of any lot consolidation that has been  recorded.

recordTypes.name: Lot Line Rearrangement (5 Lots or Less)
recordTypes.description: The lot line rearrangement process is an administrative subdivision process which allows land owners to modify/alter/rearrange the interior property lines between existing platted lots within a recorded subdivision.

recordTypes.name: Road Use Agreement
recordTypes.description: A road access agreement is a legal document that establishes the terms under which a party is granted access to a public or private road. It defines the rights and responsibilities of all involved parties, including road use, maintenance obligations, design requirements, and compliance with regulations. These agreements ensure proper access for landlocked properties, new developments, or shared commercial entrances while addressing liability, insurance, and potential modifications. By outlining clear terms, a road access agreement helps prevent disputes and ensures safe and efficient connectivity to road networks.

recordTypes.name: MARIJUANA: Modification of Premises for Marijuana Licensed Facility
recordTypes.description: Click here to apply for modifications to an existing premises of a Marijuana Licensed Business.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit
recordTypes.description:
Used to permit any work/event which encroaches on any right of way within the Pueblo County road network. 
From physical work in a traffic lane, to worker presence in ROW, any work encroaching on Pueblo County ROW is required to have a proper permit.

recordTypes.name: Lot Line Vacation (5 Lots or Less)
recordTypes.description:
The lot line vacation process is an administrative process which allows a land owner to combine properties under the exact same ownership into a single conforming building site by eliminating the common interior lot line(s).

This process can be reversed using the Lot Consolidation Vacation  process.

recordTypes.name: MARIJUANA: Transfer of Ownership for a Marijuana Licensed Facility
recordTypes.description:
Click here to apply to transfer ownership of a licensed marijuana establishment to another individual or entity. 
(If the entity or individual listed on the license as the owner is not changing but the structure of the ownership of the licensed business is changing you will need to file a change of ownership not a transfer of ownership)

recordTypes.name: Land-Use Decision Appeal
recordTypes.description: A Land Use Decision Appeal application allows a property owner or applicant to formally request relief from a zoning decision or regulation. The appeal is reviewed by the applicable authority to make the applicable decision based upon the facts of the case.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit Pueblo West
recordTypes.description:
Used for any work/event in right of way on entire Pueblo County road network. 
Starting from physical work in traffic lane to worker presens in ROW,  any work in Pueblo County ROW is required to have proper permit.

recordTypes.name: Map Amendment
recordTypes.description: The map amendment process changes the current zoning district to another district. A property owner may submit a map amendment application to change the zoning of a property to use a property differently from what the existing zoning allows or to apply a conforming zone district designation.

recordTypes.name: Merger by Contiguity Certificate
recordTypes.description: To be eligible for a Merger by Contiguity Certificate, parcels of land must have been in existence prior to the original 1963 or 1967 adoption of the Pueblo County Code or related zoning action pursuant to Chapter 17.10.060(c)of the Pueblo County Unified Development Code.

recordTypes.name: Road Access Permit
recordTypes.description: Access management is the planned and regulated interaction between the roadway network and property access. It is an intentional strategy that preserves a safe and efficient transportation system necessary for smart growth. Access management is the practice of limiting and separating conflicts points, and it is the collaboration between planners and developers about property access, and the interaction amongst different modes of travel.  Access management is vital to protect and maintain the public’s safety and welfare, maintain the functional roadway classifications, and meet the needs for the traveling public as well as the communities. Access management is a cost-effective approach to ensure the longevity of the public facilities with the likelihood of an increase of population growth and an increase in traffic volumes. Access management strategies must be made with care as these decisions will directly impact adjacent land use.

recordTypes.name: MARIJUANA: Change of Ownership for Marijuana Licensed Facility
recordTypes.description:
Click here to report changes made to the ownership shares of a marijuana licensed establishment. 
(If the entity or individual listed as the owner on the marijuana license will be changing you must apply for a Transfer of Ownership for a Marijuana Licensed Facility)

recordTypes.name: MARIJUANA: Change of Location for Marijuana Licensed Facility
recordTypes.description: Click here to apply to change the physical location of a licensed marijuana establishment.

recordTypes.name: Road Access Permit Pueblo West
recordTypes.description: Access management is the planned and regulated interaction between the roadway network and property access. It is an intentional strategy that preserves a safe and efficient transportation system necessary for smart growth. Access management is the practice of limiting and separating conflicts points, and it is the collaboration between planners and developers about property access, and the interaction amongst different modes of travel.  Access management is vital to protect and maintain the public’s safety and welfare, maintain the functional roadway classifications, and meet the needs for the traveling public as well as the communities. Access management is a cost-effective approach to ensure the longevity of the public facilities with the likelihood of an increase of population growth and an increase in traffic volumes. Access management strategies must be made with care as these decisions will directly impact adjacent land use.

recordTypes.name: Mining & Extraction Permit
recordTypes.description: Review of applications for the mining or extraction of sand, soil, or gravel by the Board of County Commissioners in a manner that does not duplicate or contradict applicable state or federal requirements. Pueblo County reserves the right to assume the functions of external agencies involved with sand, soil, or gravel mining if such agencies are eliminated or their operations are curtailed.

recordTypes.name: Minor Subdivision
recordTypes.description: The Minor Subdivision process is used to evaluate proposed subdivisions that will create up to four lots or involve minimal adjustments to approved final plats.

recordTypes.name: Parcel of Record Certificate
recordTypes.description: The Parcel of Record process is an administrative process followed to document a property was lawfully created prior to the enactment of the Pueblo County Subdivision Regulations on August 31, 1972 (referred to in the Pueblo County Code as Title 16).

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Construction Discharge Permit
recordTypes.description: Any private or public construction site with construction activities disturbing one or more acres, or construction activities that are part of a larger common plan of development that disturb one or more acres is required to obtain a Pueblo County Stormwater Construction Discharge Permit.

recordTypes.name: SCDP Contractor Information
recordTypes.description: Any private or public construction site with construction activities disturbing one or more acres, or construction activities that are part of a larger common plan of development that disturb one or more acres is required to obtain a Pueblo County Stormwater Construction Discharge Permit.

recordTypes.name: Planned Unit Development (PUD)
recordTypes.description: A planned unit development is a rezoning action that is a designed grouping of both varied and compatible land uses, such as housing, recreation, commercial centers, and industrial parks, all within one contained development or subdivision.

recordTypes.name: Plat Amendment
recordTypes.description: The plat amendment process is the process to amend the boundaries of any plat or any part of an approved and recorded subdivision plat that has been approved by the Board of County Commissioners.

recordTypes.name: Firm/Company Registration
recordTypes.description:
Used for purpose of Right of Way (ROW) and Road Access (RA)Permit.
As an registered  Firm/Company you will be able to eliminate repetitive processes from your applications.

recordTypes.name: CORA Request
recordTypes.description: Pursuant to Colorado Open Records Act§ 24-72-201 et seq. and the Pueblo County Public Records Policy, Resolution No. 15-174, this application serves as a written request to obtain copies of public records.

recordTypes.name: Plat Vacation
recordTypes.description: The plat vacation process is the process followed to vacate any plat or any part of an approved and recorded subdivision plat that has been approved by the Board of County Commissioners.

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Plan
recordTypes.description: The preliminary plan process is the initial application required for any major subdivision proposal which intends to create 5 or more parcels of land or as determined by the Director.

recordTypes.name: Traffic Counts
recordTypes.description: This procedure is not open to the public at this time.

recordTypes.name: Road Alley Vacation
recordTypes.description: The road/alley vacation process is the process followed to vacate any public street, alley or public way or portion thereof.

recordTypes.name: Road Name Change
recordTypes.description: A road name change is the is the process followed to rename a public road as identified on a recorded subdivision plat.

recordTypes.name: Rural Land Use Plan
recordTypes.description: This is a process to provide an alternative method of land division that encourages the clustering of single-family residential dwellings and the preservation of open spaces in the rural portions of the County.

recordTypes.name: Sign (Advertising Devices) Plan
recordTypes.description: A Sign Plan permits signage by reviewing performance standards and Zoning requirements for signs placed on private property. Sign Plans are reviewed and approved administratively.

recordTypes.name: Sketch Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Use this record to apply for, schedule, and document Sketch Plan Reviews (SPR). Offered by Pueblo Means Business, this service allows developers, builders, and property owners to have conceptual projects reviewed by relevant development agencies before investing significant time and money. By identifying all requirements early, this mandatory process for commercial projects and subdivisions streamlines the path to completion. Please note that most applicants will be required to attend an SPR meeting, held on the second and fourth Tuesdays of the month between 10 AM and Noon.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description: A Special Event is a temporary commercial, promotional, or festive activity, at a specific location that is open to the public and is planned for or expected to attract a large assembly of persons.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Exemption
recordTypes.description: The subdivision exemption process is an abbreviated subdivision process which can be pursued to legally establish parcels of land that fall within the parameters of Part 1, Article 28 of Title 30, C.R.S. or Chapter 16.04.040 4., of the Pueblo County Code.

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit
recordTypes.description: The Special Use Permit allows a parcel of land or property to be used in a manner that deviates from normally accepted uses allowed by zoning. This process grants discretionary ability to the Planning Commission through specific findings to condition an approval to ensure that a special use does not disrupt the zoning scheme.

recordTypes.name: Wastewater Treatment Facility
recordTypes.description: The Department of Planning and Development performs staff support functions for both the County and the PACOG in their respective roles of lead management agency and lead planning agency as the designated 208 Water Quality Authority.  This application functions as the submittal portal for CDPHE Water Quality applications requiring approval by PACOG.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use Permit
recordTypes.description: The Temporary Use Permit procedure is intended to provide a mechanism for enforcement of the temporary use regulations in §17.03.050 in order to allow short-term and minor deviations for uses that are temporary in nature, that will not adversely impact surrounding properties, and that can be terminated and removed at will.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Authorization for Non-Permitted Structures
recordTypes.description:
A Zoning Authorization for a non-permitted structure focuses on zoning requirements such as allowed use, setbacks, height, and lot coverage to ensure the structure fits within the property’s zoning district.

This authorization is often needed for record-keeping, property transactions, or to address questions about an existing structure. It does not replace a building permit and does not approve construction that otherwise requires one.

**Common examples include:**

* Fences under 7'
* Agricultural or farm structures

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Complaint
recordTypes.description: A complaint form provides information from the public to the Pueblo County Land Use Inspector relating to potential zoning code violations.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Review
recordTypes.description: Zoning Compliance Reviews are administrative written responses to requests regarding a specific proposed use of a property or structure.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Review - Hemp
recordTypes.description: The zoning compliance review - hemp process is an administrative process followed to ensure all hemp establishments are in compliance with the applicable provisions of the Pueblo County Code.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Review - Marijuana
recordTypes.description: The zoning compliance review - marijuana process is an administrative process followed to ensure all marijuana establishments are in compliance with the applicable provisions of the Pueblo County Code.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Variance
recordTypes.description: A Request to hear and decide appeals for a variance from the strict application of the of the Pueblo County Code.

recordTypes.name: 1041 Permit Areas and Activities of State and Local Interest
recordTypes.description: The Colorado General Assembly enacted measures to further define the authority of state and local governments in making planning decisions for matters of statewide interest. These powers are commonly referred to as "1041 powers". The general intention of these powers is to allow for local governments to maintain their control over certain development projects even where the development project has statewide impacts.

recordTypes.name: 1041 Permit Areas and Activities of State and Local Interest - Amendment
recordTypes.description: The Colorado General Assembly enacted measures to further define the authority of state and local governments in making planning decisions for matters of statewide interest. These powers are commonly referred to as "1041 powers". The general intention of these powers is to allow for local governments to maintain their control over certain development projects even where the development project has statewide impacts.

recordTypes.name: 1041 Permit FONSI Application
recordTypes.description: The 1041 FONSI is established to provide an administrative approval process for those projects that require a 1041 permit with no mitigation.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Construction & Excavation Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for any & all construction or excavation activities occurring in the public right-of-way and/or city utility easements.  Permits must be submitted at least 48 hours prior to the start date of the permit.  Permits that are submitted with less than 48 hours notice may not be processed by the planned start date.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Quality Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A City Stormwater Quality Permit is required when construction activities disturb between 1 and 5 acres of land, in a sensitive area, in close proximity to a stream/river, or steep slopes.

recordTypes.name: Onsite Grading and Excavation Permit
recordTypes.description: Onsite Excavation & Grading Permits are required for significant over-lot grading projects and for projects undertaking the installation of subdivision utility or infrastructure improvements which  excavates or imports 10 cubic-yards of material or more.

recordTypes.name: Alteration Certificate
recordTypes.description: For alterations to structures that are located in the Historic Overlay Districts of Third Avenue and Downtown Main Avenue. This includes changes to paint color, reroofs, solar, window alterations, additions, remodels or new construction, or demolition.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - General
recordTypes.description: A building permit must be obtained prior to the start of any work or ground disturbance within City limits.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - General TEST
recordTypes.description: A building permit must be obtained prior to the start of any work or ground disturbance within City limits.

recordTypes.name: Change of Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application for a change of use of a building or land to another use of a building or land. No vacant land shall be used or occupied and no building shall be occupied or used until a change of use (which includes, but is not limited to, a conditional use permit, a limited use permit, or special use permit), building permit or other appropriate permit has been issued.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Construction & Excavation Permit TEST
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for any & all construction or excavation activities occurring in the public right-of-way and/or city utility easements.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Demolition

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a Conditional Use Permit (CUP).

recordTypes.name: Report a Concern
recordTypes.description: Report a concern regarding the following: Signage, Lighting, Noise, Fence/Property line dispute, Storage, Land Use related, Building/Construction related, Engineering/Streets related

recordTypes.name: Bistro Table Permit Renewal - Annual Fee Payment
Design Review Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request approval for any exterior modifications or site plan changes to a commercial. If applying for a building permit for a multi-family development, Design Review approval will be required.

recordTypes.name: Retaining Wall Permit
recordTypes.description: A Retaining Wall Permit is required prior to construction of any retaining wall 30 inches in height or greater. If the wall design is submitted concurrently with a building permit or a site plan review, a separate permit is not needed.

recordTypes.name: Easement Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request dedication of an easement from the City of Durango, or to initiate an easement dedication to the City of Durango.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Manufactured/Mobile Home Final Inspection
recordTypes.description: A final inspection must be obtained prior occupying any manufactured/mobile home structure within City limits.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Mechanical only
recordTypes.description:
The addition, replacement, or repair of mechanical systems requires a mechanical permit.  
For Gas line or plumbing please seek a permit from the state at https://dpo.colorado.gov/Plumbing.

recordTypes.name: Revocable Permit for Use of the Public Right-of-Way, Short-term
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for any use or obstruction occurring in the public right-of-way and/or city utility easements.  Permits must be submitted at least 2 business days prior to the start date of the permit.  Permits that are submitted with less than 2 business days notice may not be processed by the planned start date.

recordTypes.name: Report a Concern TEST
recordTypes.description: Report a concern regarding the following: Signage, Lighting, Noise, Fence/Property line dispute, Storage, Land Use related, Building/Construction related, Engineering/Streets related

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit TEST
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a Limited Use Permit (SUP).

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Special Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Home Occupation is the use of a residence for a commercial use, aka Business Use of a Home per LUDC 2-3-2-4. The commercial use shall be accessory or secondary to the primary residential use of the property.

recordTypes.name: Land Use Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application for: Subdivisions/replat, Site Plan Review, EN Alternative Compliance, Annexation, Comprehensive Plan Amendment, Planned Development, Variance, Rezoning, Telecommunications.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Roofing only
recordTypes.description: The addition, replacement, or repair of roofing materials require roofing permit.

recordTypes.name: Limited Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a general Limited Use Permit (LUP), Vacation Rental LUP, and LUP for an ADU.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - If located in the County (on City Services)

recordTypes.name: Pre-Application Meeting Request
recordTypes.description: A Pre-Application meeting is an opportunity for an applicant to get preliminary feedback on a project proposal.

recordTypes.name: Service Area/ICA
recordTypes.description: Use this application for Implied Consent Agreements (ICA), Joint Planning Area (JPA) reviews, Intergovernmental reviews, etc.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application type to apply for standard sign permits, alternative compliance sign permits, Master Sign Programs, and Master Sign Program amendments.

recordTypes.name: Signage or Minor Uses in Right-of-Way Revocable Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Signs, awnings, or sculptures that are in street/road right of way that are not on private property. These are known as minor encroachments in the ROW. There is a separate permitting process for major encroachments such as structures.

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this application to apply for a Special Use Permit (SUP). 

Please DO NOT use this application for a Home Occupation Special Use Permit. You can find the specific application form for the Home Occupation Special Use Permit above in this list.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application for temporary special events, temporary commercial sales, temporary buildings and construction uses, or temporary storage containers and dumpsters.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request a Zoning Verification letter.

recordTypes.name: Special Activities Permit Application DRAFT
recordTypes.description: The Special Activities Permit Request is for use by event organizers seeking the use of Public Right of Way on city streets, parks and open space. Permit Requests must be completed no less than 45 days from event.

recordTypes.name: Hot Work Permit
recordTypes.description: For the use of welding, grinding, torching, open flame, braising, cutting, soldering, thawing pipe, chemical welding, or torch applied roofing. Hot work permits are only valid during business hours of the Fire Marshal's Office M-F 8:00AM to 4:30PM. They are valid from the date of issuance and until Friday at 4:30PM during the same week of issuance, unless special permission is given by the Fire Marshal.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Department of Public Works permit for all Roadway Excavation and Curb Cuts for Sidewalks and Driveways.

recordTypes.name: Tree Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for Removal, Pruning or Planting Trees or Shrubs located within the limits of a Public Road or Grounds. After submission, please allow for 48-72 hours for determination.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Notification
recordTypes.description:
A completed Special Event Application is required for public events that are held on Town of New Milford property or buildings. The purpose of this permit is to:
•Ensure the health and safety of the public.
•Minimize the legal and financial risks of the event organizer and the Town.
•Protect public property from misuse and potential damage.
•Ensure that State and Local laws, ordinances, and Fire Safety and Prevention codes are enforced.
Final submission of this application must be given to the New Milford Fire Marshal’s Office. This form must be completed in its entirety.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Site Plan Application/Site Plan Modification Application/Special Permit & Site Plan Application
recordTypes.description: This application is to be used for projects that require Site Plan, Site Plan Modification or Special Permit & Site Plan approval by the Zoning Commission.  In order for an online application to be considered complete and formally accepted, the appropriate application fee must be paid and hard copies of any site plans/surveys/plan sets (4 FOLDED full sized & 8 reduced -11" x 17"), reports and any other supplemental information and materials that are required and/or attached to the online application must be submitted to the Zoning Office.

recordTypes.name: Schedule A Application
recordTypes.description: A Schedule A application will be required for any type of project that is within 100 feet of a wetlands/watercourse and/or within 200 feet of a river or Candlewood Lake.  This document is designed to assist in determining whether the activity proposed may have a significant impact on wetlands and/or watercourses in the Town of New Milford.  Please complete the entire form, as answers to these questions will be considered as part of the application for approval and may be subject to further verification and public review.  Provide any additional information you believe will be needed to complete the application.  In order for an online application to be considered complete and formally accepted, the appropriate application fee must be paid and twelve (12) full sized (1 original and 11 hard copies) of the site plan/maps and 1 copy of everything else that is required and attached to the online application must be submitted to the Inland Wetlands Office. Copies of the online Schedule A application do not need to be submitted. Please be advised that the Inland Wetlands Commission prefers plans to be 1”=40’ with 2 foot contours.  Plans must be folded. Official maps and application information are located in the Inland Wetlands office.***NOTE: Any information entered in and transferred from ViewPermit prior to 3/1/2020 can be located under the Conservation section of ViewCloud. ***

recordTypes.name: Schedule B Application
recordTypes.description: Any person proposing to carry out a permitted or non-regulated operation or use as listed in sections 4.2 and 4.3 of the Wetland Regulations, shall, prior to commencement of such operation or use, notify the Wetlands Commission about the pendency of the project, and provide the Wetlands Commission with sufficient information to enable it to properly determine whether the proposed operation and use is a permitted or non-regulated use of the wetlands or watercourse.  The Commission shall rule that the proposed operation or use is an “as of right” permitted use, a non-regulated use or operation, or that an individual wetlands permit is required. In order for an online application to be considered complete and formally accepted, the appropriate application fee must be paid and 1 Original hard copies, of all information that is required and/or attached to the online application must be submitted to the Inland Wetlands Office. Official maps and application information are located in the Inland Wetlands office. ***NOTE: Any information entered in and transferred from ViewPermit prior to 3/1/2020 can be located under the Conservation section of ViewCloud. ***

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Variance Application
recordTypes.description: Due to the timeframes for notice of public hearings, outlined in §8-7d of CTGS and referenced in the Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA) Bylaws section IV, Notice of Hearing, COMPLETED applications must be received a minimum of Thirty (30) days PRIOR to a regular meeting date in order to be placed on that meeting agenda.

recordTypes.description: Temporary erection of Tent.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Applications - WestFarm Malls ONLY
recordTypes.description: WestFarms Mall Tenant Improvement Permits

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Applications included but not limited to: UST Removal, Full / Partial Structure Demolition, & In Ground Pool Demolition.

recordTypes.name: Fire Suppression/Sprinkler Permit Application

categories.name: On Line Permit Applications
categories.content:
The Town of Farmington has, as of January 1, 2026, rolled out a newer permit process.

Please select the permit application which best fits your portion of work to be performed.

recordTypes.name: Planning and Zoning Bond Submission
recordTypes.description: This application is only for the purpose of submitting a Planning and Zoning bond or requesting release of a Planning and Zoning Bond.  All other bond submission or release requests should be directed to the appropriate department.

recordTypes.name: Social Services Donations
recordTypes.description: This form is to allow you to donate to different Social Services programs. With so many needy in the town every dollar counts. Thanks you.

recordTypes.name: Submittals
recordTypes.description: Submittal of shop drawings by contractor; review by CEI and Engineer with Town oversight; reporting to contractor of submittal status and, ultimately, approval.

recordTypes.name: Certified Payroll
recordTypes.description: Submission of monthly certified payroll records.  Does not generate an approval report.

recordTypes.name: Materials Certificate
recordTypes.description: To submit materials certificates.

recordTypes.name: Subcontractor Approval
recordTypes.description: The Town of East Hartford, Department of Public Works, Engineering Division is responsible for review and approval of requests to sublet work (also referred to as subcontracting approvals) for the Brewer Street Reconstruction Project.

recordTypes.name: Requests (RFI/RFC)
recordTypes.description: To submit requests for infomation or requests for changes.

recordTypes.name: License Application
recordTypes.description: Licensing with the Department of Public Works, Engineering Division allows the licensed company to apply for a permit to work on Town property (any street, sidewalk or public place).

recordTypes.name: Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Licensed contractors must submit a permit application for authorization to complete work on Town right-of-way or Town properties.  In addition, companies holding a written contract with the Town need to apply for a permit (license not required in this case).  For obstruction type activities, use this form.

recordTypes.name: Planning & Zoning Commission Application
recordTypes.description: This form should be used for applicants seeking approval from the East Hartford Planning & Zoning Commission. Requests for Site Plan, Special Permit, Subdivision, Text Amendments or Zone Changes should all be submitted using this form.

recordTypes.name: EH Public Swimming Pool Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for permit to operate a public swimming pool. Swimming Pool licenses are renewable annually and expire on June 30th.

recordTypes.name: EH Food Establishment Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for an annual foodservice permit for the following establishment types: Restaurant, Grocery/Convenience Store, Deli, and Caterer.  Please include as much information as possible including uploading menus, floor plans/diagrams, CFPM certificates, etc. as applicable.

recordTypes.name: Road Obstruction Application
recordTypes.description: Individuals and companies can apply for obstructions of the Town right-of-way or Town properties.  This is typically a dumpster that has to be placed in the ROW for home improvement or cleanup.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Widening/Expansion Request
recordTypes.description: If a driveway replacement will expand (lengthen or widen) the driveway, review by the Engineering Division and the Zoning Enforcement Officer is required.  There is no fee for this review.  Owners can submit an application before they retain a contractor.  Alternately, contractors can submit on behalf of the owner.  This review is required even in cases where the expanded driveway will be entirely located on private property (not in the Town's right-of-way).

recordTypes.name: EH Itinerant Food Vendor Application
recordTypes.description:
Use this form to apply for Food Truck/Itinerant Food Vending Establishment (IFVE) permits.  This is an application for an Itinerant Food Service Permit ONLY and does not eliminate the need 
for other approvals needed within the communities where you prepare and serve food.   Menus must be provided along with this application and fee.
 Arrangements for inspection of all vehicles must be made with the Health Department prior to the issuance of any License or Permit to serve food. Each vehicle must be inspected and must have its own Permit:  you must submit a separate application and fee for each vehicle.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to perform any construction such as new buildings, additions and alterations.

recordTypes.name: EH Temporary Food Vendor Application
recordTypes.description:
Use this form to apply for a Temporary Food Service Permit.  

Menus must be provided along with this application and fee.

CT Public Health Code Section 19-13-B42(a)(14) states: "Temporary food service establishment" means a food service establishment that operates at a fixed location for a temporary period of time, not to exceed two (2) weeks, in connection with a carnival, circus, public exhibition, festival, celebration, or similar transitory gathering.

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands Application
recordTypes.description: This permit should be utilized for all activity requiring Inland Wetlands Commission approval and Inland Wetlands Agent approval. This application may also be utilized to apply for a Declaratory Ruling for 'By-Right' Activities.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for Permanent Sign Approval prior to a Building or Electrical Permit. Temporary Signs such as banners or A-Frame Signs should be applied for using the Temporary Sign Permit in the Building and Inspections Department.

recordTypes.name: Roofing, Windows, and Siding Permit - Residential 1&2 Family
recordTypes.description: Application to perform roofing, windows and siding and facade work for one- and two-family dwellings or their accessory buildings (IRC structures).

recordTypes.name: EH Itinerant Food Vendor Reciprocal License Application
recordTypes.description:
To be filled out by itinerant food vending establishments wishing to participate in the reciprocity program. 
 See this link for information regarding license reciprocity to determine if you are eligible: 

https://portal.ct.gov/DPH/Food-Protection-Program/Itinerant-Food-Vendors

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to perform any demolition of structures.  Please submit your letter of intent to demolish as soon as possible as this will start the 60 day waiting period for structures older than 50 years of age.

recordTypes.name: Solar - Residential 1&2 Family (and SolarAPP+)
recordTypes.description: This Permit should be utilized for all 1 & 2 Family Residential Solar Applications. Contractors may use this application for all solar applications including those made through SolarApp+ for any 1 &2 family residential (IRC) structures as well.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Permit for separate activities regulated by the Zoning Regulations which do not require a Building Permit such as construction of small accessory structures such as sheds, commercial tenant fit-ups or changes of use, work within the flood Hazard Zone and excavation or addition of earth, sand, stone, soil any other earth products onto a property.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Letter
recordTypes.description: A request for Zoning Compliance Letter may require the property owner to schedule a Zoning Compliance Inspection of the property. Requests will be processed in a timely manner, but may take 1-3 weeks to inspect and review.

recordTypes.name: Portable Sign and Temporary Signs
recordTypes.description: Permit for Portable and Temporary Business Signs such as A-Frames Signs and Banners.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA)
recordTypes.description: Applications for Zoning Board of Appeals including Variances of the Zoning Regulations and Appeals of the Zoning Enforcement Officer.

recordTypes.name: PM - Rental Dwelling Inspection
recordTypes.description: Inspections of rental dwelling units as required by EH Property Maintenance Code section 104.7. These inspections must be requested by the owner when a tenant moves out and before a new tenant moves in.
