recordTypes.name: DATA ORDER
recordTypes.description: The Freedom of Information Act allows access to building department records or reports that already exist upon request.  It does not give automatic access to answers to specified questions.  Some data sets are so large or the requestor has a specific set of parameters for data that they are looking for:  These types of requests are loaded onto a USB drive and mailed to the requestor.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for all residential and commercial construction in accordance with the Connecticut State Building Code.    Including but not limited to:  roofing, siding, windows, wood burning stoves/inserts, additions, pools, decks, signs and accessory buildings as required by law.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: CGS Chapter 541 State Demolition Code Sections 29-401 thru 415

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: An electrical permit is required for new, remodel, and maintenance electrical work.

recordTypes.name: Fuel Tank(s)
recordTypes.description: A Fuel tank Permit is required for all work involving the installation, replacement and/or removal of fuel tanks.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical permit
recordTypes.description: A Mechanical Permit is required for all working involving , heating, ventilating, air conditioning equipment installation, alteration, repair, and/or replacement.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: A Plumbing Permit is required for all work involving plumbing, gas or drainage piping, fixture or water heating equipment, water treatment equipment installation, alteration, repair, and/or replacement. Also included is work associated with the installation alteration and or repair to Fire Sprinkler Systems.

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer Connection
recordTypes.description: An inspection of sewer venting must be approved by a building inspector prior to connection to the lateral..  A Sanitary Sewer Connection permit is required for all work involving the installation, alteration, repair, and/or replacement of all connections made to town Sanitary Sewer Systems.

categories.name: Building Department
categories.content:
*** DURING THIS BUSY SEASON, PLEASE PLAN AHEAD AND ALLOW A LEAD TIME OF 10-14 BUSINESS DAYS FOR TOWN INSPECTIONS. 

***PLEASE FOLLOW GUIDELINES WITHIN CHAPTER 33 IBC (SAFEGUARDS DURING CONSTRUCTION) WHEN POTENTALY CREATING A HAZARD DURING CONSTRUCTION.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit
recordTypes.description: Any excavation in the City Right of Way requires a permit. The contractor must have a current Acord Certificate of Insurance, current Permit Bond ($5000.00) and a $1000.00 security deposit on file with the Engineering office before a permit will be issued. NO PERMITS WILL BE PROCESSED WITHOUT A VALID CALL BEFORE YOU DIG

recordTypes.name: Bulky Waste Request
recordTypes.description:
ONLY USE THIS FORM FOR THE 3RD OR MORE REQUEST
Residential Bulky Waste Pick Up Request

recordTypes.name: PRE-APPLICATION ENGINEERING REVIEW
recordTypes.description: SUBMISSION FOR ENGINEER PRE-APPLICATION APPROVAL FOR PROJECTS

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer Discharge Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
THIS IS NOT A PERMIT  
Applications expire one year from the date of review decision.

This Application is for Sanitary Sewer Uses Only. Storm water is covered under a separate application.

(Examples: New Building, new connection/going from septic to sewer, addition/renovation of building,
change of Use, repair, relocation, replacement, cap/demolish, reconnection, etc.)

recordTypes.name: FOG Permit Application Form
recordTypes.description: Fats, Oils and Grease Discharge Permit Application Form

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
A zoning permit issued by the Zoning Enforcement Officer shall be required before commencing any of the following activities: 
(1) The erection, reconstruction, or structural alteration of any building or structure.
(2) The movement of any building or structure upon or to any lot.
(3) A change of use of land, building or structure.
(4) The rearrangement or alteration of any area used for parking.
(6) Any other uses, restrictions or requirements specified in Torrington Zoning Regulations, specifically but not exclusively section 8.6.3 of the Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Enforcement Officer Decision Appeal
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Enforcement Officer (ZEO) is the municipal official responsible for enforcing zoning regulations, and an appeal is filed when a property owner believes the ZEO has made an error in a decision, requirement, or order related to their property or a zoning matter. The Zoning Board of Appeals then holds a public hearing to review the evidence anew and can either uphold, reverse, or modify the ZEO's decision.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit DRIVEWAY ONLY
recordTypes.description: Any excavation in the City Right of Way requires a permit. The contractor must have a current Acord Certificate of Insurance, and a $1000.00 security deposit on file with the Engineering office before a driveway permit will be issued. NO PERMITS WILL BE PROCESSED WITHOUT A VALID CALL BEFORE YOU DIG

recordTypes.name: Sewer Lateral Permit on Private Property
recordTypes.description:
For sanitary sewer lateral repairs on private property ONLY
A Right of Way permit is required for work in the Right of Way

recordTypes.name: Complaint Form (Land Use Department)
recordTypes.description: File a complaint regarding potential Blight, Zoning, or Inland Wetlands violations.

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands - Permit Application
recordTypes.description: An inland wetlands permit shall be required before conducting a regulated activity within 100' of a watercourse and 75' of wetlands soils.

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands - Jurisdictional Ruling
recordTypes.description: This application is to request the Inland Wetlands Commission rule that the proposed activity is 'as-of-right,' per Section 4 of the Torrington Inland Wetlands Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Utility Right of Way Permit
recordTypes.description: Any excavation in the City Right of Way requires a permit. The contractor must have a current Acord Certificate of Insurance, current Permit Bond ($5000.00) and a $1000.00 security deposit on file with the Engineering office before a permit will be issued. NO PERMITS WILL BE PROCESSED WITHOUT A VALID CALL BEFORE YOU DIG

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration
recordTypes.description: Contractors should complete this registration to have your bond and insurance on file with the Engineering Department before filling out a Street Excavation Permit application.  Do it once and only upload bond and insurance again once your policy term expires!

recordTypes.name: Zoning Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A sign permit issued by the Zoning Enforcement Officer shall be required before the erection or alteration of any sign except as specified in Section 5.15 of the Torrington Zoning Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Portable Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A sign permit issued by the Zoning Enforcement Officer shall be required before the erection or alteration of any sign except as specified in Section 5.15 of the Torrington Zoning Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certificate of Compliance Application
recordTypes.description: A certificate from the Land Use Office attesting to current zoning compliance on a subject property.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Site Plan Application
recordTypes.description: Site Plan approval shall be obtained for the construction, expansion, exterior alteration or change of use of any building or structure. Site plan approval shall also be obtained for the erection of any sign over 32 square feet in size, the alteration or expansion of a parking area, or any change of use of a lot.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster Permit
recordTypes.description: Approval from City Engineer  and a permit is required to place a dumpster/container on a City street Right of Way

recordTypes.name: Zoning Architectural Review Committee Application
recordTypes.description:
The purpose of the Architectural Review Committee is to advise the Planning and Zoning Commission on the physical aspects of the City's environment. Within thirty-five days after being referred to the Committee, the Committee shall review and make written recommendations on:

A.\tall site plans;
B.\tall incentive housing development applications (Section 4.15)
C.\tall changes to facades of non-residential buildings; and
D.\tall signs except:
\t1. \tthose on one, two and three family residential properties; and
\t2. \tthose less than 32 square feet in area.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Subdivision/Resubdivision Application
recordTypes.description: A subdivision approval is required when dividing a parcel of land into three or more lots made subsequent to the adoption of subdivision regulations on February 16, 1956. Subdivision requires a public hearing. Resubdivision is included in subdivision approvals and relates to any change in a map of an approved or recorded subdivision if the change affects any street layout, diminishes the size of a lot and creates a new lot. Please contact the City Planner at 860-489-2221 for a consultation regarding a potential subdivision or resubdivision.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Special Exception Application
recordTypes.description: These Regulations are based upon the division of the City into zoning districts within which the use of land and structures are substantially uniform.  The Commission, however, recognizes that certain uses and situations have unique characteristics.  Because of their uniqueness, the Commission treats these uses and situations as Special Exceptions which allows the Commission to evaluate them on a case by case basis.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Grading Permit Application
Zoning Floodplain Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A floodplain permit permit issued by the Zoning Enforcement Officer shall be required before commencing development activity in the Special Flood Hazard Area (SFHA). The SFHA includes land in the floodplain within a community subject to a one (1) percent or greater chance of flooding in any given year.  See Section 7.2 of the Zoning regulations for further detail.

recordTypes.name: Change of Zoning Map Application
recordTypes.description: The Zoning Map may be amended by the Commission on its own initiative or at the request of an applicant. In addition to the requirements of the Connecticut General Statutes, applicants shall adhere to the requirements of Section 8.7 in the Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Change of Zoning Regulations
recordTypes.description: This application is needed to make a request to the Planning & Zoning Commission to change the official Zoning Regulations. A public hearing will be required.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Variance Application
recordTypes.description: A variance is a request to vary the Zoning Regulations.   In other words, a variance lets you do something with your property that the Zoning Regulations do not allow. The Zoning Board of Appeals hears and decides upon all requests for variances from the zoning regulations. Variances are granted on the basis of “exceptional difficulty or unusual hardship.” A hardship must be related solely either to the property’s unusual shape or topography or to the condition or location of an existing structure.

categories.name: Land Use Department
categories.content:
Welcome to the Town of Newington Planning Department

This portion of the Town's online application portal should be used to submit land use applications in accordance with Newington's Land Use Regulations.

categories.name: Town Manager's Office
categories.content:
Welcome!


Plese use the application below to submit your Temporary Event application to the Town for review. If you have any questions, please contact the Town Manager's Office at 860-665-8510

recordTypes.name: Staff Level- Early Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This Early Plan Review Process is for Special Exceptions, Subdivisions, or Resubdivisions.

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands & Watercourses Agency (IWWA) Permit
recordTypes.description: Inland Wetlands and Watercourses permit application to conduct Regulated Activity

recordTypes.name: Staff Level- Land Use Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for Zoning Permits, Certificates of Zoning Compliance, Minor Site Plans, and Minor Site Plan Modifications.

recordTypes.name: PCD- Tenant Fit-Out
recordTypes.description:
Use this permit type for ALL businesses operating in Commercial Spaces
Applies to:
1. Change of use 
AND/OR 
2. New owner/operator of business

recordTypes.name: IWWA Subdivision/Resubdivision Referral - NO Regulated Activity
recordTypes.description: Subdivision/resubdivision of property containing wetlands where NO Regulated Activities will occur (8-26 referral)

recordTypes.name: Commission Level- Land Use Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for Site Plan Review, Coastal Site Plan Review, Special Exception Zoning Regulation Amendments and Zoning Map Amendments.

recordTypes.name: Commission Level- Subdivision and Resubdivision Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for Subdivision and Resubdivision.

recordTypes.name: IWWA Jurisdictional Ruling Request
recordTypes.description: The Inland Wetlands and Watercourses Agency has the authority to determine whether an activity is “as of right” or a “permitted non-regulated use” as identified in Connecticut General Statute 22a-40

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Variance Application
recordTypes.description: Variance Application in accordance with CGS Section 8-6 and Branford Zoning Regulations 9.13.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Letter Request
recordTypes.description: This is not a permit. This is a letter typically used to disclose the zoning status of a property.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Demolition applications shall be submitted to the building department for approval for the removal or razing of any structure greater than 500 square feet. All demolition operations shall follow the requirements of Connecticut General States 29-401 through 29-415 inclusively including Chapter 129 of the general code of Branford.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: A Electrical permit is selected for any owner or owner's authorized agent who intends to erect, install, enlarge, alter, repair, remove, convert or replace any electrical system, or installation of which is regulated by this code, or to cause any such work to be performed, shall first make application to the building official and obtain the required permit.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: A Plumbing permit is selected for any owner or owner's authorized agent who intends to erect, install, enlarge, alter, repair, remove, convert or replace any gas, plumbing system, or installation of which is regulated by this code, or to cause any such work to be performed, shall first make application to the building official and obtain the required permit.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: A Mechanical permit is selected for any owner or owner's authorized agent who intends to erect, install, enlarge, alter, repair, remove, convert or replace any gas, or mechanical system, or installation of which is regulated by this code, or to cause any such work to be performed, shall first make application to the building official and obtain the required permit.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: A Residential Building Permit shall apply to any owner or owner's authorized agent who intends to construct, enlarge, alter, repair, move, or change the occupancy of a building or structure, or to move a lot line that will affect any existing building or structure, or the installation of which is regulated by this code, or to cause any such work to be performed, shall first make application to the building official and obtain the required permit.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: A Commercial Building Permit shall apply to any owner or owner's authorized agent who intends to construct, enlarge, alter, repair, move, demolish or change the occupancy of a building or structure, or to move a lot line that will affect any existing building or structure or installation of which is regulated by this code, or to cause any such work to be performed, shall first make application to the building official and obtain the required permit.

categories.name: Engineering
categories.content: For Questions on Engineering Permit call 203-315-0606

recordTypes.name: Accessory Apartment Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this application to obtain or renew an Accessory Apartment zoning certificate in accordance with Section 24 of the Madison Zoning Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Planning & Zoning Commission Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for any submission to the Planning & Zoning Commission including Site Plan, Special Exception, Village District, Subdivision, Re-Subdivision, Text Amendment, and Zone Boundary Change.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for Variances, Substitution of non-conforming uses, Modifications of Variances, and Appeals of ZEO's Decision

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands and Watercourses Agency Application (IWWA)
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for any regulated activities within a wetland or watercourse and the 100ft upland review area. This includes as of right determinations, non-regulated determinations, timber harvests, and text and boundary amendments.

recordTypes.name: Open Burn Permit
recordTypes.description: Burn Permits can be filled out prior to coming to the office to obtain a signature. Once permit is completed and the fee paid an inspection of the burn site will be conducted, from that day the permit will be good for fourteen (14 days). Once a permit issued the home owner MUST call (203) 245-2772 option "0" to obtain approval to burn for the day. Burning hours are from 10 AM - 5 PM on a clear day with AQI below 75 and fire danger moderate or low. Burn permits are required to be requested at least 7 days before date of issue.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this permit application for home occupations, temporary and permanent signage, and small accessory structures under 200 sq.ft.

categories.name: Inspectional Services
categories.content:
Welcome to our Online Permitting System.


In an effort to streamline the Town of Madison’s permitting process, the building permit has changed effective October 1, 2025. What’s changed? The permit types have been changed to be less confusing. Depending on your choice of permit type, additional fields will appear requiring more information. Below is a list for your reference.

categories.name: Land Use
categories.content:
Welcome to the Madison Land Use Department's Online Portal. All Planning & Zoning, Inland Wetlands, Zoning Board of Appeals, Historic District Commission, and Administrative Zoning Permit applications can be found here. 


If you have questions or need assistance using this system, please contact the Land Use Department at 203-245-5631 or

categories.name: Health
categories.content:
“In an effort to streamline the Town of Madison’s permitting process, effective February 6, 2023 you will no longer need to fill out separate permit applications for each department unless it is specific to that department.

When applying for new construction, additions, renovations, etc. you only need to make one application for permit. The application will be routed to the necessary departments internally (i.e. Zoning, Health, Flood, Building, etc.). In special circumstance

recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description: This is for the annual Dog License. Call 860-738-6963 with questions. Dog Licenses expire on June 30th. Late renewals will have a penalty of $1 per month starting July 1st.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit (No Trades)
recordTypes.description:
Please be aware that as of January 1, 2026 this permit is for construction only, NOT trade permits. Please apply separately for Electrical, Mechanical, and Plumbing Permits.  

If you are applying for Solar Installation, the following applications are required: Zoning Permit, Building Permit, and Electrical Permit. 

Refunds for cancelled permits will be give within 6 months, minus 25% plus State Fees.

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands and Watercourses Commission Application
recordTypes.description: ANY WETLANDS APPLICATION MUST INCLUDE 10 PAPER COPIES INCLUDING A FULL SIZE SITE PLAN OF ALL DOCUMENTATION, WHICH SHALL BE DELIVERED TO TOWN HALL NO LATER THAN THE THURSDAY AT NOON BEFORE THE NEXT UPCOMING MEETING IN ORDER TO PROCEED WITH THE APPLICATION. IF YOUR PROJECT REQUIRES A PUBLIC HEARING THERE WILL PROVIDED A SIGN PROVIDED FOR YOU TO LOCATE ON SITE. THERE WILL BE A $25.00 REFUNDABLE DEPOSIT.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this application for all electrical work including electrical work associated with new or re-construction.

Solar installations require a Building Permit AND an Electrical Permit.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit (HVAC & Associated work)
recordTypes.description: This permit is for HVAC and associated work. If there is associated electrical Work, an Electrical permit is required. If there is associated plumbing work, a Plumbing Permit is required.

recordTypes.name: Wetland As-of-Right Determination
recordTypes.description: Use this application when requesting an as-of-right determination for maintenance or other permitted activities within a regulated area.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit for al plumbing work.

recordTypes.name: Planning and Zoning Commission Application for Development
recordTypes.description: ANY APPLICATION FOR DEVELOPMENT MUST INCLUDE 9 PAPER COPIES OF ALL DOCUMENTATION, WHICH SHALL BE DELIVERED TO TOWN HALL NO LATER THAN THE THURSDAY AT NOON BEFORE THE NEXT UPCOMING MEETING IN ORDER TO PROCEED WITH THE APPLICATION. PLEASE NOTE ANY PUBLIC HEARINGS REQUIRE A SIGN TO BE POSTED ON SITE. A SIGN WILL BE PROVIDED TO YOU WITH A $25.00 DEPOSIT.

recordTypes.name: ZBA Special Exception Application
recordTypes.description: ANY ZBA SPECIAL EXCEPTION APPLICATION MUST INCLUDE 8 PAPER COPIES OF ALL DOCUMENTATION, WHICH SHALL BE DELIVERED TO TOWN HALL NO LATER THAN 18 DAYS BEFORE THE NEXT UPCOMING MEETING IN ORDER TO PROCEED WITH THE APPLICATION. PLEASE NOTE ANY PUBLIC HEARINGS REQUIRE A SIGN TO BE POSTED ON SITE. A SIGN WILL BE PROVIDED TO YOU WITH A $25.00 DEPOSIT.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Please contact the Land Use Office 860-738-6593  with your proposed project to verify you are using the correct Zoning Application.

recordTypes.name: ZBA Variance Application
recordTypes.description: PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT ANY APPLICATION FOR A VARIANCE MUST INCLUDE 8 PAPER COPIES OF ALL DOCUMENTATION, WHICH SHALL BE DELIVERED TO TOWN HALL NO LATER THAN 18 DAYS PRIOR TO THE NEXT UPCOMING MEETING IN ORDER TO PROCEED WITH THE APPLICATION. PLEASE NOTE ANY PUBLIC HEARINGS REQUIRE A SIGN TO BE POSTED ON SITE. A SIGN WILL BE PROVIDED TO YOU WITH A $25.00 DEPOSIT.

categories.name: Land Use Department

recordTypes.name: General Instructions for Obtaining a Zoning and Building Permit Electronically
recordTypes.description: Find out how to submit an application.

recordTypes.name: Cosmetology/Salon Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This application is required for any new establishment seeking to operate as a salon, barbershop, nail salon, esthetics studio, or other personal services business.

recordTypes.name: Food Truck/Itinerant Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: This is where you apply if you have a food truck or other mobile food unit and are seeking a food license.

recordTypes.name: FM Annual Operating Permit or License Inspection
recordTypes.description: This License Inspection and/or Operating Permit is required as per Town Ordinance and is issued to facilities such as licensed; daycare, liquor permit establishments, rooming houses, and healthcare facilities, etc. as defined in the Ordinance.  Typically these Permits are issued and are valid for one year only, and may in some case be in addition to any required State of Connecticut permit that may apply to the business use.

recordTypes.name: Annual Food Service Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for an annual food service permit.

recordTypes.name: FM Blasting Permit
recordTypes.description:
Blaster must come to office to obtain a blasting permit. Please bring proof of insurance and explosives license. There is a fee of $60.00 set by C.G.S. 

Prior to issuance of Blasting Permit; Proof of notification of blasting to all property owners within 100 feet of the property where blasting will occur shall be provided in writing to the Fire Marshal's Office.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is designated for residential and commercial projects. It includes both Building and Zoning applications.

recordTypes.name: Annual Cosmetology/Salon Permit
recordTypes.description: All cosmetology establishments operating in the Town of Darien are required to complete this application to obtain or renew their annual permit.

recordTypes.name: Planning & Zoning Commission Application: For Change of Zoning Regulations and/or Change of Zoning Map Only
FM Bonfire Permit
recordTypes.description: This Permit is required for any "open campfire" as defined by Town Ordinance.  These Permits are invalid if State Fire Danger Ratings reach "HIGH" or above, even after issuance of said Permit.   PLEASE NOTE for SINGLE USE PERMIT, do not apply for a permit more than five (5) days prior to the start date requested.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit for: Temporary Service, Generator, Electric Service new or upgrade, and all other electrical permit applications.

recordTypes.name: FM Commercial Fireworks Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any vendor, temporary or permanent, that will be selling consumer fireworks in the Town of Darien.

recordTypes.name: Addition, Reconstruction, Pool, or Detached Building
recordTypes.description: This application is required for additions, reconstructions, detached buildings, and pools. Before any addition, pool, or new structure can be approved, the property must demonstrate a suitable area for the repair or replacement of the septic system.

recordTypes.name: Food Service Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This application is required for all new food service establishments as well as for renovations to existing food service facilities.

recordTypes.name: FM Commercial Fuel Storage Tank Installation Permit
recordTypes.description: This Permit is required for the installation of any fuel storage tank(s) for all commercial and multi-family (3 or more units) properties in the Town of Darien.  FOR SINGLE FAMILY RESIDENTIAL PROPERTY INSTALLS USE BUILDING DEPARTMENT PERMIT APPLICATION.

recordTypes.name: HVAC Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit application for gas lines, propane and oil tanks as well as other HVAC work.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This application is designated for residential and commercial demolition projects.

recordTypes.name: FM Commercial Tank PIPING ONLY Installation Permit
recordTypes.description: This Permit is required for the PIPING INSTALLATION of any fuel storage tank(s) for all commercial and multi-family (3 or more units) properties in the Town of Darien.  FOR SINGLE FAMILY RESIDENTIAL PROPERTY INSTALLS USE BUILDING DEPARTMENT PERMIT APPLICATION.

recordTypes.name: Demolition
recordTypes.description: This application is required to be completed before the demolition of any structure.

recordTypes.name: FM Fire & Police Alarm Registration Application
recordTypes.description: This application is required for any fire and police alarm system located within the Town of Darien as defined by Town Ordinance.  The Town of Darien requires a one-time registration of alarm systems, however updated information or relocation to a new address also requires a new application for registration.

recordTypes.name: Septic Tank Abandonment
recordTypes.description:
This form must to be completed prior to pumping and crushing/filling an existing tank and drywells. 
Note: only needed when connecting to public sewer!

recordTypes.name: FM Fire Alarm Installation/ Renovation/ Modification
recordTypes.description: Review of plans for construction, renovation or changes of a fire alarm system in a commercial or multi-family occupancy.  You will be required to secure a separate Electrical Permit from the Building Department for this type of work.

recordTypes.name: Septic Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Please select this option if you are submitting a plan for a new septic system, B100a, or for the repair of an existing system. Once your plan is approved, a separate Septic Permit to Install must be submitted.

recordTypes.name: FM Fire Sprinkler Installation/ Renovation
recordTypes.description: Review of plans for construction, renovation or changes of fire sprinkler system in a commercial or multi-family 3 units or more occupancy.

recordTypes.name: Septic Permit to Install
recordTypes.description: This application is required to obtain a Permit to Construct a septic system.

recordTypes.name: Soil Test Request Form
recordTypes.description: Application for septic soil testing with the Darien Health Department. Fee is per lot tested. Minimum of 4 deep test holes greater than 5ft deep is required (2 in proposed area and 2 holes down gradient).

recordTypes.name: FM Fuel Storage Tank Removal/Abandon ABOVEGROUND ONLY Permit
recordTypes.description: This Permit is required for the removal of an Aboveground Fuel Storage Tank(s) in the Town of Darien.

recordTypes.name: Well Water Treatment Wastewater (WTW)
recordTypes.description: Please complete this application when planning to install a water treatment wastewater system.

recordTypes.name: FM Fuel Storage Tank Removal/Abandon UNDERGROUND ONLY Permit
recordTypes.description: This Permit is required for the removal or abandonment of any underground fuel storage tank(s) in the Town of Darien.

recordTypes.name: FM Liquified Propane Gas Tank(s) Installation/ Exchange/ Refill Station Permit
recordTypes.description: This Permit is required for the installation of any Liquified Propane Gas fuel storage tank(s) for all commercial and multi-family (3 or more units) properties in the Town of Darien.  FOR SINGLE FAMILY RESIDENTIAL PROPERTY INSTALLS USE BUILDING DEPARTMENT PERMIT APPLICATION.

recordTypes.name: FM Specialty Fire Suppression System Installation/ Renovation - NOT a Type I Exhaust Hood Suppression System
recordTypes.description: Review of plans for construction, renovation or changes to a specialty fire suppression system such as gas station, laboratory, and data room  extinguishing system(s), special hazard fire protection system, etc.  THIS IS NOT FOR REVIEW OF THE ACTUAL EXHAUST HOOD and any hood(s) will require a separate permit under the Type I Kitchen Exhaust Hood review section of this program.

recordTypes.name: FM Type I Kitchen Exhaust Hood Installation
recordTypes.description: Review of plans for construction, renovation or changes of any Type I commercial exhaust hood(s).  NOTE:  Any required fire suppression system for said hood(s) will require a separate permit under the Cooking Fire Suppression System review section of this program.

recordTypes.name: FM Type I Exhaust Hood Fire Suppression System
recordTypes.description: This application is for submittal and review of drawings specifications for fire suppression systems to be installed in Type I kitchen exhaust systems for the protection of commercial cooking appliances.  When making application for review, please attach all pertinent documents, including but not limited to shop drawings and equipment specifications.

recordTypes.name: FM Incident Report Documentation Request
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request copies of Fire Marshal's Office reports and records.

recordTypes.name: FM Tank Closure Report Documentation Request(s)
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request copies of Fire Marshal's Office reports and records.

recordTypes.name: Volunteer Application
recordTypes.description: Join the Town of Willingtown as a volunteer! Complete this application to help with community programs, events, and projects. All skill levels welcome!

recordTypes.name: Town Offices Building Field - Rental Form
recordTypes.description: Reserve the Town Offices Building Fields, home of the Kevin Legare Memorial Baseball and Softball Field, for practices, games, or events. The rental fee is $50 for every 2 hours, payable before use begins.

recordTypes.name: River Road Athletic Complex Park - Rental Form
recordTypes.description:
River Road Athletic Complex has a pavilion, fields, and courts available for rent for your next birthday party or family gathering! 

Reminder: All activities at River Road Athletic Complex are now monitored under 24-hour video surveillance.

recordTypes.name: Universal Registration Form - Individual
recordTypes.description: This is a universal registration form for Willington Parks & Recreation Department programs and events. Please only complete this form if the program or event you are registering for is not listed on this page. A separate form is required for each participant. Submission of this form does not guarantee placement until registration is confirmed by the department.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way/Curb Cut Permit
recordTypes.description: THIS FORM SHOULD BE USED FOR WORK WITHIN THE TOWN RIGHT OF WAY INCLUDING DRIVEWAYS

recordTypes.description: For Online Food Pantry Donations

recordTypes.name: Fuel Bank
recordTypes.description: For Online Fuel Bank Donations

recordTypes.name: Administrative Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this permit application if you are submitting a permit to staff for work related to a single family home, including but not limited to: new house, addition, accessory building, sheds, decks, pools, garages, etc.

recordTypes.name: Planning & Zoning Commission Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this form if you are applying for a Special Permit, Site plan or other approval type which is reviewed by the Willington Planning and Zoning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Adult Basketball
recordTypes.description: The Willington Parks & Recreation Adult Co-Ed Basketball is NOW OPEN for 2025-2026! This year this program is open for individuals over 25 years old. The program will run Sunday nights 7-8:30 PM from November 30, 2025- June 28, 2026. Residents $65. Non-Residents $75.

recordTypes.name: Inland Wetlands and Watercourses Application (IWWC)
recordTypes.description: A permit from IWWC shall be required if the activity is proposed within a regulated area. Applications shall be submitted for the following: As of Right Activities, Agricultural Exemptions, Timber Harvest's and General approval from the IWWC

recordTypes.name: Timber Harvest
recordTypes.description: Please use this application template to submit for approval to conduct a timber harvest in Willington

recordTypes.name: Temporary Outdoor Dining or Display of Merchandise
recordTypes.description: Temp permits allowed per the Governor's Executive Order

recordTypes.name: Hydroponic Herb Garden Class
recordTypes.description: The Willington Parks & Recreation will host a 60-90 min. Home Hydroponics “Bokit” Building class. Participants will gain a general understanding of Hydroponic Farming, its benefits, and the science behind the “Kratky method,” a non-circulating, no-electricity approach ideal for beginners. Participants will create their own Bokit Herb Jar container, plant their seedlings, and leave with instructions on how to set-up and maintain their Bokit at home. All materials, including beginning seedlings and fertilizer will be supplied. February 25, 2026. 6:30-8 PM. $12 each jar

recordTypes.name: Snow Shoe Reservation
recordTypes.description: Reserve snow shoes. Must receive confirmation from Parks and Recreation Department to ensure availability. FREE

recordTypes.name: Buildable Lot or Compliance Review
recordTypes.description: If you are seeking a review and certification of the compliance status of your use and/or property, you can complete this form to request this review by the Town's Land Use Department

recordTypes.description: Apply for a special exception, variance from zoning regulation location approval, or appeal from decision of zoning agent.

recordTypes.name: Boys High School Basketball Registration
recordTypes.description:
2025-2026 High School Basketball

Recreational Basketball features basic skills, dribbling, passing, shooting, good sportsmanship, and fun! All home games and practices are at the Hall Memorial School Gym, or in Ashford (depending on the team). $140 each

All Planning & Zoning, Inland Wetlands, Zoning Board of Appeals and Administrative Zoning Permit applications are submitted via this portal. Paper applications are not accepted.

recordTypes.name: FM UST-AST
recordTypes.description: Underground / Aboveground Storage Tank Installation or Removal Permit - Use this application if you intend to alter, clean, repair, line with a protective coating, remove, abandon, place temporarily out of service, or otherwise dispose of a flammable or combustible liquid tank. Permit Fee: $50 per tank on residential property / $100 per tank on commercial property.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk, Curb and Driveway License
recordTypes.description: Contractors need to obtain Hamden's Sidewalk, Curb and Driveway License, which is valid for one calendar year, in order to work in the Town's Right of Way (sidewalk, driveway apron and curb area)

recordTypes.name: RECORDS
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request records from the Fire Department and/or Fire Marshal.

recordTypes.name: FM Operations and Materials Permit
recordTypes.description: to maintain, store, use, or handle materials; to conduct processes that could produce conditions hazardous to life or property; or to install equipment used in connection with such activities.

recordTypes.name: FM Operating Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request inspections of buildings for licensing requirements. Permit Fees vary from $40-$80 depending on occupancy type.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk/Driveway Permit
recordTypes.description: Sidewalk/Driveway Permits cover work associated with driveway aprons, sidewalks and curbs in the Town’s Right of Way area.

recordTypes.name: Engineering Records and Data Request
recordTypes.description: This application is to obtain any scans and/or photocopies of maps or plans within the Engineering Department. GIS Plots, Shapefiles, Geodatabase or any other Digital Data are also applicable to this application.

recordTypes.name: *BLDG-PZ
recordTypes.description:
Building Permits: Including but not limited to permits for new construction, additions, accessory dwelling units (ADUs), alterations, roofs, decks, siding, garages, gazebos, replacement doors/windows, pools, signs and tents. 

Planning & Zoning Permits: the aforementioned Building Permits, Change of Use, Continuation of Use have been integrated  with P&Z processes to provide more efficient service and seamless communication between departments, contractors, and our residents.

recordTypes.name: Excavation Permit
recordTypes.description: Excavation Permit allows contractors to work on the following within the Town's Right Of Way: Street Excavation, Storm Drainage Construction, Sanitary Sewer Construction and any construction or sawcut to the asphalt roadway or sidewalk area.

recordTypes.name: Animal Shelter Building/Facility Donations
recordTypes.description: The Animal Shelter Building/Facility fund benefits a new shelter for use by the Town of Hamden.

recordTypes.name: *ELEC
recordTypes.description: Electrical Permits - including low voltage, fire alarm system work. (solar use Solar Permit ONLY)

recordTypes.name: Hamden Food Bank Donations
recordTypes.description: Hamden Food Bank Donations benefits the running of the Hamden Food Bank within our Keefe Community Center.   Your donation helps to alleviate food insecurity for Hamden families by providing shelf-stable non-perishable foods and fresh meal kits when available.

recordTypes.name: Veterans Commission Gift Fund
recordTypes.description: Hamden Veterans Commission Donations benefits the running of the Veterans Commission within our Government Center.  Your donations help us provide Flags for our Veterans graves, Wreaths for our underprivileged at ceremonies, educational supplies for programs in our schools.

recordTypes.name: *PLMB
recordTypes.description: Plumbing Permits - including Fire Sprinklers

recordTypes.name: *MECH
recordTypes.description: Heating & Mechanical Permits - Including HVAC, Piping, Hoods/Ducts, Fire Suppression Systems

recordTypes.name: Commission on Disabilities Gift Fund
recordTypes.description:
The Commission on Disabilities Gift Fund benefits the sponsoring of events for adults over 18 and families with a person with a disability, which include:

Quinnipiac University sporting events & Hartford Yard Goats games.

The commission also checks on and handles incidents of ADA compliance.

recordTypes.name: Community Services Gift Fund
recordTypes.description: The Community Services Gift Fund benefits the Hamden Food Bank,  the Diaper Bank,  and other social services needs for members of our community.

recordTypes.name: DEMO
recordTypes.description: Demolition Permit - to completely demolish a structure

recordTypes.name: Chimney Liner

recordTypes.name: Hamden Tree Fund
recordTypes.description: The Hamden Tree fund benefits to help purchase, plant, and maintain trees in our Town.

recordTypes.description: Your donation will enhance the quality of activities, refreshments, and performers that are provided, ensuring that Earth Day is shared with as many community members as possible.

recordTypes.description: SOLAR PERMITS for residential and commercial properties.

recordTypes.name: Change of Use/Occupancy Permit
recordTypes.description: A Change or Use or Occupancy Permit is necessary when a building's use or occupancy classification is altered. This can include various scenarios, such as converting a residential property into a commercial space or changing the type of business operating within a building. The Florida Building Code mandates that any change in occupancy must comply with the current edition of the Florida Building Code (FBC) and Zoning Regulations.

recordTypes.description:
A minor development plan is one which is:
1. A single-family, multi-family or duplex residential project of between three and 35 units, inclusive.
2. A non-residential development under 50,000 square feet in area.
3. A mixed-use development under 50,000 square feet in area.
4. A public or private institutional development less than one acre in land area.
5. Commercial tenant finishes (i.e. interior/exterior tenant buildout improvements)
6. Right-of-way dedication.

recordTypes.description:
IMPORTANT LICENSING UPDATE - EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025
Effective July 1, 2025, the City of Stuart will no longer accept Certificate of Competency as a valid form of licensure for contractors.  Under Florida Statute 489.117, all contractors (as defined in FS 489.105(3)(a)-(o) must be State Registered or State Certified to operate legally in Florida.
If you're currently using Certificate of Competency issued by Martin County to perform/contract work, you will need to take action to comply with state requirements.

recordTypes.name: East Stuart Code Conditional Use Application
recordTypes.description: A major conditional use approval is a specific authorization granted by the city commission to permit certain uses of property, which are unique due to the nature of the use, size, location, or various characteristics particular to the zoning district. The issuance of a major conditional use approval is required for the use or occupancy of a structure specifically designated as a conditional use in the "zone district" chapter of this Code and is subject to the limitations and conditions specified therein. A major conditional use approval application may not be filed if the city commission has denied an application for a conditional use for the subject property within the previous two years.

recordTypes.description:
A pre-application meeting is mandatory for all applicants intending to submit a development proposal. It is a forum in which the applicant and the review staff can discuss issues related to the project concept.

The purpose of the application should be to communicate to the reviewing staff, the decision-makers, and the public what is being proposed and how the proposal meets and complies with the City’s Comprehensive Plan and the Land Development Code.

recordTypes.name: Executive Development Order - State of Emergency
recordTypes.description: The declaration of a state of emergency issued by the Governor for a natural emergency tolls the period remaining to exercise the rights under a permit or other authorization for the duration of the emergency declaration. Further, the emergency declaration extends the period remaining to exercise the rights under a permit or other authorization for 24 months in addition to the tolled period.

The grant funding request shall be made using this application form. The grant application form must be accompanied by all of the required information as set forth in the application form. The City  shall review the grant funding application for completeness. If the application is determined to be incomplete, the City  shall reject the grant funding application and notify the applicant of such rejection, and the reasons therefore, within 15 working days.

recordTypes.name: Existing Building Recertification
recordTypes.description:
All buildings, except single-family residences, duplexes and minor structures, shall be recertified where such buildings or structures have been in existence for seventeen (17) years or longer, as determined by the Building Official, who shall at such time issue a Notice of Required Inspection to the building owner.

The owner of a building or structure subject to recertification shall furnish, or cause to be furnished, within ninety (90) days of Notice of Required Inspection, a written report to the Building Official, prepared by a Professional Engineer or Architect registered in the State of Florida, certifying that each such building or structure is structurally and electrically safe, or has been made structurally and electrically safe for the specified use for continued occupancy.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use
recordTypes.description: Conditional uses are uses which, because of their character, size and potential impacts, may or may not be appropriate in particular zoning districts.  Review is based primarily on compatibility of the use with its proposed location and with surrounding land uses and on the basis of all zoning, subdivision and other ordinances applicable to the proposed location and zoning district.

recordTypes.name: Special Inspector Registration
recordTypes.description:
Special inspectors must be registered with the City of Marathon prior to performing inspections on permit applications that require specialty inspections, such as recertification inspections of existing buildings. 

Recertification inspections may only be performed by licensed, qualified professionals who have submitted written proof, accepted by the Building Official, of experience in the recertification of multiple story buildings.

Any person authorized to act on behalf of a property owner with a vacation rental property license shall obtain and maintain a vacation rental agent license.   Also any person managing their own property shall obtain and maintain a vacation rental agent license.  

ATTENTION: Owner or local contact does not have to pay the $500.00 Agent fee if you are managing your own property.  It is going to say that a payment is due, but it will show a $0.00 balance, and we will manually waive it once we process the application.

The renting of any private residence for a period of less than seven (7) nights is prohibited.  License shall be renewed annually.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use
recordTypes.description:
Temporary uses include, but are not limited to, erection of temporary structures such as fences, booths, tents, or parking of trailers for activities such as carnivals, circuses, fairs, religious meetings, temporary outdoor displays and/or sale of art objects or other items and other similar activities conducted either outdoors or within temporary structures. A temporary use is a land use established for a period of time not to exceed thirty (30) days in a calendar year and does not require permanent site improvements. The actual use embodied by a temporary use permit must be a permitted use in the zoning district in which it is proposed to be located. The temporary use permit may be allowed subject to conditions required by the Zoning Administrator so long as the Zoning Administrator determines that granting the temporary use permit will not harm the public interest if the required conditions are complied with. 

TEMPORARY USE PERMIT REVIEW PROCESS AND CRITERIA 
A temporary use may be approved, approved with modifications or denied by the administrator.  In consideration of the request, the administrator shall consider the following: 
1.  That the permit for the proposed temporary use would be consistent with the general intent of the zoning ordinance and comprehensive plan and would be permitted within the zoning district wherein located.
2.  Granting the permit would not be detrimental to the surrounding neighborhood or to the community in general, would not create a traffic hazard and would not harm the functioning of community facilities or services.

A notice of the administrative review will be provided to abutting property owners, who will have seven days from the date of the mailing to respond with written comments for consideration. 

Written notice of the decision will be provided to the applicant.  A decision may be appealed to the Planning and Zoning Commission in accordance with City procedures.

recordTypes.name: PUD Application
recordTypes.description:
A Planned Unit Development (PUD) is a development process, provided for by ordinance that allows for flexibility in the application of regulations and standards for consideration provided by a developer. (For additional information on this process and requirements please see PFMC 18.20.080) 
Process of Completion and Public Hearing Schedule:
1.  Applications will need to be deemed complete by the Planning Department prior to being scheduled for a public hearing. Once the applicant has been issued a completeness letter from the Planning Department verifying the application is complete, the application will be eligible to be scheduled at the next available Public Hearing.
2.  Each Completeness Review Period, will be reviewed within a 2-week period
3.  There is a 55-day cut-off window for a fully completed application (deemed complete) required, prior to being scheduled for the next available Public Hearing.
Once we have 4 Public Hearings the applicants will be moved to the next month’s Hearing Date.

recordTypes.name: Flood Plain
recordTypes.description:
This is an application for a Floodplain Development Permit.  Certain sections will be completed by you, the applicant, and certain sections will be completed by the local Floodplain Administrator (FPA).

The National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP) provides flood insurance to individuals at much lower premiums than could otherwise be purchased through private insurers, and makes certain federal monies available to local communities.  In order for citizens to be eligible for the national flood insurance rates, or for communities to receive certain kinds of federal monies, the community must agree to meet minimum floodplain standards.  This application is a tool to ensure that the minimum standards are met.

In a participating NFIP community, flood insurance polies can be purchased from any local insurance agent at the national rate.  Even though the policy may be issued as if it were coming from the insurance company you deal with, it is actually a Federal NFIP policy printed on the insurance agency's letterhead.  The rates are determined by the flood risk zone in which you live and by the elevation of the lowest floor of your home, not by the insurance company, and should be the same regardless of which agent or agency sells you the insurance. 

You may buy flood insurance for your own peace of mind, you may be required to buy it before a lending institution will make or refinance a loan, or you may not be buying flood insurance at all.  Whatever the case, if the property which you propose to develop is located within a "Special Flood Hazard Area" on a flood map issued by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), you MUST obtain a Floodplain Development Permit prior to beginning the project.  This is a requirement of the local Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance of your community, and there are penalties for failing to do so.

Floodplain Development Permits are ONLY required for developments in areas designated as "Special Flood Hazard Areas" of FEMA-issued flood maps.  Flood maps can be reviewed at the office of your local FPA, or online at the FEMA website: www.MSC.FEMA.gov.

If you are proposing a development of any kind (constructing a new building, adding on to an existing building, clearing land, placing fill, grading land, mining, dredging, drilling, etc...) in a floodplain, you must submit this application for a Floodplain Development Permit to your local FPA.  Depending upon the type of development you are proposing, additional forms may be required.  For example, all new buildings in a Special Flood Hazard Area require an Elevation Certificate to document that the lowest floor of the building is elevated to a certain height relative to the anticipated flood crest of the "base flood" event.  The Elevation Certificate and other forms are provided in the Attachments section of this application, but should only be completed if they are required by the FPA for the proposed development. 

Typically, the Applicant completes the application form and submits the information to the local FPA.  The FPA reviews the submission and determines whether or not additional information is needed.  If it is, the FPA will request the additional information from the Applicant.  Once all required materials have been submitted, the FPA will make a permitting decision and either issue or deny the requested Floodplain Development Permit.

The Applicant should understand that a Floodplain Development Permit is only a permit to complete the proposed development.  It is a permit to, for example, build a house, construct a baseball field, install a drainage ditch or septic system, or grade a parcel of land.  Before the house can actually be occupied, or the developed land used, a Compliance Certificate must be issued by the local FPA.  The FPA will perform an inspection after the project is completed, or perhaps several inspections throughout the progress of the project, to ensure the development is complaint with the requirements of the local Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance.  Once the Compliance Certificate has been issued, the process has been completed.

recordTypes.name: Zone Change (Map Amendment)
recordTypes.description:
An Amendment of the Zoning Ordinance, including the Official Zoning Map, consists of amending, supplementing, changing or repealing of regulations, restrictions and/or boundaries.

Process of Completion and Public Hearing Schedule:
1.  Applications will need to be deemed complete by the Planning Department prior to being scheduled for a public hearing. Once the applicant has been issued a completeness letter from the Planning Department verifying the application is complete, the application will be eligible to be scheduled at the next available Public Hearing.
2.  Each Completeness Review Period is 2 weeks.
3.  There is a 45-day cut-off window for a fully completed application (deemed complete) required prior to being scheduled for the next available Public Hearing.
Once we have 4 Public Hearings the applicants will be moved to the next month’s Hearing Date.

recordTypes.name: Development Agreement Amendment (Major)
recordTypes.description:
**THE APPLICATION WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED IF THE REQUIRED MATERIALS ARE NOT PROVIDED**
Prior to proceeding with infrastructure improvements, required as part of a Subdivision, Planned Unit Development, or other similar developments, a development agreement between the applicant the City is to be initiated If an applicant requests alterations to the resulting recorded agreement, this application must be submitted for consideration by the City.

recordTypes.name: Appeal
recordTypes.description: Any affected party may appeal a quasi-judicial decision to the City Council by filing a written notice of appeal, along with the required fee, with the City Clerk no more than fourteen (14) days after the date of the written decision. The Clerk will coordinate with the City Attorney and relevant City departments to schedule a de novo hearing, following the same notice and hearing procedures, before the City Council to consider the matter as quickly as the City Council's schedule allows.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Amendment
recordTypes.description:
A Subdivision Amendment is a development process provided for by ordinance that allows for flexibility in the application of regulations and standards for consideration provided by a developer. (For additional information on this process and requirements please see PFMC 17.12.070)

Process of Completion and Public Hearing Schedule:
1.  Applications will need to be deemed complete by the Planning Department prior to being scheduled for a public hearing. Once the applicant has been issued a completeness letter from the Planning Department verifying the application is complete, the application will be eligible to be scheduled at the next available Public Hearing.
2.  Each Completeness Review Period, will be reviewed within a 2-week period.
3.  There is a 45-day cut-off window for a fully completed application (deemed complete) required, prior to being scheduled for the next available Public Hearing.
Once we have 4 Public Hearings the applicants will be moved to the next month’s Hearing Date.

recordTypes.name: Minor Subdivision Application
recordTypes.description:
A Minor Subdivision is a division of a lot, tract or parcel into four or fewer lots, and proposing no new streets, extensions to existing streets, and where infrastructure is in place or available. 
For additional information on this process and requirements, please see PFMC 17 & 17.12.050.

recordTypes.name: Lot Line Adjustment
recordTypes.description:
A Minor Subdivision is a division of a lot, tract or parcel into four or fewer lots, and proposing no new streets, extensions to existing streets, and where infrastructure is in place or available. 
For additional information on this process and requirements, please see PFMC 17 & 17.12.050.

recordTypes.name: Seasonal Outdoor Market
recordTypes.description:
Seasonal outdoor markets are defined as seasonally operated outdoor markets located on publicly or privately owned property, where single or multiple vendors or merchants locate on a common site to sell their products to the general public for more than thirty (30) days but less than one hundred eighty (180) days annually. Outdoor markets wanting to operate less than thirty (30) days annually may be permitted under section 18.20.120 of this title. Outdoor markets wanting to operate more than one hundred eighty (180) days annually are required to meet the same performance standards as all other commercial retail businesses. Vendors allowed in seasonal outdoor markets may include farmers, crafters, fresh food merchants, vendors 
(trinkets, flea market vendors), and prepared food vendors.

recordTypes.name: Seasonal Parking Lot Permit
recordTypes.description:
Seasonal Parking in the Community Commercial Services Zone 18.24.070: Privately owned parcels of at least four (4) acres may be used to provide seasonal parking for recreational activities without complying with the parking standards contained in this Section if the property owner complies with the following requirements:
      1.   The Parking Area must be open to the public without charge.
      2.   The Parking Area may only be open from April 1 through October 31 annually.
      3.   The Parking Area must be located at least twenty-five (25) feet from all property lines.
      4.   Public restrooms and solid waste collection and disposal must be provided and must be located at least twenty-five (25) feet from all property lines.
      5.   The Parking Area must be closed between the hours of ten (10) p.m. and seven (7) a.m.
      6.   Dust abatement must be applied to the Parking Area.
      7.   The site must be maintained in good condition and repair, free from garbage, paper, litter, tall grasses or weeds, and other debris to prevent the Parking Area from becoming unsightly or becoming a fire hazard.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description:
Temporary street or lane closures will require the applicant to obtain a road closure permit through the Engineering Department. (PFMC 10.28.040)

All Special Events must be received at least five (5) days prior to the event.   Parade request must be received at least thirty-five (35) days prior to the event.  Application for the Road/Lane Closure must be received by the Engineering Department a minimum of seventy-two (72) business hours prior to the event.

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit
recordTypes.description:
The purpose of a special use permit is to establish procedures for the review and approval of uses that are not permitted by right in a particular zoning district.  A special use permit is not transferable from one parcel of land to another nor shall it be considered as establishing a binding precedent to grant other special use permits.  Special use permits require a public hearing before the Planning and Zoning Commisssion following appropriate procedures.

Process of Completion and Public Hearing Schedule:
1.  Applications will need to be deemed complete by the Planning Department prior to being scheduled for a public hearing. Once the applicant has been issued a completeness letter from the Planning Department verifying the application is complete, the application will be eligible to be scheduled at the next available Public Hearing.
2.  Each Completeness Review Period is 2 weeks.
3.  There is a 45-day cut-off window for a fully completed application (deemed complete) required prior to being scheduled for the next available Public Hearing.
Once we have 4 Public Hearings the applicants will be moved to the next month’s Hearing Date.

categories.content:

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy
Local Tax Registration Form
recordTypes.description: Local Food and Beverage Tax, Hotel/Motel Tax, Local Motor Fuel Tax

recordTypes.name: Property Owners
recordTypes.description: Property Owners Registration for ease of communication with the City of Decatur regarding issues that arise with their properties.

recordTypes.name: Amusement Device
recordTypes.description: An Amusement Device license is required to operate a device for hire or gain within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Water and Sewer Tapping
recordTypes.description: Application to tap the sewer or water main with a new service.  Legal Description for the property required.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to disturb land greater than 1 acre; or less than 1 acre if part of a larger development, a borrow pit, or adjacent to a body of water.

recordTypes.name: ****Submit Complaint (Rita's Test)
recordTypes.description: To Test Processing a Citizen Code or Weed Complaint

recordTypes.name: Garbage Hauler - Refuse Removal License
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Garbage Hauler Service within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Hotel / Motel License
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Hotel or Motel within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: ****Housing Violation (Rita's Test)
recordTypes.description: Create a new Code Enforcement Case

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit
recordTypes.description: A Right of Way Permit must be obtained when work is to be performed on City property or in Right of Way.  Only those contractors who are licensed and bonded with the City of Decatur are allowed to pull a Right of Way Permit.  Some examples of this type of work include excavation in City owned streets, alleys, boulevards, or properties to make a sewer or water tap, cap, or repair; perform utility work or repair; install a culvert; install a drive approach; or install City sidewalk.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Site Plans must be approved before obtaining construction permits for commercial projects. This application is for site plan review of commercial projects - New construction, alterations, additions and site improvements. Types of plans submitted for review with this application include: site plans, landscaping plans, lighting plans and others. This application is used for initial plan submittals, re-submittals or to request plan review/approval of responses to plan comments. Plan reviews may be submitted by owners, designers, contractors or other agents of the owner, however, plan review results/comments will only be shared with the applicant.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Commercial Building Plans must be approved before obtaining construction permits for commercial projects. This application is for building plan review of commercial projects - New construction, alterations, additions and site improvements. Types of plans submitted for review with this application include: Architectural, MEP, and others. This application is used for initial plan submittals, re-submittals or to request plan review/approval of responses to plan comments. Plan reviews may be submitted by owners, designers, contractors or other agents of the owner, however, plan review results/comments will only be shared with the applicant.

recordTypes.name: Water or Sewer Cap Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to cap the sewer or water service on private property WITHOUT demolition of the structure being served.  If capping services in conjunction with a demolition, please apply for a Demolition Permit with Building Permits and Inspection Services.

recordTypes.name: ****Nuisance Violation (Rita's Test) Copy
recordTypes.description: Create a new Code Enforcement Case

recordTypes.name: Massage Establishment
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Place of Amusement within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Home Park License
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Mobile Home Park within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Use of Parking Space
recordTypes.description:
Application to reserve a parking stall.

Note: Stalls are $10 per calendar day per stall reserved. Handicapped, Loading Zone, & 30 Minute stalls may only be reserved in special circumstances

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Unit
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Mobile Food Unit within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Sign Hanger License
recordTypes.description: Previously grouped with other contractor licenses referred to as LC-#

recordTypes.name: Place of Amusement License
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Place of Amusement within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Tree Grant Funding Application
recordTypes.description: Application for residential tree planting to share the cost of planting a tree on the street side of residential properties.  This application is to be approved for funding to participate in the program.

recordTypes.name: Tree Grant Reimbursement Request
recordTypes.description: Application to be reimbursement for planting a residential tree on the street side of a residential property.  Approved applicants will be reimbursed for 80% of the tree planting cost to a maximum reimbursement of $400.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this record type when work is being done on the physical structure of a commercial building.  Commercial buildings are any structure that is not a 1-4 unit residential structure.

recordTypes.name: Secondhand Stores, Auction Houses and Rummage Rooms - License
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Secondhand Store, Auction House or Rummage Room as defined in City Code Chapter 58 within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Rental License
recordTypes.description: License required to operate a Short-Term Rental within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.

recordTypes.name: Selective Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this record type when selective demolition is being done on a commercial or a residential building.  This permit is required for demolishing specific parts of a building, such as interior walls including mechanicals, while leaving the main structural components intact. Safeguards during construction must comply with Chapter 33 of the currently-adopted International Building Code. This permit does not allow new construction activities unless approved otherwise. If the entire structure is being demolished, then a Demolition Permit is required instead.

recordTypes.name: Video Gaming Establishment License
recordTypes.description: License required by an establishment to allow the operation of video gaming terminals within the corporate city limits of the City of Decatur.  The applying establishment must have a current State of Illinois Gaming License for the location to be licensed.  In addition, the terminal operator is also required to have a City of Decatur Video Gaming Terminal Operator License for the terminals to be in operation at the location to be licensed.

recordTypes.name: Video Gaming Terminal Operators License
recordTypes.description: Annual License for the Video Gaming Terminal Operator for any video gaming terminal located within the City of Decatur corporate city limits.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
DO NOT use this application for SOLAR,  fence, swimming pool or a roof. 

This permit type is selected when any type of residential structure is being built or altered.  This includes -- 1 to 4 residential dwellings, detached garages or sheds.

recordTypes.name: Solar Photovoltaic System Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit type is selected when solar panels are being installed in a residential or commercial application.  Commercial applications require a Commercial Site Plan Review and Commercial Building Plan Review which can be submitted at https://decaturil.portal.opengov.com/categories/1071/record-types/6522 and https://decaturil.portal.opengov.com/categories/1071/record-types/6521, respectively.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This type of permit is required when any commercial or residential structure is demolished, including sheds and detached garages.   A sewer cap and/or water cap must be permitted, completed, and inspected when demolishing a structure as part of this permit type unless approved by public works to remain. (previously requested separately from Public Works).   After the permit is submitted, city staff will verify that the water, sewer and electricity has been capped/removed, if necessary, prior to the permit being issued.  Work cannot begin until the applicant has received an email that permit has been issued.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit type is selected when the work being done is electrical in nature and is not part of another permit.  Such as -- replace/repair electrical service, electrical service upgrades, electrical wiring, add new electrical circuit, etc.  All electrical work must be done by a City of Decatur licensed electrician.  For residential structures, the property owner can do the work if they pass a written test.

recordTypes.name: Fence Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit type is used for the construction of a fence on a residential or commercial property.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit type is selected when repairing/replacing furnaces, air conditioners, commercial hoods, boilers or exhaust systems.

recordTypes.name: Fire Protection Systems Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit type is selected when repairing/replacing fire suppression or alarm systems.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit type is selected when plumbing work is being done, such as water service (repair/replace), water heater, water piping, lawn sprinkler, waste & vent systems.  All plumbing contractors must be licensed by the State of Illinois and registered with the City of Decatur.
A Right of Way Permit must be obtained when work is to be performed on City property or in Right of Way.  Only those contractors who are licensed and bonded with the City of Decatur are allowed to pull a Right of Way Permit.  Some examples of this type of work include excavation in City owned streets, alleys, boulevards, or properties to so work on a sewer or water service.

recordTypes.name: Roof Permit
recordTypes.description: This type of permit is required when any commercial or residential structure's roof is being repaired/replaced.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit type is used when installing or repairing a swimming pool.  The following contractors can be listed on this permit -- pool installer, plumber and electrician.

Any deck construction associated with the pool must be requested on a separate building permit.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this record type when adding/modifying a sign.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Structure/Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this record type for tents, air supported structures or any other type of structure that is not permenant.

recordTypes.name: Wheelchair Ramp Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit type is used for the construction of a wheelchair ramp on a residential or commercial property.

recordTypes.description: Application for New Commercial Construction.  This review will include the interior and exterior of the structure.  Separate permits must be submitted for the building's Fire Protection System (if applicable) and the building's Fire Alarm System (if applicable).

recordTypes.name: Lemont Business License/Registration
recordTypes.description: Annual business license/registration for the Village of Lemont.

If a Fire Protection System is being installed, a separate permit must be submitted under "Fire Sprinkler Permit".  If a Fire Alarm System is being installed, a separate permit must be submitted under "Fire Alarm Permit".
