IF YOU ARE A RESIDENT OF THE FRONT STREET LOFTS, THIS HANG TAG WOULD BE FOR ANY ADDITIONAL VEHICLES. Your primary vehicle should be parked in the HOA-assigned parking stall.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk and Outdoor Cafe License
recordTypes.description: Annual sidewalk cafe or outdoor dining license for the Village of Lemont.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description:
To apply for a demolition permit in the Village of Lemont, you must first successfully apply for the Cook County Environmental and Sustainability Demolition Permit, or provide a waiver from their office that a permit from their office is not required.

Per the Cook County, an interior demolition project that includes wrecking or removing/disturbing any load-supporting or load bearing structural members will require a permit from their agency.

recordTypes.name: Special Event License Application and/or Special Event Liquor License Application
recordTypes.description:
Special Events License and/or Special Events Liquor License.

Please use this form to request approval for your Special Event, and/or Special Events Liquor License.  All applications must be submitted 30 days prior to your event; to avoid a late fee of $250.00.  

Special Event License $50.00

Special Event Liquor License $25.00 per day

Other fees may apply:  Police, Lema, Public Works Services, and Fire Department Inspections; depending on event set-up and requests.  (These fees if applicable will be billed separately.)

If you have any questions, please contact Julie Thomas at jthomas@lemont.il.us or 630.258.7822.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit - EV Charger
recordTypes.description: This permit is used for electrical upgrades to the building's existing electrical service, replacing existing electrical panels, or upgrading the electrical systems to accommodate car chargers.

recordTypes.name: Hot Tub/Spa Permit
recordTypes.description:
This Hot Tub Permit application is designed to be used with standard manufacturer made hot tubs, that sit above ground and sit on an existing patio/pad or a pad built as part of this application.  If the hot tub you are proposing is a custom built below ground or semi-recessed hot tub, please apply for this type of installation with the Pool Permit instead.  The in-ground pool permit option would generate the proper application document requirements as well as the proper inspections needed for an approved hot tub.

Please confirm you have all the information required for the hot tub permit.  Please provide details if the hot tub is sitting on an existing patio/pad, or if a new pad will be built as part of this permit.  Please provide clear direction on the electrical source for the hot tub, and how power is being provided, including from where, what depth of the conduit and if this is a hard piped connection or a plugged in connection.

recordTypes.name: Miscellaneous Permit: Solar Panels, Generators, Radon , Hot Water Tank, Ansul, Paving etc.
recordTypes.description:
Miscellaneous permit application for installations such as:
-Solar Panels
-Back-Up Generators
-Radon Mitigation Systems
-Fire Suppression Ansul System
-Hot Water Tank Replacements
-Parking Lot Paving and Re-surfacing
-Drainage Installations

recordTypes.name: Permit Extension
recordTypes.description:
Permit extension request to be submitted PRIOR to the expiration of your current permit.  Permit extensions are good for half the duration of the original permit.

Longer permit extensions are reviewed only if specifically requested and included with a project schedule detailing the anticipated completion date of the project.

recordTypes.name: Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: Please note this permit only applies to the pool structure.  If you are also installing a large patio around the pool, an outdoor kitchen, an outdoor fire pit, or a pergola/pavilion structure, these features will require a separate permit.  Please reach out to the Building Department if you have questions on these permit requirements - 630-257-1580

recordTypes.name: Residential Construction Permit: Additions and Remodels
recordTypes.description:
Application for Additions or Modifications to an existing residential structure (additions, bathroom remodels, kitchen remodels, additional bedrooms, removal of load bearing walls, etc.).  Any structure that connects back to the existing home/house and expands the home's footprint should be classified as an "Addition" for the permit application option "Type of Improvement".  Covered Porches/Decks will be submitted and reviewed under this permit as well.

Apply for a Finished Basement Permit for any work regarding basements.

recordTypes.name: Master Plan Reviews - NO WORK, REVIEW ONLY
recordTypes.description: STOP - This permit application is for master plan reviews only.  These would be projects that require a review with the Village of Lemont only, and will not be built.  Final plans for the actual houses that will be built on the actual addresses should be submitted separately.  Model Homes or Sales Office Homes should be submitted under a separate permit under the address the homes will be built.

recordTypes.name: Finished Basement
recordTypes.description: Use this for any projects involving renovation existing basements or finishing a previously un-finished basement.  Drawings showing the existing conditions and proposed conditions of the Plumbing, Electrical, HVAC and layout will be required.

recordTypes.name: Residential Construction Permit: New Construction
recordTypes.description: Application for New Residential Construction

recordTypes.name: Retaining Wall Permit
recordTypes.description: Retaining walls greater than 24" in height (measured from the base of the first stone) must apply for a building permit.  Retaining walls must be installed per the manufacturer's installation instructions.  For any walls that support a surcharge load (supporting decks, pools, driveways, etc.) OR any walls that are greater than 36" in height, wall details must be designed and stamped by a Professional Engineer.

recordTypes.name: Sewer/Water Repair Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for repair of an existing sewer connection or an existing water connection.  Any work associated with a NEW water connection to the Village supplied water system, should be applied for under the "Water Connection Permit".

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk Replacement, Service Walk, Front Porch Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit to submit documentation to replace an existing sidewalk, to replace or add a service walk or to replace a front porch.  A service walk can be between the driveway and the house, or between the driveway and the back patio/porch, as long as all easement requirements are met.  Please submit documentation to the Village for review, including if any of these conditions are existing and being replaced in kind.

recordTypes.name: Siding/Brick Veneer/EIFS/Exterior Cladding Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for any modification to the exterior or veneer of the building.

recordTypes.name: Window and Door Replacement Permit
recordTypes.description: Only required when changing the size, location, or frame for an exterior window or door. A permit is not required if you are replacing windows or doors with the same size and location of the existing ones.

recordTypes.name: Acceptance of Right of way Improvements or Roadway into Monroe County Inventory
recordTypes.description: This form is used for the Acceptance of Right of way Improvements or New Roadways into Monroe County Inventory.

recordTypes.name: Freeze Thaw Period Waiver Request
recordTypes.description: This application is for a waiver from Chapter 480 regarding Vehicle Weight Limits on Monroe County Roadways starting February 3rd for a period of 90 days during the freeze/thaw period.  An application for each roadway is required.

recordTypes.name: Appeal of Decision
recordTypes.description: This form is used for the Applicant aggrieved by the denial of a permit or decision under Chapter 755 and the Manual for Construction Within and Adjacent to Monroe County Right-of-Way, or any other person whose property interests would be significantly harmed by any work permitted under this Chapter.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is for approval from the Monroe County Traffic Commission for Special Events requiring the use of county roads or public rights-of-way owned by Monroe County. To assure timely approval by the Traffic Commission to your application we ask that you notify us not less than 60 days before the event.

To receive consideration by the Traffic Commission, all relevant portions of the application must be completed. Once a completed application has been submitted to the Highway Department, it will be reviewed by staff and forwarded to the Traffic Commission for consideration. You will receive an invite via email to attend the meeting.  You may attend in person or via zoom to answer any questions the Traffic Commission may have.  Once approved by the Traffic Commission, the County retains the right to revoke permission if safety issues concerning the Special Event arise.

The Traffic Commission has the sole discretion to approve or deny an application. If the Traffic Commission approves use of county roads or public rights-of-way for the Special Event, it may impose any reasonable conditions or requirements upon the approval deemed necessary to minimize the adverse impact of the Special Event upon the community, neighborhoods, or emergency service providers. The recipient of a Special Event approval is required to comply with all federal, state, and local laws during the event.

recordTypes.name: Famers Market Registration
recordTypes.description: It is the responsibility of the Market Manager to ensure that food vendors are properly licensed and that exempt food vendors follow state and local guidelines. The Market Manager must register a Farmers’ Market with the Environmental Health – Foods Division at least 30 days prior to the market. There is no fee for the registration.

recordTypes.name: 100 Cooks Who Care Event Organizer
recordTypes.description: Questionnaire for the Chef's of basic food safety knowledge.

recordTypes.name: Soil Report Review for Subdivisions
recordTypes.description:
The Soil Report Review for Minor and Sliding Scale Subdivisions is a Health Department review of a soil report received from an Indiana Registered Soil Scientist for the purposes of determining site suitability for a septic system during a minor subdivision where a septic system is not planned to be installed within the next 2 years of application.

Applications are per subdivision not per lot.

As of 1/1/2026,  Indiana enacted legislation that made statutory changes to the use of Health First Indiana funds. Due to these changes, you may be required to fill out a questionnaire of citizenship before completion of the inspection.

IC 16-46-10-3 addresses Health First Indiana “use of funds”. IC 16-46-10-3 (f) has been added to this statute and states that “Funds may only be used for Indiana residents who are lawfully present in the United States”.

recordTypes.name: Drainage Board Review
recordTypes.description:
This record is meant to document the decisions of the Monroe County Drainage Board. The Drainage Board issues variances and waivers to the Stormwater Management Ordinance and Stormwater Technical Standards Manual requirements. The Drainage Board also hears issues related to drainage easements, karst conservancy areas, subdivisions, site plans, drainage complaints, etc. 

Those projects that do not meet the threshold for a Stormwater Grading Permit (CH 761-8(A)) but still require a stormwater quantity and post-construction stormwater quality management feature (CH 761-5(C)) must submit materials for Drainage Board review. Any land disturbing activities of sinkhole modifications within a Karst Conservancy Area (KCA) or the area that would be covered by a KCA must first secure Drainage Board approval (CH 761-7(C)). 

A Drainage Review Fee is assessed for all reviews of new detention and water quality treatment measures.

recordTypes.name: Petition to Vacate Right of way or Roadway from Monroe County Inventory
recordTypes.description: This form is used to petition the Board of Commissioners of Monroe County, Indiana, to vacate Right of way or a County maintained road in the Monroe County Roadway Inventory. There is a non-refundable $100.00 fee for each petition to vacate. Please send or drop-off payment to the Monroe County Highway Department.

recordTypes.name: Address Request
recordTypes.description: Utilize this application for new address requests or to verify an existing address. You are able to request more than one address per application. In order to locate the property that you are requesting an address for, please provide a description and site plan that will best communicate your proposed address location.

recordTypes.name: Residential Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for new installation of an electrical service, an upgrade or repair of an existing service, or the installation of a solar (photovoltaic) system which interconnects with either the power distribution grid or is connected to a structure’s wiring system. Call the Building Department if you have questions on which permit to apply for at 812-349-2580.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Subdivision
recordTypes.description:
A Final Plat is required for the subdivision and platting of land.  An administrative subdivision can include Type B, C, D, E or F. 

Type B - A division of land for the transfer of a tract or tracts to correct errors in an existing legal description, provided that no additional building sites other than for accessory buildings are created by the division.

Type C - A division of land pursuant to an allocation of land in the settlement of a decedent's estate or a court decree for the distribution of property.

Type D - A division of land for federal, state or local government to acquire street right-of-way

Type E - A division of land for the transfer of a tract or tracts between adjoining lots provided that no additional principal use building sites are created by the division. The lots so created hereunder shall have only one principal use building site each. (See Principal Building)

Type F - A division of land into cemetery plots for the purpose of burial of corpses

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Grading Permit
recordTypes.description:
Monroe County Stormwater Grading Permits are required for the following projects:

1. Land disturbance of one (1) acre or more.
2. Land disturbance less than one (1) acre that is part of a common plan of development.
3. Projects meeting the applicability of the Indiana Department of Environmental Management's Construction Stormwater General Permit. 

All projects are required to submit a certified site plan and site-specific stormwater pollution prevention plan (SWPPP) with their application. 

Projects requiring on-site detention should also submit a Preliminary Drainage Plan. 


Contact the Monroe County Stormwater Program with any questions: (812) 349-2565, storm@co.monroe.in.us.

recordTypes.name: Electrical License Board Application
recordTypes.description:
All electricians must receive approval from the Licensing and Registration Board and obtain a license before performing electrical work in Monroe County. This application and the required attachments must be received before attending a meeting. Once received, the applicant must attend, either in-person or virtually, any upcoming board meetings to request board approval of a license.  The electrician requesting the license must be the applicant.

Once approved, the license may be obtained from the Monroe County Building Department. 

The Monroe County Licensing and Registration Board meets monthly at 5:00 PM EST. The meeting dates and electronic communications link can be found on the upcoming events calendar on the Monroe County website https://www.co.monroe.in.us.

Please retain this document number, i.e. EA-XXX, for your records.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Inquiry
recordTypes.description: Prior to submitting a stormwater permit application, the petitioner can receive guidance on the stormwater requirements for their proposed project. The Stormwater Program shall aid and advise the petitioner in preparing the application and supportive documents as necessary.

recordTypes.name: License Renewal Application for Establishments
recordTypes.description: Yearly renewal application for existing establishments.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Review/Appeal
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Appeals may consider an appeal of any decision, interpretation, or determination made by the Director, or any other administrative official or board charged with the duty of enforcing and interpreting the Monroe County Zoning Ordinance. The Board of Zoning Appeals may review requests as outlined in the Monroe County Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use
recordTypes.description: A conditional use application only applies when the use requested is considered 'Conditional' in the use table of the Monroe County Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Secondary Plat Filing (i.e. Final Plat)
recordTypes.description: A Final Plat is required for the subdivision and platting of land.  Final Plat types include administrative, minor, major, and sliding scale subdivisions.

recordTypes.name: Septic Installer List Registration
recordTypes.description:
This application is optional and has a $75 fee. 

The application is intended for septic installers in Monroe County that would like to be included on the septic installer's list for the general public. Due to state law changes, Monroe County cannot certify septic installers until further notice. There is no septic installer certification process in Monroe County at this time.

A test will be included in this application with a passing score of 70% or above. 

This registration is valid for the calendar year.

If you have questions about this application, call the Health Department at 812-349-2543.

recordTypes.name: Financial Guaranty for Subdivisions
recordTypes.description: This application is utilized when a Letter of Credit/Irrevocable Letter of Credit is required in order to proceed with a final plat or development plan.

recordTypes.name: Food Safety Complaint Form
recordTypes.description: This form is for complaints regarding food borne illnesses, food safety, pest control at a retail establishment, or another food-related complaint.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Development Permit
recordTypes.description: Please contact the Planning Department before applying for this permit unless you have been directed to apply for this permit through direct communication with County staff. If calling in, please ask for the Floodplain Administrator at 812-349-2560.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit allows for the construction of single-family, duplex, and modular residential structures, remodeling, as well as for additions of rooms, decks, and sunrooms, and for finishing unfinished spaces within a home. (Class two structures). This permit includes the construction of a new residence, an addition to a residence, remodel to a residence, etc.  Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Establishment Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: A Mobile Unit means any Retail Food Establishment without a fixed location which is capable of being readily moved intact from location to location that is wheeled, on skids, mounted on a vehicle, a marine vessel, pushcart or trailer. Please allow 10-14 business days to review and process your application.

recordTypes.name: Guaranty of Performance for PUDs
recordTypes.description: This application is utilized when a Guarantee of Performance for Completion of Improvements is required in order to proceed with a PUD Development Plan. If the PUD includes a subdivision, do not utilize this application and instead utilize the "Financial Guaranty for Subdivisions".

recordTypes.name: Pre-Packaged Food Items Only - Retail Food Establishment Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: A Pre-Packaged Retail Food Establishment is an operation that stores, packages, serves, vends, or otherwise provides food for human consumption. Please allow 10-14 business days to review and process your application.

recordTypes.name: Residential Accessory Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for DETACHED outbuildings on residential property (pole barns, agricultural, utility storage buildings, detached garages, pool houses, yard barns in excess of 200 square feet in size, etc.) This permit also covers additions made to existing detached outbuildings. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: HISTORICAL Planned Unit Development Plan Review
Real Estate Septic Inspection
recordTypes.description:
This application is only for properties that have an existing septic system that requires an inspection for signs of failure. Call the Health Department at 812-349-2834 with questions. 

As of 1/1/2026,  Indiana enacted legislation that made statutory changes to the use of Health First Indiana funds. Due to these changes, you may be required to fill out a questionnaire of citizenship before completion of the inspection.

IC 16-46-10-3 addresses Health First Indiana “use of funds”. IC 16-46-10-3 (f) has been added to this statute and states that “Funds may only be used for Indiana residents who are lawfully present in the United States”.

recordTypes.name: Remote Catering Only - Retail Food Establishment Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for Remote Catering Food Establishments. Please allow 10-14 business days to review and process your application.

recordTypes.name: Historic Preservation Certificate of Appropriateness
recordTypes.description: A Certificate of Appropriateness is required prior to alteration of a locally designated historic property, structure, object, or feature. Each application must be accompanied by sketches, drawings, photographs, descriptions, or other information showing the proposed exterior alterations, additions, changes, or new construction.  The Board of Review shall prepare an application form, with instructions, for use by persons seeking a certificate of appropriateness

recordTypes.name: Residential Repair Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for a permit for repairing broken, degraded or failing existing systems such as replacing an existing foundation, replacing existing structural elements (posts/columns, broken joists/rafters/trusses) or similar. It is also for altering structural elements of a building without changing the size or use of the building space, such as opening a wall, installing doors or windows requiring header installation or modification, changing a staircase, etc. This permit is not for remodeling, additions, or converting use of area within a building. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Historic Preservation National Register Nomination
recordTypes.description: Applications for National Register Nominations can be made in the Planning Office and/or using this application. The application does not have a fee included. Prior to submitting, the applicant should attend the Historic Preservation Board of Review meeting to introduce the filing and make the Board aware of the filing.

recordTypes.name: Retail Food Establishment Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description:
A Permanent Retail Food Establishment is an operation that stores, prepares, packages, serves, vends, or otherwise provides food for human consumption. Please allow 10-14 business days to review and process your application.

A change of ownership requirements only qualifies if there is no physical construction, movement or installation of equipment, no establishment name changes, and no significant change to the food menu as the previous ownership.

Remodel requirements include plumbing, any significant changes to walls, storage, entry ways, general building changes, etc.

recordTypes.name: Multi-Market Retail Food Establishment License Application
recordTypes.description: A Multi-Market license is one that operates for 1 year, per year,  beginning April 1st and expiring March 31st, including those participating at the Farmers Market. You may choose to operate at 1-3 markets or 4-6 markets under one license. Please allow 10-14 business days to review and process your application.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This Application covers projects for new construction, additions, remodeling, and tenant buildout of commercial structures (businesses, apartments, retail, industrial, educational buildings, etc. - Class one structures). This permit can also include the addition of fire suppression systems and/or hood system installation. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application. One structure per permit, please.

recordTypes.name: Home Business Permit
recordTypes.description: A Home Based Business or Home Occupation permit (depending on which you qualify for) is for business based out of the home. If you are unsure whether you qualify for a home business, please first call the planning office at 812-349-2560 to speak with a Planner.

recordTypes.name: Seasonal Retail Food Establishment License Application
recordTypes.description: A Seasonal Food Service Establishment is one that operates for 9 months of the year, per year. Please allow 10-14 business days to review and process your application.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Fire Suppression Sprinkler System
recordTypes.description: This permit is for the installation, alteration, extension, or decommission of a Sprinkler System.  Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for changes made to an existing building when plumbing work is the full scope of the project, including work similar to installation of a grease or oil separator and the related waste and vent work to separate, install, and reconnect to the sanitary waste system of the building. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Residential Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit allows for demolition and removal of houses and/or accessory buildings on residential property.   Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Septic Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit is for those seeking a new septic permit, repair septic permit, renewal septic permit, commercial septic permit, or a campground septic permit.
Members of the Monroe County Health Department Wastewater Division advise, inspect and approve the installation of ALL Septic Systems in Monroe County.  
For questions, call 812-349-2543.

recordTypes.name: Residential Construction Planning Pre-Design (e.g. New Single Family Home, Accessory Structure, Demolition of a structure, etc)
recordTypes.description: This application should be your first step in any residential project. This pre-design will determine the checklist of documents/ approvals/ permits that will be needed for a complete Improvement Location Permit application, which is a pre-requisite for a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Alteration Repair Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for repairing a single broken, degraded or failing existing structural element or system such as columns, joists, trusses, stairs, guards or similar components. It can also be for altering single elements of a building without changing the size or use of the building space, such as opening a wall, changing a staircase, installing doors or windows requiring header installation/modification, limited floorplan modification which diminishes exiting flow or capacity, etc. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit allows for the demolition of Commercial or Multi-family structures. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Improvement Location Permit - General
recordTypes.description:
This application is for all residential structures that meet the Improvement Location Permit requirements under the Monroe County Development Ordinance. This can include, but is not limited to a new home, manufactured home placement, accessory structure, pole barn, agricultural structure, pool & spa, accessory dwelling unit, tourist home or cabin, remodel, addition, structural repair, demolition of structure, ground mount solar array, farm roadside stand, or artificial lake or pond.

This permit is a pre-requisite for applying for a residential building permit.

recordTypes.name: Residential Manufactured Home Placement
recordTypes.description: This permit is for the placement of a single or double-wide prefabricated home delivered to the site on axles. Information required for this application includes a Sewer/Septic Permit, Driveway Permit, a Site Plan and foundation information.  Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Activity Permit
recordTypes.description: This form is used for all work or activity within Monroe County Right of Way including but not limited to aerial work, driveways, excavation work, new road construction, open cuts, over-size moves, road bores, road closures and road extensions. See Chapter 755 and the Manual for Construction Within and Adjacent to Monroe County Right of Way for all requirements.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Event Organizer
recordTypes.description: Submit this form at least 14 business days before a temporary event.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Hood System Installation
recordTypes.description: This permit allows for the installation of a hood with fire suppression (type one), ventilation hoods (type two) or the repair or alteration of either type of existing hood system. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Retail Food Establishment License Application
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Food Service Establishment is one that operates at a fixed location for a period of time not to exceed fourteen (14) consecutive days in conjunction with a single event such as a fair, carnival, circus, public exhibition or similar transitory gathering. Please allow 10-14 business days to review and process your application.

recordTypes.name: Land Use Certificate Application
recordTypes.description: The Applicant applies to the Commission, in writing, for a Land Use Certificate, stating that all required improvements have been completed in the manner prescribed by these regulations, and complies with the Monroe County Code, the site plan/development plan approved and on file, and all other relevant regulations. No land shall be occupied or used and no building or other structure hereinafter erected, reconstructed or structurally altered shall be occupied or used, in whole or in part, for any purpose whatsoever, until a land use certificate has been issued stating that the structure and/or use comply with all the provisions of this ordinance applicable to the building, structure or premises of the use in the district in which it is to be located.

recordTypes.name: Residential Swimming Pool & Spa Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for In-ground pools, Spas and hot tubs, and Above-ground pools (capable of containing water to a depth exceeding 42 inches). Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Transmission Tower (Wireless Communications) Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for the installation of new transmission towers, replacement of antennae,  co-locating equipment, or similar structures (communication towers, observation facilities, training facilities, etc.). If you have questions, call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Liquid Storage & Compressed Gas Storage Containment Units Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required if the volume of the storage tanks exceeds these capacities: Liquid storage of flammable/combustible material in excess of 500 gallons, Compressed gas storage in fixed containers exceeding: 200 cubic ft. of flammable gas / 500 cubic ft. of oxidizing gas (including Oxygen) /  6,000 cubic ft. of inert gas. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Logging Permit
recordTypes.description: A logging permit is required prior to harvesting timber in the urban area as defined as "All lands or Lots used for residential purposes where there are at least eight (8) residences within any quarter mile square area, and other lands or Lots that have been or are planned for residential areas contiguous to the municipality." Note that you will also be required to apply for a 'Right-of-Way Activity' permit through the Highway Department as part of the process to get a driveway permit to allow for logging.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for new installation of an electrical service, an upgrade or repair of an existing service, or the installation of a solar (photovoltaic) system which interconnects with either the power distribution grid or is connected to a commercial building’s wiring system. Call the Building Department if you have questions on which permit to apply for at 812-349-2580.

recordTypes.name: Planned Unit Development District Plan (i.e. Outline Plan)
recordTypes.description: This is an application for amending the Planned Unit Development Ordinance. This request is granted or denied by the Monroe County Board of Commissioners Commissioners. All applicants must complete a pre-design prior to filing this application.

recordTypes.name: Right of way Surety
recordTypes.description:
This form is used for all Sureties (Letter of Credit or Surety Bond) for work or activity within Monroe County Right of Way including but not limited to aerial work, driveways, excavation work, new road construction, open cuts, over-size moves, road bores, road closures and road extensions.  See Chapter 755 and the Manual for Construction Within and Adjacent to Monroe County Right of Way for all requirements.

The Original Surety must be submitted.  No copies will be accepted.  Please submit the Continuation Certificate, Letter of Credit or Surety Bond to our Office either by drop off at our Office or via mail.  Do not upload a copy into this system.

recordTypes.name: Historical Right of way Surety
recordTypes.description:
This form is used for all Sureties (Letter of Credit or Surety Bond) pre-OpenGov for work or activity within Monroe County Right of Way including but not limited to aerial work, driveways, excavation work, new road construction, open cuts, over-size moves, road bores, road closures and road extensions. See Chapter 755 and the Manual for Construction Within and Adjacent to Monroe County Right of Way for all requirements.

The Original Surety must be submitted.  No copies will be accepted.  Please submit the Continuation Certificate, Letter of Credit or Surety Bond to our Office either by drop off at our Office or via mail.  Do not upload a copy into this system.

recordTypes.name: Residential Miscellaneous Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for fences above 6', ramps, standalone decks (decks attached to residential structures should use the "Residential Building Permit"), and other miscellaneous structures.

recordTypes.name: Planned Unit Development Secondary Review (i.e. Development Plan)
recordTypes.description: Before submitting this application, you must setup a pre-design with a planner. This review is required for any  proposed construction for property zoned Planned Unit Development in the county. Call 812-349-2560 to speak with a planner if you have questions.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Miscellaneous Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for commercial properties and can include work such as installing fences above 6', ramps, stairs, and other miscellaneous structures. . Decks & Accessory should use a Commercial  permit, ( attached to residential structures should use the "Residential Building Permit"),

recordTypes.name: Commercial Swimming Pool & Spa Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for Pools, Spas, Hot Tubs, and Water Attractions at public parks, schools, hotels, apartment buildings, etc. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Design or Pre-Filing Meeting (for Subdivisions, Rezones, Commercial Development)
recordTypes.description: Prior to submitting an application, the petitioner shall meet with the County to review the zoning district classification of the site, the regulatory ordinances, procedures and examine the proposed use and development of the property. The Planning Department shall aid and advise the petitioner in preparing the application and supportive documents as necessary.

recordTypes.name: Residential Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Primary Major Subdivision
recordTypes.description: A Preliminary Plat Major Subdivision is required for the subdivision and platting of 5 or more lots. A Preliminary Plat shall be prepared in conjunction with any proposal to subdivide or plat property within the jurisdictional area of the Plan Commission.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Agricultural Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for commercial agricultural buildings which store equipment, grains, or livestock in commercial farm operations. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Plumbers  Sign-off
recordTypes.description:
Plumber Registered in Monroe County must provide Sign-off documentation for work being performed within Monroe County. 
Plumbers are required to hold a current Monroe County Registration. A plumber registration can be had with Monroe County with a current State License and application. If you have questions as to whether you are registered in Monroe County please phone 812-349-2580.

recordTypes.name: Electrician  Sign-off
recordTypes.description:
Electricians licensed in Monroe County must provide Sign-off documentation for work being performed within Monroe County. 
Electricians are subject to approval by the Electrical Licensing Board and must hold a current Monroe County licensing. If you have questions as to whether you are licensed in Monroe County please phone 812-349-2580

recordTypes.name: Primary Minor Subdivision
recordTypes.description: A Preliminary Plat Minor Subdivision is required for the subdivision and platting of 4 or fewer lots. If a property is on sewer, lot sizes must meet or exceed minimum lot requirements. If the property is on septic, lot sizes are required to be at least 10 acres.

recordTypes.name: Primary Sliding Scale Subdivision
recordTypes.description: A Primary Plat Sliding Scale Subdivision application is required for the subdivision and platting of 4 or fewer lots. This option creates one larger parcel (55% of total acreage) that cannot be further subdivided for 25 years (See Chapter 862) and smaller parcels at least 2.5 acres in size. A pre-design with a Planner is required before filing this application.

recordTypes.name: Registration - General Contractor
recordTypes.description: We do not License General Contractors. Please self register through this application.

recordTypes.name: Registration - Design Professional
recordTypes.description: Please self-register as a Design Professional through this application. Once register your information will be within the software date base.

recordTypes.name: Property Complaint
recordTypes.description: Utilize this form (free of charge) to log potential complaints for property located in the unincorporated areas of Monroe County, IN. Note that if you make a complaint with your individual account, your information is known and that it will not be an anonymous complaint. Visit the county website (https://www.in.gov/counties/monroe/) to find contact information for individual departments.

recordTypes.name: Road Name Change Request
recordTypes.description: This application should be used to request a change to an existing road name in the Monroe County jurisdiction area. In combination with the Highway Department's recommendation, the Planning Department takes a road name change request through the Plan Commission for approval. If you request more than one road name to change, you will be required to fill out separate forms.

recordTypes.name: Licensing & Registration - Plumbing Journeyman
recordTypes.description: Licensing for residential plumbing. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Licensing & Registration - Plumbing Contractor
recordTypes.description: Licensing for Commercial and Residential plumbing. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Use Determination
recordTypes.description: Utilize this form to determine the use and related permits required for a proposed activity. You must know details such as type of activity (auto, manufacturing, etc.), hours of operation, number of employees, etc.

recordTypes.name: Licensing & Registration -  Electrician Master
recordTypes.description: Licensing for Commercial and Residential electrical contractor. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Licensing & Registration -  Electrician  Residential
recordTypes.description: Licensing for residential electrical contractor. Call the Building Department at 812-349-2580 with questions about this application.

recordTypes.name: Rezone Application
recordTypes.description: A Rezone application is needed when seeking to change the zoning classification of a property. The final decision will be made by the County Commissioners. This application should not be used if you are seeking a rezone to Planned Unit Development (PUD); instead, use the PUD application for an Outline Plan.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Before submitting this application, you must setup a pre-filing meeting with a planner. This review is required per Chapter 815. Call 812-349-2560 to speak with a planner if you have questions.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Seasonal Activity Permit
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Seasonal Activity Permit is intended to allow temporary uses in the County (i.e. seasonal sales).

recordTypes.name: Variance
recordTypes.description: A development standards variance or land use variance allows a deviation from the required use or design standards in the Monroe County Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Wireless Communication Facility (Planning Department)
recordTypes.description: This application is for co-locations, replacement of antennae, new accessory structures, new wireless towers, etc. This application can be standalone but most often is a requirement after the applicant applies for a Commercial Transmission Tower (Wireless Communications) Permit: https://monroecountyin.viewpointcloud.com/categories/1083/record-types/6564. Building Department number is 812-349-2580 and the County Planning Office is 812-349-2560.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Sign permits are required for all permanent and temporary signs.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Ordinance Amendment
recordTypes.description:
The Zoning Ordinance may be amended from time to time by ordinance
duly enacted by the Board of County Commissioners in accordance with the procedures set
out in Indiana Code Chapter 36-7-4-600 Series, Zoning Ordinance. A pre-design is required prior to applying for this application. Call 812-349-2560 to set up a pre-design.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter Request
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Verification Letter gives the applicant information regarding the zoning of the property, information regarding

recordTypes.name: Property Complaint Building Dept
recordTypes.description: Utilize this form (free of charge) to log potential complaints for property located in the unincorporated areas of Monroe County, IN. Note that if you make a complaint with your individual account, your information is known and that it will not be a anonymous complaint. Visit the county website (https://www.co.monroe.in.us/) to find contact information for individual departments.

categories.name: Highway Department
Planning Department
categories.content:
When you add a Location to your application/record, please note that any addresses with a directional prefix such as North, South, West, East should be searched for with the abbreviation of N, S, W or E. 

For example, 1000 West Oak Street should be searched by 1000 W Oak St.

City of Bloomington-Right of Way Use Application
categories.content:
City of Bloomington-Right of Way Use Application

click here: Civic Access Permit Page

recordTypes.name: Shed Permit Application
recordTypes.description: One accessory building with a maximum size of 120 square feet by 12 feet maximum height may be allowed in the rear yard only.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit Application
recordTypes.description: All electrical work requires a permit by a licensed contractor and must be performed to the current adopted edition of the National Electrical Code.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit Application
recordTypes.description: All residential and commercial/industrial plumbing new and replacements require a permit.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit Application
recordTypes.description: All residential, commercial and industrial mechanical miscellaneous require a permit.

recordTypes.name: Final Plat Application

recordTypes.name: Variance to Board of Zoning Appeals
recordTypes.description:
Variances. The Board may grant a variance from the specific terms of the zoning title which will not be contrary to the public interest and where, owing to special conditions, a literal enforcement of the provisions of the title will result in unnecessary hardship for the applicant and provided that the spirit of this title shall be observed, the public safety and welfare secured, and substantial justice done for the applicant. Such variance shall not permit any use not permitted by said title in such district. An application for a variance may be granted upon a finding by the Board that all of the following conditions have been met: 

1.\tThat the variance requested arises from such condition which is unique to the property in question and which is not ordinarily found in the same zone or district; and is not created by an action.
2.\tThat the granting of the permit for the variance will not adversely affect the right of adjacent property owners or residents. 
3. \tThat the strict application of the provisions of this title of which the variance is requested will constitute unnecessary hardship upon the property owner represented in the application. 
4. \tThat the variance desired will not adversely affect the public health, safety, morals, order, convenience, prosperity, or general welfare. 
5. \tThat the granting of the variance desired will not be opposed to the general spirit and intent of the zoning title.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Application
recordTypes.description:
A land disturbance permit shall be obtained from the Chief Building Inspector prior to commencement of any of the following:   

1.      Any activity that changes the physical conditions of landform, vegetation and hydrology, creates bare soil, or otherwise may cause erosion or sedimentation.  Such activities include, but are not limited to, clearing, removal of vegetation, stripping, grading, grubbing, excavating, filling, logging and storing of materials.  Exemptions permitted in Section 17.352 are not applicable to land disturbance activities in the floodway overlay and/or floodway fringe overlay district pursuant to Section 17.980.

2.\tUtility construction.

recordTypes.name: 2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
recordTypes.description:
How to apply for a permit and pay any fees that are due.

Applying for permits, please click on "Building Department - Apply for Permits" to begin the process. At the bottom of the next page, choose which permit type you are applying for. Next, login with your account information or sign-up if you do not have an existing account. Afterwards, the permit application process should resume. Once complete, click on "Submit" and await for any requested changes or additional information from the permit technician.

Payment of Fees:
All payments can be processed via credit card, checks and/or cash. Friendly reminder, all issued checks must be payable to Dorchester County.

recordTypes.name: 3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Document
recordTypes.description:
How to view and print your issued permit, license, or other issued document.

Building Permits:
Once payment is processed, the building permit will be issued and available for immediate printing from the nearest accessible printer. All building plans approved by the Building Inspector must be displayed on the construction site for inspection purposes along with the permit card.

recordTypes.name: Amendment to Official Zoning Map, Text Amendment, Critical Area Map & Growth Allocation
recordTypes.description:
Text Amendments include amendments to the Dorchester County Zoning Code, the Critical Area Code, and other applicable codes.

Zoning Map Amendments include amendments to the Dorchester County Zoning Maps and the Critical Area Maps, amendments to the Critical Area Maps include: amendments to the boundaries of the Critical Area, land management designations, or Modified Buffer Areas. 

Growth allocation is used when the designation of land in the Critical Area is changed from a less intense to a more intense Critical Area land management designation (ex: LDA to IDA) or to allow expanded lot coverage for certain land uses as specified in the Dorchester County Code. Growth allocation most often, but not always, will occur with a Zoning Map Amendment.

recordTypes.name: Buffer Management Plan
recordTypes.description:
The policies of the Dorchester County Critical Area Protection Program and Maryland Critical Area Law provide that forested vegetation will be maintained and increased, forest and developed woodlands will be conserved, and tree removal associated with development activities will be mitigated. Impacts to the 100’ Tidewater and Expanded Buffer must be mitigated by the planting and maintenance of native vegetation according to COMAR 27.01.09.01-2. Depending on the amount and type of impact or establishment, this form may constitute a Simplified, Minor, or Major Buffer Management Plan.

This form is used for establishment of the Buffer, Buffer mitigation, and disturbances associated with providing access to a private pier or shoreline, manually removing invasive or noxious vegetation, filling to maintain an existing lawn, removing a tree which is likely to cause damage to structures, obstruct a stream or accelerate shoreline erosion, or removing a diseased or dying tree.

recordTypes.name: Rental Unit Registration
recordTypes.description:
§ 123-22Purpose.
The purposes of this article are to protect the public health, safety, and general welfare of the citizens of Dorchester County; assist the County government in monitoring the number of rental dwelling units in the County; ensure that owners of rental dwelling units are known to the County and other interested parties and can be reached if necessary; ensure that owners of rental dwelling units are aware of their obligations under relevant codes and regulations; and ensure that rental dwelling units meet minimum standards of maintenance.

recordTypes.name: Demo Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application is intended for demolition or removal of residential, commercial and agricultural structures.

INSPECTIONS REQUESTED PRIOR TO 3:30 pm WILL BE SCHEDULED THE FOLLOWING BUSINESS DAY. ANY INSPECTION REQUESTED AFTER 3:30 PM WILL BE SCHEDULED THE 2ND BUSINESS DAY (EXCLUDING -SATURDAY, SUNDAYS AND HOLIDAYS).

Example 1: You request a rough in online at 11:40 am on Wednesday the 12th; the inspection will be scheduled for Thursday the 13th.
Example 2: You request a rough in online at 3:50pm on Wednesday; the inspection will be scheduled for Friday the 14th.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Rental

§ 123-10Purpose.
The purposes of this article are to protect the public health, safety, and general welfare of the citizens of Dorchester County; assist the County government in monitoring the number of short-term rentals in the County; ensure that owners and operators of short-term rentals are known to the County and other interested parties and can be reached if necessary; ensure that owners and operators of short-term rentals are aware of their obligations under relevant codes and regulations; and ensure that short-term rentals meet minimum standards of maintenance.

The purposes of this article are to protect the public health, safety, and general welfare of the citizens of Dorchester County; assist the County government in monitoring the number of vacant buildings in the County; ensure that owners of vacant buildings are known to the County and other interested parties and can be reached if necessary; ensure that owners of vacant buildings are aware of the obligations of ownership under relevant codes and regulations; and ensure that vacant buildings meet minimum standards of maintenance.

INSPECTIONS REQUESTED PRIOR TO 3:30 pm WILL BE SCHEDULED THE FOLLOWING BUSINESS DAY.
ANY INSPECTION REQUESTED AFTER 3:30 PM WILL BE SCHEDULED THE 2ND BUSINESS DAY (EXCLUDING -SATURDAY, SUNDAYS AND HOLIDAYS).

Example 1: You request a rough in online at 11:40 am on Wednesday the 12th; the inspection will be scheduled for Thursday the 13th.
Example 2: You request a rough in online at 3:50pm on Wednesday; the inspection will be scheduled for Friday the 14th.

recordTypes.name: Pool Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application is applicable to all types of Swimming Pools, including inground concrete, vinyl, fiberglass, and 4ft high above ground pools, and portable and . On the site plan please include pool, patio and pool equipment locations. 

An outdoor swimming pool, including an in-ground, above ground or on-ground pool, hot tub, or spa shall be provided with a barrier as described in the 2018 ICC International Swimming Pool and Spa Code Sections 305.2.1 through 305.7, as modified by local amendment to exempt properties greater than one (1) acre in size.

INSPECTIONS REQUESTED PRIOR TO 3:30 pm WILL BE SCHEDULED THE FOLLOWING BUSINESS DAY.
ANY INSPECTION REQUESTED AFTER 3:30 PM WILL BE SCHEDULED THE 2ND BUSINESS DAY (EXCLUDING -SATURDAY, SUNDAYS AND HOLIDAYS).

Example 1: You request a rough in online at 11:40 am on Wednesday the 12th; the inspection will be scheduled for Thursday the 13th.

Example 2: You request a rough in online at 3:50pm on Wednesday; the inspection will be scheduled for Friday the 14th. Times requested are not guaranteed. If there is a 'last minute' change in your initial request (after 3:30pm) please call our office to let us know.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit (Stand Alone)
recordTypes.description:
This application is for residential, commercial and agricultural plumbing work NOT associated with a Building Permit When requesting inspections please be aware that we take inspections for the NEXT business day until 3:30pm that day ONLY. Any inspections requested after 3:30pm on any day of the week will be scheduled for the FOLLOWING business day (not including Saturday, Sundays and holidays when our office is closed).

Example 1: You requested a rough in online at 11:40 am on Wednesday the 12th; the inspection will be scheduled for Thursday the 13th.

Example 2: You requested a rough in online at 3:50pm on Wednesday; the inspection will be scheduled for Friday the 14th.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit (Stand Alone)
recordTypes.description: This application is for residential, commercial and agricultural electrical work NOT associated with a Building Permit in OpenGov. If your work is in conjunction with a Building Permit in OpenGov, the applicant of that Building permit will need your email address so that they may grant you access to their Building Permit where your trade permit will be uploaded in attachments. You will log into your account, print the permit, complete it with the Contractors signature, and upload it into attachments once they have added you as a guest. You will also request your own inspections online.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Application - Preliminary & Final
recordTypes.description:
The purpose of site plan review is to ensure that certain uses and associated development conform to the requirements of this chapter. A site plan is required for the following:

Any use in the following use categories identified on the Table of Permitted Uses: Aquaculture; Commercial retail; Commercial, business and personal services; Industrial; Institutional; Maritime; Recreational; Utilities.
The following specific uses: Grain processing, drying and storage (wholesale commercial); Manufactured home parks; Multifamily dwellings and townhouses; Planned unit developments.

recordTypes.name: Forest Conservation Plan & Forest Stand Delineation
recordTypes.description: The main purpose of the Maryland Forest Conservation Act (Natural Resources Article Section 5-1601 through 5-1613) enacted in 1991 was to minimize the loss of Maryland's forest resources during land development by making the identification and protection of forests and other sensitive areas an integral part of the site planning process. Identification of priority areas prior to development makes their retention possible. Of primary interest are areas adjacent to streams or wetlands, those on steep or erodible soils or those within or adjacent to large contiguous blocks of forest or wildlife corridors.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Use Certificate
recordTypes.description: This is an application for both temporary uses and certain land uses that require periodic approval or are permitted subject to compliance with conditions.

recordTypes.name: Variance and Special Exception Application
recordTypes.description: This Application is limited to variances of Critical Area requirements to include the following activities: a.) Lot Coverage, b.) Construction activities within the Shoreline Development Buffer, c.) Forestry.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Variance - Critical Area

Licensing & Registration
categories.content:
Here is where you can apply for Electrical registration and/or Plumbing license for Dorchester County, Maryland.

Current fee for Electrical registration is $150.00 bi-annually.
Current fee for Plumbing license is $150.00 annually.

Payment can be made online OR by cash, check, or money order in-person at:

Dorchester County Office Building
501 Court Lane, Room 111
Cambridge, MD 21613

recordTypes.name: County Master Plumber License Application
recordTypes.description: All master plumbers doing work in Cecil County must be licensed by the County in accordance with the provisions of the law with respect thereto as set forth in Title 12, Plumbers, of the Business Occupations and Professions Article of the Annotated Code of Maryland. Prior to submitting an application for a County license, the applicant must present valid proof of his master plumber's certificate as issued by the Maryland State Board of Plumbing, and the applicant must also furnish copies of liability insurance.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Inspection Agency Application Form
recordTypes.description:
Each Electrical Inspection Agency seeking approval to engage in the business of inspection of electrical construction in Cecil County. 

The term of any agency will be for a period of one (1) year, renewable annually upon review of the Board of Electrical Examiners and at the discretion and appointment by Cecil County.

Each Inspection Agency must be an entity in good standing with the State of Maryland and Cecil County.

Each Inspection Agency must be familiar with Chapter 191 of the Cecil County Code and any addendums thereto.

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Home Park License
recordTypes.description:
Any plot of land which may be owned by a natural person, corporation, partnership, association, joint-stock company, society or any other entity of any kind, upon which space is provided and/or utility service supplied for two or more units.
OWNER
Any natural person, corporation, partnership, association, joint-stock company, society or any other entity of any kind.
§ 244-2
License required.
The owner of every manufactured home park in Cecil County shall obtain a license in order to operate such park in the County. The license shall be obtained from the Department of Permits and Inspections.

If this is an EMERGENCY, Dial 911

BUILDING PERMITS ARE REQUIRED IF INSTALLING NEW TOWER, REPLACING A TOWER, EXTENDING OR ALTERATING TOWER.
BUILDING PERMITS ARE REQUIRED FOR EQUIPMENT PADS 200 SQ. FT. AND LARGER.
ELECTRICAL PERMITS ARE NOT REQUIRED IF ELECTRICAL INSTALLATION IS CONTAINED TO THE TOWER
ELECTRICAL PERMITS ARE REQUIRED FOR ALL OTHER ELECTRICAL INSTALLATIONS INCLUDING LOW VOLTAGE.
PLUMBING PERMITS ARE REQUIRED FOR GAS INSTALLATIONS.

recordTypes.name: Flammable Storage Registration

If a registration is not applied for and issued, after three weeks, it may be viewed as cessation and cause for review of the license. A registration must be plainly posted on the premises. Please contact the Town Clerk's Office for more information.

recordTypes.name: Rental Registry
recordTypes.description: The Rental Registry ensures safe and hygienic conditions in rental housing, and compliance with the State Sanitary Code, Chapter II (105 CMR 410.000). Dwelling units lasting longer than (28) consecutive days require this permit.  The permit should be renewed annually and is valid for a calendar year.

Please contact the Health Department if clarification is needed.

recordTypes.name: Business Certificate
recordTypes.description: All fictitious name certificates for businesses (commonly known as "doing business as" or "DBA" certificates) are filed with the Town Clerk. Massachusetts requires anyone who is conducting business under an alias (i.e., any name other than his or her own), including corporations, to file a business certificate in the community where their business is principally headquartered.

recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description: All Dogs over 6 months old must be registered annually in South Hadley. The registration period runs from January 1 to March 31 each year. A late fee of $5.00 will be assessed if the dog license is not renewed by April 1.

Do not click 'Select' if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: 1 Day Alcohol License
recordTypes.description:
One-day alcohol licenses are required for events at which alcohol will be sold. Please note that a person can only obtain a total of 30 one-day licenses per location in one calendar year. You may use this application to apply for a license during consecutive days in the same location.

*APPLICATIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED AT LEAST TWO WEEKS IN ADVANCE OF THE EVENT. APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED LESS THAN TWO WEEKS IN ADVANCE WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED FOR REVIEW BY THE SELECTBOARD.*

Applicants CANNOT purchase alcoholic beverages from a package store. Per the ABCC, please see the list of authorized sources from which to purchase alcohol here: https://www.mass.gov/info-details/apply-for-a-special-license-or-permit-abcc

EVENT REQUIREMENTS: Issuance of this license does not exempt license holders from additional licensing requirements. Food truck permits and entertainment licenses for live music are separate, additional licenses your event may need. Contact the Health Department and Administration Office respectively at 538-5030 for more information.

recordTypes.name: Map or GIS Request
recordTypes.description: Form for Salem constituents and interested parties to request a GIS Product from the GIS division of the Engineering Department, for example a pdf map containing various layers available in GIS, or GIS data for an area of interest. Firms working on projects in the city can also use this application to request municipal utility mapping and related infrastructure plans to support surveying and/or design tasks.

recordTypes.name: Address Change Request Form for Engineering
recordTypes.description: When residents move and/or have to change the information on their water/sewer or trash account, they may fill out the following application.  This form is not to be used for a change of ownership.  If you have any questions, please call the office at 978-619-5673.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit Attestation Form
recordTypes.description: This is an annual form for owners of ADUs to attest ongoing compliance with the City of Salem zoning ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Condominium Conversion Permit
recordTypes.description:
The Housing Stability Coordinator, a member of the Mayor’s Office, administers the Condo Conversion Ordinance and is available by appointment. The Condo Conversion Ordinance aims to slow the rate at which naturally affordable rental housing, especially in multifamily buildings, is converted into condominiums or cooperatives. Its goals are to:

· Reduce displacement of renter households by strengthening tenant rights during conversions

· Preserve the supply and diversity of housing to meet the needs of changing demographics, such as smaller or older households

· Allow building owners to convert rental units while protecting current tenants

Many residents who seek help from the Housing Stability Coordinator are tenants at risk of eviction due to a pending conversion. This ordinance ensures there is time and support for these tenants to secure alternative housing, or, in some cases, purchase their unit.

recordTypes.name: Extension of Premises For Outdoor Dining
recordTypes.description:
The City of Salem Outdoor Dining Policy applies to restaurant businesses that
are seeking to extend their licensed premises to an outdoor public area including sidewalks,
streets and parking spaces, but shall not include a sidewalk in the city’s urban renewal
districts for which a permit from the Salem Redevelopment Authority (“SRA”) shall be
required. Occupancy of any outdoor dining area is prohibited until issuance of permit.

Extension of Premises for the Outdoor Dining season starts on the 1st Friday of May, and lasts until the 1st Monday in November.

recordTypes.name: Municipal Utilities Mark Out Request
recordTypes.description: Please allow a minimum of 3 business days for the mark out to take place.

recordTypes.name: Application for Hydrant Use or Temporary Water Line Connection
recordTypes.description: Temporary hydrant use, with associated Back Flow Preventer Device, is only allowed for demolition or short construction periods (less than 1 month). Temporary water use for construction purposes longer than 1 month, will be required a temporary connection.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application is necessary for any individual or corporation who are looking to have a temporary food  establishment in the City of Salem. This application asks for general business information, staffing, goods and services for the hereby stated food establishment. 

A Temporary Food Establishment is a food establishment that operates for a period of no more than 14 consecutive days in conjunction with a single event or celebration.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: To perform new construction, renovation, addition, or change in use of or occupancy.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This application form will collect information on the proposed electrical work to be done. Please fill out as completely as possible for expedient permitting.

This application is for review of a site plan regarding Life Safety initiatives proposed.

Life Safety Plan Review (LSPR) should only be selected for new construction. Any modification to an existing system requires a Fire Alarm System Shut Down or Sprinkler / Suppression Shut Down Permit.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is necessary for any individual or corporation who are looking to open (or renew) a food  establishment in the City of Salem. This application asks for general business information, staffing, goods and services, as well as the hours of operations for the hereby stated food establishment.

recordTypes.name: Extension of Premises For Outdoor Retail

If you have any questions about this application please contact Melissa Pagliaro (MPagliaro@salem.com)

recordTypes.name: Conservation Commission - WPA Form 3 - Notice of Intent
recordTypes.description: To protect the Commonwealth's wetland resources, the Massachusetts Wetlands Protection Act prohibits the removal, dredging, filling, or altering of wetlands without a permit. To obtain a permit (called an Order of Conditions), you must submit a Notice of Intent to the local Conservation Commission and MassDEP.

The Commission will then issue a Certificate of Compliance after confirming that the project has been completed in substantial compliance with the original Order of Conditions.

recordTypes.description:

Please allow up to one (1) week for this request to be processed.

recordTypes.description: Please fill out this application if you are disturbing the existing grade of land by more than two feet.

recordTypes.description: The Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation (ANRAD) provides a procedure for an applicant to confirm the delineation of a Bordering Vegetated Wetland (BVW).

recordTypes.description: Application for inspection for Fire and Life safety to renew Occupancy certificates. Inspection Certificates for establishments serving Liquor are now a separate record.
