recordTypes.description: This application is necessary for any work that requires exterior paint removal and a permit must be issued by the Board of Health prior to the paint removal process. Applicant, contractor, type of work, and clean up procedures will be assessed throughout the completion of this application.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Commission - WPA Form 7 - Extension Permit for Order of Conditions
recordTypes.description: The Extension Permit is used to extend the expiration date of the original Order of Conditions.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Registration with Certificate of Fitness
recordTypes.description:
Short-term rental(s) is defined as: The use of a residential unit for residential occupancy by a person or persons for a period of fewer than 30 consecutive calendar days for a fee. A short-term rental may or may not be facilitated through a booking agent.

The inspection checklist for the Certificate of Fitness can be found here: https://salemma.gov/DocumentCenter/View/8286/Certificate-of-Fitness-Inspection-Checklist

recordTypes.name: Final Water and Trash Computation Form
recordTypes.description:
Final Water/Sewer and Trash calculation forms are to be submitted by the realtor/seller of a property to calculate the final balance on the water/sewer and trash accounts, including charges that have not yet been billed but belong to the current owners.  Each property will be required to have the City Water Meter Technician to inspect the water meter to confirm it is functioning correctly and there is nothing that needs to be updated. Appointments for these inspections are to be scheduled on Tuesdays and Thursdays between 8:30 AM and 10:00AM.  

Please allow for at least 5 business days for your request to be processed.

IMPORTANT – TO AVOID DUPLICATE PAYMENT, CHECK WITH THE SELLER AND CITY IF THE PRIOR BALANCE WAS RECENTLY PAID. IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE SELLER TO STOP AUTO PAY & ELECTRONIC PAYMENTS

recordTypes.name: Building Department - Certificate of Inspection - Form 304 (Liquor Licensing)
recordTypes.description: Application for inspection for Fire and Life safety to renew Liquor Licenses

recordTypes.name: Hydrant Flow Test Application
recordTypes.description: The tests must be conducted in the presence of a designated Department of Public Services (DPS) employee who will operate the public hydrants and witness the test. Those requesting the test must hire their own testing personnel at their expense to perform the test and interpret the results. Applicant will also be responsible to operate any private property hydrants. Those requesting the testing will be responsible for ANY AND ALL damages

recordTypes.name: Funeral Director License
recordTypes.description: The Funeral Services profession, specifically the funeral director, provides services for the deceased and their families. Members of this profession prepare the bodies of the deceased through embalming, arrange for crematory services and provide services of assistance for family members of the deceased. To apply for a funeral director license, the accompanying form must be completely filled out.

recordTypes.name: Service Station / Repair Garage Permitting
recordTypes.description: Annual permits that are applicable to an automotive service or gas station or repair garage.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Commission - WPA Form 1 - Request for Determination of Applicability
recordTypes.description: The Request for Determination of Applicability provides applicants with the option of seeking a determination  whether the Wetlands Protection Act applies to a proposed site or activity.

recordTypes.name: Hot Works Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for Hotwork, cutting and/or welding; this application is for both annual permitting and also temporary instances. This application is not for service station needs.

recordTypes.name: Plaza Use Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Application to use Derby Square at 0 Derby Sq. and/or Charlotte Forten Park at 289 Derby St.

Applications MUST be submitted at least 60 days prior to the event date.  Applications submitted after this time may not be approved.

recordTypes.name: Hotel/Motel Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is dedicated towards individuals who are applying for a hotel and or motel operating license. This application focuses on the owners general information, information on the hereby claimed establishment, as well as general questions regarding the establishment. To qualify for a hotel/motel operating license you must fill this out.

recordTypes.name: Licensed Drainlayer Application
recordTypes.description: Application to be a City of Salem Licensed Drainlayer.

recordTypes.name: Flood Hazard Overlay District Application
recordTypes.description: The City of Salem requires a Flood Hazard Overlay District (FHOD) Approval for all proposed construction or other development in the floodplain overlay district. The floodplain overlay district is based on FEMA’s Special Flood Hazard Areas with a 1% annual chance of flooding.

recordTypes.name: Street Opening & Trench Application
recordTypes.description:
Refer to the Street Opening Rules & Regulations found on the salemma.gov "Information for Licensed Drain Layers" webpage.

Use this permit for: Boring(s), Test Pits, City Utilities (water/sewer/drain), Private Utilities (telecommunication, gas, electric), as well as trenches on private property.

recordTypes.name: Flammable & Combustible Materials Permit
recordTypes.description: Annual storage of flammables & combustibles unless temporary storage is noted.   Expires annually on April 30th

recordTypes.name: Planning Board Application
recordTypes.description:
This application form is for anyone with a project needing one of the below listed Permits from the Planning Board:
- Site Plan Review
- Special Permit - Drive Through
- Special Permit - Planned Unit Development
- Special Permit - North River Canal Corridor
- Special Permit - Land-Based Wind Energy
- Special Permit - Municipal and Religious Reuse
- Special Permit - Wireless Communications Facility

The included questions will guide you through which permits you need and assist you in filling out the forms.

If you need any assistance with the application process, please contact Planning Board staff in the City of Salem Department of Planning and Community Development.

*Please note that the below Subdivision applications are separate and available from the list of Planning Department permits:
- Form A - Approval Not Required
- Form B - Preliminary Subdivision Plan
- Form C - Definitive Subdivision Plan
- Waiver from Frontage Request
- Special Permit - Cluster Residential (only submitted with Subdivision applications)

recordTypes.name: Explosives, Fireworks, Model Rocketry, Cannon Mortar, Storage of Ammunition and Arms
recordTypes.description: Blasting Operations, Canon Mortar Firing, Model Rocketry, Fire Works

recordTypes.name: Planning Board - ANR/Form A Application
recordTypes.description:
Application for Endorsement of Plan Believed Not to Require Approval

In accordance with provisions of Section II-B of the Salem Subdivision Regulations, the applicant must file, by delivery or registered mail, a notice with the City Clerk stating the date of submission for such determination. The notice shall be attached to this application form. Seven (7) hard copies of the notice and application shall be brought by the applicant to the City Clerk to be “date stamped”.  The City Clerk will retain the original; the remaining six (6) hard copies of the notice and application, as well as six (6) hard copies of the Plan, and one (1) electronic copy of the notice, application, and plan, shall be filed in .pdf format with the Planning Board by the applicant. All hard-copy notices and applications shall be typewritten or neatly printed in ink.

recordTypes.name: Water Meter Sizing Worksheet
recordTypes.description: The Water Meter Sizing Worksheet is to be completed by a licensed plumber/design engineer to request to install a water meter larger than 5/8" at a property. This worksheet assists with the calculations to size the meter based on fixture demand. Water meters are not sized based on service pipe diameter. Once the worksheet is complete and submitted, the Engineering Department will review and confirm the meter size allowed for purchase.  5/8” Meters Do Not require a meter sizing worksheet to be completed. Meters and Meter Interface Units (MIUs) should be purchased from Ti-Sales directly.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is to request a permit for demolition activities. Please be aware that you will need to contact the Engineering Department regarding cut and cap of utilities and the use of hydrant water.  There may also be the need for paid fire watches during the demolition.

recordTypes.name: Catering License
recordTypes.description: To operate any type of food establishment such as a restaurant, you will need to obtain a catering license. The application is based on the general information of the catering establishment, menu, and a health notice. There is a one time event fee for $25 or a yearly fee of $200.

recordTypes.name: Private Well Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit assesses the type of well used, location, general contractor information, as well as insurance information. The word, "well", as used in these regulations, shall include any pit, pipe, excavation, casing, drill hole or other private source of water to be used for the purpose of supplying potable water in the City of Salem, Massachusetts.

recordTypes.name: Truss Construction Placard
recordTypes.description: This provides the ability for an owner to purchase the Truss Placard(s) to post on a building that has Truss construction. Please coordinate with Fire Prevention to pick up the requested Placards (978-745-7777).

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: All exterior signs, awnings, and interior signs that can be seen from the exterior are required to have a City of Salem Sign Permit before a sign can be fabricated and installed. Department of Planning and Community Development are reviewers on all Sign Permit Applications and the Permit is issued by the Building Department.

recordTypes.name: Summer Camp Inspection
recordTypes.description: Fire safety inspection for summer camps

recordTypes.name: Tobacco License
recordTypes.description: This license is required for any individual or organization that sells the use of Tobacco and its bi-products in the City of Salem. This form must be completely filled out for consideration of the hereby license and the applicant with have to undergo the accompanying inspections for license approval.

recordTypes.name: 21E Site Assessment Archive Request
recordTypes.description:
This application is to have an archive search requested for a known location in the City of Salem. Please identify all distinct locations in the address field.

Life Safety Plan Review should only be selected for new construction. Any modification to an existing system requires a fire alarm or sprinkler shut down permit.

recordTypes.name: Street Permit/Sidewalk (Dumpster & Storage) Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to place a dumpster or Storage POD on street or a dumpster off street. This is managed the Building Department or Fire Prevention based on proposed location of object.

recordTypes.name: Historical Commission - Certificate of Appropriateness or Non-Applicability
recordTypes.description:
A Certificate of Appropriateness is required for changes visible from a public way. A representative from the commission will determine that which is visible or not visible. 

A Certificate of Non-Applicability is a way of ratifying that a Certificate of Appropriateness is not required for the work being performed. This certificate, along with the pictures to be taken, protects the property owner from questions about changes have been made without authorization.

recordTypes.name: Septage Hauler License
recordTypes.description: This form establishes the standards for the servicing of private sewage systems and the disposal of wastewater from these sources while protecting the public health and protecting the surface and ground waters of the state from contamination.

recordTypes.name: Abandoned & Foreclosed Properties Registration
recordTypes.description: All owners, including banks and mortgage companies, must register abandoned and/or foreclosing residential and commercial properties with the Director of Inspectional Services. Once the property is no longer abandoned or is sold, the owner must provide proof of sale or written notice of occupancy to the Director of the Inspectional Services.

recordTypes.name: Abandoned & Foreclosed Properties De-Registration
recordTypes.description: All owners, including banks and mortgage companies, must register abandoned and/or foreclosing residential and commercial properties with the Director of Inspectional Services. Once the property is no longer abandoned or is sold, the owner must provide proof of sale or written notice of occupancy to the Director of the Inspectional Services.

recordTypes.name: Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit specifies the use and building of pools, wading pools, hot tubs, and saunas. Drainage, water treatment and supervision details are required for each type of pool or spa while filling out this permit form.

recordTypes.name: Historical Commission - Waiver of the Demolition Delay Ordinance
recordTypes.description:
No permit for demolition of an existing building or structure that is listed or eligible for listing on the National Register of Historic Places or that is located in an established historic district, created pursuant to this Code, or that is 50 or more years old shall be granted unless it is first submitted to the Historical Commission for review and comment. 

NOTE: Under the ordinance, the definition of demolition includes the following actions: any act of pulling down, destroying, removing or razing any of the following: 50% of all exterior walls of a building including framing, windows, doors, exterior finishes and details; or 50% of exterior walls of a building that are visible from a public way, or 50% of all roof structures of a building; or 50% of roof assemblies of a building that are viewable from a public way; or enclosure or alteration of more than 50% of the exterior walls of a building so that they no longer function as exterior walls.

recordTypes.name: Body Art & Piercing License
recordTypes.description: All persons who perform body art are required to register through the use of this application. Body art includes tattooing, permanent cosmetics, branding, and body piercing. The Salem Board of Health Body Art Regulations should be read and understood, prior to filling the permit application out.

recordTypes.name: Tanning Facility License
recordTypes.description: This license is relevant towards facilities that use any equipment used for tanning the skin that emits ultraviolet radiation, including, but not limited to, a tanning booth, tanning bed or sunlamp which includes high pressure tanning lamps. Tanning devices also include any accompanying equipment, including, but not limited to, protective eyewear, timers and handrails.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for a project to be proposed to the Zoning Board for review and decision.

recordTypes.name: Day Camp License
recordTypes.description: This license is for the right to operate a children's recreational camp that operates at least four days a week while supervising school-age children. This application shall state the location and type of camp, the approximate maximum number of persons by whom it is used, the probable duration of occupancy, the proposed sources of water and food supply for the camp, and all members of staff accountable.

recordTypes.name: SRA-Urban Renewal Area - Small Project Review
recordTypes.description: All development projects proposed in the Urban Renewal Area are required to undergo a review process by the Salem Redevelopment Authority (SRA) prior to any work being started.  Development projects begin and end the review process before the SRA.  The Small Project Review is intended for projects that do not include (1) a change to the existing structure's footprint, and/or (2) the addition of square footage to the structure.

recordTypes.name: SRA-Urban Renewal Area - Development Project, Final Design Review
recordTypes.description: All development projects in the Urban Renewal Area that include (1) a change to the existing structure's footprint and/or (2) the addition of square footage to the existing structure or lot, are required to undergo a two-step review process with the Salem Redevelopment Authority (SRA) and the Design Review Board (DRB) prior to any work being started. Final Design Review is intended to secure agreement on and approval of the final design and the complete proposal for redevelopment.

recordTypes.name: Perc Test
recordTypes.description: A percolation test is a test to determine the water absorption rate of soil in preparation for the building of a septic drain field or infiltration basin. The results of a percolation test are required to properly design a septic system. Any applicant interested needs to thoroughly fill out the accompanying form.

recordTypes.name: SRA-Urban Renewal Area - Development Project, Schematic Design Review
recordTypes.description: All development projects in the Urban Renewal Area that include (1) a change to the existing structure's footprint and/or (2) the addition of square footage to the existing structure or lot, are required to undergo a two-step review process with the Salem Redevelopment Authority (SRA) and the Design Review Board (DRB) prior to any work being started.  Schematic Design Review is intended to secure agreement on and approval of the basic design concept prior to extensive work by the development team.

Electrical Department
categories.content:
Mission Statement

The Mission of Salem Electrical Department, is the management, maintenance, repair, and  security of the City's Street lights, decorative lights, park and public building lights. The aluminum cobra head pole & lights are maintained by National Grid. The traffic signals and controllers, fire alarm street boxes and cables, are also the responsibility of the departments signal maintainers.

The Department receives and grants electrical permits, and sch

categories.name: Engineering Department
categories.content: The City of Salem's Engineering Department provides technical expertise, guidance and plan review to various city boards/commissions and other departments for public infrastructure improvements and private development projects.  The Engineering Department provides technical expertise related to connections to, and extensions of, the municipal water distribution system, wastewater collection system and stormwater management system as well as coordination o

categories.name: Fire Prevention
categories.content:
Mission Statement

The primary mission of the Salem Fire Department is to provide a range of programs designed to protect the lives and property of the citizens of the City of Salem from the adverse effects of fires, sudden medical emergencies or exposure to dangerous conditions created by either man or nature.

categories.name: Geographic Information System (GIS) Team
categories.content: Please use the following application to request a GIS product from the city.

categories.name: Health Department
categories.content:
Mission Statement

The mission of the Salem Health Department is to deliver public health services to residents, businesses and visitors to benefit the culturally diverse population of the City of Salem. Public health includes preventing and monitoring disease, providing health education and enforcing public health codes and regulations. This mission is accomplished through the core values of public health which are to prevent, promote, and protect.

categories.name: Inspectional Services
categories.content:
Mission Statement:

Our Mission is to provide the residents of our community quality service in a timely manner, and to provide answers to questions regarding building and zoning issues. To conduct inspections and enforcement actions so as to protect and safeguard all residents and visitors to our city, and to evaluate, maintain, and repair those Public Properties within our charge.

Responsibilities:

Public Properties - responsible for numerous buildings

categories.name: Licensing Board
Mayor's Office
categories.content: The Office of the Mayor is responsible for ensuring that visitors, businesses, and residents of Salem receive the highest quality of services and assistance available to them, within the jurisdiction of the Office. The Mayor’s Office is accountable to all individuals and municipal employees within the City of Salem and provides constituent services in a concise and business-friendly manner.

categories.name: Planning & Community Development
categories.content:
DPCD General Information

Preserving our past, building our future

The Department of Planning and Community Development (DPCD) is responsible for a wide range of activities and duties, including economic development, land use planning, housing policy, transportation projects, historic preservation, open space conservation programs, and neighborhood improvement efforts. DPCD administers several programs to promote homeownership and economic development, i

categories.name: Traffic and Parking

recordTypes.name: Permanent Dumpster / Rubbish Container Permit (Renewable)
recordTypes.description: A Renewable Dumpster / Rubbish Container Permit is for continuous usage in excess of one (1) year. This permit is renewable annually. This is commonly referred to as a "Permanent" Dumpster Permit.

The purpose of the Temporary Dumpster Permit is for one time clean-out(s), construction purposes or special events. This permit is non-renewable and expires after one (1) year.

In the event your Dumpster is placed on a public street or sidewalk, you will also be required to apply for a DPWP Engineering Permit (For Street Obstruction).

recordTypes.name: Flammable & Combustible Material Storage Permit
recordTypes.description:
A Flammable & Combustible Material Permit is required for individuals or companies storing flammable and combustible material on-site.
Common example of a typical non-temporary permit use case is a commercial repair garage that stores gasoline, oils, solvents, or other flammable liquids as part of routine, year-round operations.

recordTypes.name: Tanning Facility License
recordTypes.description: Health

recordTypes.name: Temporary Flammable & Combustible Material Storage Permit
recordTypes.description:
A Flammable & Combustible Material Permit is required for individuals or companies storing flammable and combustible material on-site.

A Temporary Permit is appropriate when flammable or combustible materials are stored only for a short-term project or event. Common examples include:

Construction sites storing diesel or other flammable/combustible liquids for daily activity during construction, with all materials removed once the project is complete.

Special events using a large generator with an integrated diesel tank that is removed after the event ends.


Because the materials are present only temporarily, a Temporary Permit is required.

recordTypes.description: Town of Chatham Department of Public Works 221 Crowell Road Chatham, MA 02633 Tel: (508) 945-5155 (508) 945-5150 Fax: (508) 945-5152 www.chatham-ma.gov Pipe inside House House Meter Irrigation Meter Procedure for Installation of Irrigation Meter 1.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Application - Chatham
recordTypes.description:
Regulations for Short Term Rentals (STR) were approved by the Board of Health, effective July 1, 2023. 

We are now accepting registrations for short-term rentals occurring between March 1, 2026, and February 27, 2027. If you have previously registered your rental, please log in to your account and follow the steps to renew your registration.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Review
recordTypes.description:
Administrative Review applications are for small scale projects that will not cause impact to the resource area.
Approval of these applications is at the discretion of the Conservation Agent. To discuss potentially approvable activities under an Administrative Review please contact the Conservation Agent.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Application - Chatham
recordTypes.description: To be filled out by any establishment/organization which deals in any form of food products including milk, cream and frozen desserts.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for additions, alterations, renovations, new construction and swimming pools

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Express
recordTypes.description: This application is used for ONLY roofing, siding, windows, doors, weatherization, fire alarms and SOLAR installations. Please use the Building Permit Application for any alterations, additions or new construction of a structure.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Establishment Permit Application - Chatham
recordTypes.description: In accordance with the Federal Food Code and the Town of Chatham Minimum Sanitation Standards for Food Establishment,  a temporary food establishment shall comply with all applicable requirements of the Federal 2013 Food Code, and a permit must be obtained for such temporary operations.

recordTypes.name: Bathing Beach Application - Chatham
recordTypes.description: In accordance with 105 CMR 445.000:  DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH MINIMUM STANDARDS FOR BATHING BEACHES (STATE SANITARY CODE, CHAPTER VII): A permit is required to operate a public or semi pubic beach. No person shall commence the operation of, or continue to operate, a bathing beach unless the operator is the holder of a valid permit issued by the Board of Health or the Department.

recordTypes.name: Building Move Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit is required for the moving of a building over a public or private way. 
Structure being relocated within the same lot do NOT require a Building Move Permit

recordTypes.name: Complaint Form
recordTypes.description: This form is to be used to submit and track complaints.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for complete or substantial demolition of a building and/or accessory building. For partial and interior demolition use the Building Permit application.

recordTypes.name: Bay Scallop Opening Facility Application- Chatham
Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Applicant must be a licensed professional. This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: Farmers Market Vendor Permit Application- Chatham
recordTypes.description: In  accordance with the Federal Food Code and the Town of Chatham Minimum Sanitation Standards for Food Establishment All vendors at any Chatham Farmers Market must apply for a Food Service Permit. This is a retail only market, no food preparation allowed at the site. Please contact the Health Department directly if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Exterior Mechanical System Appliance Registration
recordTypes.description: This registration is required to install, enlarge or replace an exterior mechanical system appliance.  The property owner or owner’s agent can apply for this registration.  This registration is issued by the Building Commissioner.  Separate electrical, plumbing and or gas permits may be required to be submitted by a licensed contractor.

recordTypes.name: Hotels & Motels - Chatham
recordTypes.description: In accordance with MGL Chapter 140 all Inns/Hotels/Motels and Cottages must be licensed annually by the local authorities and  must be inspected annually for sanitation, fire and building code requirements.

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: Applicant must be a licensed professional. This permit is required when gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances.

recordTypes.name: Inn Holder/B&B Room Inspections - Chatham
recordTypes.description: In accordance with the Town of Chatham Rules and Regulations, and those of the Building and Fire Codes and Standards, all Inns, Bed and Breakfast establishments, rooming houses and workforce housing licensed within the Town must be inspected annually for sanitation, fire and building code requirements.

recordTypes.name: Outdoor Display or Sale of Goods
recordTypes.description:
This permit is not for an outdoor display or sale of goods unless it specifically meeting the Bylaw Section below.

Under the Town of Chatham’s General Bylaw Section 208-24.D.1, a permit is required from the Director of Community Development for the display of a single item (or grouping of items) for placement on, upon or against the outer wall or door of the commercial establishment within the downtown business district.  The downtown business district is in the geographical area within an area of 250 feet on either side of Main Street from the western side of the rotary to Mulford Howes Lane.  The location of the proposed display must meet the provisions of Section III.D.3.e of the Protective Zoning Bylaw.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool - Chatham
recordTypes.description: In accordance with the State Sanitary Code, 105 CMR 435. 021 no person shall operate or maintain any swimming, wading or special purpose pool without obtaining a permit from the Board of Health.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Applicant must be a licensed professional. A permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.

recordTypes.name: Septic Haulers - Chatham
recordTypes.description:
In accordance with M.G.L. C 111, Sections 31B, 310 CMR 15.502 (Title 5) and Board of Health Onsite Wastewater Regulations, the undersigned makes application to the Board of Health for permission to remove and transport septage and the content of privies and cesspools.

Pumpers/Haulers licenses expire on December 31st each year.

recordTypes.name: Refuse Haulers -Chatham
recordTypes.description:
Town of Chatham Board of Health regulations governing the solid waste disposal facility:
Sect. 8.1
LICENSE  No person shall transport commercially collected household/residential refuse, non-household/commercial refuse, bulky waste, or any other garbage or rubbish materials on the streets of the Town of Chatham or into the Facility without a license from the Board of Health. Licenses shall be renewed annually in January and renewal shall be contingent on an inspec­tion of the vehicles used for transportation of refuse

recordTypes.name: Shed Registration
recordTypes.description: This registration is required for sheds 200 square feet or less

recordTypes.name: Septic Installer - Chatham
recordTypes.description: DISPOSAL SYSTEM INSTALLER'S PERMIT -In accordance with the Town of Chatham Minimum Requirements for the Subsurface Disposal of Sanitary Sewage, no person or firm shall engage in the construction, expansion or upgrade of an on-site subsurface sewage disposal system without first obtaining a Disposal System Installers Permit from the Board of Health or its Agent.

recordTypes.name: Sheet Metal Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a sheet metal worker is manufacturing, fabricating, assembling, handling, erecting, installing, dismantling, alteration and/or repairing duct work, commercial fans, kitchen hoods and vents, architectural sheet metal and metal roofing.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for temporary and permanent permit applications for signage.  Please note that if you are located within the Historic Business District additional approvals may be required.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco Sales Permit Application - Chatham
recordTypes.description: To monitor compliance of the sale of tobacco products, the Chatham Board of Health will issue a Tobacco Sales Permit in accordance with the Tobacco Control Regulation.  No person, firm, corporation, establishment or agency, shall sell tobacco products within the Town of Chatham without a valid tobacco sales permit issued by the Board of Health.  Permits must be posted in a manner conspicuous to the public. Tobacco sales permits must be renewed annually. A tobacco sales permit is non-transferable. Each applicant for a Tobacco Sales Permit is required to show proof of a current tobacco sales license issued by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts Department of Revenue.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Facility - Chatham
recordTypes.description: Body Art Licenses are renewable annually on January 1st.

recordTypes.name: Solid Fuel Burning Appliance (i.e. Woodstove, Pellet Stove, etc.)
recordTypes.description: This application is used for the installation of solid fuel burning appliances.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Practitioner - Chatham
recordTypes.description: Body Art Licenses are renewable annually on January 1st.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Storage Structure
recordTypes.description: This registration is required for temporary storage structures 200 square feet or less

recordTypes.name: Recreational Camps - Chatham
recordTypes.description: In accordance with the State Sanitary Code 105 CMR 430.000 an applicant for a Recreational Camp For Children shall file an application with the Board of Health prior to desired opening date. A plan review packet must be submitted with the application, and onsite inspection is required at the time of the camp operation.

recordTypes.name: Tent Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for all tent 400 SF or greater

recordTypes.name: Funeral Director License
recordTypes.description:
In accordance with MGL Title XVI, Chapter 114, Section 449:
 
The board of health of each town shall annually, on or before May first, license persons to act as funeral directors therein. All such licenses shall expire April thirtieth each year, unless sooner suspended or revoked. Such licenses shall be issued only to persons certified to the boards of health by said board of registration, before May first each year, as qualified to be licensed as funeral directors.

recordTypes.name: Service Request Form
recordTypes.description: Request NAED to allow the applicant to install a new electrical service or alter the existing electrical service to any residential, commercial, industrial or municipal property in the Town of North Attleborough.

recordTypes.name: Business Certificate Registration
recordTypes.description:
A Business Certificate is required for :
Any person, whether individually or as a partnership, conducting business under any title other than the complete real name of the owner(s) as well as any corporation doing business in a name other than its corporate name.
Upon discontinuing, retiring or withdrawing from such business, or in the case of a change of location where the business is conducted, a form must be filed with the office of the Town Clerk.

recordTypes.name: Historical Building Demolition Application
recordTypes.description: Demolition Permit Requests for properties 80 years or older.

recordTypes.name: Auto Dealer Class I & Class ll
recordTypes.description: The North Attleborough Licensing Board as the Local Licensing Authority, issues Class I & Class II Auto Dealer Licenses in accordance with M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 57, 58, and 59.  All auto dealers selling new, used/pre-owned vehicles, must have a license to operate in the Town of North Attleborough. New Class I & Class II Auto Dealer license applications and annual renewals are processed by the Licensing Board.

recordTypes.name: Farmer’s Market Organizer Permit
recordTypes.description: Farmer’s Market Vendor permit in accordance with the provisions of the most current MDPH Food Protection Program Policies, Procedures and/or Guideline RF-08 relating thereto, 105 CMR 590.000, and the standards of the North Attleborough Board of Health.

recordTypes.name: Licensed Utility Installer Application
recordTypes.description: License to perform work on water, sewer and drain infrastructure in the Town of North Attleborough.

recordTypes.name: Drain Connection Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to connect a private drain to the Town’s Drainage system.

recordTypes.name: Water and Sewer Service Cut & Cap Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to cut & cap a water and/or sewer service connection. You must be a Utility Installer licensed by the Town of North Attleborough Board of Public Works to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Street/Sidewalk Occupancy Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for the occupation and/or excavation of the streets and sidewalks within the streets and way under the jurisdiction of the Department of Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Body Art License
recordTypes.description: License to perform Body Art, Body Piercing, or Cosmetic Tattooing in a permitted establishment. Please use this application for Practitioner and Apprentice Licenses.

recordTypes.name: Cannabis Dispensary License
recordTypes.description: Application to License a Cannabis Dispensary with the Town of North Attleborough Licensing Board.

recordTypes.name: Outdoor Event Permit
recordTypes.description: Outdoor Event Permit for Carnivals, Road Races/Walks, Parades, Concert Series, and other Outdoor Events.

recordTypes.name: Farm Winery License to Sell at a Farmers Market & Agricultural Event
recordTypes.description: The North Attleborough Licensing Board as the Local Licensing Authority issues a Farm Winery License to Sell at a Farmers Market & Agricultural Event in accordance with M.G.L. Chapter 138, Section 15F and M.G.L. Chapter 138, Section 19B.

recordTypes.name: Bodywork Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to operate a Bodywork establishment

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, and major repairs to existing buildings including commercial, and one and two family buildings. Please note: for demolition - use new, separate Demolition Permit. To apply for a Tent Permit, please use the Carnivals, Special Event, and Tent Permit.

recordTypes.name: Trench Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime a trench hole or other excavation is being done to a depth of 3 (three) feet or more.  If this application is in connection with a road opening permit, please attach copy of road opening permit.

recordTypes.name: Water Permit (excluding Cut & Cap)
recordTypes.description: Permit to install, extend, repair or replace a water main or water service connection.

recordTypes.name: Outdoor Dining Permit
recordTypes.description: Request inspections pursuant to reopening of outdoor dining.

recordTypes.name: Bi-Directional Amplifier - Permit to Install or Maintain
Bodywork Practitioner License
recordTypes.description: License to practice bodywork in North Attleborough

recordTypes.name: Congregate Living Registration
recordTypes.description:
Yearly registration for Boarding/Lodging/Rooming Homes, Group Homes, Sober Houses, and Halfway/Recovery Houses.
Please be aware that this facility registration does not replace the State required Periodic Inspection.

recordTypes.name: Water Main Extension Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Water Main Extension Plan Review ONLY

recordTypes.name: Coin-Operated Amusement Device License (including game and photo devices)
recordTypes.description: A Coin-Operated Amusement Device license is required for each Coin-Operated Amusement Device (juke box, arcade game, etc.) offered for the use of the public in the Town of North Attleborough.

recordTypes.name: Common Victualler's License (no alcohol)
recordTypes.description: A Common Victualler's License is required for any establishment that serves food or drink to the public, under M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 2. The Licensing Board processes all requests for new CV Licenses, amendments to existing licenses and annual renewal of CV Licenses. New CV License applications require 30-60 days lead time.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit (excluding Cut & Cap)
recordTypes.description: Permit to install, extend, repair or replace a sewer main or sewer service connection.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is to be used when you are razing / demolishing an existing building or structure larger than 25’ square feet, in its entirety.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy Inspection
recordTypes.description: Used to obtain a certificate of occupancy for a NEW residence, NEW commercial property, or for re-occupancy of a commercial property by a new occupant.  This inspection is not used for residential property being sold or transferred.

recordTypes.name: Catering
recordTypes.description: Permit for an establishment that prepares food (at a permitted location outside of North Attleborough) and serves the food to the consumer at a specified location.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment/Retail Food - Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: Review of plans for all new food service, new retail food or any/all renovations to current permit holders for Food or Retail establishments.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Inspection requests - Annual/Semi Annual/Quarterly
recordTypes.description: Used for inspection of commercial properties.  Not used for new business, or residential inspections.

recordTypes.name: Sprinkler/Fire Suppression/Fire Alarm System Permit
recordTypes.description: Select this permit if you are proposing any new or any modifications to a firm alarm system, fire suppression system or sprinkler system within an residential or commercial structure.

recordTypes.name: Entertainment Equipment License (including pool tables, pinball machines, and bowling alleys)
recordTypes.description: An Entertainment Equipment License is required under M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 177 to keep a pool table or a bowling alley to be used for amusement merely and not for the purpose of gaming for money or for property.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Main Extension Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Plan review for Sewer Main Extension ONLY

recordTypes.name: Fortune Teller, Card and Palm Reading License
recordTypes.description: A Fortune Teller, Card and Palm Reading License is required to tell fortunes for money under M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 185I. Said license shall be granted only to applicants who have resided continuously in the city or town in which the license is sought for at least twelve months immediately preceding the date of the application.

recordTypes.name: Hydrant Meter Assembly Rental Application
recordTypes.description: Permit to access the public water supply by temporary hydrant meter assembly.

recordTypes.name: Sheet Metal Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a sheet metal worker is manufacturing, fabricating, assembling, handling, erecting, installing, dismantling, altering and/or repairing duct work, commercial fans, kitchen hoods and vents, architectural sheet metal and metal roofing.

recordTypes.name: Food Service
recordTypes.description: Permit for an establishment that prepares, packages, serves or vends food directly to the consumer, such as a restaurant, bar, club, church, school, etc.

recordTypes.name: Form 1 - Fuel Oil Burning Equipment (FP-056)
recordTypes.description: Application for Permit, Permit, and Certificate of Completion for the Installation or Alteration of Fuel Oil Burning Equipment and the Storage of Fuel Oil

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: Health/Fitness Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to own and operate a fitness center or gym.

recordTypes.name: Junk Dealer's License
recordTypes.description: A Junk Dealer's License is required under M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 54, to solicit for, be a collector of, or be a dealer in antiques, second-hand goods and/or junk in the Town of North Attleborough.

recordTypes.name: Hydrant Flow Test Application
recordTypes.description: Permit to use Town fire hydrants for the purpose of conducting a hydrant flow test.

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when natural gas/propane gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Open Burning Permit
recordTypes.description: Open Burning Permit Application

recordTypes.name: Hotels & Motels
recordTypes.description: Permit to own and operate a Motel, Hotel, or Inn.

recordTypes.name: Live Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: A Live Entertainment License is required under M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 183A.  The application for such a license shall state the type of entertainment to be licensed i.e., live music, performers, dancing by patrons etc.

recordTypes.name: Lodging House License
recordTypes.description: A Lodging House License is required under M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 22.  This license is granted for an establishment that is a house where lodgings are let to  four or more persons not within second degree of kindred to the person conducting/owning it.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Housing Community (Mobile Home Park)
recordTypes.description: Permit to own and operate a Mobile Home Park

recordTypes.name: Standard Permit (FP-006)
recordTypes.description: Commonwealth of Massachusetts "Application for Standard Permit"  (Form FP-006).  A list of permit categories is provided during the application process.  This permit type is not used for residential real estate transfers. **For NEW Sprinkler, Fire Suppression, and Fire Alarm Permits, please use the "Sprinkler/Fire Suppression/Fire Alarm System" Permit under the Building Department. For Flammable Storage, please use the "Storage of Flammables" permit on this page.**

recordTypes.name: Housing Inspection
recordTypes.description: Application for a rental voucher program housing inspection in compliance with the provisions of the Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation of the State Sanitary Code, Chapter II (105 CMR 410.000), made under authority of M.G.L. c.111 §§ 3 & 127A.

recordTypes.name: Periodic Inspection Certification
recordTypes.description: Periodic Inspections in accordance with the provisions of the Massachusetts State Building Code 780 CMR Section 110.7.

recordTypes.name: On Premises Alcoholic Beverage License - Section 12 & CV License
recordTypes.description: The Licensing Board  is the Local Licensing Authority (LLA) for granting alcohol licenses under Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 138; Section 12 (On-Premise) and has sole authority for the issuance and regulation of all such alcoholic beverage licenses within the Town. The Licensing Division processes all requests for new On-Premise alcohol licenses, amendments to existing licenses and annual renewal of alcohol licenses. New Alcohol license applications require 30-60 days lead time to allow for legal advertising, abutters notification and a public hearing before the Licensing Board.

recordTypes.description:
Access to the Transfer Station is limited to vehicles with a valid sticker issued by the Town. 

Stickers must be permanently affixed on the lower driver-side windshield so as not to obstruct the view, please see the diagram here, which is not to scale. 

Stickers must include the license plate # of the vehicle. 

Stickers are non-transferable and must remain on the vehicle for which it was purchased.

For any questions, please contact the DPW Office at dpwoffice@medfield.net or (508)906-3003.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs to existing non residential buildings.

recordTypes.name: Definitive Subdivision
recordTypes.description: File a Definitive Subdivision application when you are dividing land into two or more lots and at least one lot will not have the required frontage on a qualifying way or you need to create/extend a street or municipal utilities. Massachusetts’ Subdivision Control Law (MGL c.41) defines “subdivision” and its frontage exceptions. If every new lot has required frontage on a qualifying way, submit an ANR (Approval Not Required) plan instead.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs for residential buildings.

recordTypes.name: Special Permit - ZBA (includes dual SP/variance application)
recordTypes.description: ZBA Special Permit: Apply when the Medfield Zoning Bylaw—most often the Table of Use Regulations—shows “SP (ZBA)” for your proposed use or activity. Typical projects include altering or intensifying a lawful nonconforming use/structure, installing residential sports courts, operating certain home businesses, and—in limited cases—creating an Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU). This is not a variance or a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Special Permit - Planning Board
recordTypes.description: In Medfield, apply for a Planning Board Special Permit when your project (a) converts a single-family home to a two-family or builds a new two-family in the RU district with lot coverage of 15% or more, or (b) proposes a multifamily dwelling in the RU district. Most other special permits in the bylaw are issued by the Zoning Board of Appeals, while many institutional and commercial uses require Planning Board site plan approval rather than a PB special permit. Applicants should check the Table of Use Regulations (300 – Attachment 1) for their use and zoning district to confirm whether their filing is PB Special Permit (SPPB), PB site plan (PB), or ZBA Special Permit (SP).

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs to existing non residential buildings.

recordTypes.name: Approval Not Required Plan
recordTypes.description: An Approval Not Required (ANR) Plan is a type of subdivision plan under Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 41, Section 81P that does not require formal subdivision approval from the Planning Board. An ANR plan may be submitted when a property owner wishes to divide land into new lots that each have the required frontage on an existing public way, a way previously approved by the Planning Board, or a way determined by the Board to be adequate for access. Because the plan does not create a “subdivision” under state law, the Planning Board’s role is limited to confirming that the lots have sufficient frontage and access, and the plan is endorsed as “Approval Not Required.” Applicants will need to file an ANR plan when dividing land in a way that complies with frontage and access requirements, without creating new roads or infrastructure that would otherwise trigger a full subdivision review.

recordTypes.name: Scenic Road Application (Tree/Wall removal or modification)
Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Change of Use Determination
recordTypes.description: A Change of Use Determination must be requested when a property owner wants to alter a non-residential use — for example, introducing food trucks, outdoor vending, or a new commercial activity — that may affect zoning compliance. Under Section 300-14.12 of Medfield’s Zoning Bylaw, the Planning Board reviews such changes to determine whether Site Plan Approval is required. The Board evaluates various impacts including hours of operation, traffic, circulation, parking, noise, odors, trash, signage, and property owner authorization (especially for mobile food vendors). Based on that review, the Planning Board issues an official Change of Use Determination — either confirming that the proposed use may proceed as-of-right, or requiring formal Site Plan Approval if the change poses significant impacts per zoning standards.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Approval
recordTypes.description:
A Site Plan Approval is required for many new developments, expansions, or changes of use involving non-residential or multifamily properties in Medfield. Under the Zoning Bylaw, the Planning Board reviews site plans to ensure projects are designed and operated in a way that protects public health, safety, and neighborhood character. The Board considers factors such as traffic and circulation, parking, stormwater and drainage, landscaping, lighting, noise, building placement, and compatibility with surrounding uses.
Certain educational and religious uses are protected by the Dover Amendment (M.G.L. Chapter 40A, §3), which limits how municipalities may regulate them. While zoning restrictions on these uses are narrower, projects proposed under the Dover Amendment are still subject to Planning Board Site Plan Approval to address site design and operational impacts.
Applicants should file for Site Plan Approval when their project involves significant new construction, exterior expansion, or a change of use that could affect surrounding properties or town services.

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when natural gas/propane gas piping is installed, altered, added to, or repaired, including the installation of gas-fired appliances. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: *Smoke and Carbon Monoxide 26F & 26F 1/2 Inspection
recordTypes.description: Use this form to request a smoke and carbon monoxide inspection for the sale or transfer of a residential property.

recordTypes.name: Appeals to the Building Commissioner
recordTypes.description: Appeal of Building Commissioner Decision (M.G.L. c. 40A, §§ 8 & 15): Use this when a person aggrieved wishes to challenge an order, requirement, decision, enforcement action, or denial/inability to obtain a permit issued by the Building Commissioner/Zoning Enforcement Officer. File a notice of appeal within 30 days with the Town Clerk (state your grounds); the ZBA hears and decides these appeals. Not a special permit or variance application.

recordTypes.name: Sheet Metal Permit/Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is used to install Sheet Metal/Mechanical work.

recordTypes.name: Variance ONLY (No Special Permit)
recordTypes.description: Variance (M.G.L. c. 40A, §10): Apply only when strict application of the zoning bylaw (e.g., setbacks, lot area, frontage, height) would cause substantial hardship due to unique soil conditions, shape, or topography of your lot. Relief may be granted only if it can be given without substantial detriment to the public good and without nullifying or derogating from the bylaw’s intent. Variances are rare and not for personal preference or self-created hardship; this is not a Special Permit or a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Comprehensive Permit
recordTypes.description: A Comprehensive Permit (commonly called a 40B Permit) is a single, streamlined approval issued by the Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA) for housing developments that include affordable units under Massachusetts Chapter 40B. Instead of applying separately to multiple boards, applicants may use this process if at least 20–25% of the proposed units are restricted as affordable to households earning at or below 80% of the area median income. The ZBA reviews the project and may grant relief from local zoning or other requirements if needed to make the development feasible, while ensuring that health, safety, environmental, and design standards are met. A Comprehensive Permit is required when a developer seeks to build multifamily, mixed-income, or senior housing that does not fully comply with local zoning but qualifies under Chapter 40B. This process is intended to encourage the creation of affordable housing in communities where less than 10% of the housing stock is affordable.

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Subdivision
recordTypes.description: File a Preliminary Subdivision Plan to get early, non-binding feedback on your street and lot layout before preparing a Definitive Plan. It’s required for non-residential subdivisions and optional (but encouraged) for residential. Submit the plan to the Planning Board and Board of Health and give written notice to the Town Clerk at the time of submission.

recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description:
Dogs over the age of six months must be licensed. The license period is a calendar year (January 1- December 31). Proof of a current rabies shot is required. Late fines begin on March 1st. 
Before you begin make sure you have your Rabies Certificate available.

recordTypes.name: Burn Permit FP-006
recordTypes.description: Open Burn Permits are valid for single days only and are available from January 15th to May 1st; burn hours are from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Campground
recordTypes.description: Campground licenses are renewable annually on July 1st.

recordTypes.description: All  common victuallers, as defined in Massachusetts General Laws (MGL) Chapter 140, as amended, conducting business in the Town of Tisbury must be licensed by the Select Board.

recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Entertainment Licenses to establishments that have theatrical exhibitions, public shows, public amusements and exhibitions of every description (including televisions). This application is only for entertainment Monday-Saturday.

recordTypes.name: Planning Board Special Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to apply for a Special Permit from the Tisbury Planning Board. After completing this online application, you must print out three copies of your completed application and bring it to the Tisbury Town Clerk to get it date and time stamped, and then bring two copies to the Planning Board before your application is considered accepted. You must also pay the required fee online or in person.

recordTypes.name: Food Truck License
recordTypes.description:
This License applies to mobile food vendors and food trucks which operate for more than 4 days per calendar year in the Town of Tisbury. You can find the Food Truck Regulations here:

You must have a hawkers/peddler’s state license prior to applying for the town license.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Practitioner
recordTypes.description: Body Art Licenses are renewable annually on January 1st.

recordTypes.description: You need to apply for a license if you plan to operate a retail rental car business within the Town of Tisbury.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Petition
recordTypes.description: Use this Petition form to request a special permit, variance, or appeal of a decision by the Building/Zoning Inspector from the Zoning Board of Appeals.

recordTypes.name: Taxi License
recordTypes.description:
The Tisbury Select Board voted at a public meeting on April 10, 2024, as follows: A motion was duly made and seconded to set the limit of the taxi licenses at 7 licenses and no more than 8 taxicab permits per license.  The vote was unanimous. 
Due to this motion no new additional taxi license will be issued. You can still apply for renewals and transfers. 
Please call the Select Board office for a status update.

recordTypes.name: Notice of Intent (NOI)
recordTypes.description:
Purpose of the Notice of Intent (NOI) 
To protect the Commonwealth's wetland resources, the Massachusetts Wetlands Protection Act (General Law Chapter 131, Section 40) prohibits the removal, dredging, filling, or altering of wetlands without a permit. To obtain a permit (called an Order of Conditions), a project proponent must submit an application to the Conservation Commission and the Department of Environmental Protection

recordTypes.name: One Day Alcohol License
recordTypes.description: Apply for special one-day alcohol and/or a one-day entertainment license here.  One-day licenses are required for events that are advertised and/or open to the public.  Please note that a person can only obtain a total of 30 one-day licenses per location in one calendar year.  You may use this application to apply for a license during consecutive days in the same location.\tThe license application must be submitted to the Select Board office at least Forty-Five (45) days prior to the date of the event.

recordTypes.name: Sale of Tobacco & Nicotine Delivery Products
recordTypes.description: Tobacco & Nicotine Delivery Product Sales licenses are renewable annually on January 1st.

recordTypes.name: Septic Installer License
recordTypes.description:
Septic installer licenses are renewable annually on January 1st.
Proof of Insurance with the following coverages must be attached to your application:
General Liability Insurance with a minimum coverage of $100,000. 
Workers' Compensation Insurance: Massachusetts General Law Chapter 152 requires all businesses with employees to carry workers' compensation insurance.
If you have employees, you must provide a current certificate of insurance naming the local Board of Health as a certificate holder.
If you are a sole proprietor, LLC member without employees, or LLP partner without employees, you may be exempt, but you must submit a sworn, notarized Workers' Compensation Insurance Affidavit stating that coverage is not required.

recordTypes.name: Junk Dealers
recordTypes.description: The Junk Dealer's License is issued by the Select Board to the collectors of junk, dealers in junk, or keepers of shops for the purchase, sale, or barter of junk, old metals, or second-hand articles.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: Class II License
recordTypes.description: A person whose principal business is the buying or selling of second hand motor vehicles, a person who purchases and displays second hand motor vehicles for resale in retail transactions, and any other person who displays second hand motor vehicles not owned by him pursuant to an agreement in which he receives compensation, whether solely for displaying the vehicles, upon the sale of each vehicle, or otherwise must obtain Class II License from the Select Board.

recordTypes.name: Flammables & Combustibles Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for storage of Class 1 or 2 flammable liquids, excluding LP gas storage (for LP gas see Propane Tank Installation Permits).

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime a building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Gas Fitter Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when propane gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Septic Hauler License
recordTypes.description:
Septic Hauler licenses are renewable annually on January 1st.
Proof of Insurance with the following coverages must be attached to your application:
General Liability Insurance with a minimum coverage of $100,000. 
Workers' Compensation Insurance: Massachusetts General Law Chapter 152 requires all businesses with employees to carry workers' compensation insurance.
If you have employees, you must provide a current certificate of insurance naming the local Board of Health as a certificate holder.
If you are a sole proprietor, LLC member without employees, or LLP partner without employees, you may be exempt, but you must submit a sworn, notarized Workers' Compensation Insurance Affidavit stating that coverage is not required.

recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a sheet metal worker is manufacturing, fabricating, assembling, handling, erecting, installing, dismantling, alteration and/or repairing duct work, commercial fans, kitchen hoods and vents, architectural sheet metal and metal roofing.

recordTypes.name: Tents & Other Temporary Structures
recordTypes.description: This permit application is for the erection of tents and other temporary structures that exceed 400 square feet (aggregate of all temporary structures on the lot) and that will be in place for less than 180 days.

recordTypes.name: Wood Stove Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is required for the installation of solid fuel burning appliances including wood, pellet, or coal burning stoves.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Request / Complaint Form
recordTypes.description: For general environmental concerns, including a broad range of issues and complaints, suspected violations of environmental laws or activities that may endanger public health or natural resources.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: The Town of Tisbury requires a sign permit before any sign may be erected. See Tisbury Zoning Bylaw Section 07.06 for all sign requirements.

recordTypes.name: Trench Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime a trench hole or other excavation is being done to a depth of 3 (three) feet or more, that is not the excavation for a foundation.

recordTypes.name: Demolition of a Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for complete demolition of a building and/or accessory building. For partial and interior demolition use the Building Permit application.

recordTypes.name: Fire Detection, Fire Alarm & Sprinkler System Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this permit for residential or commercial fire detection and notification systems, as well as sprinkler system. This permit is required when a sprinkler system is installed, altered, extended, dismantled or reconfigured.

categories.content: Welcome to the Planning and Community Development Electronic Application Portal.

recordTypes.name: Trench, Excavation and Markings Permit
recordTypes.description:
A Trench, Excavation and Markings (TEM) Permit is required for: (1) any excavation, in the City right-of-way or on private property, which meets the legal definition of a trench (see Code of Massachusetts Regulations Title 520); (2) any alteration to the City right-of-way, even if it does not meet the legal definition of a trench; or (3) City utility marks on either public or private property.

If an extension for an existing TEM permit is needed past the expiration date, please send an extension request to dpwinfo@northamptonma.gov

recordTypes.name: Annual License
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a new, or transfer of, a Common Victualler, Entertainment, Automatic Amusement Device, Lodging House, and/or Innholder license.  Please also use this application to renew your licenses during November and December.
