recordTypes.description: This page contains the applications for land use permit types under the purview of the City of Northampton Planning Board, Zoning Board of Appeals (Zoning Board for short), and Central Business Architecture Committee (CBAC).

recordTypes.name: Car Dealer License: Class I, II & III
recordTypes.description: This application should be used to apply for a new, or transfer of, a Class I, II, or III Car Dealer License. Please also use this application to renew your licenses during November and December.

recordTypes.name: Wetlands Permitting
recordTypes.description: This page contains the applications for wetlands permit types under the purview of the City of Northampton Conservation Commission.

recordTypes.name: Historic District Applications
recordTypes.description: This page contains the applications for historic district permit types (Certificate of Appropriateness and Certificate of Non-Applicability) under the purview of the City of Northampton Historical Commission.

recordTypes.name: License to sell at Farmers Markets & Agricultural Events
recordTypes.description: Farmer winers (MGL c. 138, § 19B), farmer brewers (M.G.L. c. 138, § 19C), pub brewers (M.G.L. c. 138, § 19D), and farmer distillers (M.G.L. c. 138, § 19E) are allowed to apply for the issuance of a Farmer’s Market Permit for off-premise consumption at an indoor or outdoor agricultural event.

recordTypes.name: Liquor License: New, Transfer, or Amendment(s)
recordTypes.description: This application should be used for applying for a new liquor license, transferring a liquor license, or making amendments to your current liquor license.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term (1 day) Liquor License
recordTypes.description: This application should be used to apply for a short-term (1 day) liquor license which is a temporary liquor license issued for the service of all alcohol or wine and malt and is required for any indoor or outdoor activity or enterprise.

categories.name: Planning & Sustainability
categories.content: Please use the application forms here for permits under the jurisdiction of the Planning Board, Zoning Board of Appeals, Central Business Architecture Committee, Conservation Commission (wetlands), and Historical Commission.  The Office of Planning & Sustainability support these public bodies and the applications.

categories.name: Public Works
categories.content:
Public Works

The Northampton Department of Public Works is charged with the oversight and administration of permits in the City of Northampton for all construction activities within the City’s right-of-way and those associated with City utilities (drain, sewer and water) and for use of the City’

categories.name: License Commission
categories.content:
License Commission

The Northampton License Commission is a three-member advisory

recordTypes.name: SELCO Underground Service Rebate
recordTypes.description: The SELCO Underground Service Rebate Program provides SELCO customers with an incentive for the conversion of aerial/overhead services to underground services. Please visit our webpage for more details, if you have not already.

recordTypes.name: Dog License Application
recordTypes.description: FOR NEW DOG LICENSE APPLICATIONS ONLY: Apply here for a Dog License from the Town of Shrewsbury. All dogs over 6 months old must be licensed each year. Licenses expire on December 31st of the calendar year.  Licenses that are not completed within 30 days of submittal will be discontinued and will need to be re-submitted.

recordTypes.name: DBA Business Certificate
recordTypes.description: Apply for a DBA Business Certificate.

recordTypes.name: Garage License Application
recordTypes.description: This application is to be used for a Garage License. A Garage License is required for businesses seeking to repair vehicles on their premises. If you are also looking to sell vehicles, please complete also complete a Class I, II License Application.

recordTypes.name: Pay As You Throw (PAYT) - Bag Quality Issues
recordTypes.description: This form is to record issues with your PAYT bag(s).

recordTypes.name: Food Waste Pilot Drop-Off Program Sign Up
recordTypes.description: This pilot program allows residents to compost around the clock and free of charge. The small scale of this pilot will allow DPW staff to closely monitor the bins and determine if program expansion is feasible. Due to the scale of this program, businesses and institutions are not able to participate.

recordTypes.name: New Age Composter Purchase
recordTypes.description:
Purchase request for New Age Composter.
Each item is priced at $50 and the cost of the composters is partially subsidized by the Town of Shrewsbury's RDP Grant funds from MassDEP.  After the purchase the composters must be picked up at 100 Maple Ave, 2nd floor.

recordTypes.name: Trash & Recycling - Missed Pickup
recordTypes.description: Please record your missed Trash pick up using this form. We will contact you within 24hr.

recordTypes.name: Plow Damage/Replacement
recordTypes.description: File a request for any damage from Town plows pursuant to Select Board Operational Policy 24 – Mailbox Replacement.

recordTypes.name: Deceased Animals on Public Roads & Property
recordTypes.description:
Please provide as much information as possible. 

Before/After hours and Holidays please contact the Town of Shrewsbury police dispatch line at (508)841-8577.

recordTypes.name: Public Buildings Work Request
recordTypes.description:
For INTERNAL USE ONLY! 
Please use this form to submit Building Maintenance and Custodial support requests.

recordTypes.name: Abatement Request
recordTypes.description:
If you are submitting an abatement or credit request due to a detected leak or costs incurred for repair or replacement, proof of the issue and/or repair is required. Supporting documentation must be attached or will be requested as part of the review process.

Please allow up to 45 days for the department to review all abatement or credit requests. All accounts must be current and in good standing before an abatement or credit can be considered.

Be advised that outstanding balances will continue to accrue interest daily if payment is not received by the bill due date.

recordTypes.name: Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing your Information
Street Opening/Trench Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this record type for any excavation on private property, or in the Town's streets greater than 3-feet deep.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Management Permit
recordTypes.description: Any construction activity (including clearing, grading, and excavation) that results in a land disturbance equal to or greater than 5,000 square feet must obtain a Stormwater Management Permit.

recordTypes.name: Request a Mark Out / Dig Safe
recordTypes.description: Please allow a minimum of 3 business days for the mark out to be completed.

recordTypes.name: Conservation - Wetlands Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is for work adjacent to wetlands or riverfront areas.
A Request for Determination of Applicability (RDA), Notice of Intent (NOI), or an Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation  (ANRAD) can be submitted to the Town of Shrewsbury using this application process.

recordTypes.name: BODY ART: Establishment
recordTypes.description: A Body Art Establishment is a location, place, or business that has been granted a permit by the Board of Health where the practices of body art are performed such as but not limited to: tattooing, microblading, piercing, branding, or scarification.

recordTypes.name: Planning Board Application
recordTypes.description: This is for the following application types: Site Plan, Site Plan Modification, Special Permits, Definitive Subdivision, ANR (Approval Not Required), De minimis change, and Field Change to a Site Plan.

recordTypes.name: Blasting Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit application for all controlled/construction blasting.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: This is for the following application types through the Zoning Board of Appeals: Special Permits, Variances and Comprehensive Permits.

recordTypes.name: Address Change Request
recordTypes.description:
Request new or modified parcel, building, and/or unit address (NOT mailing address).

Apply under the existing PARCEL address. To find your parcel address, visit the GIS Map:
https://gisportal-shrewsburyma.hub.arcgis.com/

To change your mailing address, visit the Assessors Department webpage, and click Resources then Forms and Applications.

recordTypes.name: DRAFT -  FOOD:  Departmental Temp Food Notification
recordTypes.description:
For INTERNAL DEPARTMENT USE ONLY!

If any Town department will be hosting or organizing an event that involves food or food vendors, please complete this form. 

This notification will assist the Health Department in identifying where the food is coming from, where it's being prepared and by whom. It will also be instrumental in vetting out any complaints that might arise and ensure proper food handling.

Please allow a minimum of two (2) weeks notice prior to any event.

recordTypes.name: Facilities Use Request
recordTypes.description: This form is a request to use Public School Buildings Facilities.

recordTypes.name: Food Scrap Countertop Bin
recordTypes.description:
Purchase request for Food Scrap Countertop Bin.
Each item is priced at $10. After the purchase the Food Scrap Countertop Bin must be picked up at 100 Maple Ave, 2nd floor.

recordTypes.name: Request Tie Card / Service Connection / Mains Layout
recordTypes.description: Request a tie card, day card drawing, or GIS layout of an existing water or sewer service connection to a building. (Not applicable to wells or septic systems)

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Utility - Petition for Adjustment
recordTypes.description: In the event that a property owner believes the Stormwater Utility Fee (STWF) is incorrect, the property owner may apply for an adjustment.

recordTypes.name: 300th Anniversary Celebration Donations
recordTypes.description: This application form may be used to donate to support local celebrations in honor of the 300th Anniversary of the Town of Shrewsbury's incorporation in 2027. Your generous donations will help the Town create unforgettable events that honor our rich history, foster community spirit, and build connections among neighbors.

recordTypes.name: Final Read Request for Property Sale
recordTypes.description:
Please submit a request no less than five (5) business days prior to closing. 
To be completed by Seller's Closing Attorney  or Listing Agent. 
The Seller's Attorney or Listing Agent is obligated to notify the Town if the closing didn't go through or the closing date has been changed. All payments for final bills are due on the day of the closing. 

For questions, please call the DPW Department at (508) 841-8502.

recordTypes.name: General Account Inquiry
recordTypes.description: For general Account Inquiries such as bill reprints, Tax forms, Title 5 requests, balance requests and account concerns. Please allow 48 hours for requests to be received by staff and up to 7 business days depending on the ask for response. For any requests not listed please contact Department of Public Works  at 508-841-8502.

recordTypes.name: Senior Center Food Pantry Donations
recordTypes.description: This application form may be used to donate to support the Shrewsbury Senior Center Food Pantry. Your generous donations will help feed seniors in need in our community.

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer Overflow Workflow
recordTypes.description: INTERNAL USE ONLY. For reporting Sanitary Sewer Overflows during business hours, please call the Shrewsbury Department of Public Works at 508-841-8502 (Prompt #6). For weekends and after-hours, please call the Shrewsbury Fire Department at 508-841-8522 or Shrewsbury Police Department at 508-841-8577.

recordTypes.name: Water - Permit Request
recordTypes.description:
A Highway - Street opening / Trench permit is required before applying for this permit!  You will be asked to provide this permit number within this application. 

Use this record type for any water service permit requests.  Examples are; New Service, Temp Service, Disconnect, Reconnect, Repair, Water Meter Etc.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk Conditions
recordTypes.description: Overgrown trees, shrubs, trip hazards or other obstructions to public ways.

recordTypes.name: Conservation - Request for Certificate of Compliance
recordTypes.description: This application is to close out an Order of Conditions issued to a property.

recordTypes.name: Yard Waste - Missed Pickup
recordTypes.description: Please record your missed yard waste collection by using this form. We will contact you within 24hr.

recordTypes.name: DBA Business Certificate Amendment or Discontinuance
recordTypes.description: Apply for an Amendment or Discontinuance of your DBA Business Certificate.

recordTypes.name: BODY ART: Practitioner
recordTypes.description: In Massachusetts, a body art practitioner is a person who has a permit from the Board of Health to perform body art in a licensed establishment. Body art is defined as the practice of altering or adorning the body through tattooing, piercing, or other means.

recordTypes.name: Community Preservation Committee Eligibility Application
recordTypes.description:
Applicants must submit a Project Eligibility Form. This allows the CPC to provide initial feedback and guidance on whether the proposed project meets basic CPA requirements before the applicant is potentially invited to prepare the Project Funding Application. 

Please coordinate your applications with the Planning and Economic Development Department - planning@shrewsburyma.gov or call 508-841-8512

recordTypes.name: Dumpster Permit
recordTypes.description: Every dumpster, 6 yards or larger, is required to be registered with the Fire Department.  Open-top and plastic top containers are required to be placed a minimum of 10 feet from any portion of the building that is combustible construction. This includes the soffits of a block or brick building.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Residential
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, demolition and major repairs to existing one and two family buildings.

recordTypes.name: Community Preservation Committee Funding Application
recordTypes.description: The CPC will be in contact with next steps including requests for more information and scheduling a public presentation meeting. If your project involves municipal property, state procurement laws apply. To learn more, visit the Community Preservation Coalition website at https://www.communitypreservation.org/procurement.

recordTypes.name: CAMPS: Recreational for Children
recordTypes.description:
Recreational camps have five (5) or more children and operate anytime between June 1 and September 30 and/or during school vacations.  The Department of Early Education and Care does not license these types of programs.

In Massachusetts, recreational camps for children must be inspected and licensed by the local board of health in the city or town where the camp is located; to be licensed, the camp must meet all regulatory standards established by the Massachusetts Department of Public Health (MDPH) and any additional local requirements.

The MDPH regulations establish minimum health, safety, sanitary, and housing standards to protect the well being of children who are in the care of recreational camps for children in Massachusetts.

The Town of Shrewsbury enforces 105 CMR 430.00: Minimum standards for recreational camps for children (State sanitary code, chapter IV) and can be found at the following link: https://www.mass.gov/regulations/105-CMR-43000-minimum-standards-for-recreational-camps-for-children-state-sanitary-code-chapter-iv

recordTypes.name: Storm Drain Connection Request
recordTypes.description:
A Street Opening/Trench Permit and Licensed Drain Layer is required before applying for this permit! You will be asked to provide this permit number within this application. 

Use this record type for any storm drain connection/repair to the Town drainage system.  Examples include tying in a foundation, yard drains, site drainage, or roof drains to a municipal catch basin.

recordTypes.name: Road Conditions
recordTypes.description: Pot Holes, Snow and Ice hazards, manhole covers and other obstructions on public roadways.

recordTypes.name: Sewer - Permit Request
recordTypes.description: Use this record type for any Sewer service permit requests.  Examples are; New Service, Disconnect, Reconnect, Repair, Etc.

recordTypes.name: FOOD: Mobile Food Establishment (MFE) - ONLY
recordTypes.description:
This permit application type is for Mobile Food Vendors Only who are seeking either an annual permit (valid thru 12/31 of the year the permit was issued in) or a temporary permit (i.e. event that can be 1 to 14 consecutive days). 

Please DO NOT use this permit application type if you are a food vendor that will be setting up a table. 

A Mobile Food Establishment (MFE) is a food service operation permitted under the Retail Food Code that is operated from a movable motor driven or propelled vehicle, portable structure that is able to change location. 

Note: If you wish to have your MFE in a permanent fixed location, please conact the Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA), as you may be required to obtain a Variance or Special Permit. They can be reached at: 508-841-8512 or via email at: zbastaff@shrewsburyma.gov

recordTypes.name: Pre Application - Development Team Review
recordTypes.description: Meeting Request Form to assist developers, residents and landowners in the pre-development stages of potential and proposed projects and those with questions relating to permitting processes, zoning compliance, engineering standards, and land use policy considerations.

recordTypes.name: SELCO Solar Interconnection Application & Work Request
Fire Alarm System Repair
recordTypes.description: Emergency repairs can be made without a permit, provided that oral notification is given to the Shrewsbury Fire Department *before* work begins and a permit application is submitted *within 24 hours* of beginning work. A commercial building permit is required for any installation or modification of existing systems. This permit can be obtained from the building inspection services department.

recordTypes.name: Flammable Material Storage
recordTypes.description: Permit application for annual or temporary storage of flammable and combustible materials *OR* for fuel tank trucks that will be parked in Shrewsbury overnight.

recordTypes.name: SELCO Commercial EV Charging Station Rebate
FOOD: Temporary Food (ONLY for food vendors setting up a table)
recordTypes.description:
This permit application type is for Food Vendor participants who will be setting up at a table at a temporary food event (i.e. event that can be 1 to 14 consecutive days). 

Please DO NOT use this permit application type if you are a Mobile Food Establishment (MFE). 

Please be sure you have been accepted as a temporary food vendor table by the Event Organizer prior to applying for a temporary food permit with the Board of Health. 

Deadline to apply with the Board of Health is 2 weeks prior to your first vending date.

recordTypes.name: Hydrant Flow Test Request
recordTypes.description: This is for the purpose of requesting a hydrant flow test.

recordTypes.name: Change of Mailing Address
recordTypes.description:
Please allow for 5 Business days for any changes to be reviewed by the department.

Property owners in the Town of Shrewsbury are responsible for their water and sewer utility bills and it is up to them to charge their tenants (if applicable) for usage as they deem necessary. Utility bills must remain in the property owner's name and cannot be transferred to a tenant.

recordTypes.name: FOOD: Brick and Mortar Establishments
recordTypes.description:
This application type is for all NEW brick & mortar establishments and EXISTING establishments that renew annually with the Town of Shrewsbury for:

FOOD - retail, restaurants, catering, churches, schools (public and private)

CONCESSION STANDS - seasonal 

BATHING BEACH SNACK SHACK - seasonal

MILK and/or CREAM - retail and grocery stores

FROZEN DESSERT and/or ICE CREAM MIX - retail and restaurants

recordTypes.name: Cryogenic Fluid Storage
recordTypes.description: Permit application for annual or temporary storage of cryogenic fluid.

recordTypes.name: Hazardous Materials Processing
recordTypes.description: Annual application for permit to process hazardous materials.

recordTypes.name: SELCO Commercial Heat Pump Rebate Application
FOOD: Residential Kitchen / Cottage Food - ONLY
recordTypes.description:
Note: The Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA) will determine if you reside in a zoning district that allows this use. If it's determined it is not an allowed use in your zoning district, you have the option of applying for a Special Permit to do so through the ZBA. Considerations include: providing supporting information: which section of the bylaw are you seeking relief from, what is the use of the structure, show a floor plan of the structure for each level of the property identifying the uses, hours of operation, number of employees customers coming to the home etc, show off street parking on site plan.

MA Department of Public Health (MDPH) description: 
A Residential Kitchen is a kitchen in a private home. Most Residential Kitchens, including those in a private home where individuals are cooking for their family or for charitable purposes, like a bake sale, do not require a permit. Certain food-based activities in Residential Kitchens require a license or permit either as a Retail Residential Kitchen or as a Wholesale Residential Kitchen. If a Retail permit is required, the Residential Kitchen must comply with certain requirements in the Retail Food Code (105 CMR 590). If a wholesale license is required, the Residential Kitchen must comply with certain requirements in the regulations for Good Manufacturing Practices (105 CMR 500). 

https://www.mass.gov/regulations/105-CMR-59000-state-sanitary-code-chapter-x-minimum-sanitation-standards-for-food-establishments

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this record type for any installation or replacement of a driveway that will involve work in the Public Way.  Driveways on private property only do not need a permit.

recordTypes.name: Drain Layer's License & Water Service Installer
recordTypes.description: Drain layers are registered plumbers, and competent contractors licensed by the Town of Shrewsbury, Massachusetts, and bonded to lay drains in the Town of Shrewsbury, Massachusetts.  You must be a State licensed contractor or plumber to apply. In addition to your application for a new license (or a renewal), you will also be required to submit a copy of a bond to cover water, sewer, or drainage work in the amount of $5,000.  You will also be required to provide a certificate of Insurance (no less than $1,000,000) for Public Liability and Property Damage.  New applicants must also provide three letters of recommendation.  The license, if issued, is good for one calendar year.  It is only valid within the confines of Shrewsbury Ma.

recordTypes.name: Road Conditions Copy
recordTypes.description: Pot Holes, Snow and Ice hazards, manhole covers and other obstructions on public roadways.

recordTypes.name: FOOD:  Health Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This application is to be completed for brand new food establishments coming into Shrewsbury, for existing food establishments that will be undergoing remodeling/renovations, or for a change of food service. Supporting documentation will be required as noted throughout the application process.

recordTypes.name: Hot Work
recordTypes.description: Hot work is any activity or process that involves open flames or that generates sparks or heat and includes: Welding and allied processes; heat treating; grinding; thawing pipes; powder-driven fasteners; hot riveting; torch-applied roofing; and any similar applications producing or using sparks, flame or heat.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs to all buildings other than one- and two-family buildings.

recordTypes.name: Funeral Director
recordTypes.description: Morticians and funeral arrangers (also known as funeral directors or, historically, undertakers) plan the details of a funeral. They often prepare obituaries and arrange for pallbearers and clergy services. If a burial is chosen, they schedule the opening and closing of a grave with a representative of the cemetery.

recordTypes.name: Bulk Item Sticker Purchase
recordTypes.description:
Only 'Pay As You Throw' residents qualify for Bulk pick up through this program.  
If you are not sure if you qualify call 508-841-8591. There is no refunds for unused stickers.

One sticker per item is required. 
Each Sticker is $12. 

Purchase can be made either In Store (with a physical Sticker) or here Online (with a digital sticker). 
If purchased 'Online', please print the digital sticker and securely attach it to your item.

After payment,  please call Casella  508-869-4077 to schedule curbside pick up.

recordTypes.name: Hotel / Motel
recordTypes.description: This application type is for the purpose of permitting overnight cabins (hotels / motels). Renews January 1st of each year.

recordTypes.name: Alcohol License Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is to be used for all Retail Alcohol Licenses, including new applications, transfer applications, and amendments to existing licenses. 

If your establishment has additional licenses such as a common victualler (service of food for seated consumption), entertainment, or billiards license, you can apply for those within this application as well.

recordTypes.name: Residential Energy Storage System
recordTypes.description: Required prior to the installation of an Energy Storage System (ESS) at any residential property.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Energy Storage System
recordTypes.description: Required prior to the installation of an Energy Storage System (ESS) at any commercial property.

recordTypes.name: Test Copy - Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: This is a test application for internal use only. Please do not use.

recordTypes.name: Donation Bin Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for Donation Bin Permits.

recordTypes.name: MA Rental Voucher Program (MRVP): Housing Inspection & Certification of Fitness
recordTypes.description: Massachusetts Rental Voucher Program (MRVP) application for housing inspection and certification of fitness for MA Rental Voucher Program in accordance with: 760 CMR 49.00

recordTypes.name: Mobile Home Park
recordTypes.description:
In MA, a manufactured housing community, also known as a mobile home park, is a plot of land with at least three manufactured homes used for living:

The community includes any buildings, structures, fixtures, and equipment used with the manufactured homes.

The owner or occupant must have a license to use the land for a manufactured housing community.

Mobile home park tenants own their homes but rent the land underneath them. This gives them different rights and responsibilities than other tenants in a park.

recordTypes.name: TEST Vacation Watch Request
recordTypes.description: Inform the Shrewsbury Police Department of your vacation plans to request additional checks and to update your emergency contact information.

recordTypes.name: Pool Permits - All (Residential and Commercial, for Above or In-ground)
recordTypes.description: ABOVE/INGROUND POOL PERMIT APPLICATIONS ONLY.  Select this to apply for Above Ground or In-ground Pool Permit Applications.  Additional documents may be required (outlined in the process).  Review instructions before you start.

recordTypes.name: Miscellaneous Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This application can be used for uncommon permit types, such as fireworks or black powder.

recordTypes.name: Class I, Class II License Application
recordTypes.description: This application is to be used for Class I (New Car Dealer) and Class II (Used Car Dealer) Licenses.

recordTypes.name: POOL: Construction Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This application type is for the construction of a new semi-public pool and/or SPA or a renovation. This is a comprehensive application that will include plans, and specifications, stamped and signed by a Massachusetts Registered Professional Engineer or Registered Architect, to the Shrewsbury Board of Health or its designated agent. The plans must demonstrate compliance with Massachusetts' State Sanitary Code, Chapter V: Minimum Standards for Swimming Pools (105 CMR 435.000). You will also need to follow local requirements, which may include but not limited to a certified plot plan, information on pools, and the associated plan review fee.

recordTypes.name: POOL: Semi-public Swimming Pool or SPA
recordTypes.description:
This application type is for a new Semi-public swimming pool, or SPA and for the renewal of existing Semi-public swimming pools and/or SPA located at apartments, condos, healthcare facilities, or recreation facilities only. The Town of Shrewsbury enforces the following: 105 CMR 435.00: MINIMUM STANDARDS FOR SWIMMING POOLS (STATE SANITARY CODE: CHAPTER V) 

Any waste water resulting from pool draining shall be dechlorinated prior to its discharging. No waste water resulting from draining or backwash water may be discharged into a storm drain. Waste water resulting from draining may be discharged to a subsurface disposal system if it is specifically designed for that purpose and approved by the appropriate agency.

recordTypes.name: rsNA: Recombinant or Synthetic Nucleic Acid molecules
recordTypes.description:
This license is required for any institution / facility performing rsNA work in the Town of Shrewsbury. 

rsNA refers to recombinant or synthetic nucleic acid molecules. These molecules are constructed outside of living cells by joining DNA or RNA segments to DNA or RNA molecules that can replicate within a living cell. They can also be chemically or otherwise synthesized.

recordTypes.name: Water - Permit Request Copy
recordTypes.description:
A Highway - Street opening / Trench permit is required before applying for this permit!  You will be asked to provide this permit number within this application. 

Use this record type for any water service permit requests.  Examples are; New Service, Temp Service, Disconnect, Reconnect, Repair, Water Meter Etc.

recordTypes.name: WATER - Service Work Order Request
recordTypes.description: Use this request for water that is discolored, odorous, grainy in texture, low/no water pressure, and meter inquiries.

recordTypes.name: BATHING BEACH: Sunset Beach
recordTypes.description:
Bathing beach means a beach or bathing area offered to the public for recreational bathing or swimming.

Bathing beach operator shall mean any person who. (a) alone or jointly or severally with others owns a bathing beach or. (b) has care, charge, or control of such bathing beach as agent or lessee of the owner or as an independent contractor.

This permit type renews when bathing beach season is open.

recordTypes.name: Tire Storage permit
recordTypes.description: This application should be used for the storage of tires.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Inspection
recordTypes.description:
As part of the Town of Shrewsbury's Certificate of Inspection (COI) process, please be aware
that the 10th Edition of the Massachusetts State Building Code (780 CMR 110.7.1) includes
updated safety requirements. All commercial properties must now submit current
documentation verifying compliance with applicable fire and life safety systems.

Required documentation includes (if applicable):
- Fire Extinguishers: Latest inspection or invoice (NFPA 10)
- Fire Sprinkler System: Latest test report (NFPA 25)
- Standpipes: Latest test report (NFPA 14)
- Fire Alarm & Life Safety System: Latest test report (NFPA 72)
- Emergency Lighting: 90-minute battery backup test report (MA BC 1008.3.4)
-Commercial Kitchen Suppression: Latest test report (NFPA 96)
- Emergency Power Systems: Generator test report (NFPA 110)
- Exterior Fire Escapes / Egress Components: 5-year certification (1001.2.2 Design
professional or CSL holder)
- Fire Doors & Dampers: Inspection report (NFPA 80)
These updates help ensure the safety of your employees, customers, and property. Please have
all applicable reports ready when submitting your Certificate of Inspection application.
Failure to comply with 780 CMR table 110 may result in a notice of violation and subsequent fines as follows:

First Offense: $100 fine 
Second Offense: $500 fine 
Third Offense: $1,000 fine 
Subsequent Violations: a $1,000 fine will be assessed per day until the violation is resolved.

recordTypes.name: Oil burner and tank installation only, or installation plus removal
recordTypes.description: Permit Application for the Installation or Alteration of Fuel Oil Burning Equipment and the Storage of Fuel Oil

recordTypes.name: Tanning Salon
recordTypes.description:
A tanning salon is an establishment that offers services for artificial tanning and skin beautification. Tanning salons offer artificial tanning services. Tanning salons usually specialize in one type of tanning; either UV-bed light tanning, or booth spray tan application.

IMPORTANT: Please note that Massachusetts law prohibits anyone under the age of 18 from using or operating a tanning device as youths are more susceptible to skin damage. 

Once a permit has been granted, it is valid until December 31st of the year it was issued in. This permit type renews each year for a January 1 effective date.

recordTypes.name: Street Sign Request Form
recordTypes.description: This is a request form for Street Signs in the Town of Shrewsbury pursuant to Select Board Operational Policy  6

recordTypes.name: License Application (Various License Types)
recordTypes.description: This application may be used for various license types , including: Common Victualler, Dealer in Precious Metals, Annual Weekly Entertainment and Sunday Entertainment, Livery, Automatic Amusement, Billiards,  Bowling Alleys, Auctioneer, and Underground Fuel Storage Tank.

recordTypes.name: Street Light Request Form
recordTypes.description: This is a request form for additional Street Lights in the Town of Shrewsbury

recordTypes.name: Edgemere Mobile Home Park - Monthly Invoice
recordTypes.description:
This application is used for the purpose of generating a monthly invoice for the rental fee per unit from Edgeremere Mobile Home Park located on 151 Hartford Turnpike, Shrewsbury, MA 01545.

Managed by PMI, Shrewsbury,  MA 01545

Rent rolls should be provided to the Town by the fifth day of each month as required by M.G.L. Chapter 140, Section 32G.

recordTypes.name: Title V: Abandonment / Decommissioning
recordTypes.description: Abandonment or decommissioning is the process of closing down an on-site disposal system by making it inoperative (i.e. cesspool, septic system, etc.). You must be a licensed septic installer in the Town of Shrewsbury. Crush and backfill must be witnessed by the Town of Shrewsbury's Title V Agent. If pumping is required, the Health Department will require a copy of the pump record.

recordTypes.name: Title V: Inspection Report Filing
recordTypes.description: The State Title 5 Inspection Form  Filed with the Health Division.

recordTypes.name: Title V: Percolation Test
recordTypes.description: A percolation test is a procedure performed to review water drainage in different soils. It is important for many uses, such as when designing a leach field for a septic system, planning a building design, or considering agricultural use of the land.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Inspection - Improvement
recordTypes.description: This application is used for Periodic Inspections of Existing Buildings per the Massachusetts State Building Code (Section 110.7 and Table 110)

recordTypes.name: Open Burn Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required before burning material outdoors. Before applying for a permit, please read the minimum requirements on the next screen. Burning is only allowed Jan 15th - May 1st.

recordTypes.name: Vital Records Requests: Birth, Death, Marriage Certificates / Burial Permits
recordTypes.description: Certified Copies of Marriage Certificates. Birth Certificates and Death Certificates. Funeral Homes may obtain Burial Permits.

recordTypes.name: Propane Tank (COMMERCIAL) Installation/Storage
recordTypes.description: Permit Application for the Installation and/or Removal of Propane Tanks (both above ground and underground) or storage for use or sale.

recordTypes.name: Title V: Septic Hauler / Pumper
recordTypes.description:
Application to transport nightsoil waste in Shrewsbury and to discharge nightsoil waste at the treatment plant. This application can also be used to transport grease from both interior and exterior grease traps. 

Once a permit has been granted, it is valid until December 31st of the year it was issued in. This permit type renews each year for a January 1 effective date.

recordTypes.name: Title V: Septic Installer
recordTypes.description:
Septic installers put all the parts of the septic system in place, except for the plumbing inside of the dwelling. 

If you are a new company applying or haven't renewed within the last two years with the Town of Shrewsbury, please upload three valid installer permits from other municipalities. 

Once a permit has been granted, it is valid until December 31st of the year it was issued in. This permit type renews each year for a January 1 effective date.

recordTypes.name: Propane Tank (RESIDENTIAL)  Installation/Storage
recordTypes.description: Permit Application for the Installation and/or Removal of Propane Tanks (both above ground and underground)

recordTypes.name: Recycling Cart Purchase Request
recordTypes.description:
The Department of Public Works (DPW) offers 64-gallon size carts for recycling,  $75.00 per cart.
Carts will be delivered to your property and you will be notified about the delivery date.

recordTypes.name: Kennel License Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Kennel License (5+ dogs) from the Town of Shrewsbury. All dogs over 6 months old must be licensed. Licenses expire on December 31st each year.

recordTypes.name: One Day Alcohol License
recordTypes.description:
Application for a One-Day Alcohol License. 

One-day licenses are required for events that are advertised and/or open to the public.  Please note that a person can only obtain a total of 30 one-day licenses per location in one calendar year.  You may use this application to apply for a license during consecutive days in the same location.

Please note that if you plan to store alcohol before or after the event, a one-day license is needed for those days in addition to the day of the event.

recordTypes.name: TITLE V: System Pumping Record
recordTypes.description: A System Pumping Record must be submitted to the local Board of Health or other approving authority within fourteen (14) days from the pumping date in accordance with 310 CMR 15.351. Licensed septic pumpers can download the System Pumping Record (Form 4) by visiting the following link: https://www.mass.gov/doc/system-pumping-record-title-5/download

recordTypes.name: Mattress/Boxspring Drop Off  Request
recordTypes.description:
Mattress/Boxspring must be dry and in reasonable shape. 
Must not be excessively dirty or rancid. 
Urine stains are recyclable, unless rancid.

recordTypes.name: Propane Tank: Temporary Usage
recordTypes.description: Permit Application for the use of propane tanks that will NOT be 1) permanently installed or 2) removed from a permanent location.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permits
recordTypes.description: SIGN PERMITS ONLY.   Additional documents may be required (outlined in the process).  Review instructions before you start.

recordTypes.name: Real Estate Transfer (Smoke / CO Detector)
recordTypes.description: Application for Certificate of Compliance for Smoke Detectors & Carbon Monoxide Alarms (M.G.L. Chapter 148, Sections 26F, 26F1/2

recordTypes.name: Title V: Septic Plan Review
recordTypes.description:
Whether you're building a new septic system or upgrading an existing one, there are Title 5 requirements that apply to new construction. 

Per the State's Title 5 Regulations, the Title 5 Agent has forty five (45) days to review from the receipt of a complete packet to include the fee.

310 CMR 15.000: Title 5 of the State Environmental Code - https://www.mass.gov/doc/310-cmr-15000-title-5-of-the-state-environmental-code

recordTypes.name: One Day Common Victualler License
recordTypes.description:
Application for a One Day Common Victualler License.  

A common victualler license is required when an organization prepares food and sells it for on-site consumption to the public. If you are hosting a one-day event where food is being sold to the public and eaten at the same location (Ex. Barbeque, Annual Picnic, etc.) then you need to obtain a One Day Common Victualler License. You may also use this application to apply for a license during consecutive days in the same location.

If you are seeking to apply for a One Day Alcohol License, please use the One Day Alcohol License application.

recordTypes.name: Title V: Septic Repair/Replace Component(s) of an Existing On-site Sewage Disposal System
recordTypes.description:
This application is to repair/replace component(s) for an on-site sewage disposal system (example: distribution box)

Please complete and upload all applicable DEP forms: 1A / 2A / 3. DEP forms can be downloaded directly from their website at: https://www.mass.gov/lists/title-5-septic-system-forms

After the repair/replacement has been made, please upload a copy of the sketch for the repair (if applicable) and a completed Certificate of Compliance.

Fee includes $125 for the inspection by Shrewsbury's Title V Agent and $100 for the Certificate of Compliance for a total of $225.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: PLUMBING PROJECTS ONLY. Select this to apply for a Plumbing permit for residential or commercial applications. Additional documents may be required (outlined in the process).  Failure to complete the request accurately may result in application denial and subsequent reapplication fees. We strongly encourage you to read all information on our website before you apply.

recordTypes.name: Sprinkler System Repair
recordTypes.description: Emergency repairs can be made without a permit, provided that oral notification is given to the Shrewsbury Fire Department *before* work begins and a permit application is submitted *within 24 hours* of beginning work. A commercial building permit is required for any installation or modification of existing systems. This permit can be obtained from the building inspection services department.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco Retailer
recordTypes.description:
Per the Shrewsbury Board of Health's Tobacco Retail Regulations, there is a cap of twenty (20) tobacco retailer permits. 

There are no tobacco retailer permits at this time. If you wish to be placed on a waiting list, please contact the Health Department at 508-841-8384 and we can alert you if/when a license becomes available.

recordTypes.name: TESTING PURPOSES ONLY Kennel License Application Copy
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Kennel License (5+ dogs) from the Town of Shrewsbury. All dogs over 6 months old must be licensed. Licenses expire on December 31st each year.

recordTypes.name: Gas Fitting Permit
recordTypes.description: GAS FITTING PROJECTS ONLY. Select this to apply for a Gas Fitting permit for residential or commercial applications. Additional documents may be required (outlined in the process).  Failure to complete the request accurately may result in application denial, and subsequent reapplication fees. We strongly encourage you to read all information on our website before you apply.

recordTypes.name: BDA Installation Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for the installation of any public safety radio enhancement system. At the conclusion of successful acceptance testing, an annually renewable permit shall be issued.

recordTypes.name: BDA Maintenance or Modification Permit
recordTypes.description: This annually renewable permit is required for the annual maintenance and testing of any public safety radio enhancement system.

recordTypes.name: Town Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: The Town of Shrewsbury Building Inspector's Department will assume responsibility for all electrical permitting and inspections effective January 1, 2019. The online permitting portal and process will remain the same, but a revised fee schedule will apply (2019 permitting fees available at ShrewsburyMA.gov/electricpermits).

recordTypes.name: Junk Dealers and Dealers in Second Hand Articles
Swimming Lesson Registration
recordTypes.description: Spaces are limited and given on a first come first served basis.  Lessons are held rain or shine, except for thunderstorms.  No refunds are given if you cannot attend the scheduled day or the make-up session.   Children are encouraged to wear wetsuits for cooler days.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Passes - 2025
recordTypes.description: Purchase 20 visits for a discounted price.

recordTypes.name: Amendment to ABCC Liquor License
recordTypes.description:
Please note that that this application is for the Local Licensing Authority (LLA) aka City of Gardner License Commission when you are submitting a change of any kind to the ABCC.  This application was created to assist staff and applicants to track the progress of all amendment applications and to record the transaction. 

See https://www.mass.gov/guides/amending-your-alcoholic-beverages-retail-license-abcc for all the paperwork that is required by the state.  

Please note that as of 1/1/2026 there is a $100 amendment application fee.

recordTypes.name: Liquor License - Local Application (Annual)
recordTypes.description:
If you have any questions regarding your licensing procedure please feel free to contact The Board of Licensure at 978-630-4013.

Please be aware that this application is for the GARDNER LICENSE COMMISSION only.  The ABCC may have additional requirements not included here.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Please complete this application prior to opening, renovating or relocating any food Food Establishment.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment - Annual
recordTypes.description:
To be filled out by any establishment/organization which deals in any form of food products including milk, cream and frozen desserts.  Use this application for ANNUAL restaurants, retail grocery stores, food trucks, and private clubs. 

Annual Food Establishment permits expire yearly on December 31st.  The permit renewal deadline for all Food Establishment permits are due no later than November 30th to ensure that the renewal can be approved before the current permit expires.  Late applications will be charged a $50 Late Fee.

recordTypes.name: Liquor License - Local Application (Seasonal)
recordTypes.description:
If you have any questions regarding your licensing procedure please feel free to contact The Board of Licensure at 978-630-4013.

Please be aware that this application is for the GARDNER LICENSE COMMISSION only.  The ABCC may have additional requirements not included here.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application-Testing Copy
Food Vendor Permit - Waterford St. Farmer's Market 2025
recordTypes.description: Please contact the Farmer's Market (https://www.gardnerfarmersmarket.com/) to apply for vendor space prior to completing your Food Permit Application; approval of a Food Permit is not an agreement of participation in the Farmer's Market.

recordTypes.name: Food Vendor Permit - Perry Auditorium Farmer's Market 11/22/2025
recordTypes.description: Please contact the Farmer's Market (https://www.gardnerfarmersmarket.com/) to apply for vendor space prior to completing your Food Permit Application; approval of a Food Permit is not an agreement of participation in the Farmer's Market.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment - Seasonal
recordTypes.description:
To be filled out by any establishment/organization which deals in any form of food products including milk, cream and frozen desserts.  Use this application for SEASONAL restaurants, retail grocery stores, food trucks, and private clubs. 

Seasonal Food Establishment applications must be submitted 14 days prior to opening each season.

recordTypes.name: Liquor License - Local Application  (1-Day)
recordTypes.description:
If you have any questions regarding your licensing procedure please feel free to contact The License Commission Clerk at 978-630-4013.

Please visit https://www.gardner-ma.gov/286/License-Commission for additional information about 1-Day Liquor Licenses.

recordTypes.name: Well Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Permit for installation, alteration, repair or destruction of a well.

recordTypes.name: Food:  1-Day or 1-Event
recordTypes.description:
Food permit for PUBLIC events or sales held off-site of a permitted Food Service Establishment.  

Private functions held on private property that are not open to public are not required to be permitted.

recordTypes.name: Auto Amusement Device & Poker Machines (with no Alcohol License)
recordTypes.description:
If you have any questions regarding your licensing procedure please feel free to contact The Board of Licensure at 978-630-4013.

Please be aware that this application is for establishments that have AAD and do not hold an Alcohol license.  If you hold an Alcohol license, the AAD application is part of the Liquor License - Local Application 

The term ''automatic amusement device'' shall be construed as meaning any mechanism whereby, upon the deposit therein of a coin or token, any apparatus is released or set in motion or put in a position where it may be set in motion for the purpose of playing any game involving, in whole or in part, the skill of the player, including, but not exclusively, such devices as are commonly known as pinball machines including free play pinball machines, but not including slot machines as defined in chapter 23K.

recordTypes.name: Septic/Disposal Works Construction Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for any construction or alterations of a. Septic disposal works system.

recordTypes.name: Funeral Director
recordTypes.description: Funeral Director licenses are issued to persons certified to the Board of Health before May 1st each year.  All such licenses shall expire April 30th of the following year, unless sooner suspended or revoked.

recordTypes.name: Hotel/Motel
recordTypes.description: Hotel/Motel permits expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Commercial (TEST)
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs to all buildings other than one- and two-family buildings.

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Home Park
recordTypes.description: Manufactured Home Park permits expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Tanning
recordTypes.description: Tanning permits are  expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco & Nicotine Products
recordTypes.description: Tobacco Sales licenses are expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Establishment
recordTypes.description: Body Art Facility permits expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Practitioner
recordTypes.description: Body Art Licenses expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Outdoor Dining Permit
recordTypes.description: For dining establishments that wish to provide their customers with an outdoor dining experience. these permits do not expire, unless there is a change in seating plan or location.

recordTypes.name: Exhibition of Motion Pictures
recordTypes.description: Exhibition of Motion Pictures Permits expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Septic Hauler
recordTypes.description: Septic Pumpers/Haulers permits expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Septic System Installer
recordTypes.description: Septic System Installer permits expire annually on December 31st.  Septic System Installers must have a permit prior to doing any septic install or repair work in Gardner.

recordTypes.name: Solid Waste Hauler
recordTypes.description: Solid Waste Hauler permits  expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Unattended Donation Box
recordTypes.description: Unattended Donation Box permits  expire annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Camps  - Seasonal
recordTypes.description: Please submit NEW Recreational Camps applications at least 30 days prior to camp opening date.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool/Steam Bath - Annual
recordTypes.description: Application for permit to operate an public, semi-public swimming pool,  Private residential pools are not subject to Health Department permitting under the state sanitary code.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool - Seasonal
recordTypes.description: Application for permit to operate a seasonal public or semi-public swimming pool.  Private residential pools are not subject to Health Department permitting under the state sanitary code.

recordTypes.name: Bathing Beach - Seasonal
recordTypes.description:
Application for permit to operate an public or semi-public swimming bathing  beach.  

Seasonal licenses are renewable annually by April 30th, are valid upon approval from May 15 to Sept 30th.

recordTypes.name: Inspection Request for Certificate of Fitness for Human Habitation
recordTypes.description: Property Owners or housing assistance program providers can request an inspection prior to occupancy to certify that the unit is free of any Housing Code violations.  Please submit an inspection request to initiate the certification process.  There is a $75 fee for each unit to be inspected.  Please contact our office at 978-630-4013 if you have any questions.

categories.name: Building Department - Permits & Inspectional Services
categories.content:
Please attach all required attachments in order for review and approval. 

Our goal is to assist contractors and citizens alike in all matters associated with building and the Building Permit process. Call us any time at 978-630-4007 with questions on Electrical, Plumbing, or Building matters.

 

**All permit applications must  be accompanied by the Mandatory Worker's Compensation Affidav

License Commission
categories.content:
Renewal applications that remain incomplete or that have not been submitted by the application deadline date will be required to pay an late filing fee of $50 and will be have to appear before the Board of Licensure for permission to apply for late re-licensure.

All renewal applications and required documents need to be submitted electronically. We no longer accept paper applications.

Any questions? Email or call our office, and we will be happy to assist you! Business hours are 8

recordTypes.description: This permit is required when natural gas/propane gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Sheet Metal/Mechanical  Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a sheet metal worker is manufacturing, fabricating, assembling, handling, erecting, installing, dismantling, alteration and/or repairing duct work, commercial fans, kitchen hoods and vents, architectural sheet metal and metal roofing.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for all signs.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application (Residential & Commercial)
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs. Please carefully review the applicable checklist before submitting application.  Incomplete applications may delay efficiency of permit issuance.

recordTypes.name: Dog License Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Dog License (1-4 dogs) from the Town of Hudson. All dogs over 6 months old must be licensed. Licenses expire on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing Your Information
Extension of Site Plan Review Approval
recordTypes.description: Request to extend an expiring approval of a Site Plan Review.

recordTypes.name: Minor Plan Modification for Subdivision or Site Plan
recordTypes.description: Minor modifications do not require a new public hearing.

recordTypes.name: Major Plan Modification for Subdivision or Site Plan
Water & Sewer Installer/Drainlayer's License Application
recordTypes.description: All trench excavators / utility line installers need to be licensed with Hudson DPW to perform their work within the town limits. Please have your certificate of insurance / bonds / reference letters and letters of experience ready to upload for this application. Your license is valid for the current calendar year and will need to be renewed every year to stay active. Review DPW rules and regulations prior to submitting this application.

recordTypes.name: Abutter's List Request Form
recordTypes.description: Please allow for up to 5 days from the date of payment and submission of the form for the Assessor's Office to complete the processing of your request.

recordTypes.name: Hudson Community Care Fund Donations
recordTypes.description:
Credit cards, electronic Checks, or in-person cash or check are all accepted. 
Credit Cards will incur a processing fee. 

Donations of gift cards, cash or checks can be brought to the 
Hudson Health Department at Town Hall, 78 Main Street, 1st Floor.
Mon, Wed, Th: 8am - 4:30pm
Tue 8am - 6:30pm
Fri 8am - 12pm

recordTypes.name: Markout and Service Connection Application
recordTypes.description: For all digs including planting a tree, please call dig safe first. Have your dig safe ticket number ready prior to submitting this request. Dig safe does not have records of Hudson’s water / sewer lines and hence DPW does the mark out for those utilities. Be prepared to answer relevant questions for your project, DPW has the right to inspect the project if it impacts water / sewer utilities.

recordTypes.name: Application for Use of Town Property
Hotworks (Welding and Cutting) Application
recordTypes.description: Work involving, burning, welding, or a similar operation that is capable of initiating fires or explosions. Examples include, but are not limited to: welding, cutting, grinding, soldering, heat treating, hot riveting, torch-applied roofing, abrasive blasting, and powder-driven fasteners.

recordTypes.name: Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation (ANRAD)
Mattress and Box Spring Recycling
recordTypes.description: As of November 1, 2022, mattresses, box springs, and textiles will no longer be allowed in the trash. New state rules require mattresses and textiles be kept out of the trash so they can be recycled or donated for reuse. In order to comply, Hudson has set up a mattress recycling bin at the Transfer Station. A textile recycling bin is also at the Transfer Station.

recordTypes.name: Kennel License Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Kennel License (5+ dogs) from the Town of Hudson. All dogs over 6 months old must be licensed. Licenses expire on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Curbside Application
recordTypes.description: The Town of Hudson has contracted with B-P Trucking, Inc. for trash and recycling curbside pick-up. This program is fee-funded by subscription users. Tax dollars do not support the program.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Cooking Hood Suppression System Alteration, Repair, or Shutdown Permit Application
recordTypes.description: For any commercial cooking hood suppression system alterations, repairs, or shutdowns.

recordTypes.name: Sprinkler Alteration, Repair, or Shutdown Permit  Application
recordTypes.description: For any sprinkler alterations, repairs, or shutdowns.

recordTypes.name: Liquified Petroleum Gas (LPG) Storage Application
recordTypes.description: Commonwealth of Massachusetts "Application for Standard Permit" (Form FP-006). A list of permit categories is provided during the application process. This permit type is not used for residential real estate transfers.

recordTypes.name: Application for Annual Inspection
recordTypes.description: Annual Inspections expire on December 31st besides Daycares & Schools which expire on August 31st.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit
recordTypes.description:
All Driveway resurfacing and new driveways connecting to the town road right of ways will need a permit. Review Subdivision rules and regulations prior to submitting this application. If this is a new Driveway, note that you / your contractor needs to measure elevations at the center of the roadway, gutter line and 20’ into the driveway. Other measurements will need to be filled out as required.

PLEASE SUBMIT A MARKOUT APPLICATION PRIOR TO THE DRIVEWAY PERMIT APPLICATION.

recordTypes.name: Road Opening Permit
recordTypes.description:
All Hudson DPW licensed excavators are eligible to apply for this permit. If the excavation is within the road right of way (roadway, sidewalk, grass strips and adjacent land to the roadways) this permit will need to be filled out and if the excavation is more than 3’ deep, an associated Trench permit from the Fire department is required. No street opening is allowed during the snow months (November 15th to April 1st) unless it is deemed an emergency.

PLEASE SUBMIT A MARKOUT APPLICATION PRIOR TO THE ROAD OPENING PERMIT APPLICATION.

recordTypes.name: Subsurface Waste Water Disposal System Installer License Application
Electrical Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc. 

PLEASE NOTE: ALL SERVICE'S REQUIRE AN AUTHORIZATION NUMBER FROM HUDSON LIGHT AND POWER (978-568-8736) BEFORE AN ELECTRICAL PERMIT CAN BE ISSUED

Fire Alarm Alteration, Repair, or Shutdown Permit Application

A mechanical permit is required for boilers, furnaces, HVAC systems, new or replacements.

A sheet metal permit is required when work includes, but not limited to, manufacturing, assembling, fabrication, installing, dismantling, altering and repairing of duct or air exchange systems. Testing, adjusting and air balancing of all air handling equipment and duct work installed during new or remodeling of construction, residential or commercial. Installation of kitchen hoods, kitchen vents, bathroom exhaust vents and fans

The Hudson Community Care Fund is a local initiative dedicated to supporting our neighbors in times of need. This fund provides financial assistance and essential resources to Hudson community members facing challenges with housing, food security, and other basic needs such as hygiene products and clothing.

Rooted in the spirit of compassion and togetherness, the Hudson Community Care

categories.name: Conservation Commission
categories.content:
Welcome to the online permitting process for Wetland Permits

The Town of Hudson Conservation Commission is responsible for protecting Hudson’s valuable wetland resources by issuing permits for projects near wetlands and waterbodies. Permits are issued under the Massachusetts Wetlands Protection Act and the Town of Hudson Wetlands Protection Bylaw.

categories.name: Planning Board
categories.content:
The Planning Board is responsible for reviewing and permitting development proposals in the Town. This five-member elected Board reviews permit applications for subdivisions and some special permits (in the Downtown Zoning District), and it is designated as the authority for Site Plan Review approvals.

Meetings on the 1st & 3rd Tuesday of the Month

categories.name: Select Board – Local Licensing Authority
categories.content:
In the Town of Hudson, the Select Board serves as the Local Licensing Authority and is responsible for issuing licenses and for enforcing rules, regulations, and state laws. Licenses issued by the Board include: alcohol, common victualer, entertainment, class I, II & III, Christmas tree, pawn broker, second-hand dealer, roller skating, and more.

The Licensing Agent is generally available during regular business hours to assist with questions or with the application procedures.

categories.name: Zoning Board of Appeals
categories.content:
- Powers and Duties. The Board of Appeals shall pursue its duties identified in the statute, charter, by-law, and the Zoning By-Law.

- Term of Office. There shall be a Board of Appeals composed of five (5) members and three (3) associate members appointed by the Select Board, pursuant to Section 3-7(a) of the Town Charter and pursuant to Chapter 40A of the General Laws, each for three (3) year terms so that the term of office of at least two members expires each year.

recordTypes.name: Annual Building Inspection Request / Periodic Inspection Request
recordTypes.description:
The Massachusetts State Building Code (780 CMR, Chapter 1, § 110) requires that certain public use
buildings or spaces be annually and/or periodically inspected and certified by the local building official. 

Please complete this application and once we have received it through our online permitting system we will contact you schedule the inspection. 

These inspections usually take an hour or more, depending on the size of your building.

recordTypes.name: Northborough DPW - Drain Layer's Authorization
recordTypes.description: Drain layers are registered plumbers, and competent contractors licensed by the Town of Northborough, Massachusetts, and bonded to lay drains in the Town of Northborough, Massachusetts.  You must be a State licensed contractor or plumber to apply. In addition to your application for a new license (or a renewal), you will also be required to submit a copy of a bond to cover water, sewer, or drainage work in the amount of $5,000.  You will also be required to provide a certificate of Insurance naming the Town of Northborough as Additional Insured (no less than $1,000,000) for Public Liability and Property Damage.  New applicants must also provide three letters of recommendation.  The license, if issued, is good for one calendar year (expires 12/31).   It is only valid within the confines of Northborough, MA.

recordTypes.name: (CANRAD) Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation Application
recordTypes.description: Use this form for confirmation of protected resource area locations, types, size, and boundaries.  No other work will be permitted under this type of Order.  It requires work to be conducted by a licensed and certified wetland specialist, professionally engineered plan(s) of existing conditions, photos of site including main access, BVW Data Forms, ANRAD Plans Checklist available at https://www.hanover-ma.gov/node/2031/files, and appropriate fees.  It also requires submission of funds to establish a peer review account.  Contact the Conservation Agent at conservation@hanover-ma.gov to obtain the appropriate amount to submit.  ANRAD fees also apply and are paid to Comm. of MA as well as to the Town.  You are also responsible for the legal ad publication fee.  Further instructions are available within teh application.

categories.name: Inspectional Services
categories.content:
What permits are issued by the Department of Inspectional Services?

The Department of Inspectional Services, or DIS, is the issuing body for building permits, as well as certificates of inspection and electrical, plumbing, gas and mechanical permits.

Driveway permits are reviewed/issued first by DIS then they go to the Department of Public Infrastructure (DPI). Driveway, water, sewage, storm water and storm drain permits are issued by th

categories.name: Building Department

recordTypes.name: Business Certificates
recordTypes.description: Please use this application to apply for a New or Renewed DBA Certificate. All fictitious name certificates for businesses (commonly known as "doing business as" or "DBA" certificates) are filed with the Town Clerk. Massachusetts requires any person or business entity who is conducting business under an alias (i.e. any other name than their own), including corporations, to file a business certificate in the community where their business is principally headquartered. The fee to file for a Business Certificate is $30. Additionally, a $50 Zoning Review may also be charged if the review is required.

recordTypes.name: Yard Sale
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a Yard Sale Permit. These permits are limited to one per address, per year, and can be used to cover two consecutive days. Rain dates may also be noted.

PB - Special Permit by Planning Board
recordTypes.description: Special Permit from the Planning Board is required for projects specified in the Zoning Bylaws identifying the Planning Board as the Special Permit Granting Authority (SPGA) such as under § 4 - Special Regulations which includes § 4.2 -Multiple Dwellings and § 4.9 – Affordable Housing among others; § 7 - Communication Facilities; § 8 – Dennisport Village Center; § 9 - West Dennis Village Zoning; § 10 – Hotel Resorts District; § 11 – Wind Energy; § 12 – Seasonal Resort Community District; § 13 – Medical Marijuana; and Changes of Use. You will need a Stamped Site Plan showing existing and proposed conditions which includes a zoning summary table, all relevant dimensions and the property setbacks, topography, and abutting property owners. You will also need stamped existing and proposed floor plans and elevations. You should provide a detailed narrative describing the project and how the proposal meets the Intent of the zoning district, the Special Permit Review Criteria (§ 1.4.1.2); the Design Objectives (§ 4.1.2.5); and the Project Approval Requirements of the relevant section of the zoning bylaw.

recordTypes.name: PB - Planning Board Special Permit Modification
recordTypes.description: Special Permit from the Planning Board is required for projects specified in the Zoning Bylaws identifying the Planning Board as the Special Permit Granting Authority (SPGA) such as under § 4 - Special Regulations which includes § 4.2 -Multiple Dwellings and § 4.9 – Affordable Housing among others; § 7 - Communication Facilities; § 8 – Dennisport Village Center; § 9 - West Dennis Village Zoning; § 10 – Hotel Resorts District; § 11 – Wind Energy; § 12 – Seasonal Resort Community District; § 13 – Medical Marijuana; and Changes of Use. You will need a Stamped Site Plan showing existing and proposed conditions which includes a zoning summary table, all relevant dimensions and the property setbacks, topography, and abutting property owners. You will also need stamped existing and proposed floor plans and elevations. You should provide a detailed narrative describing the project and how the proposal meets the Intent of the zoning district, the Special Permit Review Criteria (§ 1.4.1.2); the Design Objectives (§ 4.1.2.5); and the Project Approval Requirements of the relevant section of the zoning bylaw.

recordTypes.name: Historic Application
recordTypes.description:
Are You Located in a Historic District?
Before submitting a Historic Application, please verify your property’s location using: 
Dennis Historic District Map (https://www.mapsonline.net/dennisma/historic.html)

Application Guidelines:
Please use the appropriate application based on your project type and location:

Old King's Highway Regional Historic District or South Dennis Historic District:
Use this application for any project requiring approval within these designated historic areas.

Demolition of Buildings/Structures 75 Years or Older (Demolition Delay):
Use the Demolition Delay application. This will be reviewed by the Dennis Historic Commission.
For questions regarding structures 75 years or older within a historic district, please contact:
Diane Rochelle – whiskeyboo@comcast.net

Please Note:
Separate applications are required for each of the following project types:

Demolition

Demolition Delay

New Construction

Additions

Accessory Structures

Solar Installations

recordTypes.name: PB - Public Shade Tree on Scenic Road - Tree Warden & PB
recordTypes.description: In accordance with MGL Chapter 87, §3 (Cutting of Public Shade Trees), The Tree Warden shall have the primary care and control of all public shade trees, shrubs and growths in the town. This includes public shade trees in the Right of Way of streets, except those within a state highway. The Tree Warden shall also have the primary care and control of town trees if so requested in writing by a town board or department with authority over that Town land. In accordance with MGL Chapter 40, §15C (Scenic Road Designation) and under the provisions of MGL Chapter 87, §3 (Cutting of Public Shade Trees), the Planning Board shall hold a joint public hearing with the Tree Warden, for the removal of a public shade tree on a designated Scenic Road.  The Tree Warden shall enforce all the provisions of law for the care and preservation of such trees, shrubs and growths.

recordTypes.name: ZBA - Variance by Zoning Board of Appeals
recordTypes.description:
Per MGL 40A, Section 10: The permit granting authority shall have the power after public hearing for which notice has been given by publication and posting as provided in section eleven and by mailing to all parties in interest to grant upon appeal or upon petition with respect to particular land or structures a variance from the terms of the applicable zoning ordinance or by-law where such permit granting authority specifically finds that owing to circumstances relating to the soil conditions, shape, or topography of such land or structures and especially affecting such land or structures but not affecting generally the zoning district in which it is located, a literal enforcement of the provisions of the ordinance or by-law would involve substantial hardship, financial or otherwise, to the petitioner or appellant, and that desirable relief may be granted without substantial detriment to the public good and without nullifying or substantially derogating from the intent or purpose of such ordinance or by-law.

A Variance from the Zoning Board of Appeals is usually required for an addition or a reconstruction of a structure that crosses a setback line, exceeds lot coverage where it does not now, increases existing non-conforming area by more than 40%, exceeds 30 % Floor Area Ratio, or other proposals that are not allowed by the zoning bylaws.

recordTypes.name: Tree Removal Application
recordTypes.description: Application must obtain prior approval from the Dudley Conservation Commission before work of any kind within areas of jurisdiction. Depending on the scope of the proposed tree cutting project and its possible impact on areas within our jurisdiction, the Conservation Commission may require additional permit (RDA or NOI)  be obtained by the applicant before work proceeds.

recordTypes.name: Street Opening
recordTypes.description:
Application for Opening of Streets
REQUIREMENTS FOR ROAD OPENING 
Within the limits of the pavement, the trench shall be backfilled ( if more than 24" deep) with Excavatable Controlled Density Fill (AKA Flowable Fill) to an elevation of four (4) inches below the top of the paved surface. The adjacent material extending one (1) foot beyond each side of the trench shall be removed, to a depth of four (4) inches. The perimeter of the trench shall be saw cut to provide a clean vertical joint.The vertical faces of the adjoining pavement shall be coated with a rapid setting type 1 (RS-1) emulsion. 4" of Bituminous Concrete shall then be laid in 2-inch lifts. The repair shall be neat, uniform and conform to the exisiting grade. 
The permitee shall be responsible for all future maintenance of the trench due to improper repair, up to and
including complete replacement of the patch, as deemed necessary by the superintendent of streets for a period of 2 years. Failure to comply within 24 hours will result in a $50.00 a day fine.
If the road opening is less than 24" in depth, screened gravel shall be used for backfill and compacted in 2 lifts. The final 4"will be bituminous concrete, laid in 2" lifts. The responsibilities remain the same as above.

recordTypes.name: Meeting Room Request Application
recordTypes.description:
The Morse Institute Library offers the use of its meeting rooms to further its roles as a place to meet and interact in meaningful ways, to learn and stay informed, and to celebrate and enjoy the diversity of the community. The Library's meeting rooms are a community asset, and use by community groups is encouraged when not in use for library purposes.

You can use this form to reserve the Lebowitz Meeting Hall and Community Room. 

Payment is due the FRIDAY before the meeting reservation.

recordTypes.name: Dog - Kennel License
recordTypes.description:
The Town of Natick is pleased to offer residents, businesses, and the public an electronic kennel licensing process through the Natick OpenGov portal. 

New Users: To use the Natick OpenGov Portal, new users must first register and create an account.
Returning Users: Use your previously created username and password.
*Note: If you have an existing OpenGov account with another community, your username and password are the same

About Natick Dog Kennel Licensing
All commercial or residential dog kennels are required to have a current Dog Kennel License to operate.

Dog Kennel Licenses must be renewed annually; failure to do so may result in fines of $500, per Article 50, §16.7 of the Town of Natick Charter and Bylaws and MGL Ch. 140, §141.

Kennel Licenses are valid January 1 through December 31 of each year.

The deadline for purchasing existing Dog Kennels without penalty is March 1. New Dog Kennel Licenses shall be obtained before the opening of the Dog Kennel. 

Purchased Dog Kennel Licenses are non-refundable.

Dog Kennel Licenses are not transferable.

If there are any questions, please contact

Animal Control Officer, (508) 647-9500

City Clerk's Office, (508) 647-6430

recordTypes.name: Community Preservation Act (CPA) - Letter of Interest ("LOI")
recordTypes.description:
The Letter of Intent (LOI) serves as guidance for individuals or CPA Project Proposal Teams as they prepare a CPA Project Proposal for consideration of Community Preservation Funding. At this stage of development, CPA Project Proposals can range from initial concepts to more formalized, scoped projects. The LOI Review Team, made up of Town Staff, will assist CPA Project Proposal Teams in refining their proposals.

After the LOI process, the next step is the CPA Funding Request Application. An LOI Letter is required before a CPA Funding Request Application may be submitted.

LOI Filings are accepted on a rolling basis
