recordTypes.name: Community Preservation Act (CPA) - CPA Funding Request Application
recordTypes.description: The CPA Funding Request Application commences after the LOI process and is the submittal of a formalized CPA Project Proposal that is ready to receive Community Preservation Funds. Review of CPA Project Proposals at this phase of review is conducted by the CPC. The review includes evaluation, ranking, and a vote whether to recommend a CPA Project Proposal to Town Meeting for allocation of Community Preservation Funds.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU) Application Review
recordTypes.description:
Natick and Accessory Dwelling Units (ADU)

As Natick prepares for the 2024 Fall Annual Town Meeting (2024 FATM), Governor Healey signed into law the Affordable Homes Act on August 6, 2024.  As part of the Affordable Homes Act, Communities are required to allow for the creation of Accessory Dwelling Units (ADU) As of Right (also referred to as By-right). The Town of Natick at the 2024 Fall Annual Town Meeting voted to adopt Section III-M Accessory Dwelling Units, which regulates how ADUs are created in Natick.

Two family dwellings require TWO building permits (one for each side).

All applications MUST be in the name of the CSL.

All uploaded documents MUST be in a PDF format. 

Please call the main office (508-647-6450) between the hours of 8am-4:30pm Monday through Wednesday, 8am-6pm Thursdays, and 8am to 12:30pm Fridays to schedule your building inspection. 

The applicant MUST be the CSL.   The job card MUST be on site at all times.

recordTypes.name: Food - Cottage Operation/Residential Kitchen
recordTypes.description:
Massachusetts State Sanitary Code Chapter X - Minimum Sanitation Standards for Food Establishments 105 CMR 590.010 (E) requires a Food Establishment Permit must be obtained if food is prepared in or distributed or sold from a Cottage Food/Residential Kitchen Operation.
Only foods that DO NOT require refrigeration and/or a variance shall be prepared in or distributed from a Cottage Operation/Residential Kitchen can be for sale to the public.
Wholesale Operations (selling to retail stores, restaurants etc.) require a food processor license be obtained from the State of MA Food Protection Program (FPP). Contact the State FPP at 617- 983-6770 or visit: https://www.mass.gov/guides/starting-a-wholesale-food-business
The use of brokers, wholesalers and warehouse by cottage kitchen operators to store, sell and distribute foods prepared in cottage (residential) kitchens is prohibited. Food products made in cottage kitchens may not be sold-out-of state (FDA does not recognize these foods as originating from an approved source).

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Applicant must be a licensed professional. 

This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc. 

The State requires that licensed electricians call the electrical inspector in order to schedule Inspections. Please call the main office (508-647-6450) between the hours of 8am-9am Monday through Friday and ask for the electrical inspector to schedule your inspections.   PLEASE HAVE YOUR PERMIT NUMBER HANDY! 

Inspections are typically scheduled the same or the following day. 

The job card MUST be on site at all times.

Please call the main office (508-647-6450) between the hours of 8am-9am Monday through Friday and ask for the gas inspector to schedule your inspections. The job card MUST be on site at all times.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Plan Review
recordTypes.description:
Commercial Plan Review
Any work requiring permitting from 780 CMR and/or the IBC that includes:

1. New or substantially altered fire alarm systems
  a. Relocation of devices that involve egress changes or the addition of walls that will require additional devices
  b. Changes in the sequence of operation
2. New or substantially modified (relocation of 20 or more sprinklers) sprinkler systems
3. Overhead gas station suppression
4. Custom-engineered hood suppression systems
5. Or other complex fire protection systems
6. If egresses are impacted in any manner, then a plan to overcome the impairment shall be submitted as part of the package and reviewed by a third party.

The Fire Department review and approval are for work involving any of the following:

- 780 CMR Chapter 4 (Special Detailed Requirements Based on Use and Occupancy)
- Chapter 9 (Fire Protection Systems) 
- Chapter 34 (Existing Structures). 

An IEBC study shall be included in the submittal.

Should the plans fit into any of the above categories, they shall be reviewed by an approved party firm from the list below. The cost for review will be borne by the submitting firm (per 527 CMR 1.00, Section 1.15.1.3). The cost is set by the reviewing firm.

Third Party Reviewers

This list is in no particular order.

Code Red Consultants, LLC
CRCFIRE.com
thirdparty@crcfire.com
All emailed inquires and documentation will receive a response within 24 hours
\t
Jensen Hughes
jensenhughes.com
Carson Cook, PE
Email: carson.cook@jensenhughes.com
One Research Drive, Suite 305C,
Westborough, MA 01581
Office: 508-273-8490
Cell: 617-966-0128
\t
JS Consulting Engineers, PLLC
jsfirecode.com
Alex Browning, PE
Email: abrowning@jsfirecode.com
224 Main Street, Suite 2C,
Salem, NH 03079
Cell: 401-965-1157

Submittal Requirements

Submittals must be in accordance with the language below and be found to be satisfactory to the reviewing party. Incomplete submittals are subject to rejection and delays in permitting.

Prior to approval of a Building Permit by the Natick Building Department, Natick Fire Prevention requires Third Party Review and Recommendation for Approval of Tier One Construction Documents (including Engineering Plans, System Narratives, etc.) associated with new or modified fire protection/fire alarm systems. In addition to the life safety system approvals, a Construction Fire Safety Plan in accordance with NFPA 241 and 527 CMR 1.00 shall be reviewed.

categories.content:
Apply Online to the Planning Board

Community Economic Development (CED), invites Applicants to submit applications for review through the Town’s online portal. The online portal intends to increase permitting efficiency, reduce paper, increase communication between Applicants and the Town while setting clear expectations for Application submittals.

At any time, if there are any questions, please get in touch with the Department of CED (508)647-6450.

categories.name: Zoning Board of Appeals
categories.content:
The Zoning Board of Appeals, also known as the ZBA, is a quasi-judicial board comprised of five regular members and three associate members. Applications reviewed by the ZBA, found within this portal, include appeals of a Building Commissioner determination, special permits, and variance applications subject to MGL c 40A.

recordTypes.name: Business Information
recordTypes.description: Welcome to the City of North St. Paul.  Thank you for registering your business with us.

recordTypes.name: Road Restriction Allowance
recordTypes.description: Moving heavy loads on City streets during posted road restrictions requires prior approval from the City of North St. Paul. If you need an allowance during this time, please complete this application for staff review.

recordTypes.name: Well Head Sealing Authorization
recordTypes.description: Cost-share program to encourage residents to seal abandoned wells to protect the City's groundwater.

recordTypes.name: Cannabis and Low Potency Hemp Edibles Registration
recordTypes.description: All establishments selling cannabis or low potency hemp edibles must apply for an annual license from the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Vendor License
recordTypes.description: Mobile Food Vendors must apply for the annual Mobile Food Vendor License.

recordTypes.name: Façade Improvement Program
recordTypes.description: The Façade Improvement Grant Program aims to strengthen, revitalize and sustain Downtown North St. Paul by encouraging and assisting property owners to make improvements to buildings within the Downtown area.

recordTypes.name: Film Production Permit
recordTypes.description: As part of Minnesota Film’s Film Ready Community Program, North St. Paul actively supports film, television, and media productions by providing a streamlined permit process. This permit makes it easier for production teams to access local resources and film at our city’s unique locations, helping showcase what North St. Paul has to offer.

recordTypes.name: Ball Field Sign Agreement
recordTypes.description: Advertise your business with a sign at one of our athletic facilities while helping the City support future park improvements. Banners are displayed from May through September.

recordTypes.name: Citywide Garage Sale
recordTypes.description: Register your North St. Paul Garage Sale for our Citywide Garage Sale event on May 1-3, 2025. Register your address and pay the $10 fee to receive a Garage Sale Yard Sign, be listed on the North St. Paul website.

recordTypes.name: Beekeeping Registration
recordTypes.description: Any resident interested in beekeeping on their property must complete an annual registration with the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Backflow Preventer Test Report
recordTypes.description: If your property is heated by a boiler we need an annual backflow preventer test filed with the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Liquor License
recordTypes.description: All establishments offering off-sale intoxicating liquors must apply for an annual license from the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster or Temporary Storage Container Permit
recordTypes.description: If your project requires you to place a dumpster on the street, you will need to apply for a Dumpster Permit from the City of North St. Paul. Permits will be granted only to City-licensed dumpster haulers.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: A zoning permit applies to driveway, fence, shed, patio, and retaining wall projects.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Permit
recordTypes.description: Right of Way permits are required for any work in the public right of way near streets, including street cuts and underground work that extends into the public right of way.

recordTypes.name: Lawn Fertilizer Applicator License
recordTypes.description: Commercial contractors applying fertilizer or other lawn treatment in the City of North St. Paul must obtain a license annually from the City. The Lawn Fertilizer Applicator License fee is $80.

recordTypes.name: Criminal Record/Background Consent
recordTypes.description: Applicants applying for certain licenses must authorize the North St. Paul Police Department to conduct a background check.

recordTypes.name: Duplex /Twin Home Rental License
recordTypes.description: To ensure the safety of our residents, the City of North St. Paul requires all duplex rental units be licensed and inspected annually.

recordTypes.name: Chicken Registration
recordTypes.description: Any resident interested in hosting a chicken coop on their property must apply for a license from the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Buckthorn Puller/Weed Wrench
recordTypes.description: Residents can reserve a Buckthorn Puller/Weed Wrench from the City Office for 5 days. Complete your reservation online and pick it up at City Hall when one is available.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Electrical permits are required for all electrical work.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Enterprise
recordTypes.description: All Boy Art Enterprise businesses in the City of North St. Paul must be licensed annually.

recordTypes.name: Consumption and Display Liquor Permit
recordTypes.description: No business establishment or club which does not hold an on-sale intoxicating liquor license may directly or indirectly allow the consumption and display of alcoholic beverages or knowingly serve any liquid for the purpose of mixing with intoxicating liquor without first having obtained a permit from the City.

recordTypes.name: Foster Care, Day Care and Group Home Inspection
recordTypes.description: As required by Ramsey County, the City of North St. Paul inspects any home requesting foster care, day care or group home status.

recordTypes.name: Potentially Dangerous Dog / Dangerous Dog Registration
recordTypes.description: Residents with dogs deemed dangerous or potentially dangerous by the City must file and complete an annual license registration.

recordTypes.name: National Night Out 2025
recordTypes.description: National Night Out is an annual celebration to encourage community-building that promotes police-community partnerships. National Night Out will take place on Tuesday, August 5th, 2025.

recordTypes.name: Cigarette & Tobacco Sale License
recordTypes.description: License for the retail sales of cigarettes and/or tobacco sales in the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Registration
recordTypes.description: Any contractor performing work in the public right-of-way must be licensed annually by the City of North St. Paul. The Right of Way License fee is $220.

recordTypes.name: Refuse Collection License (Commercial)
recordTypes.description: All garbage haulers servicing commercial properties in the City of North St. Paul must be licensed. The Garbage Refuse Collection License for commercial haulers is $220.

recordTypes.name: Data Disclosure Request: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act
Multi-Family Housing Rental License
recordTypes.description: To ensure the safety of our residents, the City of North St. Paul requires all multi-family rental units be licensed annually and inspected every two years.

recordTypes.name: Hydrant Meter Permit
recordTypes.description: If your project requires temporary water service you will need a Hydrant Meter Permit from the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Block Party Application
recordTypes.description: Plan a block party with your neighbors. Complete this application so the City of North St. Paul can assist with barricades and other needs.

recordTypes.name: Charitable Gambling Permit
recordTypes.description: Organizations hosting charitable gambling in the City of North St. Paul must apply for a gambling permit for their scheduled acvitites.

recordTypes.name: Property Watch Request
recordTypes.description: Inform the North St. Paul Police Department of your vacation plans to request additional drivebys and to update your emergency contact information.

recordTypes.name: Electric/Water/Garbage & Recycling Utility Service
recordTypes.description: Establish, update or change your North St. Paul residential electric, water, and garbage and recycling services.

recordTypes.name: Tree Trimming License
recordTypes.description: Any contractor conducting tree trimming or tree care services in the City of North St. Paul must be licensed annually. The Tree Trimmer license fee is $80.

recordTypes.name: Rental Property Change of Ownership or Management
recordTypes.description: Notify the City of North St. Paul of any ownership or management changes in your  rental property so we can update your license.

recordTypes.name: Rain Garden Permit
recordTypes.description: To ensure the initial construction and ongoing maintenance of a rain garden is performed satisfactorily, a permit shall be required for the operation of rain gardens located in the right-of-way and on private property.

recordTypes.name: Native Vegetation Permit
recordTypes.description: Any resident interested in native landscaping on their property must apply for a permit from the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Trenching Contractor License (Commercial Plumbing and Utility Permit)
recordTypes.description:
Contractors conducting any kind of trenching in the City must be licensed annually. The fee for a Trenching Contractor License is $80.

The Trenching Contractor  License fee is waived for licensed plumbers.

recordTypes.name: Kennel License
recordTypes.description: Any resident in the City of North St. Paul with three or more dogs must apply for a no-cost Kennel License.

recordTypes.name: Single Family Rental License
recordTypes.description: To ensure the safety of our residents, the City of North St. Paul requires all single family rental units be licensed and inspected annually.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Signs in the City should be kept within reasonable boundaries consistent with the objectives and goals of the community to retain its special character and economic advantages. A sign permit ensures the quality of the sign's appearance and its compliance with the City's current ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Temporary On-Sale Liquor License
recordTypes.description: This license is for non-profits or clubs who need a short-term liquor license for a specific event.

recordTypes.name: Tenant Consent to Inspect
recordTypes.description: Help us safely inspect your North St. Paul housing. Please complete a  consent to inspect form with us.

recordTypes.name: Storm Water Pollution Prevention Plan Permit
Liquor Sales: Extension of Premises
recordTypes.description: This license is for existing liquor license holders who wish to extend their liquor sales to an area outside of their permitted business for a limited time or special event.

recordTypes.name: Courtesy Bench License
recordTypes.description: License to host a courtesy bench in the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Underground Tank  Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: Removing an underground tank to repair/replace or remove? Complete an Underground Tank Removal Permit from the City to ensure the safety of your project.

recordTypes.name: Property and Special Assessment Verification Request
recordTypes.description: Title companies, realtors, and potential residents interested in determining if there are any outstanding assessments on a property may request a Property and Special Assessment Verification Report from the City.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Conditional Use-Level 3 Home Occupation Permit
Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description: A written application for a special event permit shall be completed and provided to the City not less than 30 days before the proposed event date.

recordTypes.name: Underground Tank  Installation Permit
recordTypes.description: All underground tank installations in the City of North St. Paul require a permit. Complete your permit online and easily upload your required documents.

recordTypes.name: Report a Problem: Code Compliance Concerns
Gasoline Distribution License
recordTypes.description: Any business dispensing gasoline in the City of North St. Paul must be licensed.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Interim Use-Level 2 Home Occupation Permit
Pawn Shop License
recordTypes.description: All Pawn Shops located in the City of North St. Paul must be licensed annually and meet current state and city ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Report a Problem: General City Questions/Communications Content
Report a Problem: Public Works/Electrical Concerns
Peddler Solicitor Sales License
recordTypes.description: Any profit, or non-profit agency conducting sales in the City of North St. Paul must obtain a Merchant Solicitor Sales license.

recordTypes.name: Therapeutic Massage Enterprise
recordTypes.description: All Massage Enterprise businesses in the City of North St. Paul must be licensed annually.

recordTypes.name: Therapeutic Massage Practitioner
recordTypes.description: Massage practitioners in the City of North St Paul must apply for an annual license.

recordTypes.name: Trenching (Sewer/Water) Permit
recordTypes.description: Any contractor doing sewer or water work or repairs that impact the connection between the resident's and the City's sanitary sewer or water system, including new or repaired connections must have a Trenching Permit from the City of North St. Paul.

recordTypes.name: Tree Service Permit
recordTypes.description: Any planting, removal or treatment of trees in the public right-of-way require a Tree Service Permit from the City of North St. Paul, including any work that may impact power lines.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Site plan review is required for all new multifamily and nonresidential developments and any additions that result in the expansion of 1,000 square feet.

categories.name: Right-of-Way
categories.content: Any work in the public right-of-way requires a permit from the City of North St. Paul. This includes any excavation, placement of dumpsters or containers, as well as other public use of the City's right-of-way easements.

categories.name: Zoning Permits
categories.content: The City of North St. Paul requires Zoning Permits for a variety of land use and development.

categories.name: Specialty Permits
categories.content:
Specialty Permits

The City of North St. Paul offers several specialty permits including:

  • Special Event Permits
  • Cell Tower Permits
  • Charitable Gambling P

categories.name: Contractor Licenses
categories.content: The City of North St. Paul requires contractors to be licensed for various work in the City. Please review the list of required contractor licenses before beginning work on your project.

categories.name: Liquor Licenses
categories.content: All Liquor License applicants in the City of North St. Paul  must complete the appropriate application and provide all required documents. The North St. Paul City Council is the final authority on all Liquor License applications. All Liquor Licenses expire on June 30 each year.

categories.name: Rental Housing Licenses & Reports
Police
categories.content: The North St. Paul Police Department serves the safety needs of the City's residents, businesses, and visitors. Please review the following applications for service and/or information provided by the Department.

categories.name: Resident Resources
categories.content: The City of North St. Paul provides many ways for our residents to communicate with staff and participate in our commissions, authorities,  employment and volunteer activities.

recordTypes.name: Revolving Loan Fund Application
recordTypes.description: This loan application is intended as gap financing for a commercial project; a bridge with the applicant's existing conventional lender. It is intended to help businesses and build a strong, diversified and sustainable economy in Winona County. As a public fund, financial information from applicants may be discussed in open meetings. Please review the Revolving Loan Checklist and guidelines on the County website,

recordTypes.name: Annual Solid Waste Collection and Transportation License
recordTypes.description: This application is for new and existing solid waste haulers who collect and transport wastes in Winona County.  The Winona County Solid Waste Ordnance requires solid waste collection and hauling services operating in Winona County to be licensed annually by the Winona County Board of Commissioners and submit all requested information before final Board approval.

recordTypes.name: Feedlot Permit
recordTypes.description:
For an existing or a new feedlot.
Change of Operation (switching animal types, increasing animal numbers, new manure storage, new/expanding facilities)

recordTypes.name: Notification of Well Construction
recordTypes.description: A notification of well construction is required before starting work on a private water supply well.  Homeowners wishing to install their own drivepoint well should contact this office before attempting to use the online application process.

recordTypes.name: Address Request
recordTypes.description: Request for new address

recordTypes.name: Commercial Timber Harvesting Permit
recordTypes.description: Commercial timber harvesting is defined as the gathering of timber on private lands for the purpose of realizing a profit. A permit is required if the harvest is occurring on one (1) or more acres within the Natural Features Overlay Districts or the harvest is occurring within or involves five (5) acres or more of land outside the Natural Features Overlay District.

recordTypes.name: Address Sign Replacement Request
recordTypes.description: Request for address sign replacement

recordTypes.name: Appeal to Board of Adjustment / Request for Variance
recordTypes.description: A Request for Variance is to allow an exception to Winona County Zoning Ordinance, allowing a use that is otherwise forbidden in the ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Notification of Well Sealing
recordTypes.description: A notification of well sealing is required before sealing a water supply well, dewatering well, or environmental well .  Work must be performed by a licensed Minnesota Well Contractor for the well type to be sealed.  Do not submit this notification for temporary environmental borings.

recordTypes.name: Feedlot Conditional Use Permit
recordTypes.description:
Chapter 5 of the Winona County Zoning Ordinance defines the procedure for obtaining a Conditional Use Permit (CUP) through the County Board of Commissioners.  

An application for a CUP is required when:
1: A new animal feedlot is proposed to have in excess of three hundred (300) animal units.
2 An existing animal feedlot is proposing a change in operation which results in the feedlot having in excess of three hundred (300) animal units.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit
recordTypes.description: Land disturbance is defined as any changes or alterations of the land surface including, but not limited to, removing vegetative cover, excavating, grading and filling, and the construction of impervious surfaces and structures, excluding standard agricultural practices. A permit is required when any of the conditions under 6.13.2 of the WCZO are met.

recordTypes.name: Feedlot/Manure Storage Closure
recordTypes.description: Within 60 days of closure, an owner of a feedlot must submit a certified letter to the County Feedlot Officer (or MPCA officer for your region) stating the feedlot or manure storage areas have been closed in accordance with MN Rules 7020.2025. The closure is required for feedlot components unused for one year.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use/Interim Use Permit
recordTypes.description:
A conditional use permit grants the property owner the right to use his property in a way that is expressly permitted by the Winona County Zoning Ordinance. A Conditional Use Permit may be allowed with appropriate restrictions upon a finding that:

- Certain conditions as detailed in the Zoning Ordinance exist;
- The use or development conforms to the Comprehensive Plan of the County; and
- Is compatible with the existing neighborhood.

recordTypes.name: Development Certificate
recordTypes.description: County authorization to conduct most construction activities. This includes but is not limited to building construction/alternation/removal,  rough grading, driveway construction, footing construction, or other physical changes to a site. Although Winona County does not have a building inspection program, this form is commonly referred to as a "Building Permit".

recordTypes.name: Environmental Well Permit
recordTypes.description: An Environmental Well Permit is required for the construction of a well used to sample or monitor groundwater as defined in MN Statutes 103I.005 Subd. 8a.

recordTypes.name: Septic System Application
recordTypes.description: A SSTS permit must be obtained prior to the installation, construction, replacement, modification, alteration, repair or capacity expansion of a sub-surface sewage treatment system (SSTS).

recordTypes.name: Dewatering Well Permit
recordTypes.description: A Dewatering Well Permit is required for all wells greater than 25 feet in depth used to lower groundwater levels as defined in MN Statutes 103I.005 Subd. 4a.

recordTypes.name: Septic System Point of Sale Certification
recordTypes.description: Winona County requires a point of sale certification form to be completed and approved any time a sale or transfer of property occurs, unless an exemption applies.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Vacation Rental License Application Process
recordTypes.description: Operation of a short-term vacation rental requires a registration with the Town that must be renewed on an annual basis as set forth in this Section. The Registrant shall conduct a self-inspection utilizing the Town’s Short-Term Vacation Rental Checklist and shall provide the Town a signed copy of the completed checklist as part of the registration process. The Town reserves the right to inspect the property during the registration period for the limited purpose of determining that all registration requirements for the property have been met, and the property meets all building code requirements prior to beginning operation as a short-term vacation rental. Any inspection shall occur upon prior notification to the property owner, at a reasonable time, and with the property owner or its designated agent present for the inspection. The Registrant is responsible for payment of any costs related to the inspection.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description: Nye County Special Event Permit for selling liquor at a special event by: A nonprofit organization or club which otherwise does not hold a liquor license; or A currently licensed for profit business or other for profit or nonprofit entity which desires to sell liquor outside of its licensed premises.

recordTypes.name: At-Risk Development Application
recordTypes.description: This application is ONLY for applications that have had a Site Development application submitted and would like to request an At Risk Grading Permit.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Structures, Multi-Family Structures, and Non-Traditional Single Family Structures
recordTypes.description:
All Commercial and Multi-Family Structures use this permit application. Non-prescriptive/engineered single family homes and Large Structures (Barndominiums, Aircraft Hangars, Private vehicle garages over 1,000 sq ft, and storage buildings with an interior or attached One or Two-family dwelling) also use this application. 

***Do NOT use this application for typical IRC Prescriptive One and Two-Family Dwellings (Type VB) and their associated structures. Please use the project type specific Residential Applications. Building and Safety staff cannot convert applications, and will unfortunately reject any traditional/prescriptive single family dwelling and duplex applications.***

recordTypes.name: Encroachment Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Please review the files below. Depending on your application, they may be required to attach.

recordTypes.name: Nye County Haulers License
recordTypes.description: Use this application for Solid Waste Hauler or Sludge and Septic Haulers Licenses.

recordTypes.description: Onsite Sewage Disposal System OSDS (Commercial)

recordTypes.name: 1. Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing Your Information Copy
recordTypes.description: Instructions on signing up for a Citizen Services Cloud Account and how to access your profile and records.

recordTypes.name: 2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
recordTypes.description: How to apply for a permit and pay any fees that are due.

recordTypes.name: Adult Use/Medical Cannabis Establishment Business License
recordTypes.description:
Annual renewals are due NO LATER than June 1st of each year. Any renewal not submitted by June 30th shall automatically expire. 

Any annual renewal submitted after June 1st shall be deemed a late submittal and be accessed a late fee of 25% of the annual renewal fee. 

Please note your Nye County Property and Personal Taxes must be current at time of application or the application will be placed on hold until they are current.

recordTypes.name: Improvement, Maintenance & Warranty Agreement & Security Release
recordTypes.description: Maintenance and warranty guarantees shall be required for all maps where dedication of public improvements are made to, and accepted by, Nye County.

recordTypes.name: FIRE PREVENTION -  Permits
recordTypes.description: Use this FIRE PREVENTION permit application for NEW Construction, ADDITIONS,  ALTERATIONS, Changes in OCCUPANCY , Fire SPRINKLER Systems, Fire ALARM Systems, HOOD Suppression Systems, CO2 tanks; TEMPORARY Structures, etc.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description:
Contact the Nye County Tax Assessors office prior to applying for a permit to demolish a structure.

Use this permit for the following: 
INTERIOR DEMOLITIONS where no exterior demolition work is being performed and a Tenant Improvement is not within the permitted scope of work, OR
PARTIAL DEMOLITIONS where both interior and exterior work is within the scope of demolition work, and a Tenant Improvement is not within the permitted scope of work, OR
COMPLETE DEMOLITIONS where the entire structure is removed including all footings, slabs, foundations, and associated underground utilities and tanks.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Improvement Plan and Technical Study Review
recordTypes.description: This application is for the submittal of subdivision improvement plans, engineer's estimate data sheets, and technical studies to be reviewed by Nye County Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Appeal Application
recordTypes.description:
If you wish to have the RPC reconsider a condition of approval that was placed upon your application you will need to apply for the Conditional Use Permit / Reconsideration of Conditions of Approval application and NOT an Appeal. 

Please note your Nye County Property and Personal Taxes must be current at time of application or the application will be placed on hold until they are current.

recordTypes.name: 3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Document
recordTypes.description: How to view and print your issued permit, license, or other issued document.

recordTypes.name: 4. Uploading Attachments
recordTypes.description: How to upload new attachments to your already-submitted application.

recordTypes.name: Business License Review
recordTypes.description:
Use this application for a Short Term Vacation Rental business, Initial Business (License) Review, Business Name Change, or an Address Change for the business. 

Please note your Nye County Property and Personal Taxes must be current at time of application or the application will be placed on hold until they are current.

recordTypes.name: Technical Study Review
recordTypes.description: Application to review Technical Studies. (Drainage, Geotechnical, Traffic studies, and Traffic Scoping Checklists)

recordTypes.name: Electrical Pedestal Only Permit
recordTypes.description: For the installation of a new electrical pedestal or the replacement of an existing one.

recordTypes.name: Road/Utility Construction Improvement Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This application is for the submittal of road/utility construction improvement plans, engineer's estimate data sheets, and technical studies to be reviewed by Nye County Public Works. This application is not for site development or subdivision submittals!

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
*** PLEASE NOTE***
This permit application is NOT for an electrical pedestal only. Please use the Electrical Pedestal Only Permit application.

recordTypes.name: Cannabis Quarterly Submittal
recordTypes.description:
Q1 is due April 25th
Q2 is due July 25th
Q3 is due October 25th
Q4 is due January 25th


Payment must be received within 10 days of the due date (25th of the month) to avoid late fees being accessed.

recordTypes.name: 5. How to Reach Us! About Us & Contact Information
recordTypes.description: How to reach us!

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Amendment
recordTypes.description: A Certificate of Amendment is used to correct or amend a recorded plat, survey or map.

recordTypes.name: Field Investigation
recordTypes.description: Field Inspection permits are issued to provide a mechanism to inspect for compliance when there is no active work being performed.

recordTypes.name: Grading Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit application for grading only permits when a building permit has not yet been approved or issued.

recordTypes.name: Development Agreement
recordTypes.description:
Pre-development meeting is required, contact the Planning Department at 775-751-4249 to schedule your meeting. 

After a complete application for a Development Agreement has been filed, the Planning Department shall
schedule the agreement for a hearing before the BOCC within one hundred and twenty (120) days of filing, unless the time is extended by mutual agreement of the Planning Director and the applicant.

recordTypes.name: Dust Control Plan
recordTypes.description:
Construction activities include but are not limited to: cut and fill, site cleanup, staging areas, stockpiles, surface grading, trenching, landscaping and construction. 

For additional information please visit https://www.nyecounty.net/324/Air-Quality.

recordTypes.name: Residential Carport / RV Storage Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A permanent structure that is open on at least two sides and used for the storage and/or parking of personal vehicles, recreational vehicles, and/or equipment. The structure may either be attached or detached to the principal dwelling.

recordTypes.name: Extension of Time or Cannabis Special Use Permit
Solar / Above Ground Utility Special Use Permit and Development Plan
Residential Casita permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this permit application for construction of a NEW DETACHED CASITA, or an ADDITION to or ALTERATION of an existing detached Casita. 

Please Note: When a new home or duplex has a proposed DETACHED structure, such as a casita, garage, out building, pergola or patio cover, separate applications and permits are required for the home and the detached structures.

recordTypes.name: Residential DETACHED GARAGE/WORKSHOP/ACCESSORY STRUCTURE Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
NOTE: This permit record  may NOT be used for Aircraft Hangars or Personal Vehicle Garages/Workshops/ Storage Buildings greater than 1,000 square feet. Please use the Commercial/Multi-Family/Non-Traditional... permit type and choose the "U" occupancy classification.

This permit record may NOT be used for Greenhouses, Casitas, Patio covers, Covered Porches, and Decks.

This record MAY be used for Single Family Residential DETACHED Garages, Workshops, and Accessory Structures (Storage Sheds/Out-buildings) up to 1,000 square feet.

If you are adding or altering an ATTACHED garage, workshop or storage space < 1,000 s.f. to an existing single family home or duplex, please use the single family home or duplex permit and choose the correct type of work from the dropdown menu.

recordTypes.name: Grandfathered Determination Letter or Zoning Administrator Determination Request
recordTypes.description:
If you are wanting to see if a use is permissive please use the Zoning Verification application. 

Use this application to request a Zoning Administrators Determination or a Grandfathered determination on your property(s).  For a use that isn't permissive. 

You will need to provide the burden of proof to the Zoning Administrator that your property is grandfathered.

Be specific in your request and the current usage. Please attach additional letters if needed.

recordTypes.name: Residential FENCE and/or WALL Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this building permit application for Fences and/or Walls over 6 ' high that serve Single Family Homes and Duplexes, or a Retaining Wall that measures over 4' high from the bottom of the footing to the top of the wall

recordTypes.name: Land Division
recordTypes.description:
This application is for parcel maps, subdivision maps, and boundary line adjustments. 

Please note your Nye County Property and Personal Taxes must be current at time of application or the application will be placed on hold until they are current.

recordTypes.name: Residential ISDS Individual Sewage Disposal System
recordTypes.description: Individual Sewage Disposal System ISDS (residential) (add hyperlink to handout)

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Structure Set Down Permit (Pahrump Only)
recordTypes.description:
This permit is a requirement for NEW or REPLACED Manufactured Structures within PAHRUMP ONLY. This permit is in addition to the State Manufactured Housing Permits required for ALL of Nye County. 

PLEASE NOTE: As of July 7, 2021, all State Permits for Manufactured Housing are issued and inspected by  the Department of Business and Industry Nevada Housing Division - Manufactured Housing
1830 E. College Pkwy. #120, Carson City, Nevada 89706; Phone 775-684-2940
3300 W. Sahara Ave. #320, Las Vegas, Nevada 89102; Phone 702-486-4135

Electrical Pedestals, Septic Tanks, Out Buildings and other Detached Structures are still permitted and inspected by the Nye County Building and Safety Staff.

recordTypes.name: Residential NEW STOCK PLAN SUBMITTAL *** INITIAL REVIEWS and 1 YEAR RENEWALS ONLY***
recordTypes.description:
***This is NOT an application for a building permit.***

Stock Plan Reviews are available for SINGLE FAMILY and TWO-FAMILY DWELLINGS (Duplexes), CARPORTS, SHADE STRUCTURES, and other COMMON DESIGN PROJECTS.

Approved STOCK PLAN REVIEWS are effective for 1 year from the date of approval. Stock Plans may be renewed for a renewal fee equal to the original plan review fee provided the adopted code editions have not changed.

Subsequent and separate applications for Planning and Zoning Approval, Septic Tanks, and Building Permits will be required each time you wish to construct a previously approved Stock Plan. 

Save the Stock Plan record number for entry into the application for a building permits.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Development / Pre-Application Meeting
recordTypes.description: Use this application if you would like to meet with a Planner to discuss a property requirements for potential development or prior to submitting an application for development or set up a Pre-Development Meeting with all Nye County Staff for Site Development requirements.

recordTypes.name: Residential PATIO COVER/ COVERED PORCH/ SHADE STRUCTURE/GREENHOUSE Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Open at least two sides and either freestanding or attached to the residence.

recordTypes.name: Residential Single Family Residence or Duplex Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this building permit application for TYPE VB Single Family Homes and Duplexes with or without private vehicle garages that are no greater than 1,000 s.f. 
*Permit types include New Construction, Additions, and Alterations for the principal building only.
**When a new home or duplex has a proposed DETACHED structure, such as a garage, Casita, out building, pergola or patio cover, separate applications and permits are required for the home and the detached structures.
***Large structures > 1,000 s.f. with an interior or attached one or two-family home (Private vehicle garages, Barndominiums and Aircraft Hangars) use the Commercial Structures, Multi-Family Structures, and Non-Traditional Single Family Structures application. PLEASE CALL THE PERMIT OFFICE FOR GUIDANCE.

recordTypes.name: Request for Air Quality Services (Dust Control Complaint)
recordTypes.description:
Do not put your property address as the violation address. If  you do not know the address for the complaint please use the Nye County GIS  to locate the property to submit your complaint. 

Please upload no less than 30 second clips that you have recorded showing the violation.

recordTypes.name: Request for Code Compliance Services
recordTypes.description:
Do not use this form for Air Quality (Dust Control) complaints.  

Please provide specific and detailed information, including the exact location address or Assessor's Parcel Number as well as a complete description of the violation. 

All information provided is kept confidential. The department will not accept complaints from anonymous sources.

recordTypes.name: Residential Solar Electric System Permit
recordTypes.description:
For the installation of residential mounted solar electrical equipment, including any battery storage devices, main panel upgrades, and new sub-panels.

Ground mount systems will require Planning & Zoning approval under a separate application prior to your application submission.

recordTypes.name: Road / Street Name Change/New Subdivision or New Street Name Application
Site Development
recordTypes.description: Refer to NCC 17.04. Article VI Development Standards for all requirements for commercial and industrial building.

recordTypes.name: Tenant Improvement - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is for COMMERCIAL INTERIOR work ONLY.

recordTypes.name: Vacation or Abandonment of Streets or Easements
recordTypes.description:
This application requires a map to be submitted by a Nevada Licensed Surveyor.
It will be reviewed in accordance with NRS and Nye County Code.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Review - submit for total property development and/or accessory structures
recordTypes.description:
Application Review can take 3 - 5 business days  based on work load. 

The Zoning Review application is to submit for total property development. SFR, utilities, ground mount solar, accessory structures like garages, barns, etc. 

DO NOT USE this application if you are ONLY installing a well, septic, power or fencing/block walls, pools, carports or patio covers or all of these. Use the Zoning Review - Utilities, Fencing / Block Walls, Carport, Deck, Pool or Patios

recordTypes.name: Zoning Review - Utilities, Fencing / Block Walls, Carport, Deck, Pool or Patios ONLY
Zone Change/Master Plan Amendment
recordTypes.description:
Use this application to apply for a Zone Change on your property to a current zoning district, or to apply for a Master Plan Amendment. 

Pre-Application Meetings are REQUIRED prior to application.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Ordinance Text Amendments
recordTypes.description:
This application is NOT TO CHANGE your property zoning. This application is to initiate a TEXT AMENDMENT to current Nye County Code or propose a new section of code. 

If you are unsure if this is the process you need please contact our Department or set up a Pre-Application Meeting in our online portal.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Request
recordTypes.description:
This application is for verifying whether a specific use is permissive on a property or multiple properties that may not be listed on current Nye County Code.

This is NOT to apply for adding buildings, fencing, well, septic etc on the property.

categories.name: Help, Links, Guides & Other Information
categories.content:
When uploading documents please do not include any special characters: example NO !@#$%^&*/ \\\\\\\\or non-western characters. You can have dashes - or underscores _.

Make sure your pop-up blocker allows popups from the View Point site or pop up blocker turned off.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
All driveway permit applications shall comply with the State of New Hampshire's driveway statute, RSA 236:13 and the Claremont Planning Board's requirements. 
All fees must be paid, appropriate signatures attained, and bonds (if required) posted prior to any permit being granted. All highway and right-of-way cuts require the posting of a minimum of $2500.00 bond which will be returned upon DPW approval of the completed activity. Other retainers may be higher, when in the opinion of a DPW superintendent, the activity has the potential of causing greater damage to any portion of the City's infrastructure.

categories.content: We strive to help make the City of Claremont a safe, healthy and beautiful place to live by actively enforcing the City Codes and Ordinances. recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit Permit
recordTypes.description:
Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:30a-4:30p. 631-351-3009.

RENEWAL APPLICATIONS, PLEASE FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS ON YOUR RENEWAL FORM. 
The Town of Huntington requires Accessory Dwelling Unit (formerly Accessory Apartment/mother-daughter) permits in owner-occupied single-family dwellings. Regardless of the occupancy of the apartment, whether it is for family use, being rented, for owner use, or is vacant, a valid permit must be obtained for the second kitchen. This special-use permit requires Zoning Board of Appeals approval. All new applications are subjected to a public hearing, bi-yearly inspections, and bi-yearly fees. Under town code, a saturation report is conducted on the parcel location of the application to insure regulation in the number of apartments in the area. There shall be no more than 10% or more of the lots within a one-half-mile radius of the application for which an ADU is present. Permit holders are subjected to conditions under town code.  
Under town code, NEW ADU applications are not permitted in basements/cellars/attics/or detached structures. Only one ADU per parcel of land is permitted.

recordTypes.name: 911 Address Request
recordTypes.description:
Fill out this form to request a 911 Address online. Site plans indicating where the driveway will be located are essential to receive an accurate address. Please attach all documentation pertaining to the parcel or give a detailed explanation of where the driveway will be located. 

**Important** Once this form is submitted and an address is created, it can take 1-2 business days, in most cases, for new addresses to be recognized in this system.

If you experience problems while filling out the address request form, please call the 911 Addressing Coordinator in the Planning Department at 336-242-2228

recordTypes.name: Complaints - Environmental Health
recordTypes.description:
Environmental Health Specialists enforce state and local laws, rules, and ordinances in variety of program areas.  Specialists also investigate complaints and provide science-based education about local environmental issues to residents who rely every day on safe food, land, water, and air.
Please call (336) 242-2310 if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Central Permitting Complaint Form
recordTypes.description:
Davidson County Planning Department provides investigation to properties that may feature illegal signage, solid waste (garbage, refuse, construction debris), junk vehicles, abandoned manufactured home(s), or business activity that are located within the County's planning & zoning jurisdiction. 

Please contact the City of Lexington at (336) 248-3900, the City of Thomasville at (336) 475-4255, City of High Point at (336) 883-3328 or the Town of Denton (336) 859-4231 if the property is located in any of these jurisdictions.

recordTypes.name: Improvement Permit (IP) and Construction Authorization (CA) Onsite Wastewater Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is for an Improvement Permit (IP) and a Construction Authorization (CA). It should be submitted to the Davidson County Health Department for a site when public sewer is not available. This permit is needed prior to the construction, location, or relocation of a residence, place of business, or place of public assembly. However, if you do not plan to build within the next five years you should apply for an Improvement Permit (IP) Only.

Please call (336) 242-2310 if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Step #1 Commercial Building Project Plan Review
recordTypes.description:
All commercial projects are required to submit an online Plan Review Application to the Commercial Plan Review Office. A part of the application submittal process is to upload a COMPLETE set of construction documents, plans, and drawings.  Incomplete and/or partial submittals will not be accepted until all documents have been received.

The average review process takes three (3) to five (5) weeks for all approvals from time the submittal is received. If addendums, revisions, or corrections are required to be made at the request of
any department, the process time will start over once corrected construction drawings are resubmitted to
the Plan Review Office or the department who made the request. Once all approvals have been given, an
email will be sent to the contact person/submitter with a permit number, fees due, and an uploaded set of the Approved Plan Set.

recordTypes.name: Step #2 Commercial Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: All Commercial Building Permits are required to be applied for by the appropriate license holder, or responsible party. Once all approvals have been given through the plan review process, the responsible party can make an application for the appropriate permit. The commercial plan examiner will upload the approved plan set. The Approved Plan Set will be required to be on-site and available to the inspector(s).  Central Permitting can print the plans for a $3 charge per sheet, or the contractor can print it themselves. The plans must be legible and readable.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Complaint Form- Amended
recordTypes.description:
Davidson County's Planning Department investigates properties that may contain Zoning and/or Solid Waste Violations within the County's Planning & Zoning jurisdiction. 

Please contact the City of Lexington at (336) 248-3900, the City of Thomasville at (336) 475-4255, City of High Point at (336) 883-3328 or the Town of Denton (336) 859-4231 if the property is located in any of these jurisdictions. 

**Attention: When submitting complaints online, you are creating a digital footprint; therefore, all content of this online form becomes public record. To report a violation anonymously, please send a detailed letter including the address of the violation and to the Planning Department with no name or return address via USPS, or visit us at 913 Greensboro St., Suite 305, Lexington, NC 27292**

recordTypes.name: Step #2 Commercial Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: All Commercial Building Permits are required to be applied for by the appropriate license holder, or responsible party. recordTypes.name: Improvement Permit (IP) Only Onsite Wastewater Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is for an Improvement Permit (IP) only. It should be submitted to the Davidson County Health Department for a site when public sewer is not available. This application is for a soil evaluation only and is not enough in order to obtain a building permit. This permit is needed prior to the construction, location, or relocation of a residence, place of business, or place of public assembly. However, if you plan to build within the next five years you should apply for an Improvement Permit (IP) and a Construction Authorization (CA) instead.

Please call (336) 242-2310 if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Construction Authorization (CA) Onsite Wastewater Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
This Application is for a Construction Authorization (CA) Only. It cannot be applied for unless there is a current application on file for an Improvement Permit (IP) or a valid IP exists for your site. PLEASE HAVE YOUR CURRENT IP NUMBER AVAILABLE WHEN COMPLETING THIS APPLICATION.

However, if you do not have a valid IP or a current application for an IP on file you must submit a different application. If you plan to build within the next five years you should apply for an Improvement Permit (IP) and a Construction Authorization (CA) instead.

Please call (336) 242-2310 if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Fast Track Permit Application
recordTypes.description: All Commercial Building Permits are required to be applied for by the appropriate license holder, or responsible party. recordTypes.name: Existing System Reuse Authorization Application-Building Authorization (BA) or Manufactured Home Connection (MH)
recordTypes.description:
Application for Existing System Reuse Authorization (Building Authorization or Manufactured Home Connection Authorization) is the first step in obtaining permits to set up a manufactured home, when a site modification is requested that requires a building permit (pool, deck, garage, room additions, etc.) or when a change of use occurs. The application is valid for one year from the date the application is accepted. The Existing System Reuse Authorization, once issued, is valid for one year. 
Please call (336) 242-2310 if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Permit
recordTypes.description: Where Building Permits are required and upon the request of a permit applicant the Fire Code Official is authorized to issue a Conditional Permit to occupy the premises or portion thereof before the entire work or operations on the premises is completed, provided that such portion or portions will be occupied safely prior to full competition or installation of equipment and operations without endangering life or public welfare.

recordTypes.name: Repair Permit Application - Onsite Wastewater Construction Authorization (CA)
recordTypes.description:
This application is required to repair an Onsite Wastewater System.

Septic systems will adequately absorb and purify wastewater if they are properly maintained. However, sometimes due to damage, excessive water usage, or due to the systems age a failure occurs. To protect you and the health of others, it is important to obtain a repair permit from the health department and remedy the problem as soon as possible.

The North Carolina Cooperative Extension publication states that, "Contrary to popular belief, septic systems are not maintenance free. Money that is saved by not paying a monthly sewer bill should be set aside for regular inspections and maintenance. A few precautions can save you anguish and money. Reducing water use, avoiding grease, cleaning the effluent filter, pumping the tank periodically, and properly landscaping the yard to keep surface water away from the tank and drainfield are inexpensive precautions that can help assure your system a long life. Go to this website to find out more information: https://content.ces.ncsu.edu/septic-systems-and-their-maintenance


Please call (336) 242-2310 if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Water Sample(s) Request
recordTypes.description:
After a water sample is collected from your water supply, the sample is shipped to the North Carolina State Laboratory of Public Health in Raleigh for analysis.

Bacteriological - This sample will show the presence or absence of total coliform and fecal coliform (E. coli). 

Inorganic Chemical and Nitrates – Inorganic chemical sampling tests for things such as alkalinity, arsenic, calcium, chloride, copper, hardness, lead, iron, magnesium, manganese, pH, fluoride, and zinc. 

Pesticides, Petroleum, and Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) – These tests all sample for organic chemicals.

recordTypes.description:
This Temporary Power/Gas Application is for new construction projects ONLY. Temporary Power/Gas can only be applied for where 75% of the project has been finished and inspected. This means that all trade (electrical, plumbing, and mechanical) rough-ins inspections must have been approved and that the structural portion of the work must have an approved up to an insulation inspection. 

If any trade (electrical, plumbing, and mechanical) work has not had a final inspection, you must have your subcontractors sign the temporary power form.  Please note: If you have not had an electrical final inspection, you will need to outline which circuits of the electrical system you want energized.

recordTypes.description: The City of Southport adopted a Short-Term Vacation Rental Ordinance on July 8th, 2021.  This ordinance prohibits short-term vacation rentals within the residential districts of the city of Southport but does allow short-term vacation rentals existing on the date of the adoption of the ordinance to continue as lawful nonconforming uses.  The City is no longer using a registration program to monitor the operation of shorter term vacation rentals or homestays, but the property must still comply with the zoning districts and standards of the Unified Development Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Local Board of Building Code Appeals
recordTypes.description: In accordance with § 36-105 of the Code of Virginia, there shall be established within each local building department a local board of building code appeals (LBBCA). Whenever a county or a municipality does not have such a LBBCA, the local governing body shall enter into an agreement with the local governing body of another county or municipality or with some other agency, or a state agency approved by DHCD for such appeals resulting therefrom. Fees may be levied by the local governing body in order to defray the cost of such appeals. In addition, as an authorization in this code, separate LBBCAs may be established to hear appeals of different enforcement areas such as electrical, plumbing or mechanical requirements. Each such LBBCA shall comply with the requirements of this section. The locality is responsible for maintaining a duly constituted LBBCA prepared to hear appeals within the time limits established in this section. The LBBCA shall meet as necessary to assure a duly constituted board, appoint officers as necessary, and receive such training on the code as may be appropriate or necessary from staff of the locality.

recordTypes.description: Any work within Town-owned property (roads, sidewalks, etc.) shall get prior approval with a Right-of-Way Use Permit prior to commencement. Please contact the Public Works Department at 540-347-1858 with any questions or concerns regarding Right-of-Way Permits.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit application to apply for structural changes to your residence or commercial property. This includes sheds larger than 256 square feet, like for like change-outs of gas appliances, and remodeling basements or bathrooms. Please note: Like for like replacements of electrical appliances and cosmetic work (such as painting or replacing fixtures) do not require a permit. If you aren't sure if the work you are proposing requires a permit, please call the Community Development Department at 540-347-1101. We're happy to help!

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit > 1 Acre
recordTypes.description: Use this application to submit a Land Disturbance Permit (LDP) for projects with more than one (1) acre of disturbance (not a part of a common plan development) within the Town of Warrenton, except as exempted by Article IV - Site Conservation Manual of the Town of Warrenton Zoning Ordinance. For example, commercial and industrial uses, subdivisions, schools, and churches are included in this category.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit < 1 Acre
recordTypes.description: Use this application to submit a Land Disturbance Permit (LDP) for projects with more than two thousand (2,000) square feet and less than one (1) acre of disturbance (not a part of a common plan development) within the Town of Warrenton, except as exempted by Chapter 21 - Erosion and Stormwater Management Ordinance. For example, commercial and industrial uses, subdivisions, schools, and churches are included in this category.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit - Single Family Dwelling Agreement in Lieu
recordTypes.description: Use this application to submit an “Agreement in Lieu” of an Erosion and Sediment Control (ESC) Plan for a detached single-family dwelling project with more than two thousand (2,000) square feet and less than ten thousand (10,000) square feet of disturbance within the Town of Warrenton, except as exempted by Chapter 21 - Erosion and Stormwater Management Ordinance.

recordTypes.description: This form can be submitted to provide guidance to applicants prior to the submission of a formal application. A pre-application meeting is required prior to submitting a Comprehensive Plan Amendment, Zoning Map Amendment (Rezoning), and a Special Use Permit application.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a sign permit, both permanent and temporary. Unless otherwise stated in the Zoning Ordinance (Article 6), all signs shall require a sign permit. Where applicable, signs in the Historic District shall receive approval by the Architectural Review Board (ARB) prior to issuance of a sign permit. A building permit may also be required in conjunction with a sign permit, depending on the sign type and installation method.

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Plat
recordTypes.description:
Any person proposing a subdivision of land under this Ordinance must submit to the
Planning Director a Preliminary Plat showing the general design and layout of the area
proposed to be subdivided for plats involving more than fifty (50) lots. The landowner
may submit to the Planning Director a Preliminary Plat for fifty (50) or fewer lots for
tentative approval, but this is not a requirement. The purpose of this is to enable the
subdivider to ascertain whether his plans are in accordance with the provisions of this
Ordinance and to reduce deficiencies in final plat submissions and corresponding cost to
review those plats.

recordTypes.name: Board of Zoning Appeals Variance or Appeal
recordTypes.description:
Application for a variance or an appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals per Articles 11-3.11 and 11-3.12 of the Zoning Ordinance 

The Board of Zoning Appeals shall grant a variance if the applicant proves, by a preponderance of the evidence, that the strict application of the terms of the Ordinance would unreasonably restrict the utilization of the property or that the granting of the variance would alleviate a hardship due to the physical condition relating to the property or improvements thereon at the time of the effective date of the Ordinance.

An appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals may be taken by any person aggrieved or by any officer, department, board, or bureau of the municipality affected by any decision of the Zoning Administrator or
from any order, requirement, decision or determination made by any other administrative officer in the administration or enforcement of this article or any ordinance adopted pursuant thereto. Such appeal shall be made within thirty (30) days after the decision appealed from by filing with the Zoning Administrator, and with the Board, a notice of appeal specifying the grounds thereof.

recordTypes.name: Legacy Board of Zoning Appeals Variance or Appeal
recordTypes.description:
Application for a variance or an appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals per Articles 11-3.11 and 11-3.12 of the Zoning Ordinance 

The Board of Zoning Appeals shall grant a variance if the applicant proves, by a preponderance of the evidence, that the strict application of the terms of the Ordinance would unreasonably restrict the utilization of the property or that the granting of the variance would alleviate a hardship due to the physical condition relating to the property or improvements thereon at the time of the effective date of the Ordinance.

An appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals may be taken by any person aggrieved or by any officer, department, board, or bureau of the municipality affected by any decision of the Zoning Administrator or
from any order, requirement, decision or determination made by any other administrative officer in the administration or enforcement of this article or any ordinance adopted pursuant thereto. Such appeal shall be made within thirty (30) days after the decision appealed from by filing with the Zoning Administrator, and with the Board, a notice of appeal specifying the grounds thereof.

recordTypes.name: Site Development Plan
recordTypes.description: Use this application to submit a site development plan or an amendment to an approved site development plan within the Town of Warrenton.

recordTypes.name: Boundary Line Adjustment
recordTypes.description:
This is for Boundary Line Adjustments to plats for recordation. Boundary adjustments are permitted under Article 2-14 of the Subdivision Ordinance as follows: 

The sale and exchange of parcels between adjoining lot owners, and boundary
adjustments, are permitted and can be approved by the Planning Director without review
or approval by the Planning Commission or Town Council, subject to all of the following
conditions:
a. The sale or exchange does not create an additional building lot, a public or private
street, or any other public improvement.
b. The sale or exchange does not leave a parcel that does not conform to the lot size
requirements of the zoning district in which the property is located.
c. The applicant submits a duly executed survey of the property, in conformance with
the submission requirements for final plats set forth in this Ordinance and suitable
for recordation in the Circuit Court Clerk's office, with notation indicating the
amount of acreage exchanged and that no new building lot is created.
d. The applicant submits a copy of the new deed for review and approval.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Plat
recordTypes.description:
This application can be used to apply for a Recordation plat, Administrative plat, or Vacation plat. Any plat of record may be vacated in accordance with the provisions of § 15.2-2270, et
seq., of the Code of Virginia, as amended.

For administrative Plats:
The Town Council authorizes the Subdivision Agent to permit the separation of one (1) parcel from a tract as it exists at the time of adoption of this Ordinance without complying with all requirements of this Ordinance if:
a. It is not in conflict with the general meaning and intent of this Ordinance.
b. No new streets are required to serve the parcel or the residual tract,
c. Neither the parcel nor the residual tract is less than provided in the Zoning Ordinance.
d. Both lots meet the lot frontage and width requirements as provided in the Zoning ordinance

recordTypes.name: Easement Plat

Easements granted to the Town must utilize the Town's templated deed language, which is available upon request at LandDevelopment@WarrentonVA.gov.

recordTypes.description: No application shall be accepted and reviewed unless determined by the Planning Manager to be complete. Notification of acceptance or rejection of the application will be made within 15 calendar days of submission.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Zoning Permits can be used to apply for Zoning Confirmation letters, Zoning Determination letters, Temporary Uses, New Addresses, Fences/Walls that are not for a pool, Sheds that are less than 256 Sq. ft, and other accessory structures that do not require a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Ordinance Text Amendment
recordTypes.description: This application can be used to apply for a Text Amendment to the Town of Warrenton Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: As-Built
recordTypes.description: Upon completion of all required improvements shown on the approved site development plan or subdivision construction plan, the owner or applicant shall submit to the Town of Warrenton completed as-built plans. As-built plans shall be reviewed and approved by the Public Utilities Director and Planning Director for conformity with the approved site plan and the ordinances and regulations of the Town of Warrenton and state agencies. Final approval of as-built plans shall be required before the final release of applicable bonds.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Ordinance Text Amendment
recordTypes.description: This application can be used to apply for a Text Amendment to the Town of Warrenton Subdivision Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Waiver
recordTypes.description: This application can be used to apply for an Administrative Waiver to the Town of Warrenton Zoning and Subdivision Ordinance when permitted.

recordTypes.name: Legacy Administrative Waiver
recordTypes.description: This application can be used to apply for an Administrative Waiver to the Town of Warrenton Zoning and Subdivision Ordinance when permitted.

recordTypes.name: Final Plat
recordTypes.description: Final Plat applications are required as outlined under Articles 3-9 through 3-14 of the Subdivision Ordinance. Applications for a Final Plat must adhere to the regulations set forth within the Town of Warrenton Subdivision Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Residential Drive Access & Address Permit or Roadside Pipe Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is to obtain Residential Drive access and or an Address, or to replace or install a new Roadside Drive Pipe.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Drive Access & Address Permit
recordTypes.description: Drive Access, Address & Civil Site Engineering Review for single lot Industrial Commercial projects.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Any residential project in the Union County jurisdiction which requires a permit.

recordTypes.name: Residential Express Application
recordTypes.description: Residential projects in Union County that do not require plan review. This includes restoring electric power, replacing electric panels, installing whole house generators, replacing existing mechanical units (furnace, tankless hot water like-for-like replacements, HVAC), etc.

recordTypes.name: Residential Demolition Application
recordTypes.description: Includes demolition for residential projects only.

recordTypes.name: Commercial and Multi-Family Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: Plan Review only for commercial & multi-family projects (excluding plumbing)

recordTypes.name: Commercial Inspection Log
recordTypes.description: (Formally the CPA/ commercial permit application) Permit and inspection log application for Commercial and Multi-Family projects (excluding plumbing)

recordTypes.name: Commercial Express Application
recordTypes.description: Commercial projects in Union County which DO NOT require plan review. This includes restoring electric power, replacing electric panels, replacing existing mechanical units, shingle roof replacement, etc, and more. Call our office with questions 937-645-3018.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy Application
recordTypes.description: Application for commercial certificate of occupancy (does not include any type of alteration to the building)

recordTypes.name: Commercial Demolition Application
recordTypes.description: Includes demolition for commercial projects only.

recordTypes.name: Airport Hazard Zoning Application
recordTypes.description: For projects located within a 2.5 mile radius of the Union County Airport

recordTypes.name: Sewer Tapper Registration
recordTypes.description: Sewer tapper for work done within Union County but outside the City limits of Marysville
