categories.name: Engineering & Right-of-Way Permits
categories.content: <

recordTypes.name: Minor Subdivision-Lot Split-Lot Consolidation
recordTypes.description: This application is for the consolidation of parcels or the creation of three or fewer parcels that does not involve the creation of public right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Service Provider Registration
recordTypes.description: All service providers that offer or provide any service for a fee, either within the City or outside the City's corporate limits via facilities within the City, shall register each calendar year, on or before January 1, with the City, pursuant to Section 1016.02 of the Codified Ordinances, after filing an initial registration with the City prior to making application for a use permit.

recordTypes.name: Use Permit
recordTypes.description:
Any service provider who desires to construct, reconstruct, install, operate, maintain or otherwise locate facilities or who is currently maintaining, operating, constructing, installing or otherwise locating facilities in, under, over or across any public way of the City will be required to obtain a Use Permit. 

A Use Permit is required for any service provider who desires to work within a Public Way, Public Easement, or Public property or other such location.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way
recordTypes.description: Choose this application if you will be constructing, reconstructing, altering, repairing, removing or replacing the following within the City's right-of-way: any utility services, culvert pipes, sidewalks, driveway aprons, and ditch eliminations.

recordTypes.name: Board of Zoning and Building Appeals (BZBA)
recordTypes.description: This is an application for a Public hearing to review BZBA matters of administering the Land Development Code for Variance, Appeals, Conditional Uses, Nonconforming Uses/Structures/Lots and Interpretation.

recordTypes.name: Block Party
recordTypes.description: A resident or Homeowner's Association that plans to hold a block party must complete a Block Party Application and submit it to the City for approval no later than 30 days prior to the requested event date. Please review the regulations below before submitting a Block Party Application. Submission of application does not indicate or guarantee approval.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structures
recordTypes.description: This application is for sheds, detached garages, firepits and outdoor fireplaces, pavilions, pergolas, seating and retaining walls, and gazebos, unless the project is within the Historic District, in which case use the "Historic District" application form.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is for pools, firepits and outdoor fireplaces, hot tubs, pavilions, pergolas, sheds, seating and retaining walls, and gazebos.

recordTypes.name: Addition - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is for Additions that are less than 2,000 square feet.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use
recordTypes.description: Conditional uses are allowed when certain criteria are met (refer to Chapter 1206 of the Land Development Code for conditional uses and associated criteria). The result of the application will be decided upon at the Planning Commission Meeting.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Truck Permit
recordTypes.description: All food trucks operating in the City of Hudson must be licensed annually.

recordTypes.name: Garage Sale/Temporary Sign
recordTypes.description: All temporary signs, such as “garage” sales or other “event” signs, must be registered before installing or posting the sign. Section 1207.17 of the Land Development Code requires all temporary signs to be registered.  Register for temporary signs including:  Banners, For Sale signs, and Garage Sale signs. No permit fees apply.

recordTypes.name: Construction Permit
recordTypes.description: Any service provider who is constructing, reconstructing, altering, repairing, removing or replacing their facilities within the public ways is required to apply for a Construction Permit.

recordTypes.name: Minor Subdivision-Lot Split-Lot Consolidation
recordTypes.description: This application is for the consolidation of parcels or the creation of three or fewer parcels that does not involve the creation of public right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Media Production
recordTypes.description: A permit is necessary for any individual or company interested in media production (film, video, or large-scale photography) on City property within the city limits of Hudson. Please submit requests 30 days prior to production request, if possible. Permit is valid for the duration of the production request.

recordTypes.name: Change of Use
recordTypes.description: Use certificate is requested prior to the establishment of a business or change in occupancy. The application allows the Community Development Department to confirm the use is permitted in the applicable zoning district and allows the Fire Department to review and inspect the facility, as needed.  The zoning certificate will be issued within 7-10 business days after your application is accepted.

recordTypes.name: LDC Amendment/Map Change/Vacate Road or ROW
recordTypes.description: Applications for amendments to the text of the Planning and Zoning Code, changes to the Official Zoning Map or to vacate a road or Right of Way.

recordTypes.name: Additions
recordTypes.description: This application is for Additions, unless the project is within the Historic District, in which case use the "Historic District" application form.

recordTypes.name: Submission of Right-of-Way Bond
recordTypes.description: This application is for the submission of a new or renewed Right-of-Way Bond with the City.  Please make sure you are utilizing the new Right of Way bond form with the City's current address of 1140 Terex Road, Hudson, Ohio 44236.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Special Event
recordTypes.description: The City of Hudson requires all events hosted on public property or public events on private property with an expected attendance of 250+ to obtain a Temporary Special Events Permit and submit required documents to the Community Relations Manager prior to an event. Event hosts are expected to complete the Temporary Special Events Application sixty (60) days in advance and submit all required insurance and vendor information.

recordTypes.name: Alterations
recordTypes.description: The Solar application is no longer included within Alterations. For Solar, please select the application called "Solar (Rooftop or Ground Array)". This application is for exterior alterations including windows, siding, entry door replacement, and change of roofing materials (not including replacement of asphalt shingles). If the project location is within the Historic District, use the Historic District application.

recordTypes.name: Demolition - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is for demolition of commercial structures throughout the city. If the structure is greater than 50 years old the application will be placed on an Architectural and Historic Board of Review meeting agenda.

recordTypes.name: Major Subdivision - Compatibility and/or Preliminary Review
recordTypes.description: This application is for the Compatibility and/or Preliminary Review of the creation of four or more lots and/or the improvement of one (1) or more parcels of land for residential, commercial, or industrial structures or groups of structures involving the division or allocation of land for the opening, widening, or extension of any street or streets.  The result of the application will be decided upon at the Planning Commission Meeting.

recordTypes.name: Portable On-Demand Storage (POD)
recordTypes.description: Registration required in a Residential District only.  No permit fees apply.

recordTypes.name: Deck
recordTypes.description: This application is for all decks, except in the Historic District in which case use the "Historic District" application.

recordTypes.name: Major Subdivision - Final Review
recordTypes.description: This application is for the Final Subdivision Review after approval of the Preliminary Subdivision for the creation of four or more lots and/or the improvement of one (1) or more parcels of land for residential, commercial, or industrial structures or groups of structures involving the division or allocation of land for the opening, widening, or extension of any street or streets.  The result of the application will be decided upon at the Planning Commission Meeting.

recordTypes.name: Exterior Alteration - Commercial
recordTypes.description: The Solar application is no longer included within Alterations. For Solar, please select the application called "Solar (Rooftop or Ground Array)". This application is for exterior alterations, i.e. windows, doors, siding, for all Districts. Districts 6 and 8 and Architectural and Historic Board of Review approval is not required.

recordTypes.name: Pickleball/Tennis Court Reservation - Temporary Special Events
recordTypes.description: The City of Hudson requires pickleball/tennis court reservations to be approved for Temporary Special Events. Only two (2) event requests will be accepted annually. Events will not be allowed over any holiday weekend.

recordTypes.name: Town Hall Restroom Use Request
recordTypes.description:
The City of Hudson standardly does not allow use of the Town Hall restroom for Special Event use.  The organization requesting use of the restroom must assume responsibility for all clean up, trash removal, and paper items used through the event period.  Failure to clean up after the event, or any damages caused, may result in the denial of future Temporary Special Event Permits and may be subject to clean up or repair costs invoiced by the City to the responsible organization.  

This form shall be completed no later than 14 days prior to the schedule event.

recordTypes.name: Grading & Drainage Alteration - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is for grading and drainage alterations and tree clearing and/or site preparation.

recordTypes.name: Demolition
recordTypes.description: This application is for demolition of structures throughout the city. If the structure is greater than 50 years old the application will be placed on an Architectural and Historic Board of Review meeting agenda.

recordTypes.name: Development Agreement
recordTypes.description: This application is for a development agreement between a developer and the City that would provide certainty to a developer in exchange for high-quality development at an agreed-upon schedule. The result of the application will be decided upon at the Planning Commission Meeting.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Extensions and Patios
recordTypes.description:
This application is for driveway extensions to an existing driveway and patios. Please note that a right-of-way permit is required to make changes to a driveway apron.  

If you are replacing the driveway in kind, no extension, complete the right-of-way application only.  The extension application is not needed.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use
recordTypes.description: Temporary Use certificate is for a temporary use to be determined by the City Manager. The application allows the Community Development Department to confirm the use is permitted in the applicable zoning district and allows the Fire Department to review and inspect the facility, as needed.

recordTypes.name: Historic District - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is for these types of projects located within the Historic District: Accessory Structures, Additions, Alterations, Decks, Demolitions, Fences, and any other exterior project located within the Historic District or at the site of a Historic Landmark. Please plan to have a representative for this application appear at the AHBR meeting. The zoning certificate will be issued within 1-2 business days after approval from the Architectural and Review Board.

recordTypes.name: Vendor Application
recordTypes.description: All vendors participating in a public event on public property are required to submit a vendor application thirty (30) days prior to the event.

recordTypes.name: Fence
recordTypes.description: This application is for a fence unless being proposed in the Historic District or at the site of a Historic Landmark, in which case use the "Historic District" application.

recordTypes.name: Major Development
recordTypes.description: This application is for these types of projects: Accessory structures and additions greater than 2,000 square feet or 20% of the existing building area, and all new buildings.  The result of the application will be decided upon at the Planning Commission Meeting.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use - Seasonal Sales
recordTypes.description: The Temporary Use - Seasonal Sales certificate is to permit seasonal art, craft, book sales and other similar uses (as determined by the City Manager) in Districts 4 (Historic Residential Neighborhood), 5 (Village Core District) or 8 (Industrial Office/Park). This certificate also allows for seasonal sales of farm produce and packaged agricultural products in Districts 2 (Rural Residential Conservation), 5 (Village Core/Historic District), 7 (Outer Village Commercial Corridor and Office Overlay Zone), 9 (Darrowville Commercial Corridor) and 10 (Ravenna Road Mixed-Use Corridor).

recordTypes.name: New Commercial/Industrial Structure
recordTypes.description: This application is for all new commercial/industrial buildings that has had prior site approval from Planning Commission. Including additions greater than 2,000 sq. ft. with approval from Planning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Grading & Drainage
recordTypes.description: This application is for grading and drainage projects, with the exception of ditch enclosures.  Ditch enclosures shall be applied for under City Right-of-Way Work.

recordTypes.name: Outdoor Dining on Public Sidewalk
recordTypes.description: Application to utilize a portion of the existing public sidewalk (right of way) for the establishment of outdoor dining.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental
recordTypes.description: This application is for an operation of a short-term rental (such as an Airbnb, VRBO). This application will allow for the Community Development Department to adequately review the regulations and requirements involved with operating a short-term rental.

recordTypes.name: Green Home Certification  Registry
recordTypes.description: This application is to register your home as green-certified (you must obtain an acceptable third party certification of your home's sustainability improvements before you can register with the City).

recordTypes.name: Sign (Permanent) - Commercial/Business
recordTypes.description: This application is for permanent commercial/Business signs.

recordTypes.name: Historic District
recordTypes.description: This application is for these types of projects: Accessory Structures, Additions, Alterations, Decks, Demolitions, Fences, roof shingle replacement, and any other exterior project located within the Historic District or at the site of a Historic Landmark. Please plan to have a representative for this application appear at the AHBR meeting. The zoning certificate will be issued within 1-2 business days after approval from the Architectural and Review Board.

recordTypes.name: Weddings and/or Photography
recordTypes.description: Complete this application if you wish to hold a wedding or have photos taken on City property, such as the downtown Gazebo Green or First and Main Green. For weddings in the Hudson Parks, contact the Hudson Parks Department at (330) 653-5201.

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation
recordTypes.description: This application is for Home Occupation uses.

recordTypes.name: Solar (Rooftop or Ground Array)
recordTypes.description: For installation of solar (rooftop panels or ground array). This application includes all required City of Hudson reviews for solar, including Community Development and Hudson Public Power. A solar interconnection agreement will be generated upon completion of the application if the address is within the Hudson Public Power service area.

recordTypes.name: New House
recordTypes.description: This application is for a New House. The zoning certificate will be issued within 1-2 business days after approval from the Architectural and Review Board and all comments have been addressed.

recordTypes.name: Pools and Spas
recordTypes.description: This application is for above-ground pools, in-ground pools, and spas.

recordTypes.name: RV/Boat Storage
recordTypes.description: This application is for when an RV, boat, utility trailer or any other recreational vehicle is parked on a residential property.

recordTypes.name: Solar (Rooftop or Ground Array)
recordTypes.description: For installation of solar (rooftop panels or ground array). This application includes all required City of Hudson reviews for solar, including Community Development and Hudson Public Power. A solar interconnection agreement will be generated upon completion of the application if the address is within the Hudson Public Power service area.

categories.name: Service Provider Registration and Permits
categories.content: Service Providers must obtain three separate permits before undertaking any activities involving the construction, reconstruction, installation, operation, maintenance, or placement of facilities in, under, over, or across public ways within the City. The process begins with annual registration with the City of Hudson. Following registration, providers are required to appl

recordTypes.description: All contractors must be registered with Portage County to receive Permits.

HELPFUL LINKS:

<

recordTypes.name: Property or Zoning Complaint Form for Public Use
recordTypes.description:
The purpose of this form is to allow residents, property owners, and business owner to file a complaint with the Village of Plain City Planning & Zoning Department. 

Once a complaint has been filed, the zoning specialist conducts an inspection of the alleged violation. If a violation is found to exist, a case is opened and a written Notice of Violation is sent to the owner of the subject property.

recordTypes.name: Extension Request for Final Development Plan
recordTypes.description: Final Development Plan approval shall expire 12 months after the date of final approval unless substantial construction has been commenced and is continuing. An extension of up to twelve (12) additional months may be granted if approved by administration.

recordTypes.name: Signing Up, Creating a Profile and Accessing your Records
recordTypes.description: You must sign up to use ViewPoint the first time. You will create a profile that you can access later and see all of your records.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit (New Construction, Additions, Attached Structures, etc.)
recordTypes.description:
Please fill out the Village's standard Zoning Permit application when any of the following apply: Any new building construction (not including accessory structures); building addition to residential, commercial, or industrial; exterior alterations resulting in more or less square footage (i.e. change in building footprint); decks, porches, stoops; concrete/paver patio installations; driveway alterations/widening/replacement; residential solar panel installation (roof mounted).
Please see SEPARATE applications for Fence Permits, Accessory Structure Zoning Permits, and Sign Permits.
Alterations to driveway aprons, sidewalks, curbs, or other property located in the public right-of-way will require a separate Right-of-Way permit from Village Administration.
Please note that some of these projects will require additional building permits through the Village of West Jefferson Building Department, following zoning permit approval from Village of Plain City.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure Zoning Permit (sheds/storage buildings/detached garages/gazebos/pergolas, etc.)
recordTypes.description: Permits are required for all new and replacement sheds, storage buildings, or other detached structures. The zoning code permits no more than two (2) accessory/detached structures on any property.

recordTypes.name: Applying for a Permit and Paying Fees
recordTypes.description: Once you've created a profile and signed on, you can purchase permits by selecting the appropriate application and then paying the fees.

recordTypes.name: Receiving your Permit and other Documents
recordTypes.description: You will be able to view and print your permits, certificates, receipts, and any other documents.

recordTypes.name: Fence Permit
recordTypes.description: A fence permit is required for all new and replacement fences. Minor repairs (minimal board or post/support replacement) do not require a permit.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit - PERMANENT - Wall/Building Mounted, Monument/Ground, Directional, Window vinyl/graphics
recordTypes.description: Permits for all new and replacement permanent signage.

recordTypes.name: Registering Licensed Contractors
recordTypes.description: Must I register as a contractor in the Village of Plain City?

recordTypes.name: When is a Building Permit Required?
recordTypes.description: Are you curious if your project requires a building permit?

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit - TEMPORARY - Sandwich Board, Banner, Yard Frame, Window (Sales, Grand Opening, Coming Soon, Special Promotions)
recordTypes.description:
This application is for a Temporary Sign Permit. Any non-residential temporary sign requires a permit, with the exception of the temporary window signage that are displayed less than 30 days. 
Examples of permitted temporary signs are banners, sandwich board, yard, construction, development, coming soon, grand opening, real estate (over 6 sq ft).

recordTypes.name: Special Event Temporary Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Special Events that are approved by the Village are required to submit a Special Event Temporary Sign Permit Application. This permit must be approved prior to the display of any sign.

recordTypes.name: Interested in Opening a Business in Plain City?
recordTypes.description: Before opening your doors, there are a few important steps that must be taken to ensure compliance with the Village’s Zoning Ordinances and other Building Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration/Work Permit
recordTypes.description: Contractor registration and renewal in order to perform work in the Village of Plain City.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning or Zoning Ordinance Amendment
recordTypes.description: A rezoning application is needed when seeking to change the zoning classification of a property.  The Planning and Zoning Commission will provide a recommendation to City Council, who then determines the rezoning should be approved or denied.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Zoning Compliance (Final)
recordTypes.description: A Certificate of Zoning Compliance is required before any building can be occupied per Codified Ordinances of the Village of Plain City Chapter 1135.03.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Zoning Compliance (Temporary)
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Certificate of Zoning Compliance Permit is required for any temporary business that wishes to operate within the Village.

recordTypes.name: Area Variance
recordTypes.description: A variance allows a deviation from the Village's Planning & Zoning Code. Only the Board of Zoning Appeals (BZA) and/or City Council can grant variances. A variance cannot be granted for a use that is not permitted within a zoning district. A variance cannot be granted for signage that does not meet the current sign code.

recordTypes.name: (PUD) Development Plan Application
recordTypes.description: A Development Plan application is needed for all projects proposing a Planned Development (Commercial or Residential). The application must be reviewed by Zoning and Planning Commission. There are options for a Preliminary or Final Plan, or an Amended Plan if one has previously been approved.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use
recordTypes.description: Conditional uses are those uses that, because of special requirements or characteristics, may be allowed in a particular zoning district only after review and granting of conditional use approval imposing such conditions as necessary to make the use compatible with other uses permitted in the same zone or vicinity.

recordTypes.name: Major Site Plan
recordTypes.description:
"Major Site Plan" means a plan for a development which meets one of the following:
( 1) A development involving any new construction other than one- or two-family residential structures.
(2) A development involving an addition of more than 20 percent of the gross floor area of a structure, or no more than 5,000 square feet of impervious surface.
(3) A development creating more than 10,000 square feet of impervious surface.
(4) A development impacting or adjacent to a historic, archaeological, or environmentally sensitive feature.
(5) A development impacting a non-residential site adjacent to a residential zoning district.
(6) A development which conflicts with an adopted Village plan.
(7) A development of a non-conforming site or site which does not meet the development standards of the zoning district in which it is located. 
(8) A development which generates sufficient volumes of traffic, unusual patterns, or types of traffic that result in lowering the level of service of affected streets or intersections. 
(9) Other unusual or unique impacts which, in the professional opinion of the Zoning Inspector, warrant public review.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Accessory Structure Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Temporary zoning permit for accessory structures. This includes temporary storage containers/pods on residential properties, temporary construction offices/trailers for construction sites, portable classrooms for non-residential properties, and other structures not on a permanent foundation. Temporary accessory structures shall not be located on a property for longer than thirty (30) consecutive days. This permit shall not be used for the temporary placement of boats, recreational vehicles, camping trailers, cargo trailers, or other types of trailers.

recordTypes.name: Minor Site Plan
recordTypes.description:
Prior to issuance of a zoning permit for all developments other than single family residential and two­family residential developments, a site plan as defined herein shall be submitted to the Village of Plain City Zoning Inspector for review and approval. 

"Minor Site Plan" means a plan for a development which does not qualify as a Major Site Plan by definition in 1140.03(c) or specific determination by the Zoning Inspector.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for the demolition of a single-family home, multi-family dwelling, commercial building or accessory structure/detached garage larger than 450 SF.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Zoning Tent Permit
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Zoning Permit for Tents are required for all tents greater than 400 square feet in size. Please contact the West Jefferson Building Department for any building/safety requirements at (614) 379-5250. A fire safety inspection is also required, please contact the Pleasant Valley Fire District at (614) 873-4067.

recordTypes.name: Special Use Permit
recordTypes.description:
*BZA Approval required
Due to unique characteristics relative to location, design, size, operation, traffic circulation or need for public services, several specific uses have been identified which require supplemental criteria and review to substantiate that the use is appropriate for the proposed location. The following uses are subject to a special use permit: 
- Non-Residential Portable Structures and Temporary Uses
- Construction Trailers
- Portable Classrooms Temporary
Additional details can be found in Chapter 1184 of the Codified Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Notice of Appeal
recordTypes.description:
Appeals to the Board of Zoning Appeals (BZA) may be taken by any person aggrieved, or by any officer of the Municipality affected by any decision of the Planning and Zoning Department. Appeals shall be taken within twenty (20) calendar days after the decision by filing with the Planning and Zoning Department a notice of appeal, specifying the grounds.  

Appeals from a Board of Zoning Appeals Decision constitutes a Final Order within the meaning of R.C. 2505.02 and any party may appeal this decision within 30-days in accordance with those provisions of R.C. Chapter 2505.

categories.name: Zoning
categories.content: Zoning Permit Applications. Most common applications: Fence, Shed, Signs, New Construction, Certificate of Zoning Compliance. Per the Village of Plain City Codified Ordinances, 1135.02(d), Zoning Staff have up to 30 days from the time of submittal to review & approve or disapprove a zoning permit/certificate.

recordTypes.name: Lien Letter Application
recordTypes.description: Use this form when: You are about to refinance or sell your home. It requests the Township to produce a letter for your buyer or bank to certify that there are no municipal claims such as water, sewage, municipal debts, etc. against the property being sold, transferred, or refinanced. If there is a claim, the letter will provide the amount necessary to satisfy the claim(s).

recordTypes.name: Road Occupancy Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A Road Occupancy Permit (ROP) is required when work is proposed within the Township’s road right of way.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit - New Construction
recordTypes.description:
Please use this record type for construction of new residential dwellings. I.E. Single Family Residence, Townhouses, and Quads.

If applying for townhouse or quad permits, you will need to apply for a permit for each unit within a row or cluster.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit - Modifications to Existing
recordTypes.description: Please use this permit type for residential construction of additions, alterations, decks, accessory structures (garages greater than 1000 square feet or with habitable space), porch and deck roofs, generators, solar panels, etc.

recordTypes.name: Residential Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application for residential construction of decks (less than 30" above grade), sheds (under 1000 square feet), and detached structures (garage under 1000 square feet, greenhouse, carport, coop).

recordTypes.name: Pool/Hot Tub/Spa Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a pool, hot tub, or spa permit. This application should be used for both residential and non-residential applications.

recordTypes.name: Residential Fire Sprinkler Installation Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a permit to install or alter a residential fire sprinkler system. *** This is for one/two family dwellings and townhouses only.  For multi-family apartment buildings/hotels please use the non-residential fire protection permit.

recordTypes.name: Non-Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit should be used for all non-residential building permits except the installation or alterations of fire protection systems.

Permits shall be combination permits and include: building, mechanical, electrical and plumbing work. Full construction drawings will be required for the review process to start.

recordTypes.name: Non-Residential Zoning Application
recordTypes.description: Choose this option to apply for Non-Residential Zoning approval

recordTypes.name: Non-Residential Fire Protection System Installation/Alteration
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a permit for the installation or alteration of fire alarms, fire sprinklers, commercial kitchen hoods/suppression systems, and emergency responder radio signal boosting systems. This can be a deferred submittal and is typically applied for by the contractor completing the work.

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Home Installation
recordTypes.description: Please use this record type for the installation of a manufactured home or the replacement of a manufactured home within an existing park.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this application for all demolition work.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for installation of building mounted signs, freestanding monument signs, and panel replacements.

recordTypes.name: Front Yard Fence Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application for construction fences located with the front yard setback of a residential home.

recordTypes.name: Wireless Communications Facility in Right of Way
recordTypes.description: Use this application after construction of a Wireless Communication Facility that is located within a Road Right of Way.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter Request
recordTypes.description: Please use this application to request an official Zoning verification on a property within the Township.

categories.content:
Welcome to the Cranberry Township Online Portal!

The purpose of requiring a Building Permit is to verify code compliance in construction through the use of established code standards that exist for safety reasons.  In order to help you easily decide which permit process is correct for you, please read through the below application options. When you click on an application type, more information will be displayed about that particular application.

Cranberry To

categories.name: Land Development
categories.content:
Our main purpose is to facilitate and manage sustainable development in Cranberry Township that meets the needs of individual property owners and the Township as a whole within the parameters of the comprehensive plan.  

We accomplish this through dynamic land use regulations, thorough inspections, community involvement, and excellent internal and external communication.  We strive to enhance the physical environment and improve the quality of life for all residents, commercia

recordTypes.name: Historical Architectural Review Board Application for Certificate of Appropriateness
recordTypes.description: No building located within the Historic District shall be erected, expanded, reconstructed, altered, restored, demolished or raised within the Historic District unless or until a Certificate of Appropriateness has been issued by the Lower Makefield Township Board of Supervisors.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way/Roadway Occupancy Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is used for all right of way/roadway occupancy and excavation.  This permit is also utilized for all sidewalk and curb installations and replacements.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Lateral Inspection Permit
recordTypes.description:
A Sanitary Sewer Lateral Inspection is required prior to the sale/transfer of any property. The seller needs to engage a plumber to conduct a video inspection of the lateral to ensure that there are no breaks, clogs, or other obstructions that could affect the sewer line. Any repairs that may be necessary would be the responsibility of the property owner.  

The Township will review the video and note any corrective work that may be needed.  The seller is responsible to pay the $125 review fee.

recordTypes.name: Moving Permit
recordTypes.description:
Anyone who moves into, within or from Lower Makefield Township must obtain a Moving Permit.  

Landlords are responsible for reporting when tenants are moving into, within, or out of the Township.

A Sewer Lateral Inspection Permit is also required prior to the sale/transfer of any property.

recordTypes.name: Code Violations / Complaints
recordTypes.description:
The IPMC (International Property Maintenance Code) has been adopted by Lower Makefield Township and is used as the basis for the Township’s Property Maintenance Codes. The Township’s goal is to encourage both property owners and tenants to voluntarily correct violations when a violation is reported or has occurred. 

Potential violations are inspected through a process of inspection, notification, education, and notices with the owner or tenant ultimately being responsible for violation corrections. Should violations occur, the owner/tenant is given the opportunity to resolve the issue before legal action is taken. 

The Code Enforcement Officer ensures compliance to the Lower Makefield Township Code of Ordinances. The Code Enforcement Officer responds and investigates complaints and nuisances which may violate the Township’s Code of Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Citizen Requests, Feedback, Questions, or Observations
recordTypes.description:
Submit any requests, feedback, questions, or observations on issues directly related to Lower Makefield Township.
**THIS FORM IS NOT FOR APPLICATIONS FOR BUILDING PERMIT(S)**

recordTypes.name: Right to Know/Request for Information Form
recordTypes.description:
Requests for public records to Lower Makefield Township will comply with Act 3 of 2008, Pennsylvania's Right-to-Know Law.

For more information regarding Pennsylvania's New Open Records Law, visit: openrecords.pa.gov.

recordTypes.name: Blasting Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit must be obtained before any person is authorized to conduct any blasting or to use any explosive for the purpose of demolishing of a structure or blasting out rock, gravel, earth, trees, or any other substance or material.

recordTypes.name: Use and Occupancy (Non-Residential)
recordTypes.description: Application for Use and Occupancy before a commercial or nonresidential building is occupied.

recordTypes.name: Fats, Oils, and Greases (FOG)
recordTypes.description:
This permit requirement shall apply to both new and existing facilities generating fats, oils, or greases, and all such facilities shall install, use, and maintain appropriate grease interceptors as required:

(1) Every commercial food establishment such as restaurants, food courts, banquet facilities, etc.
(2) Every facility that prepares or serves food such as day cares, schools, mini markets, etc.
(3) All commercial, retail and industrial facilities that have the potential to discharge FOGs.
(4) Manufacturing processes that utilize or generate FOGs including cleaning of material.
(5) All vehicle repair facilities.
(6) All areas of intensified dwelling, including, but not limited to, adult day-care facilities, assisted-living facilities, convalescent homes, day nursing and child-care facilities in which food preparation occurs, homes for the mentally challenged, hotels, maternity homes, motels in which there is a commercial food preparation service, nursing homes, retirement and life care communities and homes, and truck stops with commercial food service, shall be required to have grease interceptors.
(7) All other generators discharging grease in amounts that, in the opinion of an authorized agent, will, alone or in concert with other substances from the discharges of other facilities, have a reasonable chance to impede or stop the flow of the sewer system.

recordTypes.name: Small Wireless Communications Facilities Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is used for all small wireless communications facilities located or collocated on any property or within any right of way.

recordTypes.name: Hot Works / Welding Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit must be obtained before any person is authorized to conduct any operation that will produce hot embers being emitted in the surrounding area.  This permit also requires a fire marshal to be present while the operation is being conducted.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Hearing Board Application
recordTypes.description:
ZHBs review applications for specific reasons as outlined in the MPC, including:
•Applications for a variance or a use by special exception
•Challenges to the validity of a land use ordinance, including those raising procedural questions or alleging defects in the enactment process
•Appeals to a determination from a zoning officer, municipal engineer, or agency on preliminary opinions, floodplain determinations, transfers of development rights, or administration of sedimentation and erosion control or stormwater management

recordTypes.description:

(e.g.- Airbnb, Flipkey, Home Away, VRBO, Craigslist, etc.)

recordTypes.description: Garage sales can not be conducted more than two times per year. Please be advised that signs are not permitted in the township for garage/yard sales.

recordTypes.name: Block Party Permit
recordTypes.description: A block party is a party for which the street and sidewalks may be blocked.  No State Road, arterial or collector streets may be used for a block party.  Only local (development) residential streets may have block parties.

recordTypes.description: Apply for a One Day Temporary Amusement permit here. One Day Temporary Amusement permits are required if the event is open to the public or there is a fee to participate.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Rental Registration
recordTypes.description:
In North Kingstown, per Chapter 9 Article XVIII, all short-term rentals shall be registered with the Town of North Kingstown. This application will be the online renewal for short-term rentals for the Town of North Kingstown.

Short-term rentals (STR) are generally defined as a rental of a residential dwelling unit or accessory building for periods less than 30 consecutive days. Short-term rentals can either be owner occupied or non-owner occupied. Short-term rentals may include entire homes, apartments, or individual rooms. Short-term rentals may be advertised using online hosting platforms.

recordTypes.name: Fire/Life Safety Complaint
recordTypes.description: This record is used to report an observed or perceived fire and/or life safety condition at a property in our town. Please be advised that we only have the authority to enforce code issues in buildings other than one- or two-family dwellings, and only in the common areas of a three-family dwelling unless the building is being sold. We can enforce any code deficiencies in all other buildings, either through our department or with the involvement of the RI State Fire Marshal's Office. If you suspect it is an immediate life safety hazard, please dial 401-658-0544 and speak to the duty officer. Complaints can be reported anonymously; however, if you wish to receive a follow-up notification of the issue, please include your contact information. Thank you for helping us keep Cumberland safe.

recordTypes.description: A hot work permit is required for any operation involving open flames or producing heat and/or sparks. recordTypes.name: NP Accessory Dwelling Unit Registration
recordTypes.description:
Under the North Providence, Rhode Island Zoning Ordnance
Chapter 35 of the Town Code
As amended to December 2014



210. Accessory dwelling units

A. One accessory dwelling unit shall be permitted within, or on the same lot as, a single household residence in all R zones provided that it meets all of the following requirements:
(1) The accessory dwelling unit is designed and constructed in such a way as to maintain
the appearance of the use of the lot as a single- household residence.
(2) The accessory dwelling unit is at least 30 percent smaller in total living area than the
single-household residence, or no more than 600 square feet, whichever is smaller. Where
special circumstances exist that are peculiar to the site in question, relief from this
requirement shall be available by a special use permit provided that the conditions in
Article V of this Ordinance are satisfied.
(3) The accessory dwelling unit is in the same ownership as the single-household
residence.
(4) Either the single-household residence, or the accessory dwelling unit is occupied by the
owner for at least six months of the year

B. Any accessory dwelling unit in existence on the effective date of this Section, with the
exception of legal nonconforming accessory dwelling unit, may be legally inhabited provided
that:
(1) Application is made for a Certificate of Registration for the accessory dwelling unit no
later than one (1) year from the effective date of this Section; and
(2) Within one (1) year of the date of such application, the Zoning Enforcement Officer
determines, to the extent that he is able, that the accessory dwelling unit is in compliance
with this Ordinance and all other applicable laws. Application for a Certificate of
Registration for an existing accessory dwelling unit shall be accompanied by an inspection
fee, which shall be in the amount of $50.00 and may be increased or decreased from time to
time by the Town Council.
C. Relief from the requirement that an existing accessory dwelling unit must comply with this
Ordinance may be granted by special use permit.
D. The taking of boarders or the renting of rooms by a resident family is prohibited in both the
single-household residence and the accessory dwelling unit. No rooming or boarding house shall
be permitted to have an accessory dwelling unit.
E. An accessory dwelling unit that is part of a single-household dwelling shall comply with the
dimensional regulations for a single-household use contained in Article II of this Ordinance.
F. An accessory dwelling unit may be permitted with a special use permit in RS, RL, CL and
CG zones.

recordTypes.name: Residential Smoke & Carbon Monoxide Inspection
recordTypes.description:
At the time of the transfer of title, the seller must provide the purchaser with a
certificate from the fire department for the community in which the dwelling is
located stating that the smoke and carbon monoxide alarms have been inspected
within one hundred twenty (120) days prior to the date of sale and has been
determined to be in good working order. The fire department for the community in
which the dwelling is located must inspect the smoke and carbon monoxide
alarms of the dwelling within ten days of a request from the owner. The
inspection may be conducted by qualified personnel of the department or the
State Fire Marshal’s Office. Neither the fire department nor the State Fire
Marshal shall be liable for any damage caused by the subsequent malfunction of
a smoke alarm or carbon monoxide alarm which it inspected.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Encroachment
recordTypes.description: Utility Work: A permit is necessary for any contractor replacing and/or installing utilities (gas, electric, phone, fiber optic, etc.) within the City right-of-way. Non-Utility Work: A permit is necessary for driveway approaches, sidewalks, yard pipe, storm sewer connections or any other work within the City Right-of-Way.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Financial Security Request
recordTypes.description: If the developer opts to provide financial security in lieu of completing required infrastructure improvements prior to recording the final plat, a cost estimate prepared by the developer’s engineer must be submitted on the City’s Itemized Cost Estimate Form and approved by the City Engineer. The financial security amount shall be based on 125% of the cost estimate approved by the City.

recordTypes.name: ATAX Grant Closeout Form
recordTypes.description: Request for Accommodations Tax Grant Reimbursement

recordTypes.name: Business Assistance Grant Application
recordTypes.description: Business Assistance grants are available to selected projects for new or expanding businesses which are located in and creating jobs in the City of Anderson.

recordTypes.name: Business Development Loan Application
recordTypes.description: The goal of the Business Development Loan Program is to provide businesses with financial assistance to support the retention and creation of jobs for low to moderate income City residents. The Business Development Loan Program is designed to fill the financing gap between private debt financing and private equity. Funds are provided to create economic benefit through increased revenues and the creation and the retention of jobs in the City.

recordTypes.name: Chicken Keeping Application
recordTypes.description:
No person shall maintain chickens or a chicken coop unless granted a permit by the City of Anderson.  The permit shall be subject to terms and conditions of Section 18-10 of the Code of the City of Anderson and any conditions deemed necessary by the City to limit the potential adverse impacts on the neighborhood surrounding the property on which the chickens are kept.  

A permit to keep domesticated female chickens may be suspended or revoked by the City where there is a risk to public health or safety or for any violation of or failure to comply with any of the provisions of any other applicable ordinance or law.  Any denial, revocation, or suspension of a permit shall be in writing and shall include notification of the right to and procedure for appeal.  

Permits shall be reissued annually and are subject to any ordinance revisions adopted by Council.

recordTypes.name: Plan Review - Commercial Construction - Site/Civil or Both Structural and Site
recordTypes.description: Mostly used for NEW commercial construction.  Also used when any type of site work is involved.  Workflow will route to Building Official/Plans Examiner Review, Planning & Zoning, Engineering, Storm Water, Water/Sewer Operations, Floodplain Review, E-911 Addressing.

Used for NEW residential construction, solar panel installs, and commercial tenant upfit for existing buildings.

Code Modifications, refer to the LLR website at: https://llr.sc.gov/bcc/PDFfiles/2

recordTypes.name: Concept Plan Application
recordTypes.description:
Step 1 of 4 in the Subdivision Process:

The purpose of a Concept Plan is for the developer to present the plan of development and receive comments from the City regarding general requirements, minimum design standards, and required improvements set forth in the City Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Contractor License
recordTypes.description: A Residential Contractor License is required for any residential work within Watertown city limits.  All commercial contractors must obtain a Commercial Contractor License to work within the City of Watertown. If you primarily do residential construction but occasionally have alteration projects for commercial structures, a residential contractor license will suffice.  With your application, upload a copy of your Excise Tax License and a Certificate of Liability Insurance with a minimum $500,000.00 per occurrence. City of Watertown must be named as certificate holder.

recordTypes.name: New Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: New Commercial Buildings. This application shall also be used for New Mixed-Use projects that include both Residential and Commercial uses in the same structure.

recordTypes.name: New Commercial Building Permit FOOTING and FOUNDATION ONLY.
recordTypes.description: New Footing and foundation permit.  You will need to have a Grading Permit from the Engineering Department prior to applying for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Plan Application
recordTypes.description: Step 2 of 4 in the Subdivision Process: A Preliminary Plan for the specific phase of development as outlined by the approved Concept Plan shall be submitted to the Community Development Division to be reviewed and approved by the Design Review Team.

recordTypes.name: Construction Plans Application
recordTypes.description: Step 3 of 4 of the Subdivision Process: Construction Plans shall conform to the approved Preliminary Plan and shall be submitted to the Community Development Division to be distributed for review and approval. Final consideration and issuance of a Permit to Construct shall be made by the City Engineer within sixty (60) days following submittal.

recordTypes.name: Grading/Floodplain Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is used for grading activities and development in the floodplain. The permit expires on November 1st of Current Year and must be renewed.

recordTypes.name: New Multi-Family Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: New Multi-Family Residential Structure/Apartment Building that include 4+ units.

recordTypes.name: New Single Family Dwelling Permit
recordTypes.description:
Not more than 4 dwelling units which are attached by common vertical walls.
Single family: Detached one- and two-family dwellings.
Duplex: A building containing two (2) dwelling units totally separated from each other for occupancy of two (2) separate dwelling units location on a single lot. 
Triplex: Three (3) individual dwelling units combined into one (1) building located on a single lot, with the individual units sharing one or two common walls.
Fourplex: Four (4) individual dwelling units combined into one building located on a single lot, with the individual units sharing one or two common walls.

Information needed for application:
Site plan including setbacks and elevation of curb and finished floor.
Foundation, floor plan, and section (construction details) with all dimensions.
Elevation Certificate Based on Construction Documents from licensed surveyor, if property is located in a floodplain.

recordTypes.name: Street Approach, Curb & Gutter, and Sidewalk Permit
recordTypes.description:
Public sidewalks, approaches, curb cuts, driveways and sidewalk accessible ramps are regulated through the City Engineer’s Office. A permit is required before any work is initiated in the public right-of-way. Each property owner is responsible for the public sidewalk bordering their property. The sidewalk shall be repaired or replaced as necessary, and shall be kept cleared of snow in the wintertime. The permit expires after 90 days.

Cost-Participation Program
The City currently has a cost-participation program to assist property owners in paying for the replacement of a public sidewalk in residential areas. A permit is required before beginning any work, and the sidewalk must conform to ADA standards. For further information about this program, contact the City Engineer’s Office at 605-882-6202

recordTypes.name: Plat Application
recordTypes.description: Step 4 of 4 of the Subdivision Process: The plat shall conform substantially to the Construction Plans as approved.  OR a plat may be exempt to the subdivision process: Minor, Administrative, and Replats shall also utilize this application.

recordTypes.name: Annexation and Zoning Application
recordTypes.description: Annexation is the methodical extension of a city's boundaries into adjacent unincorporated areas and the corresponding extension of city services into those areas. Property currently not located within city limits must be formally annexed in and properly zoned before any construction can begin or connection to city utilities can take place.

recordTypes.name: Manufactured Home Placement Permit
recordTypes.description:
Manufactured Home, 20 years old or newer.

Documentation needed for application:
Site plan including setbacks and elevation of curb and finished floor.
Elevation Certificate Based on Construction Documents from licensed surveyor, if property is located in a floodplain.
Manufacturer's Installation Instructions

recordTypes.description: Commercial interior remodel, addition, doors and/or windows.

recordTypes.name: Vacation Application
recordTypes.description: Used to vacate or eliminate dedicated public right-of-way as well as recorded utility easements, access easements, etc.

recordTypes.name: Tax Increment Financing District Application
recordTypes.description: Tax Increment Financing Districts (TIF) are a public financing method that is used as a subsidy for redevelopment, infrastructure, and other community-improvement projects allowed under SDCL 11-9

recordTypes.name: Mobile Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is used for vending in the the public right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning Application

recordTypes.name: Residential Alteration Permit
recordTypes.description: Remodel, addition, basement finish, door/windows.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: Any detached or accessory structure.  Garage, garden shed, etc.

recordTypes.name: Ordinance Text Amendment
recordTypes.description: A request to change specific language in Title 21 or Title 24 of the Revised Ordinances of the City of Watertown. It is encouraged to meet with City Staff to discuss the ordinance amendment draft prior to submitting this application.

recordTypes.name: Deck Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential decks.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Application
recordTypes.description:
A use that would not be appropriate generally or without restriction throughout the zoning district
by which if controlled as to number, area, location, or relation to the neighborhood, would promote the public health, safety, morals, order, comfort, convenience, appearance, prosperity, or general welfare. Conditional Uses Applications are acted by the Board of Adjustment.

recordTypes.name: Occupy Right-of-Way/Public Property
recordTypes.description: This permit is used to permit any occurrence in which the general public would be occupying any space within the City Right-of-Way or Public Park. (Ordinance 5.0307)

recordTypes.name: Letter of Responsibility
recordTypes.description: This Letter of Responsibility is to be filled out each year by Contractor acknowledging the responsibilities and requirements for doing work in the City of Watertown (i.e. utility work, grading activity, sidewalk or street approach, etc.)

recordTypes.name: Variance Application
recordTypes.description: Appeal to the zoning ordinance. This application shall be acted on by the Board of Adjustment.

recordTypes.name: Fence Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential and Non-Residential Fences

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Temporary and Permanent Signs

recordTypes.name: Home Day Care Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit application is for Home Day Care within the City of Watertown. To ensure compliance with special use provisions, applicants must submit an application to the Community Development Division for administrative approval. If the provisions are not met, a conditional use application must be submitted and approved by the Board of Adjustment. Day Care Homes, whether registered or unregistered under SDCL 26-6-14.1 and 26-6-14.8, may not care for more than twelve children at a time, including those under six living in the home. The provider must reside at the dwelling, and employees may be present. Operating a Day Care Home without the necessary approval from the City or Board of Adjustment is a violation, subject to penalties under Chapter 21.99. Each day of violation is considered a separate offense.

recordTypes.name: LOMR/CLOMR
recordTypes.description: Use this application to submit LOMR/CLOMR documentation for community acknowledgement signature.

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit application is for Home Occupations within the City of Watertown. To ensure compliance with the special use provisions, applicants must submit an application to the Community Development Division for administrative approval. If the provisions are not met, a conditional use application must be submitted and approved by the Board of Adjustment.

recordTypes.name: Microwave Antenna Permit
recordTypes.description: Antenna installation or modifications that are attached to or located on public property.

recordTypes.name: Reroofing Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential and Commercial reroofing.

recordTypes.name: Research Request
recordTypes.description: Request research on the history of a property in relation to zoning, building permits, variances, and conditional use permits.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description:
Both inground and above ground pools.  
A permit is required for pools that are permanently affixed to the ground or remains in the same location for more than 6 months (is not taken down over the winter).
You will be asked to upload a site plan at the end of the application.  The site plan should include property lines, existing structure locations, pool location, fence location on property, fence height and length, easements, any other relevant site information.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description:
All institutional, commercial, public, and industrial structures.
Residential buildings, including condominiums or individual dwelling units operated as residential cooperatives, with more than four dwelling units.

recordTypes.name: Moving Permit
recordTypes.description: Building means a structure designed, built or occupied as a shelter or roofed enclosure for persons, animals or property and used for residential, business, mercantile, storage, commercial, industrial, institutional, assembly, educational or recreational purposes.

categories.name: Building Services/Building Permits
categories.content:
Scroll down to select the permit application based on your project type.

Building permits applied for through this portal are only for projects being completed within the City Limits of Watertown

categories.name: Contractor Corner
categories.content: Licensing Requirements:

recordTypes.name: House/Structure Moving Permit
recordTypes.description: Separate demolition permits and building permits may be required prior to a structure being moved within the City of Aransas Pass or ETJ area. Please contact the Building Department to obtain paperwork that will need to be submitted at the time of application.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Vehicle License (Transfer)
recordTypes.description: Every person holding a license shall give notice in writing to the city within ten (10) days after having sold, transferred, given away or otherwise disposed of interest in, or control of, any RV park. Application for transfer of a license shall be made within ten (10) calendar days thereafter, the city shall act on the application for license transfer and it shall be approved if the RV park is in compliance with the provisions of the City of Aransas Pass ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Water Well Permit
recordTypes.description: PURPOSE: To provide a process for identifying locations of existing water wells (constructed before April 15, 2013) within the city limits in order to identify the landscaping irrigation needs of water well owners for proper monitoring and compliance during drought restrictions imposed by the City.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Vehicle License (Renewal)
recordTypes.description: All RV park licenses expire on September 30th of every year. Application for renewal of a license shall be made on OpenGov on or before September 1st of each year. If application for renewal is not submitted within the specified time line then a late fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) shall be accrued for each week following the deadline. Such application shall contain any changes in the information occurring after the original license was issued or the latest renewal granted.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Vehicle License(Initial)
recordTypes.description: It shall be unlawful for any person to operate any RV park within the city limits unless he/she holds a valid license issued by the City of Aransas Pass in the name of the person for the specific RV park. The applicant shall make all applications for the license on OpenGov which shall issue a license upon compliance with the provisions of the Aransas Pass city ordinance. It shall further be unlawful for any person to place, or have placed, an individual RV, for the purpose of inhabiting said RV, on any lot, parcel, or tract of land, within the city limits or within the city's extraterritorial jurisdiction (ETJ) when the lot, tract or parcel is regulated by the city's ordinances and building codes through a signed water and/or sewer utility contract, that is connected to utilities (i.e. electrical, water, sewer).

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Unit
recordTypes.description: Mobile food Units must obtain a permit in order to operate within the City limits. The City of Aransas Pass does not recognize stand-alone pop-up kiosks as a mobile food unit. Letter of authorization will be needed by property owners when operating on private property.

recordTypes.name: Garage Sale Permit
recordTypes.description: Garage Sale Permits shall be limited to 3 garage sales per year, and not exceeding 3 consecutive days each time. The time of operation for garage sales shall be during daylight hours, any day of the week.

This is for R.V. permits and renewals only.

R.V. permits are only good for 180 days and then must be renewed.  In order to renew, it must be the same R.V., on the same property as previously permitted.

recordTypes.description:
A permit is required for work within, along, or across Galveston County road rights-of-way in unincorporated areas of the county.  Select this option to apply.

If you are building on private property, please use "Floodplain Development Permit".

Brattleboro requires all businesses doing business in Town to apply for a license. (See Chapter 11 of the Code of Ordinances.) Businesses have 30 days from the date of opening to obtain a license. Licenses expire annually on March 15 and cost $100.

You may also apply for or renew your Entertainment license through this process. Entertainment licenses also renew annually on March 15. New or
